check in: to give your bags to airport employees to be put on a plane for you, rather than carrying them on and off the plane yourself

check in/check into: to say who you are when you arrive at a hotel so that you can be given a key for your room

informal to go to a place in order to see what it is like

check up on: to try to discover what someone is doing in order to be certain that that person is doing what they should be doing

checking account: a bank account that you can take money from at any time and that usually earns little or no interest

If someone cheers up, or something cheers someone up, they start to feel happier.

cheese biscuit: a savoury biscuit that is eaten with cheese or contains cheese

cheese knife: a small knife with a curved blade ending in two sharp points, used to cut and pick up pieces of cheese

cheesed off: annoyed and disappointed with something or someone

「車路士」拖拉機（一種大型四輪驅動車，專為在顛簸的道路上行駛而設計，有人卻只在城市駕駛）

chemical bond: an electrical force that holds atoms together to form a molecule (= the smallest unit of a substance)

chemical dependency: the condition of being addicted to drugs or alcohol

chemical element: a substance that cannot be broken down into any simpler chemical substances and is made of atoms all of the same type

chemical formula: the way of representing a substance using the symbols of its elements

chemical reaction: a process in which the structure of atoms or molecules that make up a substance are changed

chemical warfare: the use of poisonous gases and other harmful chemicals against enemy forces

chemical weapon: a substance, such as a poisonous gas rather than an explosive, that can be used to kill or injure people

cheque guarantee card: a small plastic card that you sometimes show when you pay for something by cheque as proof that your bank will pay the money you owe

chess set: the pieces used to play chess and the board on which the game is played

（得勝後兩隊員之間的）撞胸志慶

child support: money that someone gives the mother or father of their children when they do not live with the children

chime in: to interrupt or speak in a conversation, usually to agree with what has been said

chop and change: to keep changing your ideas, opinions, activities, or job

TREE: a real or artificial fir tree that is decorated and kept in the home at Christmas

努力保持；盡力保留；緊抓…不放

FRAME: a frame on which wet clothes can be hung to dry, usually used inside the house

（尤指英格蘭西南部製造的）濃縮鮮奶油

suffer under the lash: 受到嚴厲批評，遭到痛斥

comfort break: a short pause in a meeting to allow people to go to a toilet
（會議當中讓人上廁所的）短暫休息

comfort eating: eating because you are feeling worried or upset and not because you are hungry

comfort food: the type of food that people eat when they are sad or worried, often sweet food or food that people ate as children
（難過或焦慮時食用的）安慰食品，開心食品

comfort stop: a short pause in a journey to allow passengers to go to a toilet
（長途旅程中讓人上廁所的）短暫停歇

comfort zone: a situation in which you feel comfortable and in which your ability and determination are not being tested
舒適區（指讓人感到舒服而不費力氣的狀況）

comic opera: a play that is humorous and in which there is a lot of music and singing

comic strip: a short series of funny drawings with a small amount of writing, often published in a newspaper
（通常刊登在報紙上的）連環漫畫

coming of age: Someone's coming of age is the time when that person legally becomes an adult and is old enough to vote.
成年（年滿法定年齡，享有選舉權）
the time when someone matures emotionally, or in some other way
the time when something starts to become successful

coming up roses: If something is coming up roses, it is happening successfully.

comity of nations: the friendship and respect between countries shown by accepting each other's laws, political systems, and customs
國際禮讓（國家間的友誼和尊重，表現為接受彼此的法律、政治體系以及風俗習慣）

command module: the part of particular types of spacecraft in which the people live and in which they return to earth
指揮艙（太空船裡的一部分，太空人生活其中，並乘其返回地球）

command performance: a special performance of a play or film that is given because a royal or very important person has asked for it
奉命專場演出；御前演出

comme il faut: behaving or dressing in the right way in public according to formal rules of social behaviour

commentary box: a room or place for a radio or television reporter at a special event, especially a sports competition, from which they report what is happening
（尤指體育比賽的）演播室，評論席

commissioned officer: a type of officer in the armed forces

commit suicide: If a person commits suicide, he or she kills himself or herself.

NUMBER: specialized mathematics a number that can be divided exactly by all the denominators (= numbers under the line) in a group of fractions
SIMILARITY: something that is the same for all the members of a group and might bring them together

Common Era: the period from the birth of Jesus Christ, when the Christian calendar starts counting years as AD

common factor: a number that a set of two or more different numbers can be divided by exactly

common fraction: a fraction in which there is a horizontal line with one number above it and one number below it

common ground: shared interests, beliefs, or opinions between two people or groups of people who disagree about most other subjects
（興趣、信仰或觀點上的）共同點，一致之處，共同基礎

common law: the legal system in England and most of the US that has developed over a period of time from old customs and court decisions, rather than laws made by politicians
（英格蘭和美國大部分地區的）習慣法，普通法，判例法，不成文法
someone who is not officially a wife or husband but is considered to be one because she or he has been living with their partner for a long time
實質婚姻的丈夫（或妻子）

common multiple: a number that can be divided exactly by two or more different numbers

common noun: a noun that is the name of a group of similar things, such as "table" or "book", and not of a single person, place, or thing

common or garden: 非常普通的；很平常的；很一般的

common room: a room in a school or college where students or teachers can sit together and talk when they are not working
（學校或大學師生的）公共休息室

common salt: sodium chloride: a substance used especially to make food taste better

common sense: the basic level of practical knowledge and judgment that we all need to help us live in a reasonable and safe way

common variable immunodeficiency: a group of disorders in which the body has difficulty protecting itself against disease
常見變異型免疫缺損症，常見多樣性免疫缺乏症

common wall: a wall that divides two buildings that are joined together, and belongs to both of them

communication cord: a chain in a railway carriage that a passenger can pull in an emergency to stop the train

communications satellite: an artificial object in space used to send out television and radio signals around the earth's surface

communion of saints: all the people who are part of the Church
聖徒相通，基督教教會的所有成員

community centre: a place where people who live in an area can meet each other and play sports, take courses, etc.

community chest: an amount of money that has been given and collected by the people of a particular area to help people who are old or ill and in need of help
（用於幫助老人、病人或需要救助者的）社區福利基金，公益金

community college: UK a school for children between the ages of eleven and 18 that also provides different types of classes, sports, etc. for adults from the local area
社區中學（接收11至18歲的學生，也向當地社區成人開放）
US a two-year college where students can learn a skill or prepare to enter a university
社區學院（兩年制學院，學生學習一項技能或大學預科課程）

community service: work done without payment to help other people. Criminals whose crime was not serious enough for them to be put in prison are sometimes ordered to do community service.
（志願或代替服刑的）社區服務

community spirit: friendliness and understanding between local people
社區精神（本地居民之間的友好關係和互相理解）

commuter train: a train service especially for people travelling between home and work

comp time: time that an employee who has worked extra hours may take off from work

company car: a car that is owned by a company or other organization and is used by an employee for his or her work
（公司供僱員使用的）公司車輛，業務用車

company man: a man who values the company that he works for more than anything else in his life and is willing to do whatever the company needs
公司人；忠於公司，願意為公司赴湯蹈火的人

company town: a city or town in which most of the workers are employed by a single organization
公司城鎮（大部分居民受僱於同一家公司的城鎮）

compare notes: If two people compare notes, they tell each other what they think about something they have both done.

compass point: any of the 32 marks on the compass that show direction

compass reading: the act of looking at a compass to find out where you are, or the information that it gives you
識讀羅盤；用指南針定位

compassion fatigue: the situation in which people stop thinking or worrying about a problem that is affecting a lot of people and stop giving money to them because the problem has continued for too long
同情心疲勞（指因為影響人數眾多的問題持續太久而使人不再關心、不再捐錢）

compassionate leave: a period of time that a company allows you not to come to work because a member of your family has died or is ill
（由於親屬去世或患病而特准的）恩假，喪假

complain of: to tell other people that something is making you feel ill

complement system: a group of proteins that works with other substances as part of the immune system

complementary angle: one of two angles that together add up to 90°

complementary medicine: a wide range of treatments for medical conditions that people use instead of or in addition to ordinary medicine

complex carbohydrate: a type of carbohydrate such as starch or cellulose that is is formed of many monosaccharides (= carbohydrates formed of molecules that cannot be broken down into a simpler form)

complex fraction: a fraction in which either the numerator (= the number above the line) or the denominator (= the number below the line) is itself a fraction

complex number: a value that contains both a real number and an imaginary number

complex sentence: in grammar, a sentence that contains a main part and one or more other parts

complex word: a word consisting of a main part and one or more other parts

compliment(s) slip: a piece of paper printed with the name and address of a company, sent with a parcel in place of a letter
（印有公司名稱、地址、隨包裹寄送的）贈禮便條，禮帖

compos mentis: able to think clearly and be in control of and responsible for your actions
心智健全的；神志清楚的；頭腦健康的

composite number: a positive number (= larger than zero) that can be divided by positive numbers other than 1 and itself

compound eye: an eye made of a large number of parts, each with a separate lens, as found in insects
（昆蟲的）複眼（由許多獨立晶狀體構成的眼器官）

compound fracture: an injury caused by a bone breaking or cracking and cutting through the surrounding flesh

compound leaf: a type of leaf that is formed from a number of smaller leaves all joined to one stem

compound sentence: a sentence made from two independent sentences joined by "and", "or", or "but", as in "Mary read and Tom slept."

comprehensive insurance: insurance that financially protects any other vehicles and people that are involved in a car accident with you, in addition to yourself

comprehensive school: a school in the UK for children above the age of eleven of all abilities
（英國招收年滿11歲不同資質學生的）綜合中學

compression fracture: in injury in which several of the bones in the back collapse

compression moulding: a method of making plastic shapes by pressing plastic between two shapes and heating it

compulsory purchase order: a demand made by a public authority to buy land or property from a private owner in order to use the land for public purposes
強制徵收，強制性購買令（政府當局以公共用途為名從私人業主手中收購土地或財產的命令）

computational linguistics: the study of language and speech using computers

computer dating: a way of helping people find suitable romantic partners by using a computer to match them with people of similar interests
電腦約會安排，電腦擇偶

computer game: a game that is played on a computer, in which the pictures that appear on the screen are controlled by pressing keys or moving a joystick

computer science: the study of computers and how they can be used

computer-aided design: the use of computers to design objects

computer-generated imagery: the process of using computers to create pictures or characters in film and television

con artist: a person who deceives other people by making them believe something false or making them give money away

con man: 騙子，行騙者；詐騙犯（同 con artist）

con woman: 騙子，行騙者；詐騙犯（同 con artist）

concentration camp: a place where large numbers of people are kept as prisoners in extremely bad conditions, especially for political reasons

concert grand: the biggest type of grand piano, usually used for concerts
（通常用於音樂會的）大型鋼琴，平臺大鋼琴

concert hall: a large building in which concerts are performed

concessive clause: a clause, often beginning with "though" or "although", that expresses an idea that suggests the opposite of the main part of the sentence

concrete jungle: an ugly grey area of a city where people live in closely crowded apartment buildings and there is little space and no trees or grass
混凝土叢林，水泥叢林（指高樓林立、無樹木花草的擁擠城區）

concrete mixer: 水泥攪拌機（同 cement mixer）

concrete noun: a noun that refers to a real physical object

condemned cell: a room in a prison for someone who is going to be killed as a legal punishment

condensed milk: a thick and very sweet milk from which water has been removed

condescend to: to treat someone as if you are more important or more intelligent than them
表現出高…一等的姿態，帶有優越感地對待…

confectioner's sugar: a soft powder made from sugar that is used to make icing for cakes

conference call: a work phone call that involves three or more people
電話會議（三個或更多的人通過電話進行的工作會談）

confide in: to share your feelings and secrets with someone because you trust them not to tell other people
向…傾訴；向…吐露情感（或秘密）

confidence trickster: 騙子，行騙者；詐騙犯（同 con artist）

conform to: to obey a rule or reach the necessary stated standard, or to do things in a traditional way
遵守，遵照；符合，達到；依照

conform with: to obey a rule or reach the necessary stated standard, or to do things in a traditional way
遵守，遵照；符合，達到；依照

confusion marketing: the activity of selling products or services together in a way that makes it very difficult to decide which company's products or services are cheapest
混淆行銷法（使人難以判斷不同公司的產品或服務價格孰高孰低的一種行銷法）

congenital erythropoietic porphyria: a rare inherited (= passed on from one of your parents) disease in which the body cannot process some parts of the blood properly
先天性紅血球生成性紫質症

conger eel: a long, powerful, snake-like sea fish

congestion charge: an amount of money that you have to pay each day to drive into a city centre, charged in order to reduce traffic
擁堵費（開車進入市中心需要支付的費用，徵收該項費用的目的是減少車流量。）

congressional district: an area from which a member of the US House of Representatives is elected
（美國）國會選區（每個選區均會產生一名眾議院議員）

conical flask: a glass container with a flat base, a wide, rounded body, and a long neck, used in scientific work

conjoined twins: a pair of twins who were born with some part of their bodies joined together

conjugal rights: the right to have sex with the person you are married to

conjuring trick: a trick in which something is made to appear as if by magic, often using a quick movement of the hand

conk out: If vehicles and other machines conk out, they stop working or fail suddenly.
（車輛或其他機器）突然出故障，停止運轉，突然失靈
to go to sleep very quickly, or to suddenly become unconscious
倒頭睡去；突然不省人事

connecting rod: a rod that joins two particular moving parts in an engine, especially one joining the piston to the crankshaft in a motor vehicle
連杆（在引擎中起連接作用，尤指汽車曲軸和活塞之間的連杆）

connective tissue: the strong material that supports and connects the organs in the body and is also found in the joints (= places where two bones are connected)

conscientious objector: a person who refuses to work in the armed forces for moral or religious reasons
（由於道德或宗教原因而）拒服兵役者，拒絕參軍者

consenting adult: a person who is considered old enough, and therefore responsible enough, to decide if they want sex and who they want to have sex with
（能決定自己性行爲的）已達法定性成熟年齡的成年人

consider it done: used to say that you will do a particular task immediately

consist in: to have something as a main and necessary part or quality

consist of: to be made of or formed from something

consolation prize: a small prize given to someone who has taken part in a competition, but who has not won

conspicuous consumption: the situation in which people spend a lot of money intentionally so that other people notice and admire them for their wealth

conspiracy theory: a belief that an unpleasant event or situation is the result of a secret plan made by powerful people

conspire against: If events or conditions conspire against something or conspire to do something, they combine in such a way that they spoil your plans.
（事情、環境）共同導致（計劃失敗）

constitutional monarchy: a system in which the king or queen's power is severely limited, because they act only on the advice of the politicians who form the government

constructive dismissal: actions taken by an employer that intentionally make working conditions for an employee difficult or unfair so that the employee feels forced to leave their job
推定解僱，構定解僱，間接解僱（指僱主有意使僱員工作環境惡劣或不公平，迫使其自動離職）

constructive interference: the interference produced when two or more energy waves that are in phase (= in the same stages of the repeating pattern) combine to create a stronger wave
相長干擾，建設性干擾（兩個波能互相作用而引起的振幅加大）

consulting room: an office where a doctor talks to and examines patients

consumer durables: goods that last a long time and are not intended to be bought very often, such as televisions and cars

consumer price index: a measurement of the changes in the cost of basic goods and services

consumer protection: the protection of buyers of goods and services against low quality or dangerous products and advertisements that deceive people

consumer society: a society in which people often buy new goods, especially goods that they do not need, and in which a high value is placed on owning many things

contact lens: a small round curved piece of transparent plastic, worn on the surface of the eye to improve your sight

contact sport: a sport such as rugby or American football in which players are allowed to touch each other when, for example, they are trying to get the ball
接觸性運動（如橄欖球、美式橄欖球等，球員在搶球時身體可以互相接觸）

contend with: to have to deal with a difficult or unpleasant situation
必須處理，必須應對（困境或不愉快的事）

content yourself with: to do something or have something although it is not exactly what you want
使自己滿足於；使自己甘心於

continental breakfast: a simple morning meal consisting of fruit juice, coffee, and bread with butter and jam
歐洲大陸式早餐（包括果汁、咖啡以及可塗抹奶油和果醬的麵包）

Continental Congress: one of several assemblies in the 1700s of representatives from each of the American colonies in which they organized against the British
大陸會議（17世紀英屬北美殖民地召開的由各殖民地代表參加的一系列會議，共同反對英國的殖民統治）

continental crust: the surface of the earth that is about 35 kilometres thick and includes the land masses and the solid rock below them
大陸地殼（地球的表層，約35公里厚，由陸塊及其下面的固體岩石組成）

continental drift: the very slow movement of continents over the earth's surface

continental plate: one of the large pieces of the surface of the earth that move separately

continental quilt: 羽絨被；蓬鬆棉被（同 duvet）

continental shelf: the area of the bottom of the sea near the coast of a continent, where the sea is not very deep

continuing education: classes for adults who have finished their school education, in a range of different subjects

continuous assessment: the system in which the quality of a student's work is judged by various pieces of work during a course and not by one final exam
連續評估制，連續性評定（指根據平時課業表現而非一次期末考試對學生學業質量進行評定的制度）

contract in: to formally agree to take part/stop taking part in an official plan or system
簽約加入（退出）；同意加入（退出）

contract out: to formally arrange for other people to do a particular job
訂合同把…承包出去，合同外包

contribute to: to help to cause an event or situation

contributory negligence: a judgment in court that a person who has been hurt in an accident was partly responsible for their own injuries because they failed to act in a way that could have prevented the accident or the injuries

control freak: someone who is determined to make things happen in exactly the way they want and who tries to make other people do what they want
愛指揮別人的人；支配狂；指揮狂

control key: the key on a computer keyboard that usually has "Ctrl" printed on it and that is used along with other keys to do particular operations

control tower: a building at an airport from which air traffic is watched and directed

convection cell: the circular pattern of a gas, such as air, or a liquid, such as magma (= melted rock under the surface of the earth), rising and falling as it becomes hotter and cooler

convenience food: food that is almost ready to eat when it is bought and can be prepared quickly and easily

convenience store: a shop that sells food, drinks, etc. and is usually open until late
（通常開到很晚的）便利店，便民店

convent school: a school in which the teachers are nuns (= members of a female religious order)

convention centre: a building or group of buildings where large groups of people gather for meetings or events

converging lens: a lens (= a curved piece of glass) that bends light so that it can produce an image

conversation piece: an unusual object that causes people to start talking

conveyor belt: a continuous moving strip or surface that is used for transporting objects from one place to another

Cook Islander: a person from the Cook Islands

cook sb's goose: old-fashioned to do something that spoils someone's plans and prevents them from succeeding
擾亂…的計劃；使…喪失成功機會；毀掉…的前程

cook the books: to change numbers dishonestly in the accounts (= financial records) of an organization, especially in order to steal money from it

cook up, dance up, talk up, etc. a storm: to do something with a lot of energy and often skill
奮力地燒飯煮飯／充滿激情地跳舞／熱烈地談話（等等）

cooked breakfast: a dish eaten in the morning consisting of fried eggs, bacon, sausages, and toast
熟食早餐（包括煎蛋、熏肉、香腸和吐司）

cooked to a turn: cooked for exactly the right amount of time

done to a turn: cooked for exactly the right amount of time

cookie cutter: a sharp metal or plastic device used to cut cookies into shapes before they are cooked
similar to other things of the same type, especially in a way that shows little imagination
（尤指缺乏想像力）千篇一律的，俗套的

cookie jar: a metal container with a lid used for keeping biscuits

cooking apple: a sour and usually large apple that is used in cooking
烹飪用的蘋果（一種大蘋果，味很酸）

cool down: to become less hot, or to make someone or something become less hot
（使）冷卻下來，（使）降溫；（使）涼快下來

cool off: to become less hot, or to make someone or something become less hot
（使）冷卻下來，（使）降溫；（使）涼快下來

cool bag: a bag made of a thick insulating material that keeps food and drink cold when you are travelling
（旅行時冷藏食物和飲料的）冰袋，冷藏袋

cool box: a container like a box with a lid, used for keeping food and drinks cool

cool customer: someone who stays calm and does not show their emotions, even in a difficult situation
冷靜的人，沉著的人，鎮靜的人

cool it: used to tell someone to become calm, rather than be angry or violent
（用於告訴別人）冷靜點，沉住氣，息怒

cooler bag: a bag made of a thick insulating material that keeps food and drink cold when you are travelling
（旅行時冷藏食物和飲料的）冰袋，冷藏袋

cooling tower: a tall, hollow structure that is used in industrial processes to reduce the temperature of something, especially water, so that it can be used to cool other parts of the system

cooling-off period: an agreed length of time in which someone can decide not to buy something they have agreed to buy, or a period in which two groups who are arguing can try to improve the situation before taking further action
（購買後可改變主意的）猶豫期，冷靜期；（爭執雙方的）冷卻期，冷靜期

cooped up: If you are cooped up somewhere, you are in a small closed space from which you cannot escape, or you feel as if you are.
被監禁的，遭禁錮的，受拘禁的；感覺受拘禁的

coordinate plane: a region formed by a horizontal number line and a vertical number line that meet at their zero points

cop a feel: to touch someone in a sexual way without their permission

cop a plea: to admit to having committed a crime in order to avoid being punished for a more serious crime

cop it: to be punished or spoken to severely because you have done something wrong

cop out: to avoid doing something that you should do or that you have promised to do because you are frightened, shy, or you think it is too difficult
a way of avoiding doing something difficult or unpleasant that you should do, or the excuse that you use to do this

copper beech: a type of tree with reddish-brown leaves

copper sulphate: a blue crystal that is used in industry in electroplating and in agriculture to kill fungus

cor anglais: a musical instrument like an oboe but with a lower sound
英國管（一種像雙簧管的樂器）

cor blimey!: a way of expressing surprise or anger
（表示驚訝或煩惱）老天爺！天哪！

coral reef: an area of coral, the top of which can sometimes be seen just above the sea

cordon bleu: Cordon bleu food is food that is prepared to the highest standard.
used to refer to people who are able to cook food to the highest standard

cordon sanitaire: a guarded area around a place or country that prevents people from entering or leaving it

corn bread: a type of bread made from maize

corn chips: thin, flat, crisp pieces of food made from crushed maize

corn earworm: the larva (= young form) of a type of moth (= a flying insect) that damages many different crops, including corn, cotton, and tomato
玉米穗蟲，番茄夜蛾，棉鈴蟲，螟蛉

corn oil: oil made from maize, often used for cooking

corn on the cob: the part of the maize plant that is shaped like a cylinder, and is cooked with the sweet yellow or white grains on it

corn syrup: a thick, sweet liquid made from maize

corned beef: cooked beef that has been preserved in salty water and spices, often sold in tins (= metal containers)

corner flag: in football, a flag in each corner of the pitch used to mark the edges of the playing area

corner kick: in football, an opportunity to kick the ball from the corner of the playing area, allowed when a player from the other team has not obeyed one of the rules

corner shop: a small shop, especially on a corner of a road, that sells foods and other things that are often needed

corner the market: If a company corners the market in a particular type of product, it is more successful than any other company at selling the product.

Cornish pasty: a piece of pastry baked with a mixture of meat and vegetables inside it, usually for one person to eat
康沃爾餡餅（以菜、肉爲餡的烘餅）

corporal punishment: the physical punishment of people, especially of children, by hitting them

corporate image: the way in which a company is seen and understood by people in general

corporate memory: the combined knowledge and experience of a company's employees
企業記憶，公司記憶（一家公司全體員工的知識和經驗之總和）

corporation tax: tax paid by businesses on their profits

corps de ballet: the members of a group of ballet dancers who dance together, especially those who are not the main dancers
芭蕾舞團；（尤指芭蕾舞團的）伴舞隊

corpus callosum: a wide strip of nerve fibres that connects the two halves of the brain

corpus luteum: a mass of yellow tissue that produces progesterone (= a hormone necessary for pregnancy) after a woman's egg is released

correspondence course: a course of study in which you study at home, receiving, and sending off work by post, email, etc.

corresponding angle: one of two equal angles on the same side of a line that crosses two parallel lines, and on the same side of each parallel line

corresponding angles: two equal angles on the same side of a line that crosses two parallel lines and on the same side of each parallel line

cryptic crossword: a type of crossword (= word game) that has difficult clues (= pieces of information) that are not obvious in their meaning

crystal ball: a transparent glass ball used by someone who says they can discover what will happen to you in the future by looking into it

crystal clear: 清楚明瞭的；明白無誤的；顯而易見的

crystal meth: 甲基苯丙胺；脫氧麻黃鹼（同 methamphetamine）

CS gas: a gas that causes painful breathing and tears, used by the army or police to control a person or crowd in a violent situation

CT colonography: a process in which images are produced of the inside of the colon and rectum, and displayed on a screen, to see if cancer is present
電腦斷層掃描結腸成像

CT scan: abbreviation for computerized tomography scan: another word for
電腦斷層成像，電腦斷層掃描（computerised tomography scan的縮寫）

cub reporter: a young person being trained to write articles for a newspaper
初出茅廬的記者，年輕記者

cube root: The cube root of a number is another number that, when multiplied by itself twice, makes the first number.

cuckoo clock: a decorative clock with a little wooden bird inside it that comes out every hour and makes a quick two-note sound like a cuckoo

cuddle up: to sit or lie very close to someone and put your arms around them

cuddly toy: a toy animal that is soft and covered in fur

cudgel your brains: to think very hard or try to remember something you have forgotten

cue ball: the white ball that a player hits with the cue in order to move other balls in games such as snooker

culpable homicide: in some legal systems, the crime of killing someone or causing their death, but not intentionally

culture medium: a substance containing nutrients in which cells or microorganisms can be grown
培養基（一種營養液，用於在實驗室裡培養細胞或微生物）

culture shock: a feeling of confusion felt by someone visiting a country or place that they do not know
文化衝擊，文化震驚，文化休克（指去異國或異地時産生的困惑感）

culture vulture: someone who is very interested in music, art, theatre, etc.
醉心文化藝術的人，熱衷於文化的人

cultured pearl: a pearl (= a round, white precious stone) that has been formed artificially

cum laude: at the third highest level of the special levels of achievement in a person's studies at a US college or university. The expression comes from Latin, meaning "with praise".
（拉丁語）以優等成績畢業（美國大學優等學位榮譽中的第三等）

cup final: the last game in a competition between teams, usually in football or rugby, for a cup
（通常指足球或橄欖球比賽中）爭奪獎盃的決賽，錦標賽決賽

cup holder: In team sports, the cup holders are the team that won the cup (= prize) for the competition held during the previous year or season.
獎盃贏得者；衛冕冠軍隊
a place in a car that is made to hold a drinking cup

cup tie: a game between two teams trying to win a cup (= prize), especially in football

cupboard love: love shown by someone, typically a child, in order to get something that they want, such as food
（尤指兒童）有所企圖地表示親熱（如希望得到食物）

Cupid's bow: If you have a Cupid's bow, you have an upper lip with two strong curves in it.
邱比特之箭般的嘴唇（上唇有兩條明顯的曲線）

curate's egg: something that is partly good but mainly bad
質量低劣但亦有可取之處的事物

curd cheese: a soft, smooth, white cheese without a strong taste

curiosity killed the cat: said to warn someone not to ask too many questions about something
好奇害死貓，過於好奇會惹禍上身

curl up: to sit or lie in a position with your arms and legs close to your body
If something flat, such as paper, curls up, the edges start to become rounded.

curl up and die: to feel very ashamed and sorry
羞愧難過；羞愧得無地自容

curling tongs: a device that you heat up and use for curling your hair

current account: a bank account that you can take money from at any time and that usually earns little or no interest
活期存款帳戶；往來帳戶

current affairs: political news about events happening now

curry paste: a soft mixture of spices and oil, used to flavour curries

curry powder: a dry mixture of spices used to flavour curries

curtain call: the part at the end of a performance when actors come to the front of the stage and the people watching clap to show their enjoyment

curtain rail: a fixed strip of plastic or metal from which a curtain hangs

curtain rod: a fixed pole with a set of loose rings from which a curtain hangs. It is usually made of wood and often has a decorative purpose.
窗簾杆（用來掛窗簾的橫桿，上有遊環，木製居多，通常具裝飾作用）

Cushing's syndrome: a condition in which there are too many corticosteroids (= a hormone) in the body caused by the adrenal cortex producing too much cortisol (= a hormone)

cushion the blow: to make a bad situation less serious
緩解打擊；緩和不良狀況

custard pie: a flat, open pastry container filled with a substance like cream, thrown at people's faces as part of a show to make people laugh
蛋奶凍派（舞臺上用來扔在對方臉上以引人發笑）

custard powder: a yellowish powder that you combine with milk to make custard

custard tart: a pastry container filled with custard, baked and usually eaten cold

customer base: the people who buy or use a particular product or service

customer service: UK also customer services the part of an organization that answers customers' questions, exchanges goods that are not satisfactory, etc.
the fact of treating customers in a polite and helpful way, which is considered an important part of running a good business

Customs and Excise: the former name for the UK government department that collects taxes, especially on goods leaving or entering the country

customs officer: a person whose job is to make certain travellers are not taking goods into a country without paying taxes

cut to the quick: to hurt someone's feelings a lot

cut a fine figure: to cause people to admire you because of your appearance
穿得惹人注目，顯得很出衆

cut a swathe through: to destroy a large part of something or kill many of a group of people
把…夷爲平地；嚴重摧毀；大批殺戮

cut across: to go straight from one side of an area to another instead of going around
If a problem or subject cuts across different groups of people, all of those groups are affected by or interested in it.
（問題或話題）廣泛影響到（不同群體），引起…的廣泛興趣

cut and dried: already decided and unlikely to be changed
決定的；固定的；已成定局的

cut and paste: used to say that something such as a piece of writing is not original, but includes parts of other people's work

cut back: to reduce something, or to reduce it by a particular amount
to cut off parts of a tree or other plant so that it becomes smaller
修剪，截短（樹木或其他植物）

cut both/two ways: If you say something cuts both/two ways, you think it has both a good and a bad side.
是把雙刃劍；有好也有壞，利弊互見

cut corners: to do something in the easiest, cheapest, or fastest way

cut down: to reduce the number, amount, or size of something
to make a tree or other plant fall to the ground by cutting it near the bottom

cut glass: glass with a decorative pattern cut into the surface
used about a way of speaking in which words are pronounced very clearly and carefully, in a way that is typical of someone from a high social class
（帶上流社會口音）發音清晰的

cut in: to allow someone to take part in something, for example a game or business

cut into: If an activity cuts into a period of time, it fills part of it, often a large part of it.
對環境問題的支持超越了傳統的黨派界限。

cut it/things fine: to allow very little time for something

cut loose: to behave in an uncontrolled, wild way
無拘無束；隨心所欲；無法無天

cut lunch: a light meal put in a container, usually to take with you somewhere to be eaten later

cut no ice with: to not cause someone to change their opinion or decision
沒能使…改變主意；對…不起作用

cut off your nose to spite your face: to do something because you are angry, even if it will cause trouble for you
因一時惱怒害了自己；跟自己過不去

cut out: to remove something or form a shape by cutting, usually from paper or cloth
（通常指從紙或布上）剪掉，剪裁出
to stop eating or drinking something, usually to improve your health
（通常指為改善健康而）停止食用（或飲用），戒除

cut the crap!: a rude way of telling someone to stop saying things that are not true or not important

cut the ground from under sb's feet: UK to make someone or someone's ideas seem less good, especially by doing something before them or better than them
（尤指先發制人）挫敗…的計劃，拆…的臺

cut through: If you cut through something difficult that usually causes problems, you quickly understand it or deal with it so that it does not cause problems for you.
很快理解；迅速克服；迅速應對

cut to the chase: to talk about or deal with the important parts of a subject and not waste time with things that are not important
開門見山；直接切入主題

cut up rough: to become very angry, and often violent

cut your coat according to your cloth: said to emphasize that someone should do as well as possible with the limited money they have

cut your losses: to avoid losing any more money than you have already lost
及時放棄無利可圖之事；知難而退，及早撒手

cut your political, professional, etc. t: to get your first experience of the type mentioned
初次獲得政治（職業等）經驗；初次涉足政治（職場等）

cutthroat razor: a type of old-fashioned razor with a long blade that folds out from the handle

Cyber Monday: the Monday after the Thanksgiving holiday in the US, when online stores reduce the price of goods in order to attract customers
網路星期一（美國的一項常年促銷項目，在感恩節之後的第一個星期一，網路商家降價促銷，以刺激消費者購物需求）

cycle clips: thin straps that you wear around the bottom of your trousers when you are riding a bicycle to prevent the trousers from becoming caught in the bicycle's chain
（騎腳踏車時防止褲子被鏈條捲入而在褲腳處夾的）夾子

cycle helmet: a hard hat that you wear to protect your head if you have an accident while you are riding a bicycle

cycle lane: a part of the road or a special path for the use of people riding bicycles

cycle path: a part of the road or a special path for the use of people riding bicycles

cycle rack: a row of frames where bicycles can be left
a frame that you can put on a car to carry bicycles on
（置於汽車頂部搬運腳踏車用的）腳踏車固定架

cycle rickshaw: a bicycle with three wheels, with a covered seat at the back for passengers, used as a form of taxi in some Asian countries and now also in other parts of the world

cycling shorts: short, tight trousers of a style worn by people involved in cycling sports

cystic fibrosis: a serious disease that causes glands in the lungs and other organs, such as the liver and the pancreas, not to work correctly
囊性纖維變性，囊性纖維化

D and C: abbreviation for dilatation and curettage: an operation in which the inside surface of a woman's womb is removed for medical reasons
子宮擴張刮除術（dilatation and curettage的縮寫）

LETTER: the fourth letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第四個字母）
NUMBER: also d the sign used in the Roman system for the number 500
FOOTBALL: UK a D-shaped area on the edge of the penalty area of a football pitch

dab hand: someone who is very good at a particular activity

daddy longlegs: 大蚊，長腳蚊（crane fly的非正式說法）

dado rail: a long, thin piece of decorative wood fixed about one metre above the floor along the walls of a room
（木質）牆裙裝飾線，腰線，壓裙線

daily bread: the money you need to pay for necessary things, such as food

daily paper: a newspaper that is published every day of the week except Sunday

daily passenger: someone who travels to work by train every day
每天坐火車上下班的人，通勤人員

dairy farm: a farm that only produces milk and products made from milk

dally with: to consider or imagine an idea, subject, or plan, but not in a serious way
隨便想想，不認真地考慮（想法、主題或計劃）

damage limitation: the process of limiting the damaging effects of an action or mistake, or the attempt in war to use careful planning to avoid unnecessary death
控制損失；（戰爭中的）減少傷亡

damp course: a layer of material that is put in the bottom of a wall in order to stop water from rising through the bricks
（用於牆基下的）防潮層，防潮隔離層

damp squib: an event that is not as exciting or popular as people thought it would be
令人空歡喜之事；效果不理想之事

dance attendance on: to do everything that someone asks you to and treat them in a special way

dance floor: an area of a nightclub, restaurant, etc. that is for dancing

dance hall: especially in the past, a special building or large room for dancing in

dance music: a type of music with a strong beat that people dance to in a nightclub

dance studio: a place where people can go for dance classes
舞蹈訓練場地，舞蹈工作坊

danger list: to be expected/no longer expected to die from a serious injury or illness

danger money: extra money that is paid to someone because their job is dangerous
（從事危險工作的）安全津貼，高危工作津貼

Danish pastry: a type of cake for one person, consisting of sweet pastry, often with fruit inside
（常含果料的）丹麥酥皮餅，丹麥酥皮點心

dark chocolate: dark brown chocolate that has been made without milk or with very little milk
（未加牛奶的）純巧克力，黑巧克力

dark glasses: glasses with dark lenses (= glass parts)

SECRET: UK a person who keeps their interests and ideas secret, especially someone who has a surprising ability or skill
不愛張揚的人；（尤指）深藏不露的人
WINNER: US a horse or a politician who wins a race or competition although no one expected them to
黑馬（在賽馬或競選中出乎意料的獲勝者）

dark l: a way of saying an /l/ sound, in which the back of the tongue is raised slightly
模糊的/l/音；含糊邊音/l/（發音時舌頭後部向上）

dark matter: specialized physics (according to some theories of the universe) a substance existing in space that does not give off any light

dark meat: the dark-coloured meat that you find on the legs of birds that you eat, such as chicken
深色肉（食用禽類腿上的肉，如雞腿肉）

darning needle: a special large needle used for darning, or for sewing thick cloth

dash sb's hopes: 粉碎…的希望，使…的希望破滅

data bank: a large collection of information that can be searched through quickly, especially by a computer
（尤指可使用電腦快速檢索的）資料庫，數據庫

data capture: any method of collecting information and then changing it into a form that can be read and used by a computer
數據捕捉，數據收集，數據獲取

data mining: the process of using special software to look at large amounts of computer data in order to find out useful information, for example what types of product a company's customers buy

data processing: the use of a computer to perform calculations on data

data projector: a piece of electronic equipment that is used to show information from a computer screen on a large screen

date back: to have existed for a particular length of time or since a particular time

date from: to have existed since a particular time

date rape: (a case of) rape that happens when the attacker is already known to the person who is attacked

dating agency: an organization that introduces people with similar interests to each other, especially people who want to start a romantic or sexual relationship with someone
婚介服務機構，婚姻介紹所

dawn chorus: the singing of birds together just before dawn

dawn on: If a fact dawns on you, you understand it after a period of not understanding it.

day boy: （寄宿學校的）通勤男生（不住校，住家中）

day care: care or education provided during the day, especially for young children
（尤指對幼兒或老人的）日常護理，日常照顧

day girl: （寄宿學校的）通勤女生（不住校，住家中）

day in day out: (especially of something boring) done or happening every day for a long period of time
（尤指枯燥之事）一天接一天，日復一日

day job: a job that you do to earn money so that you can do something else that you prefer but that does not pay you much money
正職（收入的主要來源，以便維持個人的其他愛好）

day nursery: a place where young children are taken care of, especially while their parents are working
（尤指父母上班時負責照顧小孩的）托兒所，幼兒園

day of reckoning: a time when the effect of a past mistake is experienced or when a crime is punished
報應之時；（罪行）算帳之日

day patient: a patient who remains in hospital during the day usually for a minor operation or other treatment
日間病人（白天留在醫院接受小手術或者治療的病人）

day pupil: a student who sleeps at home and studies at a school where some of the other students live

day release: a system in which people who work can study one day a week at a college

day return: a ticket that can only be used for travelling to a place and back to where you started in a single day

day school: a private school whose students return home in the evening

day student: a student who sleeps at home and studies at a school where some of the other students live

day trip: a visit to a place in which you go there and come back on the same day
即日來回的旅行；一天遊

daylight robbery: a situation in which you have to pay far too much money for something
漫天要價，光天化日之下搶錢

daylight saving time: the time set usually one hour later in summer so that there is a longer period of daylight in the evening
夏令時間；日光節約時間

de facto: existing in fact, although perhaps not intended, legal, or accepted
also defacto a person someone lives with as a wife or a husband, although they are not married
實質婚姻中的妻子（或丈夫）；同居伴侶

de haut en bas: If you look at someone or speak to someone de haut en bas, you do it in a way that shows you think you are superior to them. De haut en bas is French for "from high to low".
（法語）從上到下；態度傲慢地，居高臨下地

de jure: having a right or existence as stated by law
法律上（的）；根據法定權力（的）

de nos jours: used to say that someone is like a modern version of a person from the past. De nos jours is French for "of our days".

de rigueur: （在時尚、習慣等方面）必需的，必備的，不可缺少的

de trop: unnecessary, unwanted, or more than is suitable
不必要的；無用的；過頭的

dead air: a period of silence during a radio or television broadcast that is not intended
（廣播或電視播映時因故障導致的）意外中斷

dead ball: in football, an occasion when the ball is not in play and players can pick it up, for example before taking a corner or free kick

dead cat bounce: a temporary increase in the value of shares after there has been a large reduction in their value
股價短時間反彈；死貓詐屍

dead duck: someone or something that is very unlikely to be successful, especially because of a mistake or bad judgment
（尤指因過錯或判斷失誤造成的）劣勢，不太可能成功的人（或事物）

dead end: a road that is closed at one end, and does not lead anywhere
a situation that has no hope of making progress

dead heat: a competition in which two or more competitors finish at exactly the same time or with exactly the same result

dead language: a language that is no longer spoken by anyone as their main language
死語（不再有人以之作為母語的語言）

MAIL: a letter that cannot be delivered to the address written on it and cannot be returned to the person who sent it
LAW/AGREEMENT: a law or agreement that is no longer effective
已失效的法律；形同虛設的協議；空文

dead loss: an activity or process that is not at all effective or successful
a person who is not successful or useful

dead men tell no tales: People who are dead cannot tell secrets.
只有死人才會保守秘密

dead reckoning: a way of calculating the position of a ship or aircraft using only information about the direction and distance it has travelled from a known point

dead ringer: someone or something that looks very similar to someone or something else

dead weight: the heaviness of a person or object that cannot or does not move by itself
難以搬動的重物；沉重的人（或物）

dead wood: people or things that are no longer useful

dead zone: a place where a mobile phone does not work because there is no signal
無訊號區（行動電話因無訊號而無法使用）
a place or time in which nothing happens
無事發生的時間（或地點）

dead-end job: a job in which there is no chance of progressing to a better, more important job
沒有前途的工作，沒出息的工作

deadly nightshade: a very poisonous plant with small, black, shiny fruits, that grows in Europe, North Africa, and Western Asia
顛茄（一種有毒的植物，結黑而亮的小果，見於歐洲、北非和西亞）

deal in: to buy and sell particular goods as a business

deal with: to take action in order to achieve something or in order to solve a problem
to be about or be on the subject of something

Dear John letter: a letter written to end a romantic relationship

dearness allowance: an amount of money that is added to a person's basic pay or pension because of rising prices and other costs

death camp: a place where large numbers of people are sent to be killed, or kept as prisoners until they die from the extremely bad conditions

death duty: the unofficial name for tax on a person's money and possessions when they die

death knell: a warning of the end of something
終結的預兆，完結的信號

death mask: a model of a dead person's face made by pressing wax onto the face

death row: in prison and waiting to be killed as a punishment for a crime

death sentence: a legal punishment of a crime by death

death squad: an unofficial armed group who look for and illegally kill particular people, especially the enemies of a political party

death throes: the process of dying or ending in a very painful or unpleasant way
（臨死前的）痛苦掙扎；垂死掙扎

death toll: the number of people who die because of an event such as a war or an accident

death trap: something that is very dangerous and could cause death

death warrant: an official document that says that someone must be killed as a punishment

death's head: a picture of a human skull (= the hard structure of the head) used as a warning of danger or to frighten people

deathwatch beetle: an insect that eats wood, especially in old houses, causing serious damage
（尤指毀壞老屋的）報死蟲，紅毛竊蠹

debit card: a small plastic card that can be used as a method of payment, the money being taken from your bank account automatically

debit column: the list of numbers that shows amounts of money that have been spent from a bank account
借方欄，支出記錄，支出賬目

debt relief: the situation in which a bank or a government tells a person, a company, or a government that they do not have to pay back the money they owe
債務免除（銀行或政府告知個人、公司或政府不需償還借款）

decide on: to choose something or someone after careful thought

decimal currency: a money system in which a smaller unit can be multiplied by ten or a 100 to make up a bigger unit

decimal place: the position of a number after a decimal point

decimal point: the dot used between the whole numbers and the tenths of a decimal. In some countries a decimal comma is used instead.

decimal system: a system of counting based on the number ten, with numbers from 0 to 9

declarative sentence: a sentence that makes a statement or states a fact

declare for: UK to give/not give someone or something your public support

declare against: UK to give/not give someone or something your public support

decompression chamber: a small room in which a very high air pressure is reduced slowly to the normal level to prevent or treat decompression sickness
減壓艙（或室），降壓艙（或室）

decompression sickness: a serious medical condition caused by returning too quickly to the surface of the sea when diving with breathing equipment

decree absolute: the final stage of a divorce (= a legal agreement to end a marriage), when people become free to marry again

decree nisi: the first stage of a divorce (= a legal agreement to end a marriage)
（如無異議即在指定時間內生效的）離婚判決書

deed box: a metal box that can be locked, in which important documents are kept

deed poll: in the UK, a type of legal document, especially one that allows someone to officially change their name
（英國）單務契約，單邊契約（只有一方執行的契約，常用於人名的更換）

deep down: felt strongly and often hidden from other people
felt strongly and often hidden from other people

deep pockets: If an organization or person has deep pockets, they have a lot of money.

deep tissue massage: a type of massage in which the person giving the massage presses hard on areas of the body where the muscles are very stiff or painful

deep vein thrombosis: a serious medical condition in which a blood clot (= a sticky mass of blood) forms in the veins of the legs or lungs

default to: If a computer defaults to a way of operating, it automatically uses it if you do not intentionally change it.

defence mechanism: an automatic way of behaving or thinking by which you protect yourself from something, especially from feeling unpleasant emotions

defer to: to allow someone or something to make decisions for you or tell you what to do because of your respect for them or because of their higher rank, authority, knowledge, etc.

deficiency disease: a disease caused by not eating enough of particular types of food that are necessary for good health

defining moment: the point at which a situation is clearly seen to start to change
轉折點；決定性時刻；關鍵性事件

defining vocabulary: the set of words that has been used to write all the definitions in a particular dictionary

definite article: the grammatical name for the word "the" in English, or the words in other languages that have a similar use

definite maybe: something that you think you might do, but are not certain about
不一定（表示有此意願，但不確定）

d\u00e9j\u00e0 vu: the strange feeling that in some way you have already experienced what is happening now
似曾經歷過的感覺；似曾相識的感覺

delayed sleep phase pattern: a situation in which someone falls asleep and wakes later than most people

delaying tactics: actions that are intended to make something happen more slowly, in order to win an advantage

delight in: to get a lot of pleasure from something, especially something unpleasant
從（尤指不愉快的事）中取樂

delirium tremens: （長期酗酒引起的）震顫性譫妄

delivery room: a room in a hospital in which babies are born

evening primrose: a plant with pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are used to make an oil that is used to treat various medical conditions.

every cloud has a silver lining: said to emphasize that every difficult or unpleasant situation has some advantage

every dog has its day: said to emphasize that everyone is successful or happy at some time in their life

every inch of sth: all of a thing or place

every trick in the book: 所有可能的辦法；渾身解數

exclamation mark: the symbol ! written immediately after an exclamation

exclamatory sentence: a sentence containing an exclamation or strong emphasis

pardon my French!: said when you are pretending to be sorry for using a word that may be considered offensive

exhaust pipe: the pipe at the back of a vehicle or on a machine through which waste gas escapes from the engine

（英文字母表的第六個字母）

face cream: cream that you put on your face to make the skin softer and less dry

fade out: If the picture or sound of a film or recording fades out or someone fades it out, it becomes gradually weaker.

faint heart never won fair maiden: used to tell someone that they must make a lot of effort if they want to achieve something difficult
要想啃下硬骨頭，必須費點力氣；一分耕耘，一分收穫

fall into sb's arms: When people fall into each other's arms, they hold each other tightly with both arms, to show their love for each other.

fall into: to start doing something, often without intending to

RACE: the start of a race in which one competitor starts too early, before the official signal to begin

集中注意力於；集中思想於

集中注意力於；集中思想於

free fall: an occasion when something or someone falls quickly under the influence of gravity

free spirit: a person who does what they want with enjoyment and pleasure and does not feel limited by the usual rules of social behaviour

God helps those who help themselves: said to show you believe that if you make an effort to achieve something, you will be successful

God knows: used to emphasize that you do not understand something at all or have no knowledge of something at all
（用於強調不理解或不知道某事）天曉得
used to mean "I don't know" or to emphasize a statement. Some people may find this use offensive.
（表示不知道或加強語氣）天知道（有些人認為此種表達具冒犯意）

God only knows: informal it is impossible to say

God slot: a period of time on television or radio for religious broadcasts
（電視或廣播的）宗教節目時間

God willing: used to say you hope everything happens in the way you want
（表示希望事情如願以償）如果是天意，如上帝許可，如一切順利

God's gift: If you say that someone thinks they are God's gift (to someone or something), you mean that that person believes that they are better than anyone else.
上帝（對…）的恩寵；上帝恩賜的人（或物）

God's truth: said to emphasize that something is the complete truth
（用於強調某事的真實性）絕對真實

God almighty!: an expression of anger or surprise. Some people consider this offensive.
（表示憤怒或驚奇，或被認為具有冒犯性）我的天啊！

Christ almighty!: an expression of anger or surprise. Some people consider this offensive.
（表示憤怒或驚奇，或被認為具有冒犯性）我的天啊！

going away: In sports, if a team or person wins a competition going away, they win it by a lot of points, goals, etc.

going on: UK also going on for informal nearly or almost (a particular number, age, time, or amount)
接近（某個數目、年齡、時間或數量）
humorous used for saying that someone behaves like a much older person
實際上…歲，行為舉止卻像…歲

going-out-of-business sale: a sale of goods at reduced prices by a shop that is going to stop doing business and close

gold card: a credit card that you can get if you earn a lot of money

gold digger: someone, usually a woman, who tries to attract a rich person, usually a man, in order to get presents or money
以色相騙取男人財物的女人

gold disc: a prize given to the performer(s) of a popular song, or a collection of popular songs, when a large number of copies of the recording of it have been sold

gold leaf: gold in the form of very thin sheets, often used to cover objects, such as decorative details in a building

gold medal: a disk-shaped prize made of or covered with gold that is given to a person or team that wins a competition

gold mine: a place where gold is taken from the ground
something that produces wealth or information

gold reserve: the amount of gold held by a national bank, used for dealing with the national banks of other countries

gold rush: a situation in which a lot of people move to a place to try to find gold because they have heard that gold has been found there
淘金熱（指湧向新採金地的熱潮）

FINANCIAL SYSTEM: a system of providing and controlling the exchange of money in a country, in which the value of money (compared to foreign money) is fixed against that of gold
GOOD THING: something that is very good and is used for measuring how good other similar things are

golden age: a period of time, sometimes imaginary, when everyone was happy, or when a particular art, business, etc. was very successful
（有時指想像中的）黃金時代，鼎盛時期

golden boy: a person who is very successful and is much admired, although often only temporarily
（常指一時）大受歡迎的成功男孩／女孩

golden girl: a person who is very successful and is much admired, although often only temporarily
（常指一時）大受歡迎的成功男孩／女孩

golden eagle: a large bird with brown feathers on its back, found in northern parts of the world, that eats small animals

golden generation: used, especially in sports reports, to refer to a group of skilful football, rugby, etc. players of similar ages who achieve success or are expected to achieve success for their country
（尤其在體育報導中）黃金一代

golden goal: the first goal scored during a period of extra time in a football game, which ends the game and means that the team who scored it wins
金球（足球比賽加時賽中的第一個入球，它標誌著比賽的結束，進球方獲勝）

golden goose: something that gives you an advantage, especially a financial advantage
（尤指在金錢方面）給人帶來好處（或優勢）的事物；法寶；搖錢樹

golden handcuffs: payments made to employees, especially those in a high position, as a way of persuading them not to leave their jobs and go and work somewhere else
「金手銬」（指為了收買人心使其不另謀高就而給的津貼，尤指付給高級僱員的大筆錢）

golden handshake: a usually large payment made to people when they leave their job, either when their employer has asked them to leave or when they are leaving at the end of their working life, as a reward for very long or good service in their job
（被解僱或者退休時僱主為了嘉獎其出色工作而提供的一大筆）退休金，遣散費

golden hello: an extra payment that is given to someone for accepting a new job
（公司給特別看重的新職員的）豐厚見面禮，高額聘金

golden jubilee: the day exactly 50 years after an important occasion, or a special event to celebrate this

golden parachute: a large payment made to someone who has an important job with a company when that person is forced to leave their job
「金降落傘」（公司解僱重要職員時所給的一大筆補償金）

golden retriever: a large dog that has gold or cream-coloured fur
金毛尋回犬，黃金獵犬（一種有黃毛或奶油色毛的大犬）

golden rule: an important rule or principle, especially in a particular situation
（尤指在某種情況下使用的）重要的原則，指導準則，黃金準則

golden syrup: a thick, sweet, gold-coloured liquid used in cooking to make food sweet

golden wedding anniversary: the day exactly 50 years after a marriage, often celebrated with a party
結婚50周年紀念日，金婚紀念日

goldfish bowl: a bowl that is usually round and made of glass and is used for keeping pet fish in, especially goldfish

SPORT: a small, hard, white ball used for playing golf
PRINTING: a small metal ball with raised letter shapes on it, used in some types of computer printers and typewriters
（電腦列印機或打字機的）球形字體

STICK: one of a set of specially shaped wooden or metal sticks used for hitting a golf ball
CLUB: an organized group of golf players, or the building in which they meet and the area on which they play

golf course: an area of land used for playing golf

good afternoon: something you say to greet someone politely when you meet them in the afternoon
（午後見面時的問候語）下午好，你（們）好

good day: used as a greeting or when saying goodbye during the day
（日間見面招呼或告別用語）你（們）好，日安；再見

good evening: something you say to greet someone politely when you meet them in the evening
（晚上見面招呼用語）晚上好，你（們）好

good for you!: used to show approval for someone's success or good luck

Good Friday: the Friday before Easter Sunday, the day in the Christian religion on which the death of Jesus is especially remembered
（基督徒認為耶穌受難的日子，復活節前的星期五）受難節，耶穌受難瞻禮

good heavens: used to emphasize how surprised, angry, shocked, etc. you are
（驚奇、憤怒或震驚時用於加強語氣）（我的）天哪！

good grief: used to emphasize how surprised, angry, shocked, etc. you are
（驚奇、憤怒或震驚時用於加強語氣）（我的）天哪！

good gracious!: used to emphasize how surprised, angry, shocked, etc. you are
（驚奇、憤怒或震驚時用於加強語氣）（我的）天哪！

good job!: used for praising someone for something they have done well

good money: an amount of money that you think is large

good morning: something you say to greet someone politely when you meet them in the morning
（上午見面時的招呼語）早上好，上午好，你（們）好

good name: used in polite questions to ask a person's name

good night: said when people leave each other in the evening or before going to bed or to sleep
（晚上離開或者去睡覺前的告別語）晚安

good old boy: a man from the southern US who enjoys spending time with his friends, and disapproves of ideas or ways of behaving that are different from his own
標準的美國南方男子（愛和朋友開玩笑、固執己見）

good show: used as an expression of approval

good things come in small packages: said to emphasize that something does not need to be big in order to be good
濃縮的都是精品；好東西不在個頭大

good-time girl: a young woman who is only interested in pleasure, not in serious activities, work, etc.

good karma: the good or bad general character or feeling among a group of people or in a place
風土人情（特定人群或特定地區人的性格以及他們的想法）

bad karma: the good or bad general character or feeling among a group of people or in a place
風土人情（特定人群或特定地區人的性格以及他們的想法）

good stuff!: something you say to encourage or praise someone

great stuff!: something you say to encourage or praise someone

lovely stuff!: something you say to encourage or praise someone

goodbye to: used when accepting that there is no possibility of getting, keeping, or achieving a particular thing

Goodness knows: used to mean "I don't know" or to emphasize a statement. Some people may find this use offensive.
（表示不知道或加強語氣）天知道（有些人認為此種表達具冒犯意）

Heaven knows: used to mean "I don't know" or to emphasize a statement. Some people may find this use offensive.
（表示不知道或加強語氣）天知道（有些人認為此種表達具冒犯意）

Christ knows: used to mean "I don't know" or to emphasize a statement. Some people may find this use offensive.
（表示不知道或加強語氣）天知道（有些人認為此種表達具冒犯意）

goods and chattels: the things that you own other than land and buildings

goody bag: a bag of small gifts given to guests at a party or other event
（聚會上送給賓客的）一包禮品

goof around: to spend time doing nothing important or behaving in a silly way

goose step: a special way of marching with the legs lifted high and straight

Gordian knot: 棘手的問題，難辦的事；棘手的局面

Gordon Bennett: used to express great surprise or anger

Gorlin's syndrome: a rare inherited disorder that often makes a person get skin cancer on the face, chest and back and cysts (= small growths filled with liquid) on the jaw

gossip column: the part of a newspaper in which you find stories about the social and private lives of famous people
（報紙上關於名人社交或私生活的）漫談欄，茶話欄

got it in one!: something that you say when someone has guessed something correctly

governor general: the main representative of a country in another country that is controlled by the first country, especially the representative of the British king or queen in a country that is a member of the Commonwealth
（尤指英聯邦國家代表英國國王或女王的）總督

grab at: to try to get hold of someone or something quickly, with your hand

grace period: extra time you are given to pay money you owe without losing something or paying an additional amount

grade crossing: a place where a railway and a road cross each other, usually with gates that stop the traffic while a train goes past
（鐵路與公路的）平面交叉路口

grade-point average: a number that is the average mark received for all the courses a student takes and shows how well the student is doing
（學生各科成績的）平均積分點

graded reader: one of a series of books of increasing levels of difficulty, used for teaching people to read, or to help them learn a foreign language by reading
分級系列讀物（用於閱讀教學，或作為學習外語者自己閱讀之用）

graduate school: a college or a college department where students who already have a first degree are taught

graduated cylinder: a glass cylinder that has lines printed on the side of it showing how much it contains, used by scientists

grammar school: in the UK, a school for children aged between eleven and 18 who have passed an examination that shows they are good at studying
（英國11到18歲學習優秀的學生通過考試上的）文法學校

Granary Bread: a brand name for a type of bread that contains whole seeds of wheat.

grand jury: in the US, a group of people who decide if a person who has been charged with a crime should be given a trial in a law court

grand old age: If a person or animal lives to a grand old age, they live until they are very old.

grand piano: a large piano that has horizontal strings in a case supported on three legs

grand prix: one of a series of important international races for very fast and powerful cars
國際大獎賽（汽車的國際系列大獎賽中的一場）

WINNING EVERYTHING: an occasion when someone wins all of a set of important sports competitions
（體育比賽中贏得各項重要比賽的）大滿貫，全勝
CARDS: an occasion when someone wins all the cards in a card game, especially bridge
BASEBALL: in baseball, the hitting of a home run with runners at all three bases, so that four points are scored
（棒球中滿壘時的）四分本壘打

grand total: the complete number after everything has been added up

grand tour: also Grand Tour a visit to the most important countries and cities of Europe that rich young people made in the past as part of their education
大旅行，環歐旅行（指從前富人子弟在歐洲大陸主要城市的觀光旅行，作為其教育的一部分）
often humorous an occasion when someone shows you round a house or other building
參觀，遊覽（指帶領某人在房屋或其他建築物中四處觀看）

grande dame: a woman who is respected because of her experience and knowledge of a particular subject
（在某個領域因經驗豐富、知識淵博而）德高望重的女性，受人敬仰的女性，女泰斗

grandfather clock: a tall clock in a wooden case that stands on the floor

granny flat: a set of rooms, often connected to or part of a relation's house, in which an old person lives
老奶奶套房（指家中專供老年人住的房間）

granny knot: a type of simple knot that can be easily unfastened
老奶奶結（容易解開的結）

grant-maintained school: a type of school in the UK between 1988 and 1998 that received its money directly from central rather than local government
（英國）直接由中央政府出資的學校，接受中央政府撥款的學校

graph paper: a type of paper covered with small squares, for drawing graphs on

graphic arts: the arts that include drawing and printing

graphic design: the art of designing pictures and text for books, magazines, advertising, etc.
（書籍、雜誌、廣告等的）平面造型設計

graphic novel: a book containing a long story told mostly in pictures but with some writing
漫畫小說（多數以圖畫表示，也配合文字）

graphical user interface: a way of arranging information on a computer screen that is easy to understand and use because it uses icons (= pictures), menus, and a mouse rather than only text

graphics card: a circuit board (= small piece of electronic equipment) inside a computer that allows it to receive and show pictures and video
（電腦）圖形卡，圖像式配卡，顯示卡

grapple with: to try to deal with or understand a difficult problem or subject
盡力解決；設法對付；盡量克服

grasp at: to try to take an opportunity
to try to hold or touch something

grasp the nettle: to force yourself to be brave and do something that is difficult or unpleasant
迫使自己迎難而上；果斷處理棘手的問題；破釜沉舟

grass on: If a person grasses on someone else, they tell the police or someone in authority about something bad that that person has done.
向警方告密，向警方告發（某人）

grass skirt: a skirt made of long pieces of real or artificial grass, traditionally worn by dancers in the Pacific islands

grass widow: a woman who spends a lot of time apart from her partner, often because he or she is working in a different place
（因為丈夫在外地工作）長期與丈夫分居的女人，留守女性

grateful for small mercies: If someone should be grateful/thankful for small mercies, they should be grateful for something because it is not as bad as it could have been
爲情況還過得去表示慶幸

thankful for small mercies: If someone should be grateful/thankful for small mercies, they should be grateful for something because it is not as bad as it could have been
爲情況還過得去表示慶幸

gravel pit: a place where gravel is dug out of the ground

graven image: an object made especially from wood, stone, etc. and used for religious worship
（尤指用木頭、石頭等雕刻的）偶像，偽神

Graves' disease: a condition affecting the thyroid that makes every function in the body speed up. People who have Graves' disease often have eyes that stick out because of tissue swelling behind the eyes.
格雷氏病，突眼甲狀腺腫

graveyard shift: a period of work, for example in a factory, that begins late at night and ends early in the morning

gravitate towards: to be attracted by or to move in the direction of something or someone

gravitate to: to be attracted by or to move in the direction of something or someone

gravy boat: a long, low container with a handle, used for serving gravy at the table

gravy train: a way of making money quickly, easily, and often dishonestly
（常指不誠實的）輕鬆賺大錢的方法，發橫財的捷徑

grease monkey: someone whose job is repairing car or aircraft engines
汽車（或飛機）引擎修理員；機修工

grease sb's palm: to secretly give someone money in order to persuade them to do something for you

greaseproof paper: paper that does not allow oil through, used especially in cooking
（尤指烹調用的）防油紙，耐油紙，蠟紙

greasy spoon: a small, cheap restaurant, especially one that sells a lot of fried food
（尤指供應油炸食物的）低級小餐館，廉價小飯館

great ape: an animal from the group of animals that includes gorillas, orang-utangs, and chimpanzees
類人猿（包括大猩猩，紅猩猩，黑猩猩等）

Great Britain: 大不列顛（包括英格蘭、蘇格蘭及威爾士）

great minds think alike: said to someone just after you have discovered that they have had the same idea as you

greatest common factor: the largest number that can be used to divide two other numbers
最大公約數（使一組數都能被整除的最大除數）

Greek cross: a cross with four arms that are all the same length

green audit: an official examination of the effects a company or other organization has on the environment, especially the damage that it causes
綠色審查（尤指對公司或其他組織在環境造成的污染進行的調查）

green bean: a type of long, green bean that you can eat

green belt: a strip of countryside round a city or town where building is not allowed

WORK: a document giving someone who is not a US citizen permission to live and work in the US
CAR: UK a document that insures your car against accidents (= protects you financially if you have a car accident) when travelling in other countries
（在國外開車需要的）綠色保險證，汽車國外事故保險證

green fingers: the ability to make plants grow

green onion: a long, thin, green and white onion that is often eaten uncooked

Green Paper: in various countries, a government document that anyone who is interested can study and make suggestions about, especially before a law is changed or a new law is made
綠皮書（尤指英國政府供民眾對修改法律或制定新法律提出建議的文件）

green pepper: a shiny, green vegetable with a hollow centre. Green peppers can be eaten uncooked or cooked.

green room: a room, for example in a theatre, where performers can relax

green salad: a salad that consists of lettuce and other uncooked green vegetables
（萵苣等蔬菜做的）綠色沙拉，生菜沙拉

green shoots: (used especially in newspapers) the first signs of an improvement in an economy that is performing badly
（尤作報紙用語）經濟復甦的跡象

green tea: the light-coloured tea drunk especially in China and Japan
（尤指中國和日本人喝的）綠茶

green thumb: the ability to make plants grow

greener pastures: a new place or activity that offers new opportunities
更好的新地方；更好的職位

greenhouse gas: a gas that causes the greenhouse effect, especially carbon dioxide
溫室氣體（尤指二氧化碳）

Greenwich Mean Time: the time at Greenwich, Greater London, that world time zones are based on
格林威治（平均）時，世界時

greetings card: a piece of thick paper folded in half with a picture on the outside and a message inside, that you write in and send or give to someone, for example at Christmas or on their birthday

Gregorian chant: a type of Christian church music for voices alone, used since the Middle Ages
格列高利聖詠（基督教教堂演唱的一種無伴奏聖歌）

grey area: a situation that is not clear or where the rules are not known
灰色地帶，灰色區域（指不明朗的形勢或規則難界定的領域）

grey eminence: 灰色高貴（指後臺掌權的人物）

grey matter: specialized anatomy the darker tissue containing nerve fibres (= structures like threads) found in the brain and spinal cord

grey water: water that has been used before, for example for washing, that can be stored and used again, for example in toilets

grid reference: a position on a map that has been divided into squares by numbered lines going from one side to the other and from top to bottom so that you can find places easily on it

grief tourist: someone who visits a place because something bad happened there
前往悲劇發生現場的遊客

grievous bodily harm: a crime in which one person does serious physical injury to another

grill pan: an open, rectangular metal container, often with a frame of metal bars inside, on which food is cooked under the surface in a cooker which can be heated to very high temperatures

grin and bear it: to accept something bad without complaining

grin from ear to ear: 非常開心，笑得合不攏嘴

smile from ear to ear: 非常開心，笑得合不攏嘴

grind the faces of the poor: Someone who grinds the faces of the poor, treats poor people very badly, often to get money from them.

grind to a halt: 慢慢停下來，逐漸陷入停頓

grind to a standstill: 慢慢停下來，逐漸陷入停頓

Gripe Water: a brand name for a medicine given to babies to cure stomach pain

grit your teeth: to press your top and bottom teeth together, often in anger
to accept a difficult situation and deal with it in a determined way
咬緊牙關，下定決心（去應付棘手的局面）

grizzly bear: a very large, greyish-brown bear from North America

groan with/under: to carry a very large quantity of something

grope for: to try to think of something, especially the right words, the correct answer, etc.
搜腸刮肚地想，努力搜尋（尤指恰當的言辭、正確的答案）

gross domestic product: the total value of goods and services produced by a country in one year

gross receipts: money from sales, before costs and taxes are taken away
（銷售收入未扣除成本和稅收之前的）總收益

ground ball: a ball that moves along the ground rather than through the air when it has been hit in a game of baseball

ground beef: meat, usually beef, that has been cut up into very small pieces, often using a special machine

ground cover: plants that grow thickly and close to the ground, sometimes used in gardens to prevent weeds from growing
地被植物（有時用於阻止雜草生長）

ground crew: the people at an airport who take care of the aircraft while it is on the ground

ground frost: a temperature at or below freezing point on and near the ground during the night that can damage plants

ground level: the same level as the surface of the ground

BUILDING: the plan that has been drawn of a building
ACTION: mainly US the basic plan of action for something

ground rent: money paid by the owner of a building or apartment to the person who owns the land on which it has been built

ground rules: the principles on which future behaviour is based

ground speed: An aircraft's ground speed is its speed when measured against the ground rather than the air through which it moves.
對地速率（指飛機飛行時相對於地面的速度）

ground staff: the people whose job is to take care of a sports ground and its equipment

ground water: underground water that is held in the soil and rocks

ground zero: the exact place where a nuclear bomb explodes
the place where the World Trade Center stood in New York City before it was destroyed in an attack on 11 September, 2001
（毀於2001年9月11日恐怖襲擊的）紐約世界貿易中心遺址

Groundhog Day: in the US, 2 February, which, according to an old story, is the day the groundhog wakes up after sleeping through the winter. If it sees its shadow on this day, there will be six more weeks of winter, and if it does not, spring will start early.
a situation in which events that have happened before happen again, in what seems to be exactly the same way
過去發生的事情又再次同樣發生，周而復始

group captain: an officer in the British air force

group hug: the action of a group of people standing close together and putting their arms around each other, in order to show love and support

group match: one of the games in the first part of a football cup competition when the teams are divided into groups and the teams in each group play against each other. The winner or winners of each group then move onto the next part of the competition
（足球杯賽中的）小組賽階段的比賽

group of death: in the first stage of a football cup competition, a group containing several of the best teams in the competition, not all of whom can move onto the next stage
（足球杯賽中的）有最多強隊的小組，死亡之組

Group of Eight: the eight countries of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Russia, the UK, and the US, whose leaders meet every year to discuss international problems
八大工業國組織（包括加拿大、法國、德國、意大利、日本、俄羅斯、英國和美國）

group practice: a group of several doctors who work together in the same place
（幾名醫生在同一地方的）聯合醫療，集體行醫
