hope to God: （用於強調）真的希望／衷心希望／向天發誓

wish to God: （用於強調）真的希望／衷心希望／向天發誓

swear to God: （用於強調）真的希望／衷心希望／向天發誓

hormone replacement therapy: a treatment for women whose levels of female hormones are low because they have reached the menopause
荷爾蒙替代療法（治療體內雌性激素分泌不足的更年期女性）

horn in: to try to become involved in a discussion or activity when you are not wanted

hornet's nest: a very difficult or unpleasant situation, especially in which a lot of people get very angry and complain

horror film: a film in which very frightening or unnatural things happen, for example dead people coming to life and people being murdered

horror of horrors: said when you are telling someone about a very bad or embarrassing situation

horror story: a story in which very frightening and unnatural things happen
a report of real events in which things have gone very wrong

hors de combat: If you are hors de combat, you cannot take part in an activity because you are injured. Hors de combat is French for "out of combat".
失去參與機會的（法語，指退出戰鬥的）

horse around: to behave in a silly and noisy way

horse chestnut: a large tree with pink or white flowers, or the poisonous, shiny, brown nut that comes from it

horse float: a vehicle for transporting horses, sometimes pulled by another vehicle

horse racing: a sport in which people race on horses, usually to win money for the horses' owners

horse riding: the sport or activity of riding a horse

horse sense: practical knowledge and good judgment about ordinary life

horse trailer: a vehicle for transporting horses that is pulled behind another vehicle

horseback riding: the sport or activity of riding a horse

horses for courses: used to say that it is important to choose suitable people for particular activities because everyone has different skills

hospital ball: in football, a pass that is weak or not accurate and has an equal chance of being received by a player from either team, increasing the possibility of the players getting injured
（足球比賽中，因為傳得較弱或不准，讓雙方都有機會得到球，導致因爭搶而受傷的機會增加的）易讓人受傷的傳球

hostage to fortune: an action or statement that could create problems for you later
將來可能會引起麻煩的言行；冒險行為；冒險言論

hot air: If something that someone says is hot air, it is not sincere and will have no practical results.

hot and heavy: If something or someone is hot and heavy, they are full of strong emotions or sexual feelings.
感情激烈的；性慾旺盛的

hot button: a subject that is important to people and about which they have strong opinions

hot chocolate: a hot drink made from milk and/or water, powdered chocolate, and sugar

hot cross bun: a round, sweet cake like bread with a cross painted on the top, eaten in some Christian countries at Easter
（某些基督教國家在復活節吃的）十字麵包

hot desk: a desk and computer in an office that are available to be used by any worker who needs it
供機動使用的辦公桌和電腦，非固定使用的辦公桌和電腦
to work at whatever desk and computer is available in an office

hot dog!: something that you say when you are very pleased about something
FOOD: a cooked sausage eaten in a long soft piece of bread, often with ketchup (= tomato sauce) or mustard
SPORT: mainly US informal a person who makes fast, skilful movements in skiing, snowboarding, or surfing in order to make people notice them
（尤指滑雪運動中）賣弄技巧的人

hot flush: a sudden hot, uncomfortable feeling experienced by some women during the menopause
（婦女在更年期的）潮熱，熱潮紅

hot key: a key that starts a particular computer program or causes a series of actions to be performed automatically, sometimes when used in combination with another key
熱鍵（電腦操作中，啟動某一程式或引起一系列自動運行動作的鍵，有時與其他鍵合用）；快速鍵

hot off the press: News that is hot off the press has just been printed and often contains the most recent information about something.

hot pants: very small, tight shorts (= short trousers) worn by women

hot potato: a problem, situation, etc. that is difficult to deal with and causes a lot of disagreement
棘手的事情，麻煩事，燙手山竽

hot shit: someone or something that is very good

hot to trot: sexually excited and wanting to find someone to have sex with

hot tub: a large, usually wooden, container full of hot water in which more than one person can sit

hot up: If an event or situation hots up, it becomes more exciting and more things start to happen.
（事件或情況）加劇，變得更加激烈

hot-air balloon: an aircraft consisting of a very large bag filled with heated air or other gas, with a basket (= container) hanging under it in which people can ride

hot-air gun: an electrical tool that blows out hot air and is used to make paint on surfaces softer so that it can be removed more easily

hot-water bottle: a rubber container that you fill with very hot water and use to warm a bed or a part of your body

hot-water tank: a metal container, usually found in or near the bathroom, that holds and heats the water for a house

hour hand: the part on a clock or watch that points to the hours. It is shorter than the minute hand.

hourglass figure: If a woman has an hourglass figure, she has a very small waist.

house arrest: legally forced to stay in your house as if in prison

house call: an occasion when a doctor or other health worker comes to your home, usually to give treatment

House Committee: in the US, a group of people chosen by the House of Representatives to consider a particular subject
（在美國由眾議院選出，專門負責某件事情的）眾議院專門委員會

house husband: a man who stays at home and cleans the house, takes care of the children, etc. while his partner goes out to work
操持家務的丈夫，家庭主夫

house journal: a newspaper produced by a company to tell employees what is happening in the company
a newspaper or magazine that is typically read by a particular group of people and represents their opinions
（被某一典型群體閱讀，代表其觀點的）代言刊物，傳聲筒刊物

house lights: the lights in the place where the public sit in a theatre or cinema

house martin: a small bird that makes its nest under the edge of the roof of a house

house of cards: a complicated organization or plan that is very weak and can easily be destroyed or easily go wrong
脆弱的組織；極易出問題的計劃

house of correction: a building where people who have committed crimes that are not serious are sent to improve their behaviour

house organ: a newspaper produced by a company to tell employees what is happening in the company
a newspaper or magazine that is typically read by a particular group of people and represents their opinions
（被某一典型群體閱讀，代表其觀點的）代言刊物，傳聲筒刊物

house sparrow: a small, grey and brown bird that is found in most parts of the world

household goods: equipment, tools, machines, and other things used in a house

household name: a famous person that most people know of

household word: a word or name that everyone knows

housemaid's knee: a painful knee usually caused by being on the knees too much
因長跪著而引起的膝蓋疼痛

housing association: a group of people who join together so that they can build or buy houses or apartments at low cost
住宅互助協會（以低價建屋或購屋為目的）

housing benefit: in the UK, money paid by the government to help people who are poor pay for a place to live in
（英國政府提供給窮人的）住屋補助

housing estate: an area containing a large number of houses or apartments built close together at the same time

housing project: a group of houses or apartments, usually provided by the government for families who have low incomes
（通常指政府為低收入家庭建造的）住宅區

hover mower: a lawnmower that cuts grass with blades that spin round, and that is held slightly above the ground by a current of air below it

how about that?: used to emphasize that something is surprising

how about...?: informal used to make a suggestion
used when asking someone about a different thing
used when suggesting or offering something to someone
（用於建議或主動提供給別人某物）…怎麼樣？

how are you fixed for sth?: used to ask how much of something someone has, or to ask about someone's arrangements
你有多少…？你的…如何安排？

how are you keeping?: used to ask if someone is well

how are you placed for...?: used to ask someone if they have enough money, time, etc.
你的…情況如何？你覺得…怎麼樣？

how dare she, you, etc.!: used to express anger about something someone has done
（表示氣憤）她（你等）竟敢這樣（做）！

how do you do?: a formal greeting for someone that you have not met before
（初次見面時正式的問候用語）你好
a difficult, worrying, and unpleasant situation
令人煩惱不快，不好處理的情況

how do you like...?: used when asking someone how they like their drinks made
used when asking someone for an opinion

how does... grab you?: used to ask if someone would like to do something or is interested in something

how much do you want to bet?: said in answer to something that someone has said, meaning that you are certain that they are wrong
（表示確定對方錯了）你敢打賭嗎？你想賭多少？

do you want to bet?: said in answer to something that someone has said, meaning that you are certain that they are wrong
（表示確定對方錯了）你敢打賭嗎？你想賭多少？

how should I know?: I cannot be expected to know

how the other half lives: something people say when they see or hear about the lives of people who are richer than them
看看人家是怎麼生活的！（評論富人時的調侃話）

how was I to know?: used to say that something you did wrong was not your fault because you did not have enough information
（表示所做的錯事並非自己的過錯）我怎麼會知道?

how would you like...?: said to suggest that someone would not like to be in a situation experienced by someone else

used when you are extremely surprised, confused, or angry about something
（表示對某事吃驚、不解或氣憤）到底或究竟如何／甚麽／爲甚麽等

what about...?: used when suggesting or offering something to someone
（用於建議或主動提供給別人某物）…怎麼樣？

hue and cry: a noisy expression of public anger or disapproval

huff and puff: to breathe loudly, usually after physical exercise
informal disapproving to complain loudly and express disapproval

hula skirt: a skirt made of long pieces of real or artificial grass, traditionally worn by dancers in the Hawaiian islands

hum and haw: to be uncertain and take a long time deciding something

Human Genome Project: an attempt to discover all the genetic information in the human body

human geography: the study of the different ways in which human societies develop and operate in relation to their physical environment
人文地理學（研究人類社會在其自然環境下發展運作的各種方式的學科）

human immunodeficiency virus: the virus that causes AIDS (= a serious disease that destroys the body's ability to fight infection)
人體免疫缺乏病毒，愛滋病病毒

human interest: details about people's experiences and feelings
對人的情感及經歷的細節描寫

human nature: the natural ways of behaving that most people share

human relations: relationships between groups of people, especially between workers in a place of work, or the study of these relationships
（尤指工作場所的）人際關係；人際關係學

human resources: the department of an organization that deals with finding new employees, keeping records about all the organization's employees, and helping them with any problems

human rights: the basic rights that it is generally considered all people should have, such as justice and the freedom to say what you think

human shield: a person or group of people kept in a particular place in order to stop an enemy from attacking that place

human trafficking: the crime of buying and selling people, or making money from work they are forced to do, such as sex work

hung up: having a hang-up (= feeling of worry about yourself)

hung, drawn, and quartered: In the past, if someone was hung, drawn, and quartered, the person was hanged by the neck and their body was cut into pieces.

hunger strike: the act of refusing to eat in order to make a protest

hunker down: to sit down on your heels
to make yourself comfortable in a place or situation, or to prepare to stay in a place or position for a long time, usually in order to achieve something or for protection
蹲守；準備長期逗留在某處

hunt saboteur: a person who tries to stop a hunt, especially a fox hunt, because they think it is cruel to animals
主張禁獵（尤指反對獵狐）的人

hunting ground: a place where you can find a lot of what you are looking for
能找到（大量所尋之物）的地方

Huntington's disease: a rare genetic disease of the nervous system that causes uncontrollable physical movements and eventual dementia

hurl mud at: to say insulting or unfair things about someone, especially to try to damage their reputation

throw mud at: to say insulting or unfair things about someone, especially to try to damage their reputation

sling mud at: to say insulting or unfair things about someone, especially to try to damage their reputation

hurricane lamp: a light produced by burning paraffin, that has a strong glass cover to protect the flame from wind

hurry up: to move or do things more quickly than normal or to make someone do this

hurt sb's feelings: to upset someone by criticizing them or by refusing something that they have offered you

hush money: money that is given to someone to make them keep something secret

hydrochloric acid: an acid containing hydrogen and chlorine

hydrogen bomb: a nuclear bomb that explodes when the central parts of its hydrogen atoms join together

hydrogen bond: a weak connection that is formed between an atom of hydrogen and an atom of another substance such as oxygen or nitrogen

hydrogen peroxide: a clear liquid chemical used to kill bacteria, to remove colour from cloth, and to bleach hair
過氧化氫，雙氧水（一種無色化學品，用於殺菌，為毛料、頭髮脫色等）

hydroxyl ion: an ion with a negative charge, consisting of an oxygen atom and a hydrogen atom
氫氧離子（有一個氧原子和一個氫原子組成的帶有負電荷的離子）

hyped up: too excited or nervous and unable to rest or be calm

hyperoxaluria and oxalosis: a rare genetic disorder in which there is too much oxalate (= an organic salt) in the urine so that calcium oxalate crystals form in the kidneys and kidney stones are produced
高草酸鹽尿症和草酸鹽沉積症

hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: a condition in which the heart muscle becomes thicker than normal and does not relax enough for the heart to fill with blood and pump effectively

I am not my brother's keeper: used as a way of saying that you are not responsible for what someone else does or for what happens to them
各負其責；我無須為…負責

I ask you!: something that you say in order to show your surprise or anger at something someone has done
這到底是甚麼回事？（對別人所做的事表示驚訝或憤怒）

I beg to differ: a way of saying "I do not agree" that is polite, but may sound unfriendly
（禮貌的說法）恐怕我難以苟同

I beg to disagree: a way of saying "I do not agree" that is polite, but may sound unfriendly
（禮貌的說法）恐怕我難以苟同

I bet: said to show that you understand why someone has a particular opinion or feels a particular way

I know: said when you suddenly think of a good idea, an answer, or a solution
（表示突然想到好主意、答案、解決辦法）我有個主意，我知道了，我有辦法了
said to show you agree with something someone has just said

I mean: used to correct what you have just said or to add more information
（用於糾正說過的話或進一步添加內容）我的意思是
something that people often say before they start or continue their sentence

I might have known: said when you are not surprised at a situation or someone's behaviour, because you expected it

I must be hearing things: said when you cannot believe something because it is so unlikely
我想我一定是聽錯了（表示不相信某事）

I must say: 我必須說，我不得不承認

I need hardly do: used to say that what you are going to say is obvious

I owe you: said to thank someone for helping you and as a way of saying that you will do something for them in the future
我欠你一份情；我會報答你的這份情

I rest my case: said when you believe that something that has just happened or been said proves that you are right or telling the truth
（用於表示相信剛發生的事情或表明你說的是真話）還用我多說嗎？
specialized also my/the case rests law said by lawyers in a law court when they have finished the explanation of their case

I should be so lucky!: said when what you want is extremely unlikely to happen
我要是那麽走運就好了！

I should hope/say/think so: used to emphasize your agreement or your opinion

I should hope/say/think not: used to emphasize your agreement or your opinion

I should think not/so (too)!: said when you think what has been suggested is certainly not, or certainly is, the correct and expected thing

I shudder to think: said when you are worried about something unpleasant that might happen or might have happened
我一想到…就惴惴不安，我真不敢想

I stand corrected: used to admit that something you have said or done was wrong

I take it: said if you think that what you say is likely to be true, although it is not proved

I take/plead the Fifth: something that you say in order to tell someone you are not going to answer a question

I tell a lie: something you say when you have just said something wrong and want to correct it
（用於糾正剛剛說過的話）我說錯了

I think not: a formal way of disagreeing or saying no

I thought as much: used to say that you are not surprised by what someone has said or done

I would give anything/a lot: used to say that you would like to have or to do something very much
願意付出一切（以得到某物或做某事）

icing sugar: a soft powder made from sugar that is used to make icing for cakes

id\u00e9e fixe: a belief that someone refuses to change their mind about, even though it may be wrong

identical twin: one of two babies of the same sex who were born at the same time, developed from the same egg, and look the same

identify with: to believe that someone or something is closely connected or involved with something

identity card: an official document or card with your name, date of birth, photograph, or other information on it that proves who you are

identity crisis: a feeling of being uncertain about who or what you are

identity parade: a row of people, including a person who is believed to have committed a crime, who are shown to a witness (= person who saw the crime) to find out if the witness recognizes that person
（讓目擊者從中認出嫌疑犯的）辨認隊列

idiot savant: someone who has a mental disability but who is very good at doing a particular thing, for example remembering things

if and when: at the time that something happens

if ever there was one: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true
（用於強調所說情況的真實性）不容置疑，確實，真正

if I may be/make so bold: a polite way of asking for or suggesting something when you do not want to offend someone

if I were in your shoes: used when you want to tell someone what you would do in their situation

if I were you: used when you give someone advice

if it's not one thing, it's another: used when bad things keep happening to you
按倒葫蘆又起瓢；問題不斷

if it/a thing is worth doing, it's worth: used to emphasize that if you are going to spend time doing a piece of work, you should do it as well as possible
值得做的事情，就要把它做好。

said when you see someone look very angrily at someone else
要是表情能殺人…；那模樣兇死了

if only: used when you want to say how doing something would make it possible to avoid something unpleasant

if the cap fits: used to tell someone that they should accept a criticism that another person has made
要是批評中肯，就接受吧

if the worst comes to the worst: if the situation develops in the most serious or unpleasant way
如果最壞的事情發生；如果發生最糟的情況

if you ask me: said when giving your opinion on something

if you like: used for asking if someone agrees with a suggestion

if you take my meaning: used to say that you have left out information or your opinion from what you have just said, but that you expect the person listening still to understand it
如果你明白我的意思（指弦外之音）

if you will: used to say that a particular expression is one way of saying something, especially to suggest that some people may not choose to say it that way
如果你願意那樣說的話

if it comes to the crunch: if/when a situation becomes extremely serious and a decision must be made
要是到了緊要關頭；等到了關鍵時刻；需要作出決定時

when it comes to the crunch: if/when a situation becomes extremely serious and a decision must be made
要是到了緊要關頭；等到了關鍵時刻；需要作出決定時

if push comes to shove: If something can be done if push comes to shove, it can be done if the situation becomes so bad that you have to do it.
一旦情況緊急，不得已時

when push comes to shove: If something can be done if push comes to shove, it can be done if the situation becomes so bad that you have to do it.
一旦情況緊急，不得已時

ignorance is bliss: said to emphasize that sometimes it is better for you if you do not know all the facts about a situation

ill will: bad feelings between people because of things that happened in the past
to be angry with someone because of something they have done
對（某人）懷有敵意；生（某人）的氣

illegal alien: someone who lives or works in another country when they do not have the legal right to do this
非法（在其他國家生活或工作）的外國人

illegal immigrant: someone who lives or works in another country when they do not have the legal right to do this

imaginary number: a number that is the square root of a negative number

immersion heater: an electric device used for heating water

immune response: the reaction within the body that is caused by antigens (= foreign substances) and results in the production of antibodies that can fight disease by killing the bacteria or viruses that cause it
免疫反應（由體內的抗原引發的反應，過程中抗原製造抗體，抗體負責殺死致病的細菌或病毒，以對抗疾病）

immune system: the cells and tissues in the body that make it able to protect itself against infection

immune thrombocytopenic purpura: a condition in which the body does not have enough platelets (= very small cells in the blood that make it thicker in order to stop bleeding), often causing very small red spots to form on the skin
特發性血小板減少性紫癜，自身免疫性血小板減少性紫癜

impinge on: to have an effect on something, often causing problems by limiting it in some way

impinge upon: to have an effect on something, often causing problems by limiting it in some way

imprest system: a method of keeping an amount of cash in a business for paying small amounts, where a certain amount of money is kept and replaced to the same level at the beginning of each new period
（商業機構保持一定資金用於零星開支的）定額預付制

improper fraction: a fraction in which the number below the line is smaller than the number above it

improve on: to do something in a better way or with better results than before

improve upon: to do something in a better way or with better results than before

impulse buy: something that you buy suddenly and without thinking carefully

in a dream: not conscious of what is happening around you because other thoughts are filling your mind

in a flutter: in a confused and excited state

in a heartbeat: very quickly, without needing to think about it

in a manner of speaking: used for saying that something is partly true
不妨說，可以說；在某種意義上

in a stew: If someone is in a stew, that person is in a difficult situation that causes them to feel worried or upset.

in a word: said when you are going to give your opinion about something quickly and directly

in a world of your own: thinking your own thoughts and ideas and not giving much attention to what is happening around you
沉浸在自己的世界中，與外界隔絕

in absentia: while the person involved is not present

in advance: before a particular time, or before doing a particular thing

in all but name: existing as a fact but not officially described that way
實際存在但未獲正式認可；只缺正式名分

in all honesty: said when expressing your opinion honestly, seriously, or truthfully
老實說／嚴肅地說／說真的

in all seriousness: said when expressing your opinion honestly, seriously, or truthfully
老實說／嚴肅地說／說真的

in all truthfulness: said when expressing your opinion honestly, seriously, or truthfully
老實說／嚴肅地說／說真的

in all: with everything added together to make a total

in all weathers: If something is done in all weathers, it is done in every type of weather.
無論天氣好壞；風雨無阻

in arrears: owing money that should have been paid already
If someone is paid in arrears, they are paid at the end of the period of time during which the money was earned.
後付（工作一段時間後支付薪水）

in balance: spending no more money in a budget (= financial plan) than is taken in during a particular period

in blissful ignorance: not knowing any of the unpleasant facts about something

in broad daylight: If a crime is committed in broad daylight, it happens during the day, when it could have been seen and prevented.

in camera: in private, without the public, newspaper reporters, etc. being there
私下的，秘密的，不公開的

in cold blood: If someone kills in cold blood, they kill in a way that seems especially cruel because it seems to show no emotion.

in commission: If something, such as a machine or a military ship, is in commission it is working and ready for use.
（機器、軍艦等）在使用中的，在服役的

in concert: playing or singing with other musicians in a public performance

in extremis: formal in an extremely difficult situation
specialized medical at the moment of death

in flower: If a plant is in flower, it has open flowers.

in for a penny: something you say that means that since you have started something or are involved in it, you should complete the work although it has become more difficult or complicated than you had expected
一不做，二不休；要做就該做到底

in full cry: talking continuously about something in a noisy or eager way

in glorious technicolor: very colourful or too brightly coloured
色彩艷麗的；過於艷麗的，俗艷的

in God's/heaven's name: used to add force to something that is said. Some people find the use of "God" offensive.
（用於加強語氣）看在上帝的份上

in good faith: If something is done in good faith, it is done sincerely and honestly.

in hand: being worked on or dealt with now

in his/her/their wisdom: something that you say when you do not understand why someone has done something stupid
以他／她／他們的智慧（用於表示不明白為甚麼某人要做蠢事）

in hot pursuit: following someone closely, trying hard to catch them

in inverted commas: used in spoken English after a word or phrase to show that it has not been used accurately or that the opposite meaning is intended
加引號的，所謂的（表示使用不正確或意思相反）

in kind: (of payment) given in the form of goods or services and not money
以實物支付，以貨代款；以服務償付
formal If you do something in kind, you do the same thing to someone that they have just done to you.

in knots: If your stomach is in knots, it feels tight and uncomfortable because you are nervous or excited.
（胃因緊張或興奮）緊縮的，痙攣的

in line with: similar to, or at the same level as something
與…相似；與…處於同等水準

in loco parentis: being responsible for a child while the child's parents are absent
（對別人的孩子）代盡父母的責任

in medias res: a Latin expression that refers to a story, or the action of a play, etc. starting without any introduction
（拉丁語）直接切入本題地；開門見山地

in memory of: as a way of remembering someone who has died

in midstream: in the middle of an activity, often one that is interrupted

in name only: If a situation exists in name only, it is officially described that way, although that description is not completely accurate.

in on: involved with or knowing about a particular activity or plan

in phase/out of phase: If two things are happening in/out of phase they are reaching the same or related stages at the same time/at different times.

in ribbons: 粉碎；破爛；破碎成一條條

in rotation: one after the other, in a regular order

in safe hands: being cared for or dealt with by someone skilled
受到妥善照管；由專業人員處理

in sb's capable hands: being dealt with by the person mentioned

in sb's gift/in the gift of: UK formal If something is in someone's gift, that person can decide who to give it to.

in sb's hour of need: at a time when someone really needs help
在（某人）急需幫助的時候

in sb's infinite wisdom: used to show that you do not understand why someone has done something and that you think it was a stupid action
以（某人）無比的智慧（表示不明白某人為甚麼做了讓人覺得很傻的事）

in sb's pocket: in a situation where someone has power or control over you
被（某人）控制，服從於（某人）

in sb's words: used when you repeat what someone said

in secret: in a private place with no one else present and without other people knowing
only in someone's thoughts, without telling other people

in shirtsleeves: dressed informally, wearing a shirt with no jacket over it

in short: used before describing something or someone in as few words and as directly as possible

in situ: in the original place instead of being moved to another place

in so many words: directly, or in a way that makes it very clear what you mean

in spades: in large amounts or to a very great degree

in stitches: If a joke or funny story has you in stitches, it makes you laugh a lot.
（笑話或有趣的故事）令人笑岔氣，讓人捧腹

in tandem: If two pieces of equipment, people, etc. are working in tandem, they are working together, especially well or closely.

in terror of your life: frightened that you will be killed
為自己的性命提心吊膽

in the air: If something is in the air, you feel that it is happening or about to happen.
即將發生；可被感覺到；被人們意識到

in the balance: If a situation is in the balance, it has reached a stage where it will soon be decided one way or another.

in the bosom of: If you are in the bosom of a group of people, especially your family, you are with them and protected and loved by them.

in the can: If a film is in the can, filming has finished and it is ready to be prepared for showing to the public.
（影片）已經完成拍攝的，已經錄製好的

in the cold light of day: If you think about something in the cold light of day, you think about it clearly and calmly, without the emotions you had at the time it happened, and you often feel sorry or ashamed about it.
事後冷靜理智地回想某事（常感到遺憾或羞愧）

in the country of the blind, the one-eye: said about a difficult situation in which someone with only a few skills is in a better position and more successful than those people who have none
在困難的環境裡，身懷一技之人的處境比一無所長的人好

in the doghouse: If you are in the doghouse, someone is annoyed with you and shows their disapproval.

in the face of: despite having to deal with a difficult situation or problem

in the firing line: likely to be criticized, attacked, or got rid of
易遭到批評（或攻擊、拋棄）

in the first/second place: used to separate and emphasize reasons or opinions

in the flesh: in real life, and not on TV, in a film, in a picture, etc.

in the flower of sb's youth: the time when someone was young and in the best and most active period of life

in the fullness of time: If you say something will happen in the fullness of time, you mean that it will happen if you wait long enough.

in the heat of the moment: If you say or do something in the heat of the moment, you say or do it without thinking because you are very angry or excited.

in the hot seat: in a position where you are responsible for important or difficult things

in the lap of luxury: living in very comfortable conditions because you have a lot of money

in the lap of the gods: used to say that a situation that cannot be controlled and depends only on good luck
全靠運氣，碰運氣，聽天由命

in the last/final analysis: something you say when you are talking about what is most important or true in a situation

in the line of duty: Something that happens to you in the line of duty happens when you are doing your job.
在工作中；在執行任務時

in the long run: at a time that is far away in the future

in the making: If something was a period of time in the making, it took that amount of time to make.
（花某一段時間）完成，製造成，製作成

in the name of: (said or done) in order to help a particular thing succeed

in the nick of time: 在緊要關頭；在最後一刻

in the person of: 透過（某人）表現；以（某人）的身分

in the process: If you are doing something, and you do something else in the process, the second thing happens as a result of doing the first thing.

in the raw: in a plain and honest way, with nothing hidden
赤裸裸地；不加掩飾地；坦誠直率地

in the right place at the right time: in the best position or place to take advantage of an opportunity
在恰當的時機出現在恰當的地點；佔天時地利

in the same breath: If you say two things in the same breath, you say two things that are so different that if one is true, the other must be false.
同時，緊接著（指同時説出兩件相抵觸的事）

in the shape of: in the form of something, or appearing as something

in the short run: at a time that is near in the future

in the strictest confidence: If you tell someone something in the strictest confidence, you expect them not to tell it to anyone else.

in the teeth of: If something happens or is done in the teeth of difficulties, the difficulties cause problems but do not stop it.

in the thick of: in the most active or dangerous part of a particular situation or activity
在…的最激烈時，在…的最危險時刻

in the tradition of: having characteristics similar to a particular person or thing

in the twinkling of an eye: If something happens in the twinkling of an eye, it happens very quickly.

in the wake of: If something happens in the wake of something else, it happens after and often because of it.

in the wilderness: If someone, such as a politician, is in the wilderness, they no longer have a position of authority and are not now in the news.
（政治家）遠離權力和活動中心，在野

in the wind: If something is in the wind, people are talking about it and it may happen, but noone is sure.
If someone is in the wind, they are missing, especially after escaping

in the works: in the process of being planned or done

in the wrong place at the wrong time: in a situation where something bad happens to you because you are unlucky, not because you do anything wrong
在錯誤的時間出現在了錯誤的地點

in the zone: If you are in the zone, you are happy or excited because you are doing something very skilfully and easily.

in too deep: too involved in a difficult situation

in tow: If you go somewhere with a particular person in tow, they are with you.

in tray: a flat, open container where letters and other documents are put when they arrive in a person's office and where they are kept until the person has time to deal with them
（辦公室內放來文來函用的）收文籃

in triplicate: When a document is prepared or written in triplicate, two exact copies of it are made also.

in view of: because of a particular thing, or considering a particular fact

in vitro: happening outside the body in artificial conditions, often in a test tube
（生物過程或生物反應）在體外（常指試管內）進行的

in vitro fertilization: a treatment for a woman who cannot become pregnant naturally, in which an egg is fertilized outside her body and the resulting embryo is put into her womb to develop into a baby

in vivo: happening or existing inside a living body

in words of one syllable: in simple language avoiding long, difficult, or specialized words
用簡單的話，用容易理解的話

in your backyard: in the area where you live, or in the area of interest or activity that you are involved in or responsible for
在自家的後院；在自己的住所；在自己的興趣（或活動、責任）範圍內

in your dreams!: something you say to someone who has just told you about something they are hoping for, in order to show that you do not believe it will happen
做白日夢！（當別人說了一些你認為沒可能發生的事情，你給對方的反應）

in your face: shocking and annoying in a way that is difficult to ignore
used to describe something done in a forceful way that intends to shock people

in your heart of hearts: in your most secret and true thoughts

in your mind's eye: 在（某人）腦海中；在（某人）記憶裡

in your own right: If you have a position in your own right, you have earned it or got it by yourself and not because of anyone else.
依靠自己的能力；根據自己的權利；憑自己的資格

in your own words: If you say something in your own words, you speak without copying what someone else has said.

in your salad days: during the period of time when you were a young person and had little experience
在少不更事的歲月，涉世未深時

in your tracks: in the exact place where you are standing

in between times: during the periods between the separate events mentioned

between times: during the periods between the separate events mentioned

in the middle of nowhere: far away from any towns and cities and where few people live

the middle of nowhere: far away from any towns and cities and where few people live

in fits and starts: If something happens in fits and starts, it often stops and then starts again.

by fits and starts: If something happens in fits and starts, it often stops and then starts again.

in of keeping: suitable or not suitable for a particular situation
（與…）一致／不一致；（與…）協調／不協調

out of keeping: suitable or not suitable for a particular situation
（與…）一致／不一致；（與…）協調／不協調

in of pocket: having more/less money than you started with after an activity involving money

out of pocket: having more/less money than you started with after an activity involving money

in of the running: having/not having a reasonable chance of winning
有／沒有希望獲勝；有／沒有成功的機會

out of the running: having/not having a reasonable chance of winning
有／沒有希望獲勝；有／沒有成功的機會

in all the years: during the whole of a stated period of time

through all the years: during the whole of a stated period of time

in spitting distance: If something is in or within spitting distance, it is very close.

within spitting distance: If something is in or within spitting distance, it is very close.

inasmuch as: used to introduce a phrase that explains why or how much something described in another part of the sentence is true

Inauguration Day: in the US, the day when a person officially becomes president in a special ceremony and takes responsibility from the previous president
美國總統就職日（美國總統從前任總統接過權力，正式就職，舉行就職儀式的日子）

inbounds pass: in basketball, a throw from outside the playing area that puts the ball back into play

inch by inch: in great detail and in many very small stages

incident ray: in physics, a ray of light that hits a surface
入射線（物理學中，照射到表面的光線）

incidental music: music that is played during a film, broadcast, or film to create a particular mood

incline to: to think that a belief or opinion is probably correct
傾向於認為；傾向於贊同

incline towards: to think that a belief or opinion is probably correct
傾向於認為；傾向於贊同

income support: in the UK, money that is paid by the government to people who have no income or a very low income
（英國政府向無收入或低收入人士發放的）收入補貼

income tax: a tax that you have to pay on your income, usually higher for people with larger incomes

indecent assault: an attack on someone that involves sexual actions but not rape (= forced sex)
猥褻行為；猥褻他人身體

indecent exposure: the act of showing the sexual organs in public in a way that is intended to upset people
有傷風化的性器官裸露

indefinite article: the grammatical name for the words "a" and "an" in English or words in other languages that have a similar use

US: in the US, the official name for the Fourth of July holiday
OTHER COUNTRIES: a day on which a country celebrates being independent from foreign rule

independent clause: a clause in a sentence that would form a complete sentence by itself

independent means: income that you have from investments, etc. rather than from a job

independent school: in the UK, a school that does not receive money from the government

independent variable: a number or amount whose value does not depend on the value of another element in the same mathematical expression (= group of symbols representing an amount or idea)
自變數（一個數字或數量，其值不受數學運算式裡其他元素的值的影響）

index finger: the finger next to the thumb

index fossil: a fossil that is found in many places and comes from the same time in history, so that scientists can use it to decide how old certain rocks are

index of leading economic indicators: the US government's system for describing how active the national economy will be
領先經濟指標指數（指美國政府用於描述國家經濟活力的體系）

Indian club: an object shaped like a bottle, used especially by jugglers (= performers who throw objects into the air and catch them)
（尤指玩雜耍者使用的）瓶狀體操棒

Indian ink: a thick, black ink used especially for drawing

WEATHER: a period of calm, warm weather that sometimes happens in the early autumn
秋老虎，小陽春（指初秋的一段暖和天氣）
SUCCESSFUL TIME: a pleasant or successful time nearly at the end of someone's life, job, or other period
興旺的晚期；幸福安寧的晚年

Indigenous People's Day: a US holiday on the second Monday of October when people in some states celebrate the Native Americans
（每月10月的第二個星期一，美國一些州慶祝原住民的）原住民日

indirect free kick: in football, a free kick from which a goal cannot be scored without another player first touching the ball

間接疑問（書面或口頭表達裡，轉述他人的疑問，而不是逐字逐句引述原來的問題，如「他問我怎麼了。」）

indirect speech: the act of reporting something that was said, but not using exactly the same words

indirect tax: UK a tax charged on goods and services rather than on the money that people earn
（對商品和服務徵收的）間接稅
US a tax charged on goods before they reach their final buyer
（對商品在最終購買者購買前徵收的）間接稅

indoor soccer: football played by two teams of six players, not the usual eleven players. The playing area is surrounded by a wall, not lines, and the game does not stop for throw-ins, corners, or goal kicks.

induced current: an electric current that results when a second conductor (= a substance that carries electricity) is placed in an area where there is already an electric current

industrial action: an occasion when workers do something that is intended to force an employer to agree to something, especially by stopping work

industrial archaeology: the study of the buildings and places related to early types of industry
工業考古學（研究和早期工業有關的建築和場所的學科）

industrial disease: an illness related to the work that someone does

industrial espionage: an occasion when one company steals secrets from another company with which it is competing

industrial estate: a special area on the edge of a town where there are a lot of factories and businesses

industrial park: a special area on the edge of a town where there are a lot of factories and businesses

industrial relations: the relationships between companies and their workers

industrial tribunal: a type of law court that makes judgments on disagreements between companies and their workers
勞資裁判庭，勞資關係審裁法庭

inertia reel: An inertia reel seat belt moves freely but holds you firmly in position if the vehicle stops suddenly.
慣性捲筒（安全帶或座椅安全帶，能自由伸縮，突然受力時可自動收緊以保護使用者）

inertia selling: the act of sending products to people who have not asked for them, and then demanding payment
慣性銷售（廠商未獲訂購通知便先自行給買主發貨，其後再收款的銷售方法）

infant school: in the UK, a school or part of a school for children who are four to seven years old

inferiority complex: a feeling that you are not as good, as intelligent, as attractive, etc. as other people

infertility clinic: a special building or part of a hospital where people go to get medical treatment or advice when they are unable to produce children

infinity pool: a swimming pool in which the top of the water is at the same level as the edges surrounding the pool, and seems, to someone in the pool, to stretch to the horizon (= the point where the land appears to join the sky)
（水面和游泳池的邊沿一樣高的）無邊際游泳池

通脹螺旋（指物價提高和工資增加兩者交互作用引起的物價持續上漲）

inflected language: a language that changes the form or ending of some words when the way in which they are used in sentences changes

inform against: If you inform on/against someone, you give the police information, usually secretly, about that person, showing that he or she has done something wrong.

inform on: If you inform on/against someone, you give the police information, usually secretly, about that person, showing that he or she has done something wrong.

information overload: a situation in which you receive too much information at one time and cannot think about it in a clear way

information retrieval: the process of finding stored information on a computer

information superhighway: the internet and other systems that allow people to share information electronically

information technology: the science and activity of using computers and other electronic equipment to store and send information

infra dig: below what you consider to be socially acceptable
有失尊嚴的；有失身分的

infringe on: If something infringes on/upon someone's rights or freedom, it takes away some of their rights or limits their freedom.

infringe upon: If something infringes on/upon someone's rights or freedom, it takes away some of their rights or limits their freedom.

inheritance tax: a tax paid on money or property you have received from someone who has died

initiation ceremony: a process or event that a person takes part in to become an official member of a group

injection moulding: a process used for making plastic objects, in which melted plastic is forced into metal shapes and left until it is hard

injury time: a period of time added to the end of a sports game because play was stopped during the game to take care of players who were hurt

inkblot test: a psychological test in which a person is shown spots of ink and asked what they look like, as a way of learning about the person's personality or feelings

inkjet printer: an electronic printer that blows ink onto paper using very small jets (= small openings that push out liquid)

inline skate: roller skates (= special boots worn for travelling fast for sport or enjoyment) with a single row of small wheels on the bottom
直排輪滑（穿單排滾軸鞋滑行）

inline skating: the activity of skating while wearing special skates with a single row of wheels on the bottom of each one
直排輪滑（穿單排滾軸鞋滑行）

inner child: Your inner child is the part of your personality that still reacts and feels like a child.

inner circle: the small group of people who control an organization, political party, etc.

inner city: the central part of a city where people live and where there are often problems because people are poor and there are few jobs and bad houses
in the central part of a city where people live and where there are often problems because people are poor and there are few jobs and bad houses, or relating to areas like this

inner ear: the part inside the ear that controls balance and the ability to hear, and contains the cochlea
內耳（控制身體平衡和聽力，內有耳蝸）

inner ring: an area around the centre of a town or city where people live
靠近市中心的地區，靠近城市內環的

inner tube: a tube filled with air that fits inside a car or bicycle tyre

inorganic chemistry: the scientific study of chemical substances that do not contain carbon

inquire after: to ask for information about someone, especially about their health, in order to be polite
問候，詢問（尤指健康狀況）

inquire into: to try to discover the facts about something

inquire within: written on a notice on a building, meaning that information can be found inside
（寫在建築物的告示上）詳情請入內查詢

inside job: a crime, especially stealing, committed by someone in the place where they work

ROAD: UK the part of the road nearest the edge, used especially by slower vehicles
（尤指供慢車行駛的）靠近路邊的車道，外側車道
US the part of the road nearest the vehicles going in the opposite direction
RACE: the part of a racetrack nearest the middle

inside leg: the measurement from the top of your inner leg to your ankle

inside of: mainly US If you do something inside of a particular time, you do it using slightly less than that amout of time.

insider dealing: the illegal buying and selling of shares in a company by people who have special information because they are involved with the company
（利用內幕消息非法買賣公司股票的）內部交易

insinuate yourself into: to use clever, secret, and often unpleasant methods to gradually become part of something

insist on doing: to keep doing something, even if it annoys other people, or people think it is not good for you
（即使惹惱他人，或被人認為對自己無益，依然）執意做（某事）

installment plan: a method of paying for something in which the buyer pays part of the cost immediately and then makes small regular payments until the debt is completely paid

instant messaging: a type of service available on the internet that allows you to exchange written messages with someone else who is using the service at the same time

instant replay: a repeat of an important moment from a sports event shown on television, often more slowly to show the action in detail

instantaneous velocity: a calculation that tells you how far and in what direction an object would travel if it continued in the way it was going for one second

instead of: in place of someone or something

institutionalized racism: racism (= when someone is treated unfairly because of their race) that has become part of the normal behaviour of people within an organization

insulating tape: a strip of sticky material that is put around a piece of electrical wire in order to stop someone or something from being harmed by the electricity

insurance policy: a written agreement for insurance between an insurance company and a person who wants insurance

insure against: to do something in order to prevent something unpleasant from happening or from affecting you

intaglio printing: a method of printing using a surface with lines cut into it

intangible asset: something valuable that a company has that is not material, such as a good reputation

integrated circuit: a very small electronic circuit that consists of a lot of small parts made on a piece of semiconducting material

intellectual property: abbreviation IP someone's idea, invention, creation, etc., that can be protected by law from being copied by someone else

intelligence test: a test that measures the ability of a person to understand and learn by comparing it with the ability of other people

intelligent design: the idea that the world is so complicated that it cannot have developed by chance, and must have been made by God or some other intelligent being
智慧設計論（一種見解，認為這個世界十分複雜，因此其產生並非偶然，必定是由上帝或其他智慧生物所創造出來的）

intensive care: (in a hospital) continuous treatment for patients who are seriously ill, very badly injured, or who have just had an operation
（醫院裡的）特別護理，深切治療
also the intensive care unit the part of a hospital that provides intensive care
加護病房，深切治療部，特別護理病房

intensive farming: a way of producing large amounts of crops, by using chemicals and machines

interest group: a group or organization with particular aims and ideas that tries to influence the government

interest rate: the interest percent that a bank or other financial company charges you when you borrow money, or the interest percent it pays you when you keep money in an account

interfere with: to prevent something from working effectively or from developing successfully
If something interferes with radio or television signals, it stops you from getting good sound or pictures.

interior angle: an angle on the inside of a triangle or other polygon

interior decorator: a person whose job is either planning the decoration of the inside of a building such as a house or office or doing the decoration himself or herself
室內設計師；室內裝潢師

interior design: the art of planning the decoration of the inside of a building such as a house or office

intermediate school: a type of school in the US for children from grades 4-6, or aged approximately 12-14
（美國學校的4至6年級，學生年齡在12至14歲的）中等學校

internal combustion engine: an engine that produces energy by burning fuel within itself

internal energy: the total amount of energy in a system, equal to the kinetic energy added to the potential energy

internal medicine: the part of medical science that is involved in the discovery of diseases inside the body and the treatment of them without cutting the body open

international law: the set of rules that most countries obey when dealing with other countries

internet banking: the system that allows you to put in or take out money from a bank account by using the internet

internet caf\u00e9: a small, informal restaurant where you can pay to use the internet
提供上網服務的小餐館

internet dating: a way to meet people for possible romantic relationships, in which you look at descriptions of people on the internet and arrange to meet them if you like them
網路約會（透過在網際網路上看別人的描述資訊並安排見面的約會方式）

interquartile range: in statistics, the numbers that are above the lowest 25 percent and below the top 25 percent

into the bargain: in addition to other facts previously mentioned

introductory course: a college or university course that introduces students to a subject and prepares them for studying it at a higher level

inveigh against: to strongly criticize something or someone

inverse function: a function that does the opposite of a particular function

inverse proportion: the fact of the proportion of different amounts changing so that as one gets bigger the other gets smaller

inverted commas: the symbols “ ” or ‘ ’ that are put around a word or phrase to show that someone else has written or said it

inverted snob: a person who makes it known that they do not like things related to high social position but approve of things related to low social position
（不喜歡與高社會地位有關的事物，而認同低社會地位相關事物的）倒轉勢利者

invest in: to buy something because you think it will be useful, even if you think it is expensive

investigative journalism: a type of journalism that tries to discover information of public interest that someone is trying to hide

investment bank: a bank that helps companies sell and buy shares, or helps them buy other companies or merge (= join together) with each other

invisible ink: ink that cannot be seen until it is treated with chemicals or heat

iodine solution: iodine dissolved in a solution of potassium iodide, used in chemistry to test for starch

ionic bond: a chemical bond in which two ions are joined together because one has a positive charge and the other a negative charge

IP address: abbreviation for Internet Protocol Address: a number that is given to each computer when it is connected to the internet

Irish American: a person who lives in the US but whose family originally came from Ireland

Irish coffee: hot coffee mixed with whisky and with thick cream on the top, usually served in a glass

Irish stew: meat, often mutton (= meat from a sheep) cooked in water with onions, potatoes, etc.

iron box: a piece of equipment for making clothes flat and smooth

iron lung: a machine with a large metal tube that pushes air in and out of someone's lungs to help them when it is difficult to breathe because of an illness

iron man: a person of great physical strength and the ability to continue doing something difficult for a long time

iron rations: a basic amount of food for a person to live on

ironing board: a narrow table, usually covered with cloth and having folding legs, on which clothes can be put flat to iron them

irrational number: a number that cannot be expressed as the ratio of two whole numbers

is he/she for real?: used when you think someone is silly or very surprising

（用於表示答案毫無疑問是肯定的）教皇是天主教徒嗎?這還用問嗎?

islets of Langerhans: a group of cells in the pancreas that produce the hormones insulin and glucagon

isosceles triangle: a triangle with two sides of equal length

issue from: If something issues from a place, it comes out of that place.

it all amounts/comes to the same thing: used to mean that any of several different possible actions will produce the same result

it beats me: said when you do not understand a situation or someone's behaviour

it figures: used to say that you are not surprised by something unpleasant that has happened
那是意料之中的事，一點都不奇怪

it goes without saying: used to mean that something is obvious

it makes me puke: used to say that something makes you very upset or angry

it's a crying shame: something that you say when you think a situation is wrong

it's no use crying over spilled milk: said to emphasize that it is not useful feeling sorry about something that has already happened

it's safe to say: used to say that you are confident about what you are going to say

it's the least I can do: a polite answer to someone who thanks you, usually when you feel you should do more to help

it's the same old story: said when talking about a bad situation that has happened many times before

business as usual: said when things are continuing as they always do, despite a difficult situation

that's the story of my life: said when something bad happens to you that has happened to you many times before

ivory tower: To live or be in an ivory tower is not to know about or to want to avoid the ordinary and unpleasant things that happen in people's lives.

an expression of surprise, shock, or anger. Some people might consider this use offensive.
（表示驚訝、震驚或惱怒）天哪（該表達法有時被認為具有冒犯性）

If a horse jibs at something, it stops suddenly in front of it and refuses to move forward.

（英國酒吧關門前）買飲料的最後機會

last will and testament: your written instructions about what should happen to your body and the things that you own after your death

last word: the final remark in an argument or discussion
（辯論或討論中的）最終的話，最後陳述

latch onto: 與…發生聯繫，與…産生關聯
informal to become interested in an idea, story, or activity, and to start to use it

latchkey kid: a child who has a key to his or her home and is often alone at home after school has finished for the day because his or her parents are out at work
（因父母均工作放學後獨自在家的）掛鎖匙兒童

late developer: someone who becomes good at something after people usually become good at it

latent heat: the heat that is absorbed or released by a substance when it changes state, for example from a liquid to a gas, while the temperature of the substance does not change

lateral thinking: a way of solving a problem by thinking about it in a different and original way and not using traditional or expected methods
水平思考，橫向思維（指用想像力尋求解決問題的新辦法）

Latin American: from or relating to the areas of North, South, and Central America where Spanish or Portuguese is spoken

latissimus dorsi: a wide flat muscle at either side of the back

lattice window: a window made from small pieces of glass that are held in place by metal strips

laugh at: to show that you think someone or something is stupid
to treat someone or something as if he, she, or it is not important or does not deserve serious attention

laugh in sb's face: to make it obvious to someone that you do not respect them

laugh like a drain: to laugh a lot, very loudly

laugh, shout, scream, etc. your head off: to laugh, shout, scream, etc. very noisily and for a long time

laughing gas: nitrous oxide : a type of gas that is used as an anaesthetic (= a substance that stops pain)

laughing stock: someone or something that seems stupid or silly, especially by trying to be serious or important and not succeeding

laughter is the best medicine: said to mean that trying to be happy is a good way to stop worrying

launch into: to start saying something or criticizing something with a lot of energy or anger

launch pad: a special area from which spacecraft or missiles are sent into the sky

laundry basket: a large container in which dirty clothes are kept until they are washed
（裝待洗衣物的）洗衣筐，衣物筐

laundry detergent: a detergent in the form of a powder or liquid that is used for washing clothes and other things made of cloth

laurel wreath: a circle of leaves that, in the past, was worn on the head by an important person or the winner of a competition

lava lamp: a decorative electric lamp in which a brightly coloured amount of wax moves up and down a container full of transparent liquid, forming new shapes as it does so
熔岩燈（一種裝飾性燈具）

lavender language: words, phrases, and ways of speaking that are used by gay people
同性戀語言（同性戀者專用的詞彙和片語）

law and order: a situation in which the laws of a country are being obeyed, especially when the police or army are used to make certain of this

law clerk: a person who works with a judge and helps the judge make decisions

law enforcement: the activity of making certain that the laws of an area are obeyed

lawn bowling: a game played either outside on smooth grass or inside on an artificial surface, in which the players roll a large black or brown ball as close as possible to a smaller white ball

lawn party: 花園招待會，遊園會（同 garden party）

lay a finger on: 動（某人）一個手指頭，動（某人）一根毫毛

lay brother: someone who belongs to a religious group, especially a group living together in a monastery or convent, and who does simple work for the group, such as preparing food

lay sister: someone who belongs to a religious group, especially a group living together in a monastery or convent, and who does simple work for the group, such as preparing food

lay down the law: to forcefully make known what you think should happen

lay down your life for: to die for something you believe in strongly
為…而獻身，為…貢獻出自己的生命

lay into: to attack someone physically, or to criticize someone in an angry way

lay off: in football , to kick the ball gently into a space so that another player from your team can run forward into the space, then move forward with the ball or shoot towards the goal without slowing down or stopping

lay the basis/foundations for: to prepare for or start an activity or task

lay the ghost of N: to finally stop being worried or upset about something that has worried or upset you for a long time

lay yourself open to attack, criticism,: to make it easy for people to attack you, etc.
給人留下攻擊／批評／取笑等的把柄

lay yourself open to ridicule: to make it easy for people to laugh unkindly at you
使自己成為笑柄；招致嘲笑

layer cake: two or more soft cakes put on top of each other with jam, cream, or icing (= a sweet mixture made from sugar) between the cakes

lazy Susan: a circular piece of wood or plastic on a base that is put on a table and can be turned around so that everyone can reach the food that is on it
餐桌轉盤（餐桌上木質或塑膠的圓盤，轉動可使就餐的人都能取到食物）

lead off: to begin to speak, usually as the first person to speak
first in a series of things
一系列（事情）中的第一個

lead poisoning: an illness that happens when lead is absorbed by the body
鉛中毒（人體吸收鉛導致的疾病）

lead singer: the main singer in a musical group

lead the field: to be better than all other people or things
在該領域／群體中／世界上領先

lead the pack: to be better than all other people or things
在該領域／群體中／世界上領先

lead the world: to be better than all other people or things
在該領域／群體中／世界上領先

lead time: the time between the design of a product and its production, or between ordering a product and receiving it
提前期（新產品投入生產之前所需的設計時間）

lead to: If an action or event leads to something, it causes that thing to happen or exist.

lead up to: If a period of time or series of events leads up to an event or activity, it happens until that event or activity begins.
to prepare to talk about something by gradually mentioning the subject you want to talk about

lead with: to put a particular story first or in the most important position in a news report or newspaper
把（某條新聞）放在（新聞報導或報紙的）最顯要位置

lead the life of Riley: to live an easy and comfortable life, without any need to work hard
過著無憂無慮的生活，過著安逸的生活

live the life of Riley: to live an easy and comfortable life, without any need to work hard
過著無憂無慮的生活，過著安逸的生活

leaded window: a window made from small pieces of glass fastened together with lead strips

leading edge: the most advanced position in an area of activity

leading hand: the most experienced person in a factory, etc.

leading lady: the female actor who has the most important part in a play or film

leading light: an important and respected person in a group or organization

leading man: the actor who has the most important part in a play or film

leading question: a question that tricks someone into answering in a particular way

leaf mould: a type of fertilizer (= substance that makes plants grow) made from leaves that fall from trees in the autumn

leaf through: to quickly turn the pages of a book or a magazine, reading only a little of it

lean against: to sit or stand with part of your body touching something as a support
to put something against a wall or other surface so that it is supported

lean on: to sit or stand with part of your body touching something as a support
to put something against a wall or other surface so that it is supported

lean and hungry: showing a very strong and determined wish to get something

lean towards: to be interested in something and be likely to do a particular activity
對…有興趣；有可能參與…活動

leap at: to eagerly accept the chance to do or have something
趕緊抓住，迫不及待地接受

leap out at: If something leaps out at you, you notice it immediately.

learn a/your lesson: to suffer a bad experience and know not to do it again

learn to live with: to accept a new but unpleasant situation that you cannot change

learn the ropes: to learn/know how to do a job or activity

know the ropes: to learn/know how to do a job or activity

learner's permit: an official document that a person has to have when they are learning to drive

learning curve: the rate of someone's progress in learning a new skill

learning difficulties: mental problems that affect a person's ability to learn things

learning disability: one of many conditions that can have an effect on someone's ability to learn easily

leash law: a law in many US cities and towns that says people must keep their dogs on a leash when they are outside their homes
（美國許多城鎮的）拴狗令（人們在自家以外必須用繩牽著狗）

least said soonest mended: used to say that a bad situation can be quickly forgotten if people stop talking about it
（指對於壞事）議論越少，淡忘越快。

leave a bad taste in sb's mouth: If an experience leaves a bad taste in your mouth, you have an unpleasant memory of it.

leave a lot to be desired: to be much worse than you would like

leave go/hold of: to stop holding on to something

leave it at that: to agree that there has been enough discussion, study, etc. and that it is time to stop

leave no stone unturned: to do everything you can to achieve a good result, especially when looking for something

leave off!: used to tell someone to stop being annoying

leave the field open for: UK also leave the field clear for sb to stop competing with someone, making it possible for them to succeed

lech after: to show too much sexual interest in someone

LED display: the letters or numbers shown in lights on a piece of electronic equipment

left field: the left part of the field in baseball
unusual and different from what is normally seen, said, or done
不同于平時所見（或所說、所作）的

left of centre: used to describe a political belief that contains some socialist ideas but is not extreme

left-hand drive: A left-hand drive vehicle has the steering wheel on the left-hand side.

left-handed compliment: a remark that seems to say something pleasant about a person but could also be an insult

left-luggage office: a place at a station, airport, etc. where you can leave your bags for a short time until you need them

legal aid: a system of providing free advice about the law and practical help with legal matters for people who are too poor to pay for it

legal high: a drug that is taken for pleasure and has the same effect as an illegal drug, but has not been made illegal

legal holiday: ( in the US) a day on which government offices and many businesses are not open

legal pad: a notepad (= a set of sheets of paper, joined at the top edge, for writing on) containing yellow paper with lines on it

legal tender: the money that can be officially used in a country

legionnaires' disease: a serious and infectious disease of the lungs caused by bacteria in the air

legislative assembly: one of the two parts of the organization that makes laws in some American and Australian states, most Canadian provinces and some countries

（澳大利亞和印度的部分州／邦的）立法機構的上院

leisure centre: a building containing a swimming pool and other places where you can play sports

leisure wear: clothes that are worn for relaxing in

lemon butter: a thick, sweet substance made from lemons, sugar, eggs, and butter that you can spread on bread or cakes
檸檬酪，檸檬凍，檸檬黃油

lemon curd: a thick, sweet substance made from lemons, sugar, eggs, and butter that you can spread on bread or cakes
檸檬酪，檸檬凍，檸檬黃油

lemon grass: a tropical grass with a flavour like lemon, used especially in Southeast Asian cooking

lemon sole: a flat fish that can be cooked and eaten

lend an ear: to listen to someone with sympathy

lending library: 公共圖書館（同 public library）

lending rate: the amount that a bank charges on money that it lends

let go: to stop taking care of something such as a house or garden
to not correct or argue with something that a person says or does that is wrong

let it all hang out: to behave freely without being shy or feeling worried about what other people will think of you

let it be known: to make certain that people know something
讓大家都知道，到處宣揚

let it lie: to take no action about something

let loose: to allow someone to do what they want in a place

to allow an animal to run around freely after it has been tied up

let me see/let's see: used when you want to think for a moment about something
讓我／我們想想，讓我／我們看看

let nature take its course: to allow someone or something to live or die naturally
任由自生自滅，順其自然

let on: to tell other people about something that you know, especially when it is a secret

let out: to cause something to come out
to make a piece of clothing wider by removing the sewing from the sides and sewing closer to the edge of the material

let rip: to behave in an angry and emotional way

let fly: to behave in an angry and emotional way

let sleeping dogs lie: said to warn someone that they should not talk about a bad situation that most people have forgotten about

let the cat out of the bag: to allow a secret to be known, usually without intending to

let the genie out of the bottle: to allow something to happen that cannot then be stopped

let the side down: to behave in a way that embarrasses or disappoints a group of people that you are part of

let up: If bad weather or an unpleasant situation lets up, it stops or improves.

a pause or reduction in something, usually something bad

let your hair down: to allow yourself to behave much more freely than usual and enjoy yourself

let yourself go: informal to allow yourself to become less attractive or healthy

let's see: used when you want to think carefully about something or are trying to remember

level off: If a rate or amount levels off, it stops rising or falling and stays at the same level.

level out: If an aircraft levels off/out, it starts to travel horizontally rather than going up or down.

ley line: an imaginary line between some important places such as hills, believed to be where there were very old paths. Ley lines are sometimes thought to have special powers.

liberal arts: college or university subjects, such as history, languages, and literature, that develop students' general education rather than preparing them for a particular job

lick sb's boots: to try very hard to please someone in authority, usually in order to get an advantage

lie around: If things are lying around, they are left in places where they should not be.
to spend time lying down and doing very little

lie back: to move the top half of your body from a sitting to a lying position

a short rest, usually in or on a bed

lie up: to hide from police officers, soldiers, etc. who are looking for you
躲避（警察或士兵等的搜索）

lieutenant governor: in the US, a state government official whose rank is just below the governor
in Canada, Australia, India, and some other countries, an official who represents the head of state in a province, state, territory, etc.

life coach: someone who you pay to give you advice about how to improve your life
人生教練（受僱為某人提供人生建議的人）

life cycle: the series of changes that a living thing goes through from the beginning of its life until death
生命週期；生活週期，生活史

life event: a very important event in someone's life, such as marriage, the birth of a child, or the death of a family member
人生中非常重要的事件

life in the fast lane: a way of living that is full of excitement, activity, and often danger

life insurance: a system in which you make regular payments to an insurance company in exchange for a fixed amount of money that will be paid to you when you reach a certain age, or paid to someone you have named, usually a member of your family, when you die

（常幽默地用作反語）一切都十全十美；一切都完美無缺

life jacket: a piece of equipment, like a jacket without sleeves, that is filled with air or light material and is designed to help you float if you fall into water

life peer: in the UK, a person who is given the honour of a title such as "Lord" and a place in the House of Lords as a reward for the good things they have done for the country

life peerage: the honour and position of being a life peer

life raft: a type of boat that is carried on a large ship and is used in emergencies, for example when the ship is sinking, to take people to safety

life science: one of the types of science that deal with the structure and behaviour of living things, such as botany, zoology, biochemistry, and anthropology

life sentence: also informal life the punishment of being put in prison for a very long time, or, in the US, until death
長期監禁；（美國的）終身監禁，無期徒刑
something that will make a person suffer for the rest of their life
讓（某人）一生都要遭受折磨的（事件）

life story: everything that has happened to someone during their life

life's a bitch: saying said when you find a situation difficult or have had a bad experience

life's work: Your life's work is the work that is most important to you and to which you give a lot of time and effort.
傾注畢生心血的工作；畢生事業

life-support system: also life support [ U ] the equipment used to keep a person alive when they are very ill, or injured
the natural structures and systems that are necessary for living things, especially humans, to be able to live
（尤指人類的）生命維持體系，生態環境

lifestyle manager: someone who you pay to give you advice about how to improve your life
生活顧問（受僱為某人提供生活建議的人）

ligamentum flavum: a ligament (= strong fibre) that helps connect the bones that make up the spine

light up: If your face or eyes light up, or if a smile lights up your face, you suddenly look happy.
使高興起來，（使）顯出笑意

使（某人）加快，加強（尤指在過去行動遲緩的情況下）

light aircraft: a small plane suitable for carrying only a small number of passengers

light and shade: different parts of the character of a person or the quality of a thing

隧道盡頭的亮光，曙光（指局勢出現好轉或艱巨任務即將完成的跡象）

light bulb: a rounded glass container with a thin thread of metal inside that produces light when an electric current goes through it

light globe: a rounded glass container with a thin thread of metal inside which produces light when an electric current goes through it

light heavyweight: a boxer whose weight is between middleweight and heavyweight

light industry: industry that makes small things and does not need to use large, heavy machinery

light meter: a device for measuring how much light there is, especially when taking a photograph

light year: the distance that light travels in one year (about 9.5 million million kilometres)
光年（指光1年走過的距離，約為9.5兆公里）

light years away: an extremely long time from now in the past or future

light-bulb moment: a moment when you suddenly realize something or have a good idea

lighting-up time: the time in the afternoon or evening when the law states that vehicles must have their lights switched on

METAL STRIP: a strip of metal, going from the highest point of a building to the ground, that prevents lightning from damaging the building by taking the electricity to the ground before it can reach a dangerous level
FOR CRITICISM: someone or something that takes all the blame or criticism in a situation, although other people or things are responsible too
代罪羔羊，代人受過者；引火燒身的人(或事)

lightning never strikes twice: said to show that it is unlikely that something bad or unusual will happen to the same person twice
閃電不會兩次擊中同一個地方；倒楣事不會總落在同一個人身上；一事不過二

lightning strike: 「野貓」式罷工，閃電式罷工（同 wildcat strike）

like a bull in a china shop: If someone is like a bull in a china shop, they are very careless in the way that they move or behave.
笨手笨腳的人；魯莽闖禍的人

like a cat on a hot tin roof: used to describe someone who is in a state of extreme nervous worry
如熱鍋上的螞蟻，坐立不安

like a lamb to the slaughter: If someone does something or goes somewhere like a lamb to the slaughter, they do it without knowing that something bad is going to happen and therefore act calmly and without fighting against the situation.

like a man/woman possessed: in a wild and uncontrolled way

like a maniac: UK If someone works like a maniac, they work extremely hard.
（工作或鍛煉）狂熱地，極其努力地

陌生的領域；可能會有危險的情況

uncharted waters: a situation that is not well known and may be dangerous
陌生的領域；可能會有危險的情況

Murphy's law: the principle that if it is possible for something to go wrong, it will go wrong
莫非定律（一種認為凡有可能出差錯的事終將出差錯的論斷）

muscle in: to force your way into a situation and make certain you are included, although you are not wanted

muscular dystrophy: a serious disease in which a person's muscles gradually become weaker until walking is no longer possible

museum piece: something that is very old-fashioned and should no longer be used

mushroom cloud: a very large cloud of dust that rises into the air in the shape of a large mushroom, especially after a nuclear explosion

mushy peas: soft, cooked marrowfat peas (= a type of large pea)

music box: a decorative box with a device inside it that plays a tune when you open the lid

music hall: a type of theatre entertainment in the 1800s and 1900s that included music, dancing, and jokes, or the building used for this entertainment

music system: a collection of equipment for playing recorded sound

music theatre: a type of musical work that involves acting, costumes, etc., usually performed by a small number of people

musical chairs: a game in which children walk around a group of chairs while music plays. When the music stops they have to sit quickly on a chair, but because there is always one fewer chairs than children, the child that is left standing must leave the game

mustard gas: a very poisonous gas, used as a weapon, that burns the skin, damages organs inside the body, and can kill

muster point: a place where everyone in an area or on a boat is ordered to go when there is an emergency

muster your forces: to make great arrangements and efforts, usually to prepare for an attack or event

mute swan: the largest type of swan. Mute swans do not make as much noise as other swans when they fly.

mutton dressed as lamb: a way of describing an older woman who is dressed in a style that is more suitable for a younger woman

mutual friend: a person who is the friend of two people who may or may not know each other

mutual fund: a service where financial experts invest the money of many people in many different companies

my dear boy: a friendly way of talking to a man

my boy: a friendly way of talking to a man

my arse!: said when you do not believe what someone has just said

my bad: US informal used for saying that you accept that you are wrong or that something is your fault

my foot: used to mean that you do not believe what another person has just told you

我的心爲（某人）流血，我爲（某人）感到悲傷（幽默的用法，常表示相反的意思）

my lips are sealed: said when you are promising to keep a secret

my point exactly: said in answer to something that someone has just said when you believe it yourself, or when you have said it yourself earlier

my sweet: a way of talking to someone you love

myalgic encephalomyelitis: 慢性疲勞綜合征（同 chronic fatigue syndrome）

myasthenia gravis: a chronic disease causing weakness of the muscles of the face, arms, and legs that leads to the eyelids falling down and an unsteady way of walking

myelin damage: damage to the fatty substance that covers nerves

神秘顧客（指受僱裝扮成普通顧客來檢查商店及企業服務品質的人）

（尤指許多遊客一起乘坐大客車、事先不知道目的地的）神秘旅行

LETTER: the 14th letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第14個字母）

naff off: used to rudely tell someone to go away because they are annoying you

nag away at: If doubts or worries nag (away) at you, you think about them all the time.

nag at: If doubts or worries nag (away) at you, you think about them all the time.

nail file: a small strip of metal or paper with a rough surface used for making the edges of your nails smooth and curved

nail polish: a coloured liquid that is painted on fingernails or toenails

name and shame: to publicly say that a person, group, or business has done something wrong

name day: a day that is celebrated by some Christians with the same name as a saint who is also celebrated on that day
和基督教徒同名的聖徒紀念日

name names: to tell someone in authority the names of people involved in a secret or illegal activity
供出（參與秘密或非法行動者的）姓名

name the day: to decide the date on which you are going to get married

name your poison: used to ask what type of alcoholic drink someone would like

nanny state: a government that tries to give too much advice or make too many laws about how people should live their lives, especially about eating, smoking, or drinking alcohol

nappy rash: a red, painful area of skin on a baby's bottom caused by a wet nappy

nasal consonant: a consonant in which air escapes only through the nose

（加入各色的肉粒和蔬菜粒的）印尼炒飯
