national debt: the total amount of money that is owed by a country's government

national grid: a system of special wires that take electricity from power stations (= places where electricity is made) to all parts of a country

national holiday: a day when most people in a country do not have to work

National Insurance: a system in the UK in which the government collects money from companies and workers and makes payments to people who are too old or ill to work or who have no job

national park: an area of a country that is protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history

national service: the system in some countries by which young people, especially men, are ordered by law to spend a period of time in the armed forces

National Socialism: 國家社會主義，納粹主義（同 Nazism）

national treasure: someone or something of which a particular country is very proud

Native American: a member of one of the races who were living in North and South America before Europeans arrived
美洲土著居民，印第安人

native place: the town or city or area that a person is from, especially the one in which they were born and lived while young

native speaker: someone who has spoken a particular language since they were a baby, rather than having learned it as a child or adult
母語使用者，說本族語的人

nativity play: a play that tells the story of Jesus Christ's birth, usually performed by children at Christmas
（通常在聖誕節期間由兒童表演的）耶穌誕生劇

natural gas: gas, found underground, that is used as a fuel

natural history: the study of plants, animals, rocks, etc.

natural resources: things such as minerals, forests, coal, etc. that exist in a place and can be used by people

nautical mile: a unit of distance used at sea that is equal to 1,852 metres

navel orange: a type of orange that is sweet and usually without seeds

navigation bar: a long, narrow area on a computer screen that contains buttons or names you can choose to move to different parts of a website or window

navy bean: a small white bean, used for making baked beans

ne plus ultra: the ne plus ultra of sth
the best or most excellent example of something

neap tide: specialized environment a tide in the sea when there is the smallest difference between how high the water is at high tide and how high it is at low tide

near at hand: If something is near at hand, it is near enough to you for you to reach it.

HIT: also near thing a situation in which something almost hits something else
HAPPEN: an attempt to do or achieve something that fails although it almost succeeds

near post: the goalpost that is closest to the ball when it is kicked towards the goal

near the knuckle: about sex and therefore likely to offend people

near thing: a situation in which you almost failed to achieve something and only just succeeded

near-death experience: an experience described by some people who have been close to death, in which the person feels as if they have left their body and are watching themselves from above

necessity is the mother of invention: an expression that means that if you really need to do something, you will think of a way of doing it

neck and neck: If two competitors are neck and neck, they are level with each other and have an equal chance of winning.

never look a gift horse in the mouth: said to advise someone not to refuse something good that is being offered

新時代，新世紀（興起於20世紀80年代末的一種生活和思維方式，以先於現代科學和經濟理論出現的思想觀念為基礎）

新血（指朝氣蓬勃或帶來新思想的新成員）
people who join an organization and who can provide new ideas and energy

someone who has recently become involved with an activity or organization

新工黨（由20世紀90年代初英國工黨中部分支援黨內變革的成員組成，其要求為降低稅率、減少政府對諸如教育和衛生等公用事業的投資的控制、加大對企業的支援等）

new lad: a man, usually in his 20s or 30s, who behaves in a way he sees as typically male

新媒體（指利用電腦或網際網路提供資訊或娛樂的產品和服務）

PEOPLE: people who are doing activities in a new and different way

New Year: the beginning of the year that is about to begin or has just begun

New Year's Day: the first day of the year, a public holiday in many countries

New Zealand: a country in the southern Pacific Ocean
belonging to or relating to New Zealand or its people

fresh blood: people who join an organization and who can provide new ideas and energy

news agency: an organization that supplies reports to newspapers, magazines, and television and radio companies

in the next room, house, or building

next of kin 2: the person or group of people you are most closely related to

next to last: The next to last person or thing is the one before the last one.

nice one!: something that you say when you have just heard that someone has done something you think is good
好樣的！太好了！（用於表示對某人所作所為的讚歎）

ten to the dozen: If you are talking nineteen/ten to the dozen, you are talking very quickly and without stopping.

nip and tuck: If a competition is nip and tuck, first one side seems to be winning and then the other, so that the result is not certain.
If a situation is nip and tuck, someone or something in that situation comes very close to failing or ending.

nitrous oxide: a type of gas with a sweet smell that is used as a weak anaesthetic (= substance that stops pain), especially by dentists
一氧化二氮；笑氣（一種帶甜味的氣體，有輕微的麻醉作用，常用於牙科止痛）

no dice: something that people say when you may not or cannot do something

no expense is spared: If no expense is spared in arranging something, a lot of money is spent to make it extremely good.

no fewer than: used to show that you consider a number to be surprisingly large

no flies on: UK If you say there are no flies on someone, you mean that they cannot easily be deceived.

no good: 道德敗壞的；品行惡劣的
A no-good person does nothing useful or helpful and is therefore considered to be of little value.
（人）無用處的，無幫助的，一無是處的

no great shakes: 並不太好的，不怎麼樣的，並不高明的

no holds barred: 不受任何限制的；放縱的

no less than: used to show your surprise at a large number

no longer: in the past but not now

used to emphasize that something is always true, or that someone must do something
不管甚麼／何時／為甚麼等

no mean achievement: 了不起的成就，不是容易的事

no mean feat: 了不起的成就，不是容易的事

no mean: used to say a person is very good at a certain activity

no more Mr Nice Guy: something that is said when someone has decided to stop thinking about the wishes and feelings of other people

no news is good news: said to make someone feel less worried when they have not received information about someone or something, because if something bad had happened, they would have been told about it

no problem: said to show that you will or can do what someone has asked you to
used as a friendly answer when someone thanks you for something you have done

沒問題（表示答應做某事）

沒關係，不用謝（回答感謝）

no room for: If you say there is no room for a feeling or type of behaviour, you mean it is not acceptable.

no shit!: an expression of surprise, often used as a joke when someone has told you something that is very obvious
（表示對剛聽到的話感到驚訝）不會吧

no sooner ... than: used to show that one thing happens immediately after another thing

no sweat: If you say that something is no sweat, you mean that it will not be difficult or cause problems.

no wonder: 並不讓人驚訝；並不奇怪

no-claims bonus: an amount by which someone's payment for insurance is reduced, especially for a motor vehicle, because they have not made any claims for a particular period
（尤指汽車保險在某段時期內沒有索賠要求而享有的）無索償折扣，無索賠贈金

not enough room to swing a cat: said about a place or space that is very small
空間很狹小；（地方）連轉個身都困難

Nobel prize: any of the six international prizes that are given each year to people who make important discoveries or progress in chemistry, physics, medicine, literature, peace, and economics

noble gas: any of a group of gases, such as helium and neon, that do not react with other chemicals
惰性氣體（一系列不與其他化學物質發生反應的氣體，例如氦氣、氖氣）

noblesse oblige: the idea that someone with power and influence should use their social position to help other people
位高應不負重望；顯貴者行為理應高尚

（在夜間大量進食，當時無意識或事後不記得的）夜食症

nod off: to begin sleeping, especially not intentionally
打瞌睡；（尤指無意中）睡著

noise pollution: noise, such as that from traffic, that upsets people where they live or work and is considered to be unhealthy for them

nom de guerre: a name chosen by someone to use when he or she is involved in a particular activity, especially fighting in a war

神志不清的；（尤指）精神失常的，不能為行為負責的

non sequitur: a statement that does not correctly follow from the meaning of the previous statement

non-alcoholic fatty liver disease: a condition in which there is too much fat in the liver, affecting people who drink little or no alcohol. It can lead to hepatitis and scarring of the liver

non-commissioned officer: a member of the armed forces who has achieved the rank of officer by rising from the lower ranks rather than by receiving a commission

non-governmental organization: an organization that tries to achieve social or political aims but is not controlled by a government

Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma: cancer that starts in one or more lymph nodes or the spleen and spreads to any part of the body, often the liver and bone marrow

non-identical twin: one of a pair of twins (= two children born to the same mother on the same occasion) who do not look exactly the same because they developed from two separate eggs

nonce word: a word invented for a particular occasion or situation
為特定場合臨時杜撰的詞

none other than: said when you want to show that someone or something is a surprising or exciting choice or example
（用於表示吃驚或興奮）竟然，正是

not any worse, better, richer, etc. than before

nonsense syllable: words or parts of words that do not exist in the language you are using

normal force: the amount of force that keeps two surfaces touching, but does not let them come apart or press further together

north of: used to say that an amount is more than the stated amount

nose cone: the front part of a spacecraft, aircraft, or missile (= flying weapon)

nose in the air: used to describe the way someone behaves when they think they are better than other people and do not want to speak to them

nose job: to have an operation to change the shape of your nose

nosy parker: 愛管閒事的人；好打聽消息的人

not be all fun and games: If an activity is not all fun and games, parts of it are difficult or unpleasant.

not be the end of the world: If something is not the end of the world, it will not cause very serious problems.

not be up to much: to not be of good quality

not believe your eyes: to be so surprised by what you see or hear that you think you are imagining it

簡直不敢相信自己的眼睛／耳朵

not believe your luck: to be very surprised and very pleased

not blink: to not show any shock or surprise

not content with doing: in addition to something wrong or unpleasant you have done

not darken sb's door: used to tell someone to never come back to a place

not for the squeamish: used to say that something is unpleasant, and will upset people who are squeamish

not get over: When you say that you can't get over something, you mean that you are very surprised by it.

not get/go anywhere: If you are not getting/going anywhere, you are not improving or advancing a particular situation.

not give a monkey's: If you don't/couldn't give a monkey's about something, you are not at all worried by it.

not give/care a toss: to not be worried at all by something

not half: used in spoken English to express a positive statement more strongly

not have the foggiest: to not know or understand something at all

not have the heart to do: to feel unable to do something because you feel it would be unkind

not know what hit you: to feel shocked or confused because something bad has happened to you suddenly when you were not expecting it

not mince words: to say what you mean clearly and directly, even if you upset people by doing this
直截了當地說，直言不諱

a small piece of card or thick paper that you write notes on for speeches, school work, etc.

a series of problems that you have to solve in order to achieve something

used to show that what you are saying is obvious or already known

confused or uncertain about what to do next

off the charts: mainly US extremely popular or successful
非常受歡迎的，極成功的

off the cuff: If you speak off the cuff, you say something without having prepared or thought about your words first.
未經準備；未加思索；即興地

off the hook: If you leave the phone off the hook, you do not put it back correctly and it will not ring.
If you are off the hook, you have escaped from a difficult situation.

off the record: If someone says something off the record, they do not want it to be publicly reported.

off the top of your head: from the knowledge you have in your memory
憑既有知識；不假思索地

off white: a white colour with a little grey or yellow in it

off with: used as a way of ordering someone to remove something

off your rocker: If you say that someone is off their rocker, you mean that that person is behaving in a very strange or silly way.

off your trolley: behaving in an extremely unusual way or doing something very silly
瘋瘋癲癲，失去理智；十分愚蠢

offend against: to break a rule or principle or not fit well with something that people consider to be correct
違反，觸犯（規則）；違背（常理）

office building: a large building that contains offices

office hours: the hours during the day when people who work in offices are usually at work
US the times during the day when you can go to see a doctor, dentist, professor, etc. at his or her office

office junior: a young person, often one who has recently left school, who works in an office doing mainly unskilled jobs
見習職員，辦公室文員（剛剛畢業的年青人，在辦公室中主要做技術性低的工作）

office spouse: someone who you work with and have a very close relationship with, but not in a sexual way
辦公室伴侶（與異性同事保持很密切的關係，但非性關係）

official receiver: a person who is ordered by the government to deal with the income and property of a company or a person after they have gone bankrupt (= are unable to pay their debts)
（政府任命的處理破產事務的）官方接管人，破產管理人

official secret: a piece of information that is known only by the government and its employees

offset lithography: a method of printing in which an image is put on a rubber sheet before going on to the paper or object being printed

offside trap: in football, a movement by the defending team that puts an attacking player in an offside position

oh my God!: used to emphasize how surprised, angry, shocked, etc. you are
（驚奇、憤怒或震驚時用於加強語氣）（我的）天哪！

oh yes: used when you have just remembered something that you were saying
（用於表示剛想起某事）對了，想起來了

oh Lord: used to express surprise, shock, or worry

oil paint: a thick type of paint with an oil base, used for painting pictures

oil painting: a picture painted with oil paints
the art or process of painting with oil paints

oil rig: a large structure with equipment for removing oil from under the ground, especially from under the sea
（尤指從海底開採石油的）石油鑽塔，鑽井平臺，油井設備

oil slick: a layer of oil that is floating over a large area of the surface of the sea, usually because an accident has caused it to escape from a ship or container
（通常指因發生事故從油輪或容器中漏出、漂浮在海面上的）浮油

oil spill: an accident in which oil has come out of a ship and caused pollution
（因發生事故從油輪或容器中漏出）石油洩漏

oil tanker: a ship that carries a large amount of oil

oil the wheels: to make it easier for something to happen

oil well: a hole that is made in the ground so that oil can be taken out of it

old age: the period in a person's life when he or she is old

old age pension: a pension that is paid by the state to people who have stopped working because they have reached a particular age

old age pensioner: a person who receives an old age pension from the state

OLD MAN: mainly UK informal an old man
mainly UK old-fashioned a way that some men address male friends that they have known for many years
STUDENT: UK An old boy of a particular school is a man who went to school there as a child

old chestnut: a subject, idea, or joke that has been discussed or repeated so often that it is not funny any more
老掉牙的話題（或想法、笑話）

Old Father Time: an image of an old man who represents time passing
時間老人（代表時間流逝）

old flame: a person that you loved or had a sexual relationship with in the past

OLD WOMAN: mainly UK informal an old woman
mainly UK old-fashioned informal a way that some men address female friends that they have known for many years
（用於男性稱呼相知多年的女性朋友）老朋友，老夥伴，老姐姐
STUDENT: UK An old girl of a particular school is a woman who went to school there as a child.

old growth: trees that have been growing for a very long time

old hand: someone who is very experienced and skilled in a particular area of activity

old hat: 過時的；老式的；不新奇的

Old Labour: the people who do not support the changes made in the British Labour Party in the early 1990s and who still believe in the party's more traditional principles. These include higher taxes for investment in public services, such as health and education, and a close relationship with trade unions
老工黨（英國工黨中在1990年代以及現在的一些反對改革的人，他們支持傳統原則，包括支持徵收高稅，從而對健康、教育等公共服務作出投入以及與各工會組織保持密切聯繫）

old maid: a woman who is not married or has not had a sexual relationship and is not now young

old master: a painting by a famous European artist of the past, especially from the 13th to the 17th century
古典名作（尤指13至17世紀歐洲著名藝術家的作品）

PEOPLE: used to refer to rich people whose families have been rich for a long time
祖上殷實的富人，富裕世家
MONEY: a type of money that is no longer used
作廢的錢，不再使用的錢

Old Nick: devil (EVIL BEING)  (= the main evil spirit in the Christian religion)

old people's home: a place where old people can live together and be cared for when they are too weak or ill to take care of themselves

old wives' tale: a piece of advice or a theory, often related to matters of health, that was believed in the past but is now known to be wrong
（常指健康方面）不科學的陳腐說法；無稽之談

old woman: a man who worries about matters and details that are not important
愛大驚小怪的男人；婆婆媽媽的男人

olive drab: a greyish-green colour that is often used for military uniforms
（常用作軍服的）灰綠色，橄欖綠色

olive oil: a yellow or green oil, made by pressing olives

omniscient narrator: the voice in which a story is written that is outside the story and knows everything about the characters and events in the story

on a dime: US informal If a vehicle, etc. can turn, stop, etc. on a dime, it can turn, etc. in a very small space.
（車輛等）能在極小的空間內（轉彎）

on a need-to-know basis: If you tell people something on a need-to-know basis, you only tell them the facts they need to know at the time they need to know them, and nothing more.
僅限於人們需要知道的東西

on a razor edge: in a very uncertain and dangerous situation
處於險境；境況岌岌可危

on a shoestring: If you do something on a shoestring, you do it with a very small amount of money.

on a wing and a prayer: If you do something on a wing and a prayer, you do it hoping that you will succeed, although you are not prepared enough for it.
準備不充分但又希望成功

on all fours: with your hands and knees on the ground

on an even keel: regular and well-balanced and not likely to change suddenly

on and off: If something happens on and off during a period of time, it happens sometimes.

on autopilot: doing something without thinking about it or without making an effort
無意識地；不假思索地；機械地，習慣性地

on board: as part of a group or team, especially for a special purpose
used to refer to things that are carried by a vehicle and form part of it

on call: If a worker such as a doctor is on call, he or she is available to work or make official visits at any time when needed.
（醫療從業者的）聽候召喚，待命
used to describe workers who are available to make official visits at any time when they are needed
（工作人員）隨叫隨到的，待命的
relating to the work of someone who is available at any time when needed
（工作）需要所叫隨到的，隨時待命的

on demand: at any time that someone wants or needs something
available when a customer wants or asks for something
應顧客要求即可提供的，隨選的
able to be watched at any time
a service for watching films or TV programmes at any time

on deposit: Money that is on deposit is saved in a bank or something similar.

on everyone's lips: being talked about by a lot of people
廣為談論的，議論紛紛的

on hand: near to someone or something, and ready to help or be used if necessary

on high: mainly humorous If an order comes from on high, it comes from someone in a position of authority.
（命令）由上級下達的，來自高層的

on its last legs: Something that is on its last legs is in such bad condition that it will soon be unable to work as it should.

on message: (of a politician) saying things in public that support the official ideas of his or her political party
（政界人士在公開場合講話與所在政黨的官方觀點）一致地，口徑一致地

on no account: If something must on no account/not on any account be done, it must not be done at any time or for any reason.

on paper: judging something by how it has been planned rather than how it really works in practice
據書面材料，在書面上，在理論上

on pins and needles: US worried or excited about something that is going to happen
為即將發生的事情而擔心（或激動），如坐針氈

on sb's account: If something is said to be on someone's or something's account, it is because of that person or thing.

on sb's doorstep: very close to where someone is or lives

on skid row: poor, without a job or a place to live, and often drinking too much alcohol

on stream: Something in industry or business that is on stream is being produced or is available for use

on target: If you are on target with a piece of work, you are making good progress and likely to achieve what you planned.
進展順利的，成功在望的

on the back burner: If something is on the back burner, it is temporarily not being dealt with or considered, especially because it is not urgent or important.
（尤指因不緊急或不重要而）暫時擱置一旁

on the back of an envelope: in a hurried way, without much detail

on the back of: soon after an earlier success, and as a result of it
由於（不久前的某項成就）

on the blink: When a machine is on the blink, it is not working correctly.

on the bounce: one after another with nothing else between

on the dot: exactly at the stated or expected time

on the face of it: used when you are describing how a situation seems on the surface

on the factory floor: involving ordinary workers rather than managers
涉及普通工人（而非管理者）

on the fly: informal If you do something on the fly, you do it quickly, often while you are doing something else, without preparing and without thinking too much about how it should be done.
為經準備或較多考慮就開始匆忙做…（往往與其他事情一起進行）
specialized computing without interrupting a computer program that is already running
無需中斷一個已經運行的電腦程式（而同時執行其他功能）

on the front burner: US getting or needing immediate attention
得到（或需要）立刻的關注

on the go: UK in the process of being produced
正在生產中，處於生產過程中

on the ground: 在公眾中，在普通百姓中

on the hoof: If you do something on the hoof, you do it while you are moving about or doing something else, often without giving it the attention it deserves.

on the horizon: likely to happen or exist soon

on the house: If you have something on the house, it is given to you free by a business.

on the inside: If someone is on the inside, they have a job or position in which they have special or secret information.
在（機構或組織的）內部；參與內部機密

on the large, small, etc. side: too large, small, etc. for a particular purpose

on the loose: If a dangerous person or animal is on the loose, that person or animal is free to move around a place and harm people.

on the nod: If a suggestion is approved on the nod, it is accepted without discussion.

on the nose: exactly right, often an exact amount of money or time

on the one hand ... on the other hand: used when you are comparing two different facts or two opposite ways of thinking about a situation

on the part of sb/on sb's part: 由某人所作；由某人所經歷

on the quiet: 秘密地，不為人注意地，暗地裡

on the rebound: unhappy and confused because a close, romantic relationship of yours has recently finished
（因失戀而）處於心灰意懶的狀態

on the record: If you say something on the record, you state it publicly.

one day: at some time in the future
at some time in the future
將來有一天，將來某一天

one for the books: 意想不到之事，出乎意料之事

one for the road: an alcoholic drink just before leaving

one good turn deserves another: said when you do a helpful or kind act for someone who has done something good for you
好心應該得到好報；以德報德

one in a million: a chance that is extremely unlikely

one man's loss is another man's gain: said when someone gets an advantage from someone else's bad luck
一人之失即是他人之得；此消彼長

one man's meat is another man's poison: said to emphasize that people like different things

one of these days: some time in the near future
將來有一天，過不了多久

one of those days: a bad day, full of problems
倒楣的日子，不走運的日子

one step forward, two steps back: If you take one step forward, two steps back, you make progress but then experience events that cause you to be further behind than you were when you made the progress.

one thing leads to another: If one thing leads to another, there is a series of events in which each event was caused by the previous one.
一環扣一環；一來二去；自然而然

one too many: If you have had one too many, you have drunk too much alcohol.

one way or another: in some way that is not stated
in any way that is possible

one, two, etc. down, one, two etc. to go: an expression that is used to mean that you have done or dealt with the first, second, etc. of a series of things and have yet to do or deal with the rest
已經完成了一／兩個，還有一／兩個沒完成呢

one-armed bandit: a type of slot machine with a large metal pole on the side that you pull to make it work
「獨臂強盜」（指一種角子老虎機）

one-hit wonder: a performer of popular music who makes one successful recording but then no others
只有一首成名曲的歌手

one-horse race: a race or competition that only one of the competitors has a real chance of winning
只有一位參賽者有機會獲勝的比賽，一位參賽者遙遙領先的比賽

one-horse town: a town that is small and not important

one-man band: a musician who performs alone, usually outside, carrying and playing several instruments at the same time
（通常在室外，同時演奏多種樂器的）一人樂隊

SEX: a sexual relationship that lasts for only one night, or a person who you have had this type of relationship with
一夜情，一夜風流；一夜情人，露水夫妻
PERFORMANCE: a performance that happens only once in a particular place

one-parent family: a family that includes either a mother or a father but not both

one-track mind: to think about one particular thing and nothing else

one-trick pony: informal someone or something that is only good for one particular purpose, or at doing one particular thing
僅能做好某一件事的人，只有單一用途的物品

one-two punch: two unpleasant things that happen together

some day: at some time in the future
將來有一天，將來某一天

online bank: a bank that operates over the internet

online banking: the process or activity of managing bank accounts or operating as a bank over the internet
使用網路銀行；網路銀行服務

online dating: a way of starting a romantic relationship on the internet, by giving information about yourself or replying to someone else's information

only child: a child who has no sisters or brothers

only have eyes for: to be interested in or attracted to only one person

only joking!: said when you mean that something you said was not intended to be serious

only so much: used to say that there are limits to something

only so many: used to say that there are limits to something

only to do: used to show that something is surprising or unexpected

only time will tell: UK also (only) time can tell used to say that the truth or a result will only be known in the future after events have happened

time will tell: UK also (only) time can tell used to say that the truth or a result will only be known in the future after events have happened

op art: a type of modern art that uses patterns that do not exist naturally in order to create images that appear to move or to be something that they are not
歐普藝術，光效應藝術，視幻藝術（一種利用實際上不存在的圖形使人產生視錯覺的現代藝術）

used by writers to avoid repeating the details of a book or article that has already been referred to, when all the details other than the page number are the same
（用於避免重複前文提到的書或文章的細節）同上，同前文所引

open up: to do a medical operation on someone to see inside their body
給（某人）動手術，給（某人）開刀
to open the lock on the door of a building
to improve a situation by making it less limited
to show something that was hidden or not previously known
to make a space larger or less closed in

open admissions: a system that allows students to go to a college without having any special qualifications for it
（不限制入學資格的）開放招生制

open adoption: an arrangement by which children are legally adopted by people who are not their natural parents, but still continue to communicate with their natural parents
開放式領養（孩子法律上跟養父母住在一起，仍可繼續與親生父母保持聯繫）

open book: If someone is an open book, it is easy to know what they are thinking and feeling.
是個極坦率的人；是個很容易看透的人

open classroom: in the US, a system for educating young children in which classes and activities are informal and changed to suit each child
（美國的）開放式課堂，大課堂（指開展不拘形式、富於變化的課程或活動以適應每個學生的教育制度）

open day: a day when an organization such as a school, college, or factory allows members of the public to go in and see what happens there
（學校、大學、工廠等接受公眾參觀的）接待日，開放日

open fire: a fire that you light outside, for example to cook on, or a fire in a space in a wall of a building, with a chimney to take the smoke away
在屋外點的火；壁爐裡的爐火

open fireplace: a space in a wall of a building in which a fire can be lit, with a chimney to take the smoke away

open house: mainly US UK usually open day a day when an organization such as a school, college, or factory allows members of the public to go in and see what happens there
（學校、大學、工廠等接受公眾參觀的）接待日，開放日
a time when a house or apartment that is being sold can be looked at by the public
UK a situation in which people welcome visitors at any time
隨時開放；隨時歡迎來客

open letter: a letter intended to be read by a lot of people, not just the person it is written to

open market: a situation in which companies can trade freely without limits, and prices are changed according to the number of goods and how many people are buying them

open marriage: a marriage in which both partners are free to have sexual relationships with other people
開放婚姻（指配偶雙方都有發生婚外性關係的自由）

open mind: to wait until you know all the facts before forming an opinion or making a judgment
不持任何偏見的；不存先入之見的

open prison: a prison where prisoners have more freedom because they are trusted not to escape
開放式監獄；不設防監獄

open sandwich: a single slice of bread with various types of food, such as cheese or cold meat, on the top
單片三明治，外餡三明治

open sb's eyes: to make someone realize something surprising or shocking that they had not known about or understood before
使（某人）認清，使（某人）了解

open season: the period in the year when it is legal to hunt particular animals
（法定的）漁獵開放季節，狩獵期
a situation that allows or causes a particular group of people to be treated unfairly
（針對某些團體的）不公平待遇

open secret: a fact that should be a secret when in fact a lot of people know about it

open sesame: something that makes it very easy to achieve a particular thing
（達到…的）法寶，通行手段，開門咒語

open the floodgates: If an action or a decision opens the floodgates, it allows something to happen a lot or allows many people to do something that was not previously allowed.
引發更多同類事件；放開限制

Open University: in the UK, a university that usually accepts students without formal qualifications and allows them to study from home, receiving and sending work by post, by email, or over the internet
（英國）開放大學（通常接受沒有正式文憑的學生，採用函授、電子郵件和網路進行教學的大學）

open verdict: a legal decision that records a death but does not state its cause
存疑判決；死因不詳的裁決

open your heart to someone: to tell someone about your problems and secrets

open your mouth: to speak or start to speak

open-faced sandwich: a single slice of bread with various types of food, such as cheese or cold meat, on the top
外陷三明治，單片三明治

open-heart surgery: a medical operation in which the body is cut open and the heart is repaired, while the body's blood is kept flowing by a machine
心臟直視手術；體外循環心臟手術

opening hours: the times when a business, such as a bar, restaurant, shop, or bank, is open for people to use it
（酒吧、飯店、商店、銀行等商家的）營業時間

opening night: the first night that a play, film, etc. is performed or shown
（戲劇、電影等的）首演之夜，首映之夜

opening time: the time at which a bar or pub opens

opera glasses: small binoculars that can be used in large theatres by people sitting far from the stage, so that they can see the performers more clearly
觀劇鏡（指看戲用的小型雙筒望遠鏡）

opera house: a theatre that is specially designed for operas to be performed in

operating room: a special room in which people are operated on in a hospital

operating system: a set of programs that control the way a computer system works, especially how its memory is used and how different programs work together

operating table: a special table that a patient lies on during an operation

operating theatre: a special room in which people are operated on in a hospital

operational research: work that is done to find the best ways to solve problems in business and industry

opinion poll: an occasion when people are asked questions to discover what they think about a subject

opportunistic infection: an infection caused by bacteria or a virus that is not harmful to a healthy person but harms a person whose body's natural defence against infection is damaged
機會性感染（細菌或病毒引起的感染，對健康的人一般無害，但會影響自然防禦感染能力受損的人）

opportunity shop: a shop in which a charity sells all types of used goods that are given by the public, or in which they sell new goods, to make money for the work of the charity

opposite number: a person who has a very similar job or rank to you but in a different organization
（其他機構中）與自己職務對等的人，級別對等者，對應者

opt in: to choose to be part of an activity, arrangement, etc.
the fact of choosing to take part in an activity, arrangement, etc. rather than being forced to take part

opt out: to choose not to be part of an activity or to stop being involved in it
a situation in which some members of a group choose not to join or be involved in an activity

optic nerve: the group of nerve fibres (= structures like threads) that pass signals from the retina at the back of each eye to the brain
視神經（形如細絲的神經纖維束，將視覺訊號從眼球後部的視網膜傳送至大腦）

optical character recognition: the process by which an electronic device recognizes printed or written letters or numbers
光符識別，光學文字辨識（用電子儀器識別印刷或書寫字元的過程）

optical fibre: a long, thin glass rod through which very large amounts of information can be sent in the form of light

optical illusion: something that tricks your eyes and makes you think you see something that is not really there, or see it differently from how it really is

or die in the attempt: said when someone would do anything to achieve what they want to achieve

or else: used to say what will happen if another thing does not happen
used to compare two different things or situations
（用於對比兩種不同的事物或情形）要不，要麽
informal used as a threat, sometimes humorously
（表示威脅，有時是一種幽默的說法）要不然，否則的話

or no: used to emphasize that the stated thing will not make any difference
（用於強調所說事物不會有影響）或沒有

or otherwise: used to refer to the opposite of the word that comes before it

or something: used to show that what you have just said is only an example or you are not certain about it
諸如此類的，…之類的東西

or what?: informal used at the end of a phrase for emphasis

oral history: information about a historical event or period that is told to you by people who experienced it

oral implant: a device or tissue put inside the mouth

oral sex: the activity of using the tongue and lips to touch someone's sexual organs in order to give pleasure

oral tradition: a system for preserving a group's beliefs, customs, and history, in which parents tell their children about them, and the children tell their children, and so on
口述傳統，口頭文化（某一群體對其信仰、習俗、歷史的傳承體系，由父母口頭傳授給孩子，一輩一輩傳授下去）

orange squash: a drink that tastes like oranges, made by adding water to very strong, sweet orange juice

orbital road: a road that takes traffic around a city rather than through it

orchestra pit: the area of a theatre in which musicians play their instruments, usually in front of the stage
樂池，樂隊席（舞臺前樂隊演奏的地方）

order book: a book in which a business keeps a record of customers' orders
（公司或店鋪記錄客戶訂單的）訂貨簿，訂單簿

order form: a printed form that a customer uses to request goods or a service

order of magnitude: the approximate size of something, especially a number
specialized mathematics a level in a system used for measuring something in which each level is ten times larger than the one before
成指數增加的，以十倍為單位增加的

order paper: in parliament, a list which shows the order in which matters will be discussed on a particular day

order your thoughts: to plan what you want to say or do

orders are orders: said when you have to do something because someone in authority has told you to, and usually when you do not really approve of it
（通常指雖然不贊成但）命令就是命令，命令必須執行

Ordinary level: formal for O level (= a British school exam in the past)
（英國學校舊時的）普通程度考試；普通程度證書 (O Level 的正式說法）

organ grinder: a person who earns money in the street by playing a musical instrument that is operated by turning a handle

organ loft: a raised area in a church or concert hall where the organ is and the organist (= organ player) sits

organ transplant surgery: the process of taking a healthy organ such as a heart or lung from a person who has just died and putting it into a living person to replace an organ that is not working properly

organic chemistry: the scientific study of chemical substances that contain carbon, including artificial substances such as plastics

organic growth: If a company experiences organic growth, it develops its own business instead of buying other companies.
（公司的）內生增長，有機增長（主要依靠自身業務增長而取得發展，而非透過收購其他公司）

organized chaos: a situation in which there seems to be a lot of confusion and no organization, which makes you surprised that the results are good
有組織的混亂（看似混亂，但結果卻出乎意料的好）

organized crime: criminal organizations that plan and commit crime, or the crimes that are committed by such organizations
犯罪集團；有組織犯罪，集團犯罪

organized labour: workers considered as a group that can act together to improve their situation

original jurisdiction: the right of a court to be the first to hear a legal case

original sin: in the Christian religion, the idea that all humans are born with a tendency to be evil

orthodox medicine: the use of drugs and operations to cure illness

osmotic pressure: the amount of pressure needed to stop the flow of a liquid through a membrane (= cell covering)
滲透壓（阻止水溶液穿透細胞膜的壓力）

other half: a person's husband, wife, or usual partner
另一半（指丈夫、妻子或伴侶）

DUTY: used to show when it is necessary or would be a good thing to perform the activity referred to by the following verb
（表示做某事有必要、值得或有利）應該，應當
PROBABLE: used to express something that you expect will happen

Ouija board: a brand name for a board, printed with letters of the alphabet and numbers, that people use in the belief that it will help them receive messages from people who are dead
靈應牌，維佳博多牌（一種有字母和數字的板牌，據信用於接收亡靈傳遞的訊息）

Our Father: （基督教的）主禱詞（同 the Lord's Prayer）

Our Lady: (in some parts of the Christian religion) a name for Mary, the mother of Jesus

out and about: active; doing the things you usually do

out and away: used with superlatives to mean by a great amount
（與形容最高級連用）無可比擬的

out front: In a theatre, if you say that someone is out front, you mean they are one of the people watching the performance.

out loud: If you say or read something out loud, you say or read it so that other people can hear you.

NO LONGER IN: no longer in a stated place or condition
不在（某處）；不處於（某種情況）
MADE FROM: also of used to show what something is made from
BECAUSE OF: used to show the reason why someone does something
FROM AMONG: from among an amount or number
ORIGIN: used to describe where something came from or began
形容某事的起源（或來歷）

out of action: If a machine or vehicle is out of action, it is not working or cannot be used.
If a person is out of action, they are injured or ill and cannot do things they usually do.
因病倒或受傷而不能正常活動

out of bounds: If an area is out of bounds, people are not allowed to go there.
mainly US sports If the ball is out of bounds, it is not within the playing area.

out of commission: If something, such as a machine or a military ship, is out of commission it is broken or not available to be used.
（機器、軍艦等）壞了的，不可使用的，退役的

FASHION: If clothes, colours, styles, etc. are out of date, they are old and not fashionable.
（衣服、顏色、樣式等）過時的，不時興的，陳舊的
INFORMATION: If information is out of date, it is old and not useful or correct.
（資訊）過時的，無用的，不準確的
FOOD: If food is out of date, it is old and not now safe to eat.

out of hand: If you refuse something out of hand, you refuse it completely without thinking about or discussing it.

out of harm's way: in a position that is safe from harm or from which harm cannot be done

out of hours: If you drink in a bar out of hours, you drink alcohol at a time when it is not allowed by law.
在違禁時間，在正常營業時間之外

out of it: not conscious of where you are or what condition you are in as a result of taking alcohol or drugs
（在酒精、藥物或毒品的作用下）昏昏然的，無知覺的，昏迷的
unhappy because you are not included in what is happening
（因為被排除在外而）不開心的，失落的

out of order: If something someone says or does is out of order, it is unpleasant or not suitable and it is likely to upset or offend people.

out of sight: informal extremely expensive and more than you are able to spend

out of sight, out of mind: said to emphasize that when something or someone cannot be seen, it is easy to forget it, him, or her

out of station: Indian English away; not present in a place

out of the blue: If something happens out of the blue, it is completely unexpected.

out of the frying pan into the fire: said when you move from a bad or difficult situation to one that is worse
跳出油鍋又入火坑；才出龍潭又入虎穴

out of the mouths of babes: said when a child says something that surprises you because it seems very wise
出自天真的稚子之口；童言有道

out of the picture: not important to or not involved in a situation

out of your depth: not having the knowledge, experience, or skills to deal with a particular subject or situation
in water that is so deep that it goes over your head when you are standing

out of your mind: unable to behave or deal with things normally because something has made you very worried, unhappy, or angry
（因憂慮、不高興或憤怒而）精神錯亂，發狂
informal extremely stupid or mentally ill
極其愚蠢的；昏了頭的；犯傻的

out of your head: 極其愚蠢的；昏了頭的；犯傻的

out of/from the corner of your eye: If you see something out of/from the corner of your eye, you see it but not clearly because it happens to the side of you.
用眼角餘光（看），不經意（瞅見）

out on a limb: having an opinion that is different from most people's and is unpopular
（意見）未得到衆人贊同的，孤立的

out tray: a flat, open container on a desk for letters and other documents that have already been dealt with and are waiting to be sent to someone else or put away
（辦公桌上存放已處理或待發文件的）發文盤，待發信件盤

out with it!: said to someone when you want that person to tell you something that they do not want you to know

out-of-body experience: an experience in which you feel as if you have left your own body and can see it from the outside, usually from above
靈魂出竅的體驗，出體體驗

outboard motor: a motor with a propeller, designed to be attached to the back of a small boat
a boat with an outboard motor

outer ring: an area around the edges of a region, town, or city

outer space: the part of space that is very far away from Earth

outfield player: any of the players on a football team other than the goalkeeper
（足球）除守門員之外的所有球員，外場球員

outlet mall: a large group of shops, usually outside a town or city, that each sell clothes, goods, etc. made by a particular company, for a reduced price
（通常坐落在市郊的）購物中心，廉價商品銷售中心

outside broadcast: a broadcast made away from the television or radio station

outside forward: on a football team, one of two players who attack down the left and right hand sides of the pitch

ROAD: UK informal outside the part of the road nearest the vehicles going in the opposite direction, used especially by faster vehicles
（尤指快車行駛的）外車道，快車道
US the part of the road nearest the edge, especially used by slower vehicles
（尤指慢車行駛的）外車道，慢車道
RACE TRACK: the part of a race track that is furthest from the centre

outstation cheque: a cheque from a bank that is not local

oven glove: a thick covering for the hand, used for taking hot things out of an oven

over my dead body: If you say something will happen over your dead body, you mean that you will do everything you can to prevent it.
只要我還有一口氣就不能那樣做；除非我死了

over the counter: Drugs that are bought over the counter are bought in a shop without first visiting a doctor
MEDICINE: An over-the-counter drug is bought from a shop without the person who buys it having visited a doctor first.
（藥品）非處方的，無需處方也可買到的
SHARES: specialized finance & economics used to describe shares that are traded directly between dealers (= people and organizations that buy and sell for others), rather than on a stock market

over the hill: used for describing someone who is old and no longer useful or attractive
過了巔峰期；年老不中用

over the odds: more than something is really worth

over the top: too extreme and not suitable, or demanding too much attention or effort, especially in an uncontrolled way

over your head: too difficult or strange for you to understand

over-egg the pudding: to spoil something by trying too hard to improve it

overhead projector: a device that makes large images from a flat, transparent sheet and shows them on a white screen or wall

overplay your hand: to spoil your chance of success by saying or doing too much
說得（或做得）太多而毀掉勝機

overstep the mark: to behave in a completely unacceptable way

overtaking lane: the part of a main road that is used for passing other vehicles and is nearest the centre of the road

owe it to yourself: to deserve and need to do something that will be good for you
自己理應做，自己當之無愧

own brand: a product that has the name of the shop that sells it, rather than the name of the company that made it

own goal: in sport, a point that a player scores by mistake against their own team
（體育比賽中的）烏龍球，無意中幫對方得分的進球
something that you do that gives you a disadvantage and helps someone else, even if this is the opposite of what you intended
無意中讓自己吃虧的行為

own up: to admit that you have done something wrong

oxbow lake: a curved lake that was originally a bend in a river but became separated when the river took a new, straighter course
牛軛湖（當河流出現新的、更直的流向時，原有的河流彎曲處分離形成湖泊）

Oxford shirt: a man's shirt made of a particular type of heavy cotton cloth

oxygen bar: a place where you pay to breathe pure oxygen in order to improve your health and help you relax
提供吸氧服務的場所，氧吧（顧客付費吸入純淨的、有益健康的氧氣，有助於放鬆）

oxygen debt: the extra oxygen that the body uses during exercise, which must be replaced when resting
氧債（運動時身體消耗的額外氧氣，需要在運動後恢復）

oxygen mask: a piece of equipment that can be put over a person's nose and mouth to supply them with oxygen

oxygen tank: a container with oxygen inside it, used for helping people to breathe, for example when they are very ill, or when they are diving underwater
氧氣罐（充滿氧氣的容器，幫助病人或潛水者呼吸）

oxygen tent: a clear covering put over the head and upper body of a person who is ill to provide oxygen to help them breathe

oyster bed: an area at the bottom of the sea where oysters live
牡蠣繁殖地；牡蠣養殖場

Oyster card: a small plastic card that can be used as a method of payment on buses, trains, and the underground in London
（在倫敦公共交通系統內用來支付車費的）八達通卡

LETTER: the 16th letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第16個字母）
SIGN: parking , used especially on road signs

郵資和包裝費（postage and packing的縮寫）

PA system: 有線廣播系統（public address system的縮寫）

pace bowler: in cricket, a player who bowls the ball fast

pack up: to collect all your things together when you have finished doing something

pack a punch: to have a lot of force or a great effect

pack animal: an animal, such as a horse, that is used to transport things on its back

pack ice: a large mass of ice floating in the sea that has been formed by smaller pieces of ice being forced together
流冰群，浮冰群，大片浮冰

pack sth/somewhere out: to make a place very full

package deal: a set of arrangements that must be accepted together and not separately

package store: 持有外賣酒類執照的商店（同 off-licence）

package tour: a holiday at a fixed price in which the travel company arranges your travel, hotels, and sometimes meals for you
（費用固定、一切由旅行社代辦的）包辦旅遊

packed lunch: a light meal put in a bag or container, that you take with you to be eaten later, for example at school or work

packed like sardines: If people are packed or squashed like sardines, they are positioned very close together so that they cannot move.
擁擠不堪，（像沙丁魚一樣）緊緊擠在一起

squashed like sardines: If people are packed or squashed like sardines, they are positioned very close together so that they cannot move.
擁擠不堪，（像沙丁魚一樣）緊緊擠在一起

packing case: a large, strong box for transporting things

padded cell: a room in a mental hospital that has very soft walls to stop a seriously mentally ill person from hurting himself or herself
（精神病院裡牆上裝有護墊防止病人自殘的）軟墊病房，軟墊小室

paddle board: a board used in the sport of paddle boarding

paddle boarding: a sport in which you travel across water or ride on waves using a board, which you can sit or stand on, and sometimes a paddle

paddle steamer: a large boat that uses a paddle driven by steam to move through the water

paddle wheel: a type of wheel with small flat blades attached around the edge that makes a boat move through the water or that operates a piece of machinery

paddle your own canoe: If you describe a person as paddling their own canoe, you mean that they are independent and do not need help from anyone else.
自力更生，自食其力；獨立處事

paddling pool: a pool that is not deep that small children can play in

paddy field: a field planted with rice growing in water

paddy wagon: a closed police vehicle used for transporting prisoners

paediatric thrombocytopenia: a condition in children in which the blood has too few platelets (= cells that help the blood to get thicker to stop bleeding)

paedophile ring: a group of people who take part in illegal sexual activity involving children

page view: an occasion when a single page of a website is visited, for example by someone clicking on a link to that page

page-three girl: a young woman who appears with naked breasts in photographs for some popular newspapers in the UK
三版女郎（出現在英國某些通俗報紙上裸露胸部的年輕女子）

paint a black picture of: to describe a situation or person as extremely bad
把（形勢）描繪得很嚴峻；把（某人）說得很壞

paint a picture: to describe or show something in a particular way

paint stripper: a liquid used to remove old paint from wooden surfaces

paint thinner: a liquid that you add to paint to make it less thick or to remove paint from brushes

pair off: to introduce two people to each other so that they will start a romantic relationship
使（兩人）結成一對情侶，介紹（兩個人）認識
If a group of people pair off, they divide into pairs in order to do something, and if you pair them off, you divide them into pairs.
兩人一組結成對；把（一組人）分成幾對

pair up: to join together temporarily with another person in order to do something

pak choi: a vegetable, often used in Chinese cooking, that has dark green leaves on thick white stems
小白菜，青菜（一種蔬菜，常用於中國飲食，莖厚白，葉深綠）

pal around: to spend time with someone that you are very friendly with

palace coup: a situation in which a leader is removed from power by the people who have worked with him or her

pale ale: a type of beer that does not contain much alcohol and is often sold in bottles

pale imitation: something that is similar to but not as good as something else

pale in comparison: to seem much less serious or important when compared with someone or something else

pale into insignificance: to seem not important when compared with something else
（與其他事情比起來）無足輕重，相形失色

palette knife: a knife with a wide thin blade, a rounded end, and no sharp edge, used to mix paints together and also to spread soft substances when cooking
調色刀；（烹飪時用的）刮鏟，圓頭無刃刀

palisade layer: a layer of long cells between two thin surface layers of a leaf, containing a lot of chloroplasts (= the parts of a cell where energy from the sun is turned into food)

palm oil: an oil from the nuts of some types of palm tree, used in some foods and to make soap

Palm Sunday: the Sunday before Easter (= a Christian religious holiday) in Christian religions
棕枝主日，聖枝主日（即復活節前的星期日）

pan out: to develop in a particular way or in a successful way

Pancake Day: the day before Lent (= a religious period in the Christian religion) starts, when pancakes are traditionally eaten
薄餅日（大齋期的前一天，按傳統習俗要吃薄餅）

pancake landing: an occasion when an aircraft lands without using its wheels by dropping onto the ground from a low height, because it has a problem and cannot continue to fly

pancreatic duct: in the human body, a tube that runs from the pancreas and joins the bile duct, taking pancreatic juice into the small intestine

pancreatic juice: a liquid produced by the pancreas containing substances that digest food as it reaches the small intestine

pancreatic mass: a growth or tumour in the pancreas that can be either benign (= not likely to cause death) or malignant (= if untreated could lead to death)

pander to: to do or provide exactly what a person or group wants, especially when it is not acceptable, reasonable, or approved of, usually in order to get some personal advantage

Pandora's box: something that creates a lot of new problems that you did not expect
潘朵拉的盒子（指邪惡之源）

Panenka penalty: a penalty kick in football in which the ball is gently chipped (= sent high into the air for a short distance) into the goal after the goalkeeper has dived to one side of the goal

panic attack: a sudden period of severe anxiety in which your heart beats fast, you have trouble breathing, and you feel as if something very bad is going to happen
（一陣突如其來的）驚慌失措，惶恐

panic button: a device, usually a button, that is used to call for help by someone in a dangerous situation
報警按鈕，緊急呼救按鈕

panic buying: a situation in which many people suddenly buy as much food, fuel, etc. as they can because they are worried about something bad that may happen
（因害怕不好的事即將發生而出現的）搶購，恐慌性購買

panic selling: a situation in which many people suddenly start to sell company shares that they own, because they are worried that their value is going to fall

panic stations: a situation in which people feel worried and nervous because things need to be done quickly
（由於事情緊急而出現的）慌亂狀態

pant for: to want someone or something very much

pant after: to want someone or something very much

pantomime horse: two people pretending humorously to be a horse by dressing in special clothes and standing one behind the other so that the front person appears as the horse's front half and the person behind forms the back part
雙人扮馬（由兩個演員穿特殊的衣服扮演的馬，前面的演員撐起馬頭和前腿，後面的演員撐起後腿）

panty liner: a small length of material that can be stuck to the inside of a woman's underpants to absorb any liquid from the body

Pap smear: a medical test in which cells from a woman's cervix (= entrance to the womb) are removed and examined to discover if there is any disease

paper clip: a small piece of bent wire used for holding pieces of paper together

paper knife: a knife for opening envelopes that is not sharp and is often decorative

paper money: money in paper form, rather than coins

paper over: to hide an unpleasant situation, especially a problem or disagreement, in order to make people believe that it does not exist or is not serious

paper over the cracks: to hide problems, especially arguments between people, in order to make a situation seem better than it really is
掩蓋（尤指人與人之間的爭執）

paper profit: a profit that is shown in financial records but has not yet been made by a company, especially because it is waiting for payments it is owed

paper round: the job, often done by children, of taking newspapers to people's homes
（通常由報童來做的）上門送報

paper tiger: something, such as an enemy or foreign country, that seems very strong and dangerous but is really weak and not harmful
紙老虎（指外強中乾的敵人或國家）

paper towel: a sheet of soft thick paper used for drying your hands, cleaning objects, absorbing liquids, etc.

paper trail: a series of documents that show a record of your activities
（對某人活動作記載的）紙上跟蹤，活動紀錄，檔案

papier m\u00e2ch\u00e9: pieces of paper mixed with glue or with flour and water, used to make decorative objects or models
（用紙屑、膠質、麵糊等混合製成，可用於製作裝飾性物品或模型的）紙型，混凝紙

Papua New Guinea: a country in Australasia, forming part of the island of New Guinea
巴布亞紐幾內亞（南太平洋島國）

Papua New Guinean: belonging to or relating to Papua New Guinea or its people
巴布亞紐幾內亞的；巴布亞紐幾內亞人的
a person from Papua New Guinea

par excellence: You describe something as par excellence when it is the best example of its type

parachute payments: a series of payments spread over a period of four years that the Premier League gives to football clubs who are relegated (= moved to a lower group) at the end of a season
（由英格蘭超級聯賽付給降級球隊、分四年付清的）降級付費

parade ground: a large flat area where soldiers march and practise military movements

paradigm shift: a time when the usual and accepted way of doing or thinking about something changes completely
行為（或思維）方式的改變，範式轉移

parallel circuit: a circuit in which the electric current passes through two or more branches or connected parts at the same time before it combines again

parallel imports: products that are bought unofficially in foreign countries by companies or people who then sell them more cheaply than usual in their own countries
平行進口（一些公司或人從外國運來的、非正式進口的產品，其後這些產品在本國以更便宜的價格出售）

parallel parking: the act of parking a vehicle along or parallel to the side of the road, rather than facing into the side of the road
路邊平行停車（使車與道路平行）

parallel port: a part of a computer to which wires from other pieces of equipment such as a printer can be connected, sending information eight bits (= units of information), or one byte, at a time through a special wire
並行埠，平行埠（電腦的一個零件，其他設備如印表機的電纜可連接到該埠上，該埠透過特殊電纜每次傳遞8個位元，即一個位元組的資訊）

parallel processing: the ability of a computer to do two or more pieces of work at the same time

parathyroid gland: any of four glands (= small organs in the body) that control the amount of the chemicals calcium and phosphorus in the body

parcel bomb: a bomb wrapped up as a parcel and sent by post

parcel post: the system in which parcelsare sent by post

parchment paper: paper that does not allow oil through, used especially in cooking
（尤指烹調用的）防油紙，耐油紙，蠟紙

pardon me for breathing: used to tell someone that you think they have just answered or spoken to you in an unreasonably critical or rude way
總不能不讓人呼吸了吧！（用於當某人以極其苛刻或粗魯的方式答話或對自己說話時）

pardon me for existing: used to tell someone that you think they have just answered or spoken to you in an unreasonably critical or rude way
總不能不讓人呼吸了吧！（用於當某人以極其苛刻或粗魯的方式答話或對自己說話時）

pardon me for living!: used to tell someone that you think they have just answered or spoken to you in an unreasonably critical or rude way
總不能不讓人呼吸了吧！（用於當某人以極其苛刻或粗魯的方式答話或對自己說話時）

parent company: a company that controls other smaller companies

parent-teacher association: an organization run by teachers and the parents of children at a school that tries to help the school, especially by organizing activities that raise money for it
（尤指透過組織募款活動來對學校予以幫助的）家長教師聯誼會，家長教師會

parental leave: time that a parent is allowed to spend away from work to take care of his or her baby

paring knife: a small knife that is used to cut away a thin outer layer of something, especially fruit

parish clerk: an official whose duties are connected with a church

parish council: a group of people who are elected to make decisions for their parish

park keeper: a person who is in charge of and takes care of a public park

park the bus: If a football team parks the bus, it defends without trying to attack, with almost all of the players on the team staying deep inside their own half of the pitch.
（足球比賽中）球隊放棄進攻，所有球員都在自己半場後方參加防守

parking brake: a device operated by hand that locks into position and prevents a vehicle from moving

parking garage: a building where you can leave a car for a period of time

parking light: either of the two smaller lights attached to the front of a car

parking lot: an outside area of ground where you can leave a car for a period of time

parking meter: a device at the side of the road that you put money into so that you can leave your vehicle there for a particular amount of time

parking policeman: someone whose job is to make certain that people do not leave their cars in illegal places

parking ticket: an official notice put on your vehicle when you have parked illegally that tells you that you must pay a fine (= a punishment that involves paying an amount of money)

Parkinson's law: the idea that any piece of work will increase to fill as much time as you have to do it in
帕金森定律（指工作總要拖到最後時限才能完成的一種觀點）

parlour game: a game played inside a house, usually involving words or acting
室內遊戲（常涉及文字或表演）

Parma ham: Italian dried ham (= meat from the leg or shoulder of a pig) served in very thin slices: prosciutto

parochial school: a school controlled by a religious organization that usually receives no money from the government

part company: If two people part company, they end their relationship.

part exchange: a way of paying for a new object that involves giving your old one as part of the payment
部分抵價交易，以舊換新交易

part of speech: one of the grammatical groups, such as noun, verb, and adjective, into which words are divided depending on their use

part of the furniture: something or someone so familiar that you no longer notice it, him, or her
習以為常之事，司空見慣的事（或人）

part with: to give something to someone else, especially when you do not want to

partially sighted: People who are partially sighted are not completely blind but are able to see very little.

particle accelerator: in physics, a machine that makes extremely small pieces of matter travel at very high speeds, so that scientists can study the way they behave

particle physics: the part of physics that studies particles (= extremely small pieces of matter)

parting shot: a remark that you make when you are leaving, so that it has a stronger effect

party animal: someone who enjoys parties and party activities very much and goes to as many as possible

party bag: a bag of small gifts given to guests at a party or other event
（聚會上送給賓客的）一包禮品

party faithful: people who have been loyal members or supporters of a party for a long time
忠誠的黨員；忠誠的政黨擁護者

party favor: a small present given to guests at a party
（聚會上通常送給孩子的）小禮物

POLITICS: the official ideas and goals of a political party
政黨的路線，政黨的政策
PHONE: a phone connection that is shared by two or more customers with separate phones

party piece: a short performance or an action done in public, especially one showing an unusual or humorous skill

party planner: someone whose job is to organize parties and social events for other people
聚會策劃人，社交活動策劃人

party political broadcast: a short television or radio programme in which a politician talks about his or her party's ideas and plans in order to try to win more support
政黨政治電視（或廣播）節目

party politics: political activity and discussion within or relating to political parties rather than the whole country

party pooper: someone who spoils other people's enjoyment by disapproving of or not taking part in a particular activity
煞風景的人，令人掃興的人

party popper: a small device, held in the hand, that makes a loud noise and produces many small strips of coloured paper when you pull the string on it

party wall: a wall that divides two buildings that are joined together, and belongs to both of them

pas de deux: (in ballet) a dance for two people, usually a man and a woman
（芭蕾舞中通常一男一女的）双人舞

pass as: to appear to be someone or something else, or to cause people to believe that you are someone or something else

pass for: to appear to be someone or something else, or to cause people to believe that you are someone or something else

DEGREE: UK a degree given to university or college students who have passed their exams, but not well enough to get an honours degree
（授予未達到榮譽學位標準的學生的）普通學士學位
DEGREE COURSE: Australian English a degree course that is designed to be finished in three years instead of the usual four

pass key: a key for a door that is only given to people who are allowed to enter

pass mark: the number of points that must be achieved in order to be successful in an exam

pass on: to tell someone something that another person has told you
to give someone something that another person has given you
to give a disease to another person

pass out: to give something to each person in a group of people

pass rate: the number of people, shown as a percent, who were successful in a particular exam

pass the buck: to blame someone or make them responsible for a problem that you should deal with

pass the hat around: to try to collect money by asking people or organizations

pass the hat round: to try to collect money by asking people or organizations

pass the time of day: to have a short informal conversation

passing grade: the number of points that must be achieved in order to be successful in an exam

passing lane: the part of a main road that is used for passing other vehicles and is nearest the centre of the road

passing shot: an occasion when you successfully hit the ball past the other player in tennis

passion flower: a tropical climbing plant with large colourful flowers and fruits called passion fruits

passion fruit: a small fruit with thick purple or yellow skin and many seeds
百香果，熱情果，西番蓮果

passion play: a play that tells the story of the suffering and death of Jesus Christ

passions run high: a way of describing a time when people feel strong emotions about a particular subject

passive immunity: protection against disease in the form of antibodies (= substances in the blood that fight disease) that come from someone else, for example from the mother's milk
使用抗生素來免受疾病感染

passive offside: in football, an occasion when a player who is standing in an offside position is not punished for being offside because he or she does not move or try to reach the ball
（足球比賽中，處於越位位置的球員因為沒有參與進攻而沒受罰的情形）被動越位

passive resistance: the act of showing in a peaceful way that you oppose something, rather than using violence

passive smoking: the unwanted breathing in of other people's cigarette smoke, especially by people who do not smoke

past master: a person who is very skilled in a particular activity

past participle: the form of a verb, usually made by adding -ed, used in some grammatical structures such as the passive and the present perfect

pastoral farming: farming that involves keeping sheep, cattle, etc.

patch pocket: a square of material sewn onto the outside of a piece of clothing for carrying things in

p\u00e2t\u00e9 de foie gras: a thick, smooth, soft food made from the liver of a goose or duck that has been fed to make it fat

patent ductus arteriosus: a birth defect of the heart in which a temporary blood vessel that supplies the unborn child does not close at birth

patent leather: a type of leather that has a very smooth, shiny surface

patent medicine: a medicine, usually not a very powerful one, that you can buy without the written permission of a doctor
成藥，專利藥品（指非處方藥）

paternity leave: a period of time that a father is legally allowed to be away from his job so that he can spend time with his new baby
陪產假（法律上允許父親離開工作的一段時間，以便他可以照顧他的新生嬰兒）

pathetic fallacy: the use by a writer or poet of words that give human feelings or qualities to objects, nature, or animals, for example by referring to the "cruel sea"
感情誤置（某一作家或詩人使用的詞語，向物體、大自然或動物賦予人類的情感或素質，例如「殘酷的大海」）

paths cross: If two people's paths cross, the people meet.

patio heater: a device that is used to heat an outside area where people sit, for example at a bar or restaurant with outside tables

patrol car: an official car used by the police

patrol officer: a police officer who wears a uniform and patrols a particular area

patrol wagon: a closed police vehicle used for transporting prisoners

patron saint: a Christian saint who is believed to give special help to a particular place, activity, person, or type of object

pave the way: If something paves the way for/to something else, it makes the other thing possible.

paved with gold: used about a city to mean that it is easy to make money there
（某個城市）遍地是黃金，極容易發財

pavement artist: a person who draws pictures on a pavement using coloured chalks, especially so that people who walk past will give small amounts of money
（用彩色粉筆在人行道上作畫討錢的）街頭畫家

paving stone: a flat piece of stone, usually used in groups to cover a path or an area

pay out: to spend a lot of money on something, or to pay a lot of money to someone
（為…）付出大筆錢，（向…）支付大筆資金
to release a piece of rope or cable in a controlled way
小心地放出（繩索或電線）

pay channel: a television channel (= a broadcasting company) that you pay money to watch

pay claim: a demand for an increase in pay

pay dirt: something very valuable or very useful that is found after searching or effort
（經搜索或付出努力後所作的）有利發現

pay dividends: If something you do pays dividends, it causes good results at a time in the future.

pay down: to pay part of an amount that you owe, so that the debt is reduced

pay for: to be punished for doing something bad to someone else, or to suffer because of a mistake that you made
為…付出代價，因…得到報應

pay off: to pay back money that you owe

pay packet: the amount of money a person earns

pay rise: an increase in the amount of money you earn for doing your job

pay the price: to experience the bad result of something you have done

pay the ultimate price: to die because of something you have done, especially something you do for moral reasons

pay through the nose: to pay too much money for something

pay top dollar: to pay a lot of money for something

pay TV: television stations that you must pay to watch

pay up: to give someone the money that you owe them, especially when you do not want to
（尤指不情願地）付清欠款，償還欠款

pay your dues: to do something that you do not enjoy in order to have something that you want, or because you feel it is your duty
（為得到自己想要的而）做自己不喜歡的事；恪盡職守

pay your respects: to visit someone in order to welcome or talk to them
also pay your last respects to honour someone after their death, usually by going to the person's funeral
（通常指參加葬禮）（向死者）表示敬意，告別

pay your way: to pay for yourself rather than allowing someone else to pay
自己支付費用，自食其力

payback period: the amount of time it takes to get back the amount of money originally invested in something

payback's a bitch: If a person says payback's a bitch, they mean that something bad has happened as a result of something else.
說要回報根本是屁話（如某人說「回報是屁話」，表示過去發生事情引起了較壞的結果）

payday loan: an amount of money that is lent to someone by a company for a short time at a very high rate of interest
（針對個人的短期高利息貸款）發薪日貸款

FOOD: a soup made from peas, especially one made from dried peas that have been boiled
（尤指用幹豌豆煮沸做成的）豌豆湯
FOG: US old-fashioned informal UK pea-souper a very thick fog

peace dividend: the money saved by a country when it no longer needs to make or buy weapons because the threat of war has grown less
（戰爭威脅減小時政府透過削減軍費而節省下來的）和平紅利

peace offering: something said or given by a person to show that they want to be friendly, especially to someone they have argued with

peace pipe: a decorated tobacco pipe used by Native Americans at official events, especially as a sign of peace
和平煙鬥（尤指美洲土著居民在慶典上使用的作為和平象徵的精美煙鬥）

peace sign: a sign made with the hand by holding it with the palm forward and the first two fingers in the shape of a V, used to express peace
（掌心向外、食指和中指形成V字形的）和平手勢

peach Melba: a sweet food made from half a peach, ice cream, and raspberry sauce
蜜桃霜淇淋，樹莓醬桃子霜淇淋

peak oil: the time after which there will start to be less oil available

peanut brittle: hard toffee (= a type of sweet made from butter and sugar) that contains peanuts
花生糖，花生酥（硬奶糖，由奶油和糖製成的一種糖果，含有花生）

peanut butter: a soft, pale brown substance made from crushed peanuts, often eaten spread on bread

pear cider: an alcoholic drink made from pears

pearl diver: a person who swims deep down into the sea to find shells containing pearls

pearly king: Pearly kings and queens are particular men and women from London who have the right to dress in special black clothes covered with pearl buttons, in order to collect money for charity.
珠母鈕王／後（珠母紐王和珠母紐後指來自倫敦的特定男女，他們有權穿著綴滿珍珠紐扣的黑衣服為慈善機構籌款）

pearly queen: Pearly kings and queens are particular men and women from London who have the right to dress in special black clothes covered with pearl buttons, in order to collect money for charity.
珠母鈕王／後（珠母紐王和珠母紐後指來自倫敦的特定男女，他們有權穿著綴滿珍珠紐扣的黑衣服為慈善機構籌款）

peat bog: an area of land from which peat is taken

peck at: to eat small quantities of something without any enthusiasm

pecking order: an informal social system in which some people or groups know they are more or less important than others
長幼尊卑制度；權勢等級

pectoral fin: the fin on each side of a fish near the front of its body, used for controlling the direction the fish goes in and for slowing it down
胸鰭（魚身體前面兩側的鰭，用於控制轉向和減速）

pectus carinatum: a deformity in which the chest is narrow and sticks out more than usual at the front

pectus excavatum: a deformity in which the chest goes in more than usual at the front

pedal boat: a small boat that is moved by pushing pedals with the feet

pedal power: the activity of riding a bicycle

pedestrian crossing: a special place in a road where traffic must stop to allow people to walk across

pedestrian precinct: a shopping area in a town where vehicles are not allowed

peel away: When vehicles, people, or animals peel away/off, they separate from the group or structure they were part of and move away in a different direction.

peel off: When vehicles, people, or animals peel away/off, they separate from the group or structure they were part of and move away in a different direction.

peeping Tom: a man who tries to secretly watch women when they are wearing no clothes
窺視者（指偷看女人脫衣服的男人）

peer group: the people who are approximately the same age as you and come from a similar social group
同齡群體；同輩群體；同儕團體

peer of the realm: a member of the House of Lords (= the part of the UK parliament that is not elected) who is not a life peer

peer pressure: the strong influence of a group, especially of children, on members of that group to behave as everyone else does

peer review: the process of someone reading, checking, and giving his or her opinion about something that has been written by another scientist or expert working in the same subject area, or a piece of work in which this is done

peg leg: an artificial leg, especially a wooden one that is joined to the natural leg at the knee
（尤指木製，在膝蓋處接合的）假腿，義腿

peg out: If you peg out an area, you mark the edges of it by putting short sticks into the ground.

pelican crossing: a special place in the road in the UK, with a set of lights at the opposite side of the road and a device that people can press to make the red light show and the traffic stop, allowing them to cross

pen drive: a small piece of equipment that you connect to a computer or other piece of electronic equipment to copy and store information

pen lid: a cover that goes over the top of a pen to stop the ink from escaping

pen name: a name chosen by a writer to use instead of using his or her real name when publishing books

pen pal: someone who you exchange letters with as a hobby, but usually have not met

pen pusher: a person who has an office job that is not interesting

penal code: the system of legal punishment of a country

penalty area: in football, the area surrounded by white lines in front of the goal

penalty box: in ice hockey, an area where players must sit when they are given a penalty

penalty shootout: a way of deciding who will win a football game in which both teams finished with the same number of goals, by each team taking turns to have a set number of kicks at the goal

penalty spot: in football, the place painted with a white spot from which a penalty kick is taken

pencil case: a small bag for holding pens, pencils, etc., often used at school

pencil pusher: a person who has an office job that is not interesting

pencil sharpener: a mechanical, electric, or small handheld device for making a sharp point on pencils

pencil skirt: 直筒長裙，長而窄的裙子

penny whistle: a small cheap musical instrument shaped like a tube with holes along one side and a part for your mouth at one end that you blow into

pension fund: money that employees of a company pay regularly to be invested to provide them with a pension when they are older

pension plan: a financial plan that allows you to receive money after you or your employer have paid money into it for a number of years

pentatonic scale: a scale based on five notes, such as the one that uses only the black keys on a piano

people carrier: a large, high car that can carry more people than a normal car

people sth/somewhere by: If something or somewhere is peopled by/with a particular type of person, it is filled with them.
充滿，充斥著（某種類型的人）

people sth/somewhere with: If something or somewhere is peopled by/with a particular type of person, it is filled with them.
充滿，充斥著（某種類型的人）

people trafficking: the crime of buying and selling people, or making money from work they are forced to do, such as sex work

pep pill: a pill containing a drug that makes you feel more active

pep rally: a gathering of people who want to show their support and enthusiasm, especially for a sports team before a game
（尤指在體育比賽之前）表達支持和熱情的集會

鼓舞士氣的談話，激勵性談話

pepper pot: a small container with several holes in the top that contains pepper

peppercorn rent: a very small amount of money that you pay as rent
象徵性租金，極低的租金

per annum: used in business when referring to an amount that is produced, sold, or spent each year

per calendar month: used in business when referring to an amount that is produced, sold, or spent each month

per capita: If you express an amount per capita, you mean that amount for each person.

peregrine falcon: a large bird with a dark back and wings and a light-coloured breast that catches mice and other small animals

perfect storm: an extremely bad situation in which many bad things happen at the same time
（許多糟糕的事情同時發生而）糟得不可更糟的局面

perform miracles/a miracle: to be extremely effective in improving a situation

work miracles/a miracle: to be extremely effective in improving a situation

performance art: a type of theatre entertainment in which the artist's personality and the way in which they create and develop their ideas form part of the show

period piece: something such as a book or a film that is very old-fashioned, often in a way that is funny to people now
（常令現代人覺得可笑的）過時之作
