peripheral nervous system: the part of the nervous system that includes all the nerves in the body outside the brain and the spinal cord

peripheral vascular disease: a disorder in which the arteries become narrow leading to reduced blood flow affecting especially the legs

perish the thought: said to show that you hope that something that has been suggested will never happen

perk up: to become or cause someone to become happier, more energetic, or more active
（使）（某人）快活起來；（使）（某人）振作起來；（使）（某人）活躍起來

permanent secretary: (in the ) a government official who belongs to the Civil Service (= the official departments responsible for putting government plans into action) rather than an elected government

permissive society: the type of society that has existed in most of Europe, Australia, and North America since the 1960s, in which there is a great amount of freedom of behaviour, especially sexual freedom

peroxide blonde: a woman who has used peroxide to make her hair blonde

perp walk: an occasion when police officers take a person who has been arrested for a crime through a public area so he or she can be seen and photographed by the media
（員警將被拘捕的罪犯帶到公共場所讓媒體觀看和拍攝的）遊街

persecution complex: People with a persecution complex suffer from the feeling that other people are trying to harm them.

Persian cat: a type of cat with long hair, short legs, and a round face

Persian rug: a floor covering made by hand in Iran from silk or wool
波斯地毯（鋪地用物，來自伊朗或其他中東國家，由絲或羊毛經手工製成）

persistent vegetative state: a medical condition in which a person's brain shows no sign of activity and they have to be kept alive by drugs and machines
持續性植物狀態，植物人狀態

persona non grata: specialized politics a person who is not wanted or welcome in a particular country, because they are unacceptable to its government
someone who is not popular or accepted by others

personal ad: an advertisement that you put in a newspaper or magazine, often in order to find a sexual partner
（報紙或雜誌上的）徵婚（或徵友）廣告

personal allowance: an amount of money that you can earn before you start to be taxed
（繳納所得稅前的）個人收入免稅額

personal column: the part of a newspaper or magazine that contains short advertisements and private messages
（報紙或雜誌上的）私人廣告欄，人事廣告欄

personal computer: a computer that is used mainly by people at home rather than by large organizations

personal digital assistant: a small computer that you can carry with you
個人數碼手帳；個人數位助理

personal effects: things you own that you often carry with you, such as keys or clothing
（鎖匙、衣物等）隨身物品，私人物品

personal identification number: 個人身份識別碼；銀行卡密碼（PIN的正式說法）

personal injury: physical or mental harm that is caused to someone, especially when this is the fault of another person or an organization
（尤指因他人或機構導致的）人身傷害

personal organizer: a small book or electronic device in which information is stored, such as names, addresses, phone numbers, and dates of meetings, used to help organize your time
個人記事本；電子記事簿

personal pronoun: in grammar, a word such as "I", "you", and "they", that refers to a person in speech or in writing

personal property: the things you own that you can take with you, such as money, vehicles, or furniture

personal shopper: someone whose job is to find things for someone else to buy

personal stereo: a small electronic device that plays music and has headphones so that you can listen to music while you are doing other things

personal touch: an original or special quality, or something that is done for every single person in a group in order to make them feel special
個人化色彩；（針對團體中每一個人的）人性化舉措

personal trainer: someone whose job is to help you become stronger and healthier by deciding which exercises you should do and showing you how to do them

personality clash: a situation in which two or more people have very different characters and are unable to have a good relationship with each other

personality cult: officially organized admiration and love for a particular person, especially a political leader
（尤指對政治領袖的）個人崇拜

personality disorder: any of a number of mental diseases, in which you have problems in relating to what is around you and to other people, and in keeping a fixed image of yourself

personnel carrier: an armed transport vehicle used by the army

pertain to: to be connected with a particular subject, event, or situation

pes anserinus: the point where the tendons of three leg muscles attach to the tibia (= the large bone at the front of the lower leg)
the point where the main nerve of the face divides into different nerves

pester power: the ability that children have to make their parents buy something, by asking for it many times until they get it
纏功（兒童嚷著要父母親購買東西的能力）

pet name: an informal name given to someone by their family or friends

PET scan: abbreviation for positron emission tomography scan: a medical test that can produce an image of the brain or of another part of a person's body
正電子發射電腦斷層攝片（positron emission tomography scan的縮寫）

Peter Pan: a man who never seems to look any older although he is no longer young
彼得‧潘；天真的成年男人（這種男人雖然不再年輕，但看起來似乎不會變老）

Peter Pan collar: a small collar with rounded ends

petit bourgeois: belonging to the lower middle social class, or having the characteristics that are considered typical of this class, such as thinking money and possessions are more important than other things, and not trusting new or different ideas

petit four: a small cake or biscuit, usually served at the end of a meal with coffee
（常指飯後配咖啡吃的）小蛋糕，小甜餅

petits pois: small peas (= round, green seeds that are eaten as a vegetable)

Petri dish: a small, clear, round dish with a cover, used in scientific tests especially for growing bacteria
（尤指用於培養細菌的）皮氏培養皿

petrol bomb: a bottle filled with petrol or other liquid fuel, with a piece of cloth in its top, that is set on fire and thrown

petrol bunk: a place where fuel is sold for road vehicles

petrol cap: on a car, a small cover that goes over the hole that you put fuel into

petrol station: a place where fuel is sold for road vehicles, often with a small shop

petroleum jelly: a clear substance made from petroleum, used as a base for medicines that are rubbed into the skin, and also for making parts in a machine move easily against each other

petting zoo: an open area where small or young animals are kept that children can hold, touch, and sometimes feed
（允許兒童愛撫和餵食小動物的）愛畜動物園；可愛動物園

petty cash: a small amount of money kept in an office for buying small things that are needed
（辦公室裡的）小額現金，小額備用金

petty crime: a type of crime that is not considered serious when compared with some other crimes

petty officer: a rank in a navy, below the officers but above the ordinary sailors

plunge into: to suddenly experience a bad situation or unhappiness, or to make someone or something suddenly experience a bad situation or unhappiness

plunge in/plunge into: to suddenly start doing something actively or enthusiastically

plus fours: trousers with legs that are wide above the knee and end in a tightly fitted strip just below the knee, sometimes worn by men playing golf
（打高爾夫球時穿的）寬大運動褲，燈籠褲

plus one: a person that you take to a party or other event, usually when the invitation says that you can bring one other person with you
（尤指當請柬說明可以邀請一名同伴參加時，帶領參加晚會或活動的）同伴

PO box: a box with a number in a post office to which your letters and parcels can be sent and from which you can collect them

poacher turned gamekeeper: someone who opposed people in authority in the past but who now has a position of authority themselves
當年造反今天掌權的人

pocket handkerchief: used to describe a garden or field that is very small and usually square

CHILD'S MONEY: mainly UK US allowance an amount of money that parents regularly give to their child to spend as they choose
ADULT'S MONEY: money for spending on your own personal things
informal a small amount of money, especially an amount that is not enough

pocket veto: a way that a government can stop a law from being introduced by deliberately failing to sign it before the government finishes its business for the year
擱置否決（指政府對擬議的法律不予簽字，擱置至年度結束，該法律提案即失效）

POEMS syndrome: a condition of the blood that causes damage to the nerves, resulting in weakness of the arms and legs, as well as abnormal changes in the liver, spleen, and endocrine system. POEMS is an acronym of the main features: polyneuropathy, organomegaly, endocrinopathy, monoclonal gammopathy and skin changes
POEMS症候群（包括多發性神經病變、臟器腫大、內分泌病變、M蛋白和皮膚改變。POEMS是 polyneuropathy、organomegaly、endocrinopathy、monoclonal gammopathy和skin changes的縮寫）

poet laureate: in the UK, a poet given a special position by the king or queen, who is asked to write poems about important public occasions

poetic justice: an occasion when something bad happens to a person who seems to deserve it, usually because of bad things that person has done

poetic licence: the act by a writer or poet of changing facts or rules to make a story or poem more interesting or effective

pogo stick: a child's toy made of a long metal stick with a bar to hold across the top, and a large bar across the bottom for your feet, used to bounce around on
蹦蹦蹺，彈簧單高蹺（一種上端裝有把手、下部裝有彈簧踏板的跳躍遊戲器具）

point out: to tell someone about some information, often because you believe they do not know it or have forgotten it
to make a person notice someone or something, sometimes by holding up one of your fingers towards him, her, or it

point of no return: the stage at which it is no longer possible to stop what you are doing and when its effects cannot now be avoided or prevented
無退路的地步；欲罷不能的地步

point of order: an occasion on which a person in a formal meeting states their belief that a rule of the meeting has been broken

point taken: used to say you accept what someone has said

point the finger at: to accuse someone of being responsible for something bad that has happened

point the way: to show how something can be done better in the future

point to: to make it seem likely that a particular fact is true or that a particular event will happen

表明可能是；顯示…可能會發生

points deduction: a punishment given to a sports team or sportsperson, in which points are taken from them
扣分（作為對運動隊或運動員的懲罰）

poison ivy: a North American plant that causes your skin to itch and turn red if you touch its leaves

poison sb's mind: to make someone believe unpleasant things about another person that are not true

poison-pen letter: a letter in which very unkind or unpleasant things are written about the person it is sent to, in order to offend or upset them

poke around: to search for something by moving things around, usually not in a very careful or organized way

polar bear: a bear with white fur that lives in the Arctic

police car: an official car used by the police

police constable: in the UK, a police officer of the lowest rank

police department: in the US, the police force in an area or city

police force: the police in a country or area

police state: a country in which the government uses the police to severely limit people's freedom
警察國家（政府透過警察部門嚴格限制民眾自由）

police station: the local office of the police in a town or part of a city

political action committee: an organization that gives money and support to politicians in order to influence them
（資助政客已求得影響力的）政治行動委員會

political geography: the study of the way in which the world is divided into countries

political science: the study of how people get or compete for power and how it is used in governing a country

politically correct: Someone who is politically correct believes that language and actions that could be offensive to others, especially those relating to sex and race, should be avoided.
（言行）政治正確的；（尤指）避免性別（或種族）歧視的
A politically correct word or expression is used instead of another one to avoid being offensive.
（詞語或表達方式）政治正確的

polka dot: one of a large number of small, round spots that are printed in a regular pattern on cloth

poll tax: a tax of a fixed amount that must be paid by each adult

pollen count: a measurement of the amount of pollen in the air

polling booth: a small area with walls on three sides in a polling station where you can vote in private

polling day: the day when people vote in an election

polling station: a place where people go to vote in an election

polo neck: a high, round collar that folds over on itself and covers the neck
a piece of clothing with a polo neck

polo shirt: an informal style of cotton shirt, with short sleeves, a collar, and some buttons at the neck

polycystic kidney disease: a genetic disorder in which a lot of cysts (= small growths filled with liquid) form on the kidneys often causing kidney failure

polycystic ovary syndrome: a condition in which there are a lot of cysts (= small growths filled with liquid) on the ovaries, associated with having high levels of male hormones

polyvinyl chloride: a type of plastic that is used especially for making clothes, floor coverings, and bags

pommel horse: a piece of equipment used in gymnastics, that stands on four legs, and has two handles on the top that you hold while moving your body and legs around

ponce about: UK offensive If a man ponces about/around, he behaves or dresses more like a woman than like a man.
informal to waste time doing silly things that do not achieve anything or help anyone

ponce around: UK offensive If a man ponces about/around, he behaves or dresses more like a woman than like a man.
informal to waste time doing silly things that do not achieve anything or help anyone

pond life: plants and animals that live in a small area of water
UK informal also mainly US pond scum people that you do not respect or like at all
蠢人（用以指你完全沒有敬意或毫不喜歡的人）

pony trekking: the activity of riding horses through the countryside

Ponzi scheme: a way of deceiving investors (= people who give money to a company hoping to get more back) by using the money they give to pay interest to existing customers rather than investing it
（欺騙投資者，把新加入的投資者的資金用來支付利息給原來的投資者，而不是用於投資的）龐氏騙局

poodle around: to spend time doing things without any particular purpose or plan
漫無目的地做（某事），毫無計劃地做（某事）

（關於某一個問題的）情況簡編，新聞發佈稿，資訊條

poor relation: something or someone similar to but less important than another thing or person, and that people do not consider equally valuable
（同類中）略遜一籌的事物（或人）；不受青睞的事物（或人）

pop art: a type of modern art that started in the 1960s and uses images and objects from ordinary life
普普藝術，波普藝術，通俗藝術，（一種起源於20世紀60年代、運用日常生活中的形象和物品的現代藝術）

pop culture: music, TV, cinema, books, etc. that are popular and enjoyed by ordinary people, rather than experts or very educated people

pop the question: to ask someone to marry you

pop up: to appear or happen, especially suddenly or unexpectedly
used to describe a machine, book, etc. that has parts that push out from a surface or from inside
（機器，圖書等）有部分可從內部向外推出的
used to describe a shop, restaurant, etc. that operates temporarily and only for a short period when it is likely to get a lot of customers

a new window that opens quickly on a computer screen in front of what you are working on
彈跳視窗，快顯視窗（一個新視窗，在電腦螢幕上快速打開，置於你正在工作的視窗之前）
BASEBALL: also pop fly in baseball, a ball that is hit very high in the air but not very far
SHOP/STORE: a shop, restaurant, etc. that operates only temporarily for a short period when it is likely to get a lot of customers
只在顧客較多時短時間內營業的商店（或餐館等）

仔細閱讀，研讀（通常指書或文件）

FOOD: mainly UK a small, round pastry case filled with cooked pork, eaten cold
LIE: UK humorous slang another word for

pork scratchings: small, hard pieces of fried pork skin eaten cold and usually sold in bags

port of call: a place where you stop for a short time, especially on a journey

可擕式音樂播放機（尤指以MP3格式存儲音樂的播放機）

post office: a place where stamps are sold and from where letters and parcels are sent

（英國）地域性公共服務差異（人們能獲得的醫療類型、所享受的政府服務類型等均與其居住地區有關）

代表人物形象；典型事物

mainly US also potluck an informal meal where guests bring a different dish that is then shared with the other guests

pot pie: a pastry filled with vegetables and usually meat

pot roast: a piece of beef that is cooked slowly in a covered dish with a small amount of liquid and sometimes vegetables

potassium iodide: a white chemical compound, similar to salt, that forms in crystals and has medical and photographic uses

老式圓形的燒木材（或煤）的爐子

勢能（物理學上，某物因位置（如被升高）、狀態（如被拉伸或擠壓）所儲藏的能量，或其化學上儲藏的能量（如燃料或電池））

potter's wheel: a machine with a horizontal spinning disc on which clay is shaped into decorative or useful objects
拉坯輪車（製陶用的轉輪）

花園(或菜園)裡的小屋；盆栽棚

potty chair: a small chair with a hole in the seat and a bowl attached under it for teaching young children to use the toilet

pounce on: to accept something quickly and with enthusiasm

pound away at: to criticize something or try to get someone to do something
指責，批評；勸說；對…施加壓力

pound cake: a type of cake made with flour, butter, sugar, and eggs

合法但不合情理的要求

pound sterling: the official name of the pound used as money in the UK

pour scorn on: to say a person or thing is stupid and not worth anything

throw cold water on: to be negative about someone's ideas or plans
to criticize someone's opinions or ideas and stop people believing them or being excited about them

火藥桶；一觸即發的局勢；危險的地方

powder puff: a round piece of soft material used for putting powder on the face or body

powder room: a polite word for a women's toilet in a public building, such as a restaurant, hotel, theatre, etc.

power up: If something that needs power or energy powers up, or if someone powers it up, it is turned on or prepared so that it is ready for use or action.
（使）啟動；（使）積蓄能量；（使）養精蓄銳

power base: an area of a country or a group of people on which someone's power depends

power breakfast: an occasion at which people eat while they are working and talking about business
早／午餐會報；權力早／午餐會

power lunch: an occasion at which people eat while they are working and talking about business
早／午餐會報；權力早／午餐會

power broker: someone who has a big influence on decisions about who should have political power

power cut: an interruption in the supply of electricity

power dressing: a style of dressing in which business people wear formal clothes to make them seem powerful
（商界人士從衣著顏色、式樣上顯示權勢的）顯貴穿著，權力裝飾

power nap: a short sleep that you have during the day
恢復精力的小睡（白天裡的小睡）

power of attorney: the legal right to act for someone else in their financial or business matters, or the document that gives you this right

power outage: an interruption in the supply of electricity

power point: a device to which a piece of electrical equipment can be connected in order to provide it with electricity

power politics: the threat or use of military force to end an international disagreement

power station: a factory where electricity is produced

power steering: a system for changing the direction in which a road vehicle is moving by using power from the engine to help the driver turn the vehicle
（車輛上的）轉向助力裝置，動力轉向系統

power structure: a way in which power is organized or shared in an organization or society

power through: to continue in a strong and determined way until the end of something, even when this is difficult
保持頑強堅定直到最後

power tool: a tool that operates with an electric motor

power vacuum: a condition that exists when someone has lost control of something and no one has replaced them

practical joke: a joke that makes someone seem silly and involves a physical action rather than words

practical nurse: in the US, a nurse who has less medical training than a registered nurse

practice makes perfect: said to encourage someone to continue to do something many times, so that they will learn to do it very well

practise what you preach: to do the things that you advise other people to do
言傳身教，以身作則；言行一致

prairie dog: a small wild mammal that lives on the prairies of Canada and the US

prat about: to behave stupidly, especially when you should be behaving in a responsible way

prat around: to behave stupidly, especially when you should be behaving in a responsible way

prawn cocktail: a salad made with prawns, lettuce, and tomatoes in a cold sauce, usually eaten as a starter (= small dish served before a main course) and often served in a glass
（通常當作頭盤在玻璃杯裡食用的由蝦、生菜葉、番茄和冷色拉醬製成的沙拉）鮮蝦雞尾酒

prayer mat: a small piece of thick cloth on which a Muslim goes down on his knees and bends his body down to the ground when praying

向已皈依者宣教佈道；勸別人相信他們已經相信的東西

掠奪性定價，超低價競爭，惡意價格競爭

predictive texting: a feature of a mobile phone in which words are suggested automatically while you are writing a text message
（寫手機簡訊時的）聯想文本，預言性文本

預備學校（在英國通常指為進入公學作準備的私立學校，所收學生為7至13歲的兒童，尤指男孩；在美國指為11歲以上的孩子上大學作準備的私立中學）

prep time: a period when teachers are at school but do not teach, and are therefore able to prepare for later classes

preparatory school: 預備學校（prep school的正式說法）

prepare the ground: If you prepare the ground for an activity or a situation, you do something that will help it to happen.

prescription drug: a drug that can only be bought if a doctor orders it for you

presence of mind: the ability to make good decisions and to act quickly and calmly in a difficult situation or an emergency

present company excepted: used to show that a criticism or a rude remark does not refer to the people you are talking to

present participle: a form of a verb that in English ends in -ing and comes after another verb to show continuous action. It is used to form the present continuous.

preservation order: an official decision that a building or area has special value and must be kept in good condition

preside over: to be in charge of a situation or place
掌管；主持（尤指正式會議或審判）

Presidents' Day: （美國第一任總統華盛頓的生日）總統日

press baron: a person who owns several newspapers and sometimes controls what they publish

充分利用本身的優勢以取得勝利

press on: to give something to someone and not allow them to refuse to accept it
迫使（某人）接受，把…硬塞給（某人），把…強加於（某人）

press ahead: to start or continue doing something in a determined way, often despite problems

press release: a public statement given to the press to publish if they wish

press stud: a small piece of metal or plastic used to fasten clothes with two usually round parts, one of which is pushed into the other

PAN: a cooking pan with a tightly fitting lid that allows food to cook quickly in steam under pressure
SITUATION: a situation in which people are under a lot of pressure
人們面臨許多壓力的情形

BODY: a place on the body where an artery (= tube carrying blood from the heart) is close to the surface of the skin, where it can be pressed to partly stop the flow of blood
SITUATION: a place or situation that is likely to cause problems
可能引發麻煩（或問題）的地方（或局面）

pressure washer: a machine that sends out a strong stream of water, used for cleaning things

prevail upon: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do

prevention is better than cure: It is better to stop something bad from happening than it is to deal with it after it has happened.
懲創於已然，不如防患於未然；預防優於補救

prey on: If an animal preys on another animal, it catches and eats it.

prick up: When an animal pricks its ears up, or when its ears prick up, it puts its ears up straight because it is listening carefully to a small sound or one that is far away.
If you prick up your ears, or if your ears prick up, you suddenly begin to listen very carefully because you have heard something interesting.

prickly pear: a type of cactus (= desert plant) that has oval fruit with sharp spines on them

pride comes/goes before a fall: said to emphasize that if you are too confident about your abilities, something bad will happen that shows that you are not as good as you think

pride yourself on: to value a skill or good quality that you have

prima ballerina: the most important female dancer in a ballet company

prima donna: the most important female singer in an opera company

prima facie: at first sight (= based on what seems to be the truth when first seen or heard)

prince consort: the title sometimes given to the husband of a ruling queen

private enterprise: industry and businesses owned by ordinary people, not by the government

公共傳播（不以盈利為目地，向公眾提供資訊、教育和娛樂的電視和電臺節目）

（美國授予作戰中負傷者的）紫心勳章

put your money on: to risk money on someone or something winning a race or competition

put money on: to risk money on someone or something winning a race or competition

put up: to suggest an idea, or to make a person available, to be considered

put upon: having to do more than is fair in order to allow other people to get what they want in a situation

put someone straight: to make certain that someone knows the real facts about a situation

set someone straight: to make certain that someone knows the real facts about a situation

（言行）造成軒然大波，招惹是非

stick that in your pipe and smoke it!: a rude way of telling someone that they must accept what you have just said, even if they do not like it

to make things the same as they were at an earlier time

to get something good as a result of your own actions

reap what you have sown: to win or lose as a result of something you did in the past

rocking chair: a chair built on two pieces of curved wood so that it moves forwards and backwards when you are sitting in it

rocking horse: a wooden toy horse that children can move backwards and forwards while they are sitting on it

rocky road: If you are on a rocky road, you are experiencing a difficult period and have a lot of problems.
障礙重重的道路；重重困難

roe deer: a small European and Asian deer
麅（產於歐亞的一種小鹿）

rogan josh: a South Asian dish consisting of meat, especially lamb, cooked in a sauce made of tomatoes
（南亞菜肴）在番茄汁中煮的肉塊（尤其是羊肉）

rogue state: a nation that is considered very dangerous to other nations

to pretend to be someone else, especially as part of learning a new skill

role reversal: a situation in which two people exchange their usual duties or positions

roll out: to make a new product, service, or system available for the first time
推出（新産品、服務等）；實行（新制度）；開展

roll over: If you roll over something on a computer screen, you move the mouse over an active place so that you can see information that is hidden under it.

roll around: (of a time or event) to happen

roll back: to reduce the cost or price of something

roll call: If someone does a roll call, they read aloud the names of all the people on the list to make certain that they are present.

roll in: to arrive in great numbers or amounts
紛至遝來；大量湧入；滾滾而來

roll of honour: a list of people who should be remembered for their brave actions

roll up your sleeves: 摩拳擦掌，躍躍欲試，捋起袖子（準備行動）

roll up!: said, especially in the past, by someone who wanted people to come and pay to look at something unusual or interesting

to arrive at a particular place or event, usually late

a cigarette that you make by wrapping a piece of paper around some tobacco

roll with the punches: to be able to deal with a series of difficult situations

roll-on roll-off: A roll-on-roll-off ship is built so that vehicles can drive on at one end and off at the other.

rolled into one: If someone or something has several qualities rolled into one, the person or thing has all of those qualities.

rolled oats: oats that have had their outer covering removed and have been crushed

roller blind: a piece of material fixed onto a wooden or metal roller that can be pulled down to cover a window

roller coaster: an exciting entertainment in an amusement park, like a fast train that goes up and down very steep slopes and around very sudden bends
a situation which changes from one extreme to another, or in which a person's feelings change from one extreme to another

速度溜旱冰運動（在圓形滑道上兩隊交叉進行的溜旱冰速度比賽）

rom com: abbreviation for romantic comedy: a film or television programme about love that is intended to make you laugh

Roman alphabet: the alphabet used for writing most western European languages, including English

Roman candle: a type of firework that produces brightly coloured stars when it explodes

root crop: a plant such as potatoes that is grown because its roots are eaten

root for: to show support for someone who is doing something difficult
給（某人）以支援，為（某人）助威，聲援（某人）
mainly US UK usually support to support a sports team or a sports player and want them to win
支持（某個運動隊伍或運動員）

rope sth/somewhere off: to surround an area or place with ropes in order to keep people out

rose window: a round window, especially in a church, with coloured glass in it

歲首節（猶太教曆新年，在九月份）

round-trip ticket: a ticket for travel to a place and back again

round the clock: 晝夜地，日以繼夜，日夜不停地

around the clock: 晝夜地，日以繼夜，日夜不停地

abbreviation for Right Honourable: a title given to important British officials such as Privy Councillors and members of the government

rubber dinghy: a small rubber boat that has air in it to keep its shape

（不經考慮）例行公事地通過，照例批准

rue the day: to feel very sorry about an event

run down: informal to criticize someone or something, often unfairly
（常指不公正地）批評，詆毀，說…的壞話
to hit and injure a person or animal with a vehicle, especially intentionally
to find someone or something after following or searching for him, her, or it for a long time

UK to reduce a business or organization in size or importance, or to become reduced in this way

run into: to drive a vehicle into an object or a person in another vehicle by accident

run a mile: to be extremely unwilling to be involved

run across: to experience a problem when you are not expecting to

run ashore: If a ship or boat runs aground/ashore, it hits the coast, sometimes becoming stuck there.

run along!: said to children to tell them to go away

run and run: to be performed successfully for a long period of time

run around: to be very busy doing a lot of different things

to avoid dealing with a problem or difficult situation

run its course: 自然發展；持續到自然結束

run off: If you run off copies of something, you print them.
to quickly and easily write something that is usually slow or difficult to write, such as a piece of poetry or music
下筆如神（快速地、容易地寫出某些內容，這些內容通常寫起來較慢且難，如詩或音樂）

run through sb's head: 突然想到；（想法）突然閃過，閃進腦中

run through sb's mind: 突然想到；（想法）突然閃過，閃進腦中

run to: to reach a particular amount, level, or size
to have enough money to buy something or (of an income, etc.) to be enough to buy something
有錢做…，買得起；（收入）足夠供…之用
If your taste or skill runs to something, that is the type of thing that you enjoy or can manage to do.

go deep: If a feeling or problem runs deep, it is strong or serious and has existed for a long time.

run like clockwork: to happen exactly as planned, without any trouble

go like clockwork: to happen exactly as planned, without any trouble

runner bean: a bean with long, flat, green pods that can be eaten, or the plant from which these beans grow

the money you need to spend in order to keep and use a vehicle

（上下班）交通高峰時間，交通擁擠時間

rush into: to forcefully persuade someone to do something without giving them time to decide if they really wantto do it
使（某人）倉促做…；使（某人）草率做…

rush job: a piece of work that is not as good as it could be, because you do it quickly
倉促完成的工作；草草而就的工作

俄羅斯輪盤賭（一種危險的遊戲，參加者在能裝6發子彈的左輪手槍中只裝一發子彈，然後將槍口對準自己的頭扳動扳機）
the action of taking very serious risks with something important
（在某件重要事情上）冒著巨大的風險

rye bread: dark brown bread made with rye

LETTER: the 19th letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第19個字母）
SMALL: written abbreviation for small, used to show the size of a piece of clothing
小號的（用來標明服裝尺寸，small 的縮寫）

sabre-toothed tiger: a large wild cat that lived in the past, with two long, curved front teeth
劍齒虎（古代的一種大型野生貓科動物，有兩隻長而彎曲的前齒）

sack race: a race in which people jump along with both legs in a cloth sack that they hold up with their hands
麻袋競走（雙腿套在布袋裡，用手抓著袋子進行跳躍式賽跑）

safari jacket: a jacket made of light cloth with short sleeves, pockets on the chest and a belt
狩獵夾克（短袖，有胸袋和腰帶）

安全通行權；安全通行證

rearranging the deckchairs on the Titani: used for saying that someone is wasting time dealing with things that are not important, and is ignoring a much more serious problem
捨本逐末；浪費時間處理瑣碎事情而忽略了關鍵問題

a very strong reaction that spreads through a group of people when something surprising or bad happens

PLATE: mainly UK a plate on which a side dish is served

徹底被人遺忘，銷聲匿跡

sit in: to go as a group into a public building and refuse to leave or to allow normal activities to continue there until a situation that you are complaining about is changed
to be present in a meeting or class, watching it but not taking part in it
an occasion when a group of people go into a public building and refuse to leave or allow normal activities to continue there until a situation that they are complaining about is changed

sit in for: to take the place of someone who would normally do a particular job or go to a particular meeting
代替（某人）履行職責；代（某人）出席會議

sit in judgment on: to make a judgment on someone especially when you have no right to do so
對（某人）妄加評判，對（某人）指指點點

sit in judgment over: to make a judgment on someone especially when you have no right to do so
對（某人）妄加評判，對（某人）指指點點

sit on: to delay taking action about something
mainly disapproving to prevent people from knowing a piece of information

sit on sb's stomach: Food that sits on your stomach makes you feel uncomfortably full.

sit on your arse: to do nothing, especially when you should be doing something
（尤指應該做事卻）無所事事，甚麽也不做

sit on your hands: to do nothing about a problem or a situation that needs dealing with

sit right/well: to be something that you agree or are pleased with

sit through: to stay until the end of an event such as a meeting or performance that is very long or boring

sit tight: mainly UK to refuse to change your mind
固執己見，堅持自己的主張

sitting duck: someone or something that is very easy for an enemy to shoot or attack
活靶；易被擊中的目標；易受攻擊的物件

sitting member: the person who is the Member of Parliament for an area at the present time

sitting room: 起居室，客廳（同 living room）

sitting target: a person or thing that is without protection and easily attacked
不動的目標，易被擊中的目標

sitting tenant: a person with a legal right to stay in a property that they are renting
（有合法權利的）現有房客，現租戶

situation comedy: a funny television or radio show in which the same characters appear in each programme in a different story

Situations Vacant: the part of a newspaper in which jobs are listed
（報紙上的）求職廣告欄； 徵人啟事

six of one and half a dozen of the other: said when you think that neither of two choices is better than the other

six of the best: a beating, usually of six hits with a stick
一頓痛打（通常是用棍棒打六下）

six-a-side football: football played by two teams of six players, not the usual eleven players. The playing area is surrounded by a wall, not lines, and the game does not stop for throw-ins, corners, or goal kicks.

six-yard box: in football, the area surrounded by white lines inside the penalty area, within which a goal kick must be taken

sixteenth note: a musical note that has a time value of half a quaver or a 16th of a semibreve

sixth form: in Britain, the part of a school for students aged 16-18
（英國學生年齡在16歲至18歲之間的）中學六年級

sixth sense: an ability that some people believe they have that seems to give them information without using the five senses of sight, hearing, touch, smell, or taste

skate over: to avoid dealing completely with something or to fail to pay enough attention to it
對…一帶而過；對…輕描淡寫

skate around: to avoid dealing completely with something or to fail to pay enough attention to it
對…一帶而過；對…輕描淡寫

skating rink: a specially prepared area for skating

skean dhu: a small knife worn in the sock as part of traditional Scottish dress
（傳統蘇格蘭裝束的一部分，藏在襪子裡的）小匕首

skeletal muscle: any of the muscles that are attached to the bones and work to create movement of the bones and joints

skeleton key: a key that will open several doors

skeleton service: the operation of something such as a transport system in an extremely limited way at certain times
（大眾運輸系統等在特定時間提供的）最基本的有限服務

skeleton staff: the smallest number of people needed for a business or organization to operate
（企業或機構運作需要的）最基本人數的工作人員

sketch map: a map with only a few details, usually drawn by hand
草圖（只有極少細節的一幅圖，通常是手畫的）

ski jump: a competition in which people on skis move very fast down a specially made steep slope which turns up at the end, and jump off from the bottom of it, landing on a lower level

ski lift: a machine, consisting of seats hanging down from a continuously moving wire, that carries people on skis to the top of slopes that they can then ski down
（運送滑雪者上坡的）滑雪電纜車

ski pants: tight trousers, usually for women, that are made from a material that stretches easily and are held firmly in place by a strap worn under each foot

ski pole: one of two short pointed poles that you hold, one in each hand, to help you balance when you are skiing

skid marks: black marks made by the tyres of a car when it starts or stops moving very quickly
（汽車開動或緊急煞車時輪胎在地面留下的）煞痕

skimmed milk: milk from which the cream has been removed

skin diving: the activity of swimming underwater with only simple breathing equipment and without a special suit
只帶面罩不穿潛水衣的潛水，切膚潛水

skin flick: a film that shows sexual acts in a way that is intended to cause sexual excitement but that would be considered unpleasant and offensive by many people

skin graft: a piece of skin taken from one part of the body and used to replace damaged skin in another part

skip out on: US to avoid doing something that you should do; to leave someone when they need your help
逃避應該做的事；當別人需要幫助時躲避

skipping rope: a rope that is used for skipping

skirting board: a piece of wood that is joined to the bottom of a wall where it meets the floor

skull and crossbones: a picture of a skull with two long bones crossing each other under it that warns of death or danger, used in the past on pirate flags and now on containers or places containing dangerous substances or machinery
骷髏圖（舊時畫在海盜旗上，現印在危險物品容器上或存放危險機器設備處，象徵死亡或危險）

sky marshal: an official person dressed in ordinary clothes, who carries a gun on an aircraft and whose job is to protect other passengers

slag heap: a hill made from the waste material from a mine

slam dunk: a shot in basketball in which a player jumps up and pushes the ball down through the net

slanging match: an argument in which both people use angry uncontrolled language and insult each other

slap and tickle: sexual activity, especially when it involves playing or joking

slasher movie: a film in which people, especially young women, are killed very violently with knives
（尤指年輕女性遭殘殺的）血腥恐怖片

slave driver: a person who makes other people work very hard
監工；逼迫他人拼命工作的人

slave labour: informal disapproving very hard work for which people are paid very little
繁重而報酬極低的工作；苦役

slave trade: the buying and selling of slaves, especially of African people who were taken to North and South America from the 16th to the 19th century
（尤指16至19世紀將非洲黑人販運至北美的）奴隸販賣；販奴

sleaze factor: a part of a situation, especially a political one, that shows low moral standards

sleek back: to make something such as hair smooth, shiny, and flat

sleek down: to make something such as hair smooth, shiny, and flat

sleep apnoea: a medical condition in which someone stops breathing for a short time when sleeping

sleep around: to have sex with a lot of different people without having a close or long relationship with any of them

sleep disorder: any of several medical conditions that prevent people sleeping in a normal way

sleep in: to sleep until later in the morning than you usually do

sleep over: to sleep in someone else's home for a night

sleep through: If you sleep through a lot of noise or an activity, it does not wake you or keep you awake.
不被（噪音等）吵醒；在…過程中睡著

sleep together: If two people sleep together, they have sex.

sleep with: 和（某人）發生性關係，和（某人）上床

sleepaway camp: a place where children can go to stay without their parents and do activities

sleeping bag: a large, thick bag for sleeping in, especially when you are sleeping outside, for example in a tent

sleeping car: a railway carriage with beds for passengers to sleep in

sleeping partner: a partner in a company who does not take an active part in its management, especially one who provides some of the money

sleeping pill: a pill that you take to help you to sleep better

sleeping sickness: an African disease that causes fever, severe loss of energy, weight loss, and sometimes death
昏睡病（非洲的一種疾病）

sleeve note: information about a performer or a performance that is supplied with a sound recording

sleight of hand: speed and skill of the hand when performing tricks
（魔術中的）巧妙手法，敏捷手法
skilful hiding of the truth in order to win an advantage

slice of the cake: If you want a slice of the cake, you want a share of any money that is being made from an activity.

slide projector: a machine that shines a light through a photograph made into a slide to produce a larger image on a screen

slide rule: a long, narrow device for calculating numbers with a middle part that slides backwards and forwards

slide show: an occasion when you use a machine to show photographs on a wall
an occasion when a computer shows several different photographs one after another on a screen
圖片播放（電腦在螢幕上逐個顯示不同的照片）

slide tackle: in football, a type of tackle in which a player slides along the ground with one leg stretched out in order to push the ball away from the opposing player

sliding scale: a system in which the rate at which something is paid changes as a result of other conditions
滑動折算制，浮動計演算法

slim down: to reduce the size of something

slim pickings: little or no success in getting something because there is not very much of it remaining

slip away: If a period of time slips away, it passes quickly.
If someone's power or the possibility of someone winning or achieving something slips away, it disappears.

slip into: to quickly put on a piece of clothing

slip of the tongue: something that you say by accident when you intended to say something else

slip out: If a remark slips out, you say it without intending to.

slip out of: to quickly take off a piece of clothing

slip road: a short road on which vehicles join or leave a main road
（用於進入或離開主路的）匝道，引道

slip through sb's fingers: If you allow an opportunity or a person to slip through your fingers, you lose it, him, or her through not taking care or making an effort.

slip through the net: to escape a punishment or be missed by a system that should deal with or protect you

slip up: a mistake or something that goes wrong

slipped disc: a medical condition in which one of the discs (= flat pieces of tissue between the bones) in the back slides out of its usual place, causing pain

slippery slope: a bad situation or habit that, after it has started, is likely to get very much worse
滑坡效應（指壞情況或惡習一旦開始就很可能變得愈加嚴重）

Sloane Ranger: a young person from a high social class, usually from London, who wears expensive, traditional clothes and speaks with an upper-class voice
（指通常住在倫敦或倫敦附近，身著昂貴傳統服裝的）上流社會年輕人，紈絝子弟

slob around: to behave in a very lazy way, doing very little

slobber over: to show how much you admire and like someone, in a way that shows little control
對（某人）垂涎三尺；向（某人）過分示愛

sloe gin: an alcoholic drink made from gin with sloes in it

slop around: to relax and do very little

slop out: When prisoners slop out, they empty the containers they use as toilets during the night in the rooms where they sleep.

slope off: to leave somewhere quietly so that you are not noticed, usually to avoid work

slot machine: a machine that you try to win money from by putting coins into it and operating it, often by pressing a button or pulling a handle
投幣式自動賭博機，吃角子老虎機

slow down: to become slower, or to make someone or something become slower

slow up: to become slower, or to make someone or something become slower

ACTIVITY: UK a period of not much activity
ANGER: US a slow, controlled show of anger

slow city: a town or city that tries to encourage a good environment, for example by providing a lot of parks and using food that is grown in the local area
慢城市（一個鎮或城市，盡力提倡良好環境，例如食用當地種植的食物並有許多公園）

slow food: good food that is prepared and cooked carefully

slow handclap: an occasion when a crowd watching a performance, sports event, etc. clap very slowly to show that they are annoyed
（表達厭煩的）慢而有節奏的掌聲

slow motion: a way of showing pictures from a film or television programme at a slower speed than normal

SLR camera: abbreviation for single-lens reflex camera: a type of camera in which the same lens (= a special piece of glass) is used for looking at and recording an image
單眼相機（SLR為single-lens reflex的縮寫）

slug it out: If two people slug it out, they fight or argue violently until one of them wins.

slug pellet: a small, hard piece of a substance that is poisonous to slugs (= small garden creatures harmful to plants)

slumber party: a party when a group of children spend the night at one child's house
睡衣晚會（一群孩子都在其中一個孩子家裡過夜的聚會）

slush fund: an amount of money that is kept for dishonest or illegal activities in politics or business
（用於政治或商業目的的）非法基金，行賄基金

slush pile: a pile of manuscripts (= early versions) of books that have been sent by writers to a publisher and that will probably n+ot be published
（作者寄給出版社但很可能不會出版的）廢稿堆

smack of: If something smacks of an unpleasant quality, it seems to have that quality.

smack your lips: to close and open your mouth loudly to express a strong wish to eat something you like a lot

small ad: （報刊上的）分類廣告（同 classified ad）

small arms: small light guns that are held and fired in one or both hands

small beer: something that does not seem important when compared to something else

small change: money that is in the form of coins of low value
something that is not considered to be expensive or important
廉價的東西；不重要的東西

small claims court: a law court that deals with claims for small amounts of money, especially from people who believe that they have had money taken from them unfairly by a business
（尤指受理商業詐欺索賠的）小額索償法院

small fry: people or things that are not considered to be important

small hours: the early hours of the morning, between twelve o'clock at night and the time when the sun rises

small intestine: the upper part of the bowels between the stomach and the large intestine

small potatoes: something that does not seem important when compared to something else

small print: text in a formal agreement that is printed smaller than the rest of the text, sometimes in the hope that it will not be noticed
（正式合約中用較小的字體印刷、可能對簽署者不利且易被忽略的）附屬細則

small talk: conversation about things that are not important, often between people who do not know each other well

smallest room: old-fashioned for the toilet (= room with a toilet)
廁所，衛生間（toilet的老式說法）

smart alec: someone who tries to appear clever or who answers questions in a clever way that annoys other people
自作聰明的人，自以爲是的人

smart bomb: a bomb that is directed to the object it is intended to hit by a television signal or a laser
智能炸彈，雷射光導向的炸彈，自動導引炸彈

smart card: a small plastic card that is used to make payments and to store personal information, and can be read when connected to a computer system

smart drug: a drug that is designed to make you more intelligent or help you think more clearly

smart fibre: a type of material that can react, for example to temperature or light
（可對例如溫度或光線等作出反應的）智能纖維

smart mouth: If someone has or is a smart mouth, they speak to other people in a way that shows little respect.
愛貧嘴的人，愛耍嘴皮子的人

smart set: people who are fashionable, rich, and often artistic or well educated
時髦人士，新潮派（常指從事藝術或受教育程度高的人）

smart TV: a television on which you can also use the internet

smarten up: to (cause to) become more clean, tidy, and stylish
（使）變得整潔入時，（使）變得時髦

smash-and-grab raid: a crime in which thieves break the window of a shop and steal things before quickly escaping

smell a rat: to recognize that something is not as it appears to be or that something dishonest is happening
發覺有可疑之處，感到其中有詐

smell blood: to recognize an opportunity to take advantage of someone who is in a difficult situation
發現有機可乘；意識到可以乘人之危

smell fishy: If a situation or an explanation smells fishy, it causes you to think that someone is being dishonest.

smell somewhere out: to fill a place with a smell, in an unpleasant way

smelling salts: a chemical with a strong smell that is put under the nose of people who have become unconscious in order to make them awake again

smile on: to feel positive about something or someone, or to treat it, him, or her in a very positive way

smoke and mirrors: Something that is described as smoke and mirrors is intended to make you believe that something is being done or is true, when it is not

smoke bomb: a device like a bomb that produces a lot of smoke instead of exploding

smoke detector: a device that makes a loud noise when there is smoke present to tell people that there is a fire
煙霧報警器；煙霧探測器

smoke signal: mainly UK a signal that uses smoke from a fire to represent words, used to send messages over long distances
a statement that is a sign of what someone's intentions are

smoke-filled room: a place where powerful people, such as politicians, meet to have discussions and make agreements in secret
（政治人物進行密談決策的）密談室

smokestack industry: a traditional industry that produces large machines or materials used in other industries and creates pollution in doing so
煙囪工業，（傳統的污染嚴重的）重工業

smoking gun: information that proves who committed a crime

smoking jacket: a comfortable coat for a man that is made from a soft material and is worn when relaxing at home, traditionally when smoking
吸煙外套（舒適柔軟的寬鬆服，傳統上供男子在家休閒、特別是吸菸時穿）

snack bar: a small, informal restaurant where small meals can be eaten or bought to take away

snail mail: letters or messages that are not sent by email, but in the post

snake charmer: someone who seems to control the movements of snakes by playing music, in order to entertain people

snake its way: Something that snakes its way moves or is arranged in a twisting way

snakes and ladders: a children's game played on a board that has pictures of snakes and ladders
梯盤棋（兒童遊戲，棋盤上有蛇和梯的圖案）

snap at sb's heels: If an animal is snapping at your heels, it is running behind you and trying to bite you.
to compete strongly with someone and have a chance of soon defeating or replacing them
與（某人）一決高下，對（某人）緊追不捨

snap bean: a long, thin, green pod, eaten as a vegetable

snap fastener: a small piece of metal or plastic used to fasten clothes, with two usually round parts, one of which is pushed into the other

snap out of: to force yourself to stop feeling sad and upset

snap sb's head off: to answer someone in an unreasonably angry way
呵斥（某人），怒氣衝衝地搶答（某人）

snap to it: used to tell someone to do something more quickly

snap your fingers: to make a noise by pushing your second finger hard against your thumb and then releasing it suddenly so that it hits the base of your thumb

snare drum: a small drum with twisted wires stretched across the bottom that shake against it when it is hit

snarled up: Snarled-up traffic is a long line of traffic that is unable to travel forward because something is blocking the road.

snatch at: to try to take hold of something
UK to try to use an opportunity quickly before it disappears

snatch victory: to win at the last moment possible, when it had previously seemed certain that you were going to lose
出人意料地反敗爲勝，在最後時刻取得勝利

sneak peek: an opportunity to see something before it is officially available
優先預覽（某物正式提供之前的觀看機會）

sneak preview: an opportunity to see (a part of) something new before the rest of the public see it

sniff at: to show disapproval or a low opinion of something
also sniff around (sth) to show that you are interested in something
對…表現出興趣，對…感興趣

sniffer dog: a dog that is trained and used by the police or army to find hidden drugs or bombs, or to find someone the police are looking for, using its sense of smell
嗅探犬（經過訓練專門用於嗅探毒品和炸彈的狗）

snooze button: a button on an alarm clock (= a clock for waking you up) that you press after it has woken you up, so that you can sleep for a few minutes more before being woken up again by the clock

snow angel: a shape made in snow by lying on your back and moving your arms and legs out and in, that looks like an angel
雪天使（躺在雪地裡搖動雙臂雙腿，在雪地上做成的像是天使的形狀）

snow blindness: a temporary loss of sight that is caused by the brightness of light reflected by large areas of snow or ice

snow job: an attempt to persuade someone to do something, or to persuade someone that something is good or true, when it is not

snow line: the level on a mountain above which snow is found for most or all of the year
雪線（高山上終年積雪的最低界線）

snow pea: the sweet, flat pods of a type of pea, picked and eaten whole

snow tyre: a tyre with a pattern of raised lines that are thicker than usual in order to stop a vehicle from sliding on ice or snow

snub nose: a nose that is short and turns upwards at the end

snuff movie: a violent film that shows a real murder
（展示真實兇殺場面的）暴力影片

so be it: used to say that it is necessary to accept the situation as it exists
（用於表示有必要接受目前的處境）就接受吧

so help me: used to make a promise in a very formal and serious way

so much for: used to express disappointment at the fact that a situation is not as you thought it was
（表示失望或惱火）…到此為止，…只好作罷

so much: an amount that you do not know or state exactly

so much the better: used to say that a particular action or situation would be even more successful

so there: used for emphasis, or to show that something is being done against someone else's wishes
（表示強調或與某人的願望相反）事情就是這樣，沒甚麽可說的

so to speak: used to explain that what you are saying is not to be understood exactly as stated

so what?: used to mean "it's not important" and "I don't care"

soap flakes: small, flat pieces of soap used for washing clothes, especially by hand
（尤指手洗衣物時用的）肥皂塊

soap opera: a series of television or radio programmes about the lives and problems of a particular group of characters. The series continues over a long period and is broadcast (several times) every week.
肥皂劇（展示一群角色的生活與遭遇的系列電視或廣播節目，持續很長時間，通常每週（多次）播出）

sob story: a story or piece of information that someone tells you or writes about himself or herself that is intended to make you feel sympathy for that person

sob stuff: spoken or written stories that are intended to cause very sad feelings

sober up: to become less drunk, or to make someone become less drunk

soccer mom: a mother who spends a lot of time taking her children to activities such as music classes, sports, etc. It is often used to refer to a type of middle-class mother.
（花大量時間帶孩子去參加活動，如音樂課、體育運動等的）足球媽媽

social climber: someone who tries to improve their social position by being very friendly to people from a higher social class
趨炎附勢的人，試圖擠入上流社會的人

social conscience: If you have a social conscience, you worry about people who are poor, ill, old, etc. and try to help them.

social contract: an agreement among the members of a society or between a society and its rulers about the rights and duties of each

social democracy: the belief that society should change from capitalism to socialism in a gradual, peaceful way; a system of government based on this belief
社會民主主義；社會民主主義制度
a country that has this system of government
實行社會民主主義制度的國家

Social Democrat: a member of the Social Democratic Party in the UK or some other countries
（英國及其他國家的）社會民主黨成員

Social Democratic Party: a political party that existed in the UK from 1981 to 1990, or one of the political parties in some other countries
（英國及其他國家的）社會民主黨

social engineering: the artificial controlling or changing of the groups within society
（使用人工手段控制和改造社會群體的）社會工程

social exclusion: a situation in which some people who are poor or who do not have a job do not feel part of the rest of society
（因為貧困或失業而感覺遭受的）社會排斥

social insurance: (in the US) money that employers and employees pay to the government so that people receive money when they are not able to work because of age, illness, etc.

Social Insurance Number: in Canada, a number given to each citizen and used by the federal government to provide citizens with government services or to collect taxes

social media: websites and computer programs that allow people to communicate and share information on the internet using a computer or mobile phone
社交媒體（網站或電腦程式）

social mobility: the ability to move from one level of society to another

social network: a website or computer program that allows people to communicate and share information on the internet using a computer or mobile phone
社交網路（網站或電腦程式）
the different groups of people that you know

social networking: the use of websites and other internet services to communicate with other people and make friends
使用網站（或其他網際網絡）與人社交

social science: the study of society and the way people live; the subjects connected with this, for example history, economics, etc.

social security: UK a system of payments made by the government to people who are ill, poor, or who have no job
a system of payments made by the government to old people, people whose husbands or wives have died, and people who are unable to work because they are ill

social service: a service provided by local or national government or another organization to help people who are old or ill or need support in their lives
[ plural ] the department in local government that provides such services

social studies: in the US, a course for younger students that includes many of the social sciences

social welfare: services provided by the government or private organizations to help poor, ill, or old people

social worker: a person who works for the social services or for a private organization providing help and support for people who need it

socialized medicine: medical services provided or paid for by the government for anyone who needs them

socket set: a set of metal tools of different sizes that fix onto one handle and are used to fasten and unfasten nuts on pieces of equipment

soda siphon: a bottle for filling water with gas and forcing it out under pressure to use in drinks

sodium bicarbonate: a white powder used to make foods rise when they are baked

sodium carbonate: a chemical compound used as a water softener and in foods and industry, in the form of white powder or crystals

sodium hydroxide: a chemical compound used in soap and paper production and in powerful cleaning substances

sodium nitrate: a chemical compound used to make explosives, fireworks, and fertilizers, and as a preservative for meat

sofa bed: a sofa that opens to form a bed

suffice to say: 無需多說，只需說…就夠了

sugar and spice: If you describe someone, especially a woman or a girl, as being sugar and spice, you mean that that person is behaving in a kind and friendly way.

sugar cane: a tropical plant from whose tall thick stems sugar can be got

sugar snap pea: a long, thin, green pod, eaten as a vegetable

sum up: to describe or express the important facts or characteristics about something or someone
An action or object that sums something or someone up represents the most typical qualities of that person or thing.
to quickly form an opinion about someone or something

sum total: The sum total of something is the whole of it, or everything

said when you are telling someone about a situation in which something unexpected and pleasant has happened

to get control of a company by buying enough of the shares in it

聽我的吧，我說的不會錯

take off: to spend time away from your work

take on: to accept a particular job or responsibility

take one at a time: to do or deal with one thing before starting to do or deal with another

take over/up the reins: to take control of something, especially an organization or a country
控制，接管（某東西，尤指某組織或國家）

take root: If an idea, belief, or system takes root somewhere, it starts to be accepted there.

take sb's breath away: to be extremely beautiful or surprising
美得令…透不過氣來；令…驚嘆

take sb's life: 殺掉（某人），取（某人）的性命

take shape: to start to develop a more clear or certain form

take stock: To take stock (of something) is to think carefully about a situation or event and form an opinion about it, so that you can decide what to do.

take the plunge: to make a decision to do something, especially after thinking about it for a long time

take the rough with the smooth: to accept the unpleasant parts of a situation as well as the pleasant parts

（高級軍官在閱兵時）接受敬禮，行答禮

take the sting out of: If something takes the sting out of an unpleasant situation, it makes it less unpleasant.

take the time: to make the effort to do something

take the weight off your feet: If you take the weight off your feet/legs, you sit down, especially after standing or walking for a long time.
（長時間站立或行走後）坐下歇歇腳，坐下喘口氣

take the weight off your legs: If you take the weight off your feet/legs, you sit down, especially after standing or walking for a long time.
（長時間站立或行走後）坐下歇歇腳，坐下喘口氣

take the wind out of sb's sails: also knock the wind out of sb's sails, knock the wind out of sb to make someone feel less confident or less determined to do something, usually by saying or doing something that they are not expecting

take the wraps off: to allow people to know about something

take things easy: to relax and not work too hard

take to drink: to start drinking alcohol often, sometimes because of a personal problem
（通常指因個人問題而）開始酗酒

take to somewhere: to go somewhere, usually because you are in a difficult or dangerous situation

take to your bed: often disapproving to go to bed, especially because you feel ill or unable to deal with things

take up the cudgels against: to argue strongly in support of, or against, someone or something

take up with: to become friendly or start a relationship with someone, especially someone who might have a bad influence on you

take your cue from: to be strongly influenced by something or someone

take your eye off the ball: to not give your attention to what you are doing at the time

take your hat off to: If you say that you take your hat off to someone, you mean that you admire them for an achievement.

take your lumps: to be criticized or beaten as a punishment

take your time: said to mean that you can spend as much time as you need in doing something, or that you should slow down
disapproving to do something too slowly

take-home message: the main message or piece of information that you learn from something

take a knock: to be damaged because of a bad experience

have a knock: to be damaged because of a bad experience

need a cold shower: an expression used when someone needs to calm down when something has made them feel sexually excited
洗個冷水澡（指某人因某事而性興奮時需要冷靜）

pick up the gauntlet: to agree to fight or compete with someone

take the pledge: to make a formal promise to stop drinking alcohol

talcum powder: a powder, usually having a pleasant smell, put on the skin to make it feel smooth or to help it stay dry

tale of woe: a report of the bad things that have happened

talk a blue streak: to talk quickly and without stopping

used to emphasize that something is very noticeable in the stated way
（用於加強語氣）說到…可真不得了

talk about sth: to think about or make plans to do something in the future
考慮（或制定計劃）要做（某事）

talk about doing: to think about or make plans to do something in the future
考慮（或制定計劃）要做（某事）

talk around: UK also talk round to avoid speaking directly about something

talk at: to speak to someone without listening to that person or allowing them to speak

talk sense: to speak in a reasonable way

talk shop: to talk about your job with those you work with when not at work

（電視或廣播中的）訪談節目，脫口秀

talk some sense into: to help someone to think about a situation in a reasonable way

talk the talk ... walk the walk: If you say that someone talks the talk but does not walk the walk, you mean that they do not act in a way that agrees with the things they say.

talk the talk: to talk or act in a confident way so that you seem to be very good at what you do
流利（或令人信服）地談論某事

talk trash: informal to say things that do not have a lot of meaning
US informal to criticize other people, especially unfairly or cruelly

talk turkey: to discuss something honestly and directly

talk in riddles: to say things in a confusing way

speak in riddles: to say things in a confusing way
說話令人莫名其妙，說話像打啞謎

talking of: while we are talking about a particular person or thing

tall oaks from little acorns grow: said about organizations or plans that start off very small or simple and become extremely large or successful

參天巨樹萌生於幼籽；合抱之木生於毫末

tank up: US informal to fill a vehicle with fuel

tap into: to manage to use something in a way that brings good results

AREA OF LAND: a tea plantation (= large area of land where tea plants are grown)

a right-wing political movement in the US that wants to greatly reduce government spending and cut taxes

tear your hair out: If you tear your hair out over a problem, you are worrying a lot about it.

tee up: to put a golf ball on the tee in preparation for playing

tee shirt: T恤衫，短袖運動衫（同 T-shirt）

損害（某人）的健康；對（某人）產生不良影響

tempt providence: If you tempt fate or providence by doing something, you take a silly risk by doing it and depend too much on your good luck.

terra incognita: a place, subject, or situation that you are not familiar with

to drive a car that you are considering buying, in order to see if you like it

text message: a written message, often containing short forms of words, sent from one mobile phone or pager to another
（行動電話或傳呼機發送的）簡訊

thank you: used to tell someone that you are grateful because they have given you something or done something for you
said when you are answering a polite question or remark

said to politely accept or refuse something that has been offered to you
謝謝（禮貌地表示接受或拒絕）
said to show your disapproval of something
something that you say or do in order to show that you are grateful for something

that really takes the biscuit: You say that something or someone (really) takes the biscuit when it or they have done something that you find extremely annoying or surprising.

that takes the biscuit: You say that something or someone (really) takes the biscuit when it or they have done something that you find extremely annoying or surprising.

that beats everything: （表示非常驚訝）真是從未發生過的怪事

that does it!: said when someone or something goes further than the limit of what is acceptable

said when you want to give further details or be more exact about something

我們兩人的情況一樣；我跟你有同感

said when you think that something is unacceptable

said when someone has just told you a surprising fact that you did not know before

used to show that you do not think what someone has said is special
沒甚麽特別的；沒甚麽不同尋常的
