the end justifies the means: said about a situation in which the final aim is so important that any way of achieving it is acceptable

the end of the line: the point at w#hich it is no longer possible to continue with a process or activity
（過程或活動的）盡頭；窮途末路

the end of the road: the point at w#hich it is no longer possible to continue with a process or activity
（過程或活動的）盡頭；窮途末路

the Episcopal Church: a part of the Anglican Church, especially in Scotland and the US
（尤指蘇格蘭和美國的）聖公會

the EU: 歐洲聯盟（the European Union的縮寫）

the European Community: the organization through which particular European governments made decisions and agreed on shared action in social and economic matters until 1993, when it became the European Union
歐洲經濟共同體（1993年成爲歐洲聯盟）

the European Union: the organization, since 1993, through which European governments who choose to be members make decisions and agree on shared action in social and economic matters

the Eurozone: the countries belonging to the European Union that use the euro as their unit of money
歐元區（指歐盟成員國中使用歐元的國家）

the evening star: a planet, especially Venus, that can be seen shining brightly in the west just after the sun has gone down

the evil eye: a look that someone gives other people that is believed to have the power to injure or harm them

the exception that proves the rule: something that emphasizes the general truth of a statement by disagreeing with it
反證規律的例外；足以證明普遍性的例外

the Exchequer: the government department that receives and gives out public money, in the UK and some other countries

the exosphere: the region of the earth's atmosphere that is furthest from the earth

the FA Cup: a competition for teams that belong to the Football Association in England, or the silver cup that is given as a prize in this competition

the face of: what you can see of something or what shows

the fact remains: 無法改變的事實是；事實仍然是

the fag end of: the last, and often worst, part of something

the Fall of Man: According to the Bible, the Fall (of Man) was the occasion when the first man and woman did not obey the rules of God and were sent away from the garden of Eden.
人類的墮落（指聖經裡亞當和夏娃違背上帝的旨意而被逐出伊甸園）

the Far East: the countries of East Asia, including China, Japan, North and South Korea, and Indonesia
遠東（包括中國、日本、南北韓和印尼）

the Faraday constant: the amount of electric charge in a mole of electrons

the fashion police: a way of referring to newspapers, television programmes, etc. that discuss and criticize the clothes that famous people wear; a way of referring to people in general who criticize the clothes that people wear
時尚警察（指報刊或電視上有關名人著裝的評論，或泛指人們對他人著裝的評論）

the fat is in the fire: said when something has been said or done that will cause a lot of trouble

the Fates: three goddesses who the ancient Greeks believed controlled people's lives and decided when people must die
（古希臘人認為掌控人的命運的）命運三女神

the father of: the man who began something or first made something important

the FBI: abbreviation for the Federal Bureau of Investigation: one of the national police forces in the US controlled by the Federal government
（美國）聯邦調查局（the Federal Bureau of Investigation的縮寫）

the Federal Reserve: the central bank of the US
美國聯邦儲備銀行（簡稱美聯儲，即美國中央銀行）

the Federated States of Micronesia: 密克羅尼西亞聯邦（西太平洋島國）

the Fertile Crescent: a region in Western Asia between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers, important to the growth of human civilization
肥沃月彎（或稱新月沃土，指西亞底格裡斯河和幼發拉底河之間孕育了人類文明的沃土）

the festive season: the period around Christmas and New Year

the final solution: the Nazi plan to kill all the Jews of Europe, which caused the murder of six million Jews between 1941 and 1945
最終解決（納粹殺死歐洲所有猶太人的計劃，造成了1941年至1945年間600萬猶太人遇害）

the final/last straw: the last in a series of unpleasant events that finally makes you feel that you cannot continue to accept a bad situation
（壓垮駱駝的）最後一根稻草；使人最終崩潰的一擊

the First Fleet: the ships that brought the first Europeans to Australia
第一艦隊（將首批歐洲人帶到澳大利亞的艦隊）

the first floor: UK the level of a building that is one level above the street
US the level of a building that is at the same level as the street

the first person: the form of a verb or pronoun that is used when people are speaking or writing about themselves
showing that someone is speaking or writing about themselves : The writer is deliberately personal, using the first-person pronoun throughout.
telling a story using the form "I" or "we": The nameless first-person narrator is the focus of the story.
described by someone who was actually present somewhere or who actually experienced something, rather than by someone reporting what they said: a collection of first-person accounts of former slaves
used to refer to a video game that you play as though you are the person in the game: Doom is the orginal first-person shooter video game.

the First World: the richer countries of the world that have advanced economies. Some people find this use offensive: Those of us who live in the First World consume more than 80% of the planet's resources.

the First World War: the war from 1914 to 1918 in which many countries fought

the flower of: the best of a particular group or type

the Football League: the football league (= group of competing teams) in England and Wales who are not in the Premier League (= the top league). It is divided into the Championship, League One, and League Two.
英格蘭和威爾士地區的足球聯賽（不包括參加英超聯賽的球隊，分為冠軍組、一級組、二級組）

the forces of evil: things that have a very bad influence or effect

the forefront: the most noticeable or important position
最顯要的位置；最重要的地位

the foregoing: what has just been mentioned or described
前面所提到的事物；以上所述

the Foreign Office: in the UK, the department of the government that deals with relations with other countries
（英國）外交和英聯邦事務部，外交部

the foreshore: the part of the land next to the sea that is between the limits reached by high and low tide, or any part of this land that does not have grass or buildings on it
（海邊高潮線和低潮線之間的）前灘，灘頭，前濱；海邊空地，海濱

the fourth dimension: used to refer to time, especially in science fiction
第四維，第四度空間（指時間，尤見於科幻小說中）

the Fourth Estate: newspapers, magazines, television, and radio stations and the people who work for them who are thought to have a lot of political influence
第四等級（指新聞界及其政治影響）

the Fourth of July: a national holiday in the US that celebrates the country's independence from Great Britain in 1776
美國獨立紀念日（紀念美國於1776年7月4日脫離英國獨立）

the fraud squad: a department in the British police that discovers and takes action against business fraud

the free world: those countries whose governments have been chosen in fair elections and whose people have full human rights, usually used to refer to the Western world in contrast to other countries, for example countries that have a Communist government
自由世界（政府經公平選舉而成的國家，其人民享有絕對的人權；尤其是在與共產主義政府國家對比時，用來指西方國家）

the front line: a place where opposing armies face each other in war and where fighting happens

the frontiers of: the limits of what is known or what has been done before in an area of knowledge or an activity

the FTSE 100: a number that expresses the value of the share prices of the 100 most important British companies, published by the Financial Times
倫敦《金融時報》指數（指英國最重要的100家公司股票價格平均數）

the full monty: the most or best that you can have, do, get, or achieve, or all that you want or need
所有可能（或最好）的事物；所有想要的事物

the Fundamental Counting Principle: the rule that says that if there are x ways in which one thing can be done, and y ways in which another thing can then be done, then there are x × y ways in which the two things can be done one after the other

the funny farm: sometimes used in a humorous or offensive way to refer to a hospital for mentally ill people
（幽默或冒犯性說法）精神病院，瘋人院

the fur flies: UK If the fur flies, people have a bad argument.

the future perfect: the form of the verb that is used to show that an action will have been performed by a particular time. In English it is formed by "will have" or "shall have" and a past participle

the G8: eight of the world's biggest industrial countries: Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Russia, the UK, and the US The G8 has regular meetings to discuss subjects such as the world economy and international trade
八大工業國組織（包括加拿大、法國、德國、意大利、日本、俄羅斯、英國和美國）

the game is up: used to tell someone that you know what their secret activities or plans are and that these cannot continue

the games that people play: the ways in which people behave in order to get an advantage

the games people play: the ways in which people behave in order to get an advantage

the gamut: the whole range of things that can be included in something
to experience or show the whole range of something
經歷（某領域）的全部事情；全盤展示

the garden of Eden: the beautiful garden, described in the Bible, made by God for Adam and Eve

the general public: ordinary people, especially all the people who are not members of a particular organization or who do not have any special type of knowledge
（尤指不屬於特定機構或沒有專業知識的）普通百姓，公眾

the generation gap: a situation in which older and younger people do not understand each other because of their different experiences, opinions, habits, and behaviour
代溝，兩代人之間的隔閡

the Geneva Convention: an agreement accepted by most countries of the world that establishes standards for the reasonable treatment of soldiers, and other people involved, in periods of war
日內瓦公約（由世界大部分國家簽署，規定戰爭期間如何對待作戰和非作戰人士的條約）

the gentry: people of high social class, especially in the past
（尤指舊時的）上流社會人士，紳士階層

the genuine article: a good and real example of a particular thing

the Gestapo: the secret police of the Nazi period in Germany 1933-45, who used cruel and evil methods and were involved in the killing of a very large number of people
蓋世太保（1933-1945納粹德國時期的秘密警察組織，行事手段兇殘惡毒，迫害百姓）

the gift of the gab: the ability to speak easily and confidently in a way that makes people want to listen to you and believe you

the GISC: abbreviation for General Insurance Standards Council: an independent organization in the UK that protects people who buy insurance products
（英國一家保護保險產品使用者的獨立機構）一般保險標準協會（General Insurance Standard Council的縮寫）

the gist: the most important pieces of information about something, or general information without details

the glass is half empty: used to refer to an attitude of always thinking about the bad things in a situation rather than the good ones: A pessimist says the glass is half empty but an optimist says that it is half full.

the glass is half full: used to refer to an attitude of always thinking about the good things in a situation rather than the bad ones: Align yourself with people who think the glass is half full.

the gloaming: the part of the day after the sun has gone down and before the sky is completely dark

the global village: all the countries of the world when thought of as being closely connected by modern communication and trade
地球村（全球所有國家由現代通訊和貿易的緊密聯繫連結而成的一個整體）

the Glorious Twelfth: 12 August, the start of the grouse shooting season in Britain
光榮的第十二日（指8月12日，英國獵松雞季節開始的那一天）

the God squad: evangelical Christians whose members are generally thought to be too forceful in trying to persuade other people to believe as they do
上帝使團（指屬於基督教福音派的成員，常常力勸別人皈依他們的信仰）

the golden boot: an award given to the player who scores the most goals in a competition or season (= the period of the year when a sport is played)
（授予進球最多球員的）金靴獎

the good old days: If you talk about the good old days, you mean a time in the past when you believe life was better.

the GOP: abbreviation for the Grand Old Party: the Republican political party in the US
老大黨（指美國共和黨，the Grand Old Party的縮寫）

the gory details: the interesting and usually personal pieces of information about a person or event
（通常指有關個人或事件的）有趣的細節

the grand old man of: a man who has been involved in a particular activity for a long time and is known and respected by a lot of people

the grandaddy of: the biggest, most important, or most powerful event or person of their type
老祖宗，祖師爺；同類中最大（或最重要、最有影響）的一個

the grass is always greener: something that you say that means that other people always seem to be in a better situation than you, although they may not be
（總是覺得別人的處境好）鄰家的草分外青；這山望著那山高

the grass is greener: something that you say that means that other people always seem to be in a better situation than you, although they may not be
（總是覺得別人的處境好）鄰家的草分外青；這山望著那山高

the gray dollar: the money that older people as a group have available to spend
灰鎊（老年人手中可支配的錢）

the Great Depression: the period of decrease in wealth, industrial production, and employment from 1929 until the start of the Second World War

the green revolution: the large increase in food production around the world because of better farming technology
（因技術改善而大大增加食物產量的）綠色革命

the greenhouse effect: an increase in the amount of carbon dioxide and other gases in the atmosphere (= mixture of gases around the earth), that is believed to be the cause of a gradual warming of the surface of the earth

the Gregorian calendar: the system used in many parts of the world to divide the 365 days of the year into weeks and months, and to number the years

the grey market: an unofficial but not completely illegal system in which products are bought and sold
（非正式但並不完全非法的）灰色市場
buying and selling of a company's shares before they are available officially
（在公司股票尚未正式發放時進行交易的）股票灰色市場，暗盤市場
people over about 50, considered as a group to which products can be sold
面對50歲以上人群的市場，，白髮市場

the grey pound: the money that older people as a group have available to spend
灰鎊（老年人手中可支配的錢）

the Grim Reaper: death, imagined as a skeleton with a large curved tool used for cutting crops
猙獰的收割者（想像中骷髏狀死神拿著鐮刀收割的形象）

the ground floor: the floor of a building that is at the same level as the ground outside
底層，底樓，一樓（建築物與外面地面相平的一層）

the groves of academe: UK literary or humorous universities considered as a whole

the gulag: severe work prisons for people found guilty of crimes against their country
古拉格（對犯有叛國罪的人實行嚴酷勞改刑罰的監獄）

the Gulf Stream: the current of warm water that flows across the Atlantic Ocean from the Gulf of Mexico towards Europe

the gutter press: the type of newspapers that pay more attention to shocking stories about crime and sex than to serious matters
（刊登聳人聽聞的犯罪或色情內容的）低級趣味報紙，下流報紙

the Haber process: a method used in industry for producing ammonia (= a strong-smelling substance used in cleaning materials)

the hair of the dog: an alcoholic drink taken as a cure the morning after an occasion when you have drunk too much alcohol

the hairdryer treatment: If football players get the hairdryer treatment, their manager shouts angrily at them in the dressing room or on the training ground.
被吹風機吹了（指足球隊員被教練在更衣室或訓練場上咆哮斥責）

the Hand of God: the name given to Diego Maradona's first goal for Argentina against England in a game of the 1986 World Cup, which he scored using his hand and later referred to as the "Hand of God"
（1986年世界盃決賽期間在阿根廷對英格蘭的比賽中，馬拉多納用手打入英格蘭隊大門的進球）上帝之手

the hand that rocks the cradle rules the: said to emphasize that women have a strong influence on events through their children
搖搖籃的手統治著世界（強調母親對孩子的深遠影響）。

the hard way: a way of doing something that makes it more difficult than it needs to be
以不必要的費力的方式
If you learn something the hard way, you learn from unpleasant experiences rather than by being taught.

the heat is on: If you say the heat is on, you mean that a time of great activity and/or pressure has begun.
開始一段忙碌（又有壓力）的日子

the heavens open: If the heavens open, it suddenly starts to rain a lot.

the heebie-jeebies: strong feelings of fear or worry

the high jump: a sport in which competitors try to jump over a bar supported on two poles. The height of the bar is gradually raised and the winner is the person who jumps highest without knocking the bar off the poles.

the high life: an exciting way of living in which rich and successful people enjoy themselves by spending a lot of time and money in fashionable places
豪華生活，上層社會的生活

the high seas: the seas that are not controlled by any country

the Highway Code: the set of official rules, published in a small book, that have to be obeyed by drivers in the UK

the highways and byways: the roads and paths of a place

the Hippocratic oath: a promise made by people when they become doctors to do everything possible to help their patients and to have high moral standards in their work
醫科學生誓約（新醫生執業前保證遵守醫德守則的誓言）

the holiday season: the period around Christmas and New Year

the holy grail: also the Holy Grail a cup believed to have been used by Jesus Christ at the meal before his death
聖杯（傳說耶穌在最後的晚餐上使用過）
something that is extremely difficult to find or get

the holy of holies: the holiest part of a religious building, especially the Jewish temple
宗教建築最神聖的部分；（尤指）猶太教會堂的內殿，至聖所
UK humorous any place that is very special

the Holy See: the government of the Roman Catholic Church, under the Pope
the area where the Pope as the Bishop of Rome has authority
教皇作為羅馬主教的教區，教廷，聖座

the Home Counties: the counties (= areas) around London in southeast England, considered to be a place where rich people live
倫敦周圍各郡（英格蘭東南部富庶地區）

the home front: the people who stay in their own country during a foreign war

the home straight: the last part of something that is being done
the last part of a race

the House of Commons: one of the two parts of parliament in the UK and Canada, whose members are each elected to represent a particular official area of the country, or its members, or the place where it meets
（英國或加拿大議會中的）下議院

the House of Lords: one of the two parts of the UK parliament, whose members are not elected but have a high social position, or its members, or the place where it meets
（英國議會中的）貴族院，上議院

the House of Representatives: the lower house of the parliaments of some countries, including the US, Australia, and New Zealand
（美國、澳大利亞及紐西蘭的）眾議院

the Houses of Parliament: the UK parliament, consisting of the House of Commons and the House of Lords
議院（英國上、下議院的合稱）

the human race: all the people in the world, considered as a group

the human touch: a friendly and pleasant way of treating other people that makes them feel relaxed

the hustings: the political activities and speeches that happen before an election and are intended to win votes

the hydrosphere: all of the water, ice, and water vapor at or near the surface of the earth, such as the seas, clouds, and the water in and under the ground
水圈（地球表面上或附近的所有的水、冰、水蒸氣的總和，如海洋、冰川、雲層以及地上或地下水）

the icing on the cake: something that makes a good situation even better

the IMF: abbreviation for the International Monetary Fund: a part of the United Nations that encourages international trade and gives financial help to poor countries
國際貨幣基金組織（International Monetary Fund的縮寫）

the Immaculate Conception: the Christian belief that Jesus Christ's mother Mary, or, more generally, Jesus Christ himself, was born free from sin (= offence against religious law)
聖母無原罪始胎（說）（基督教認為聖母瑪利亞及耶穌基督成胎時未沾染原罪）

the Indian Ocean: the ocean that is to the south of India

the Industrial Revolution: the period of time during which work began to be done more by machines in factories than by hand at home

the infield: the part of a cricket or baseball field that is closest to the player who hits the ball, or the group of players there
（板球、棒球的）內野，內場；內場員

the ink is not dry/still wet: You say that the ink is not dry/still wet on a document if it has just been written or produced.
（文件）剛寫成的，剛製作完成的

the Inland Revenue: the former name for the government office in the UK that collects the main taxes

the Inns of Court: the four societies in London for students of law, one of which a barrister (= lawyer who argues cases in a law court) must belong to
倫敦四法學院（在高級法院辯護的訟務律師必須來自其中一間）

the ins and outs: the detailed or complicated facts of something

the intelligentsia: very educated people in a society, especially those interested in the arts and in politics
知識階層，知識界；知識分子

the International Baccalaureate: a set of exams in several subjects taken by students around the age of 18 or 19 in many different countries as a qualification for going to university

the international community: countries of the world considered or acting together as a group

the International Date Line: The International Date Line is an imaginary line between the most northern and southern points on earth that goes through the Pacific Ocean. The date on the west side of the line is one day earlier than the date on the east side of the line.

the Internationale: a song that is sung by people who believe in Communism or Socialism

the internet: the large system of connected computers around the world that allows people to share information and communicate with each other

the IOC: abbreviation for the International Olympic Committee
國際奧林匹克委員會，國際奧委會（International Olympic Committee的縮寫）

the ionosphere: the part of the earth's atmosphere, from about 60 kilometres to about 1,000 kilometres above the surface, in which there are many ions

the IRA: abbreviation for the Irish Republican Army: an illegal organization that wants Northern Ireland to be politically independent of the UK and united with the Republic of Ireland, and that has fought for this aim with terrorism in the past
愛爾蘭共和軍（the Irish Republican Army的縮寫）

the Irish Sea: the sea between Britain and Ireland

the Iron Age: the period in early history starting about 1100 BC when iron was used for tools

the Iron Curtain: From 1946-1989, the Iron Curtain was the name of the border between Western Europe and the communist countries of Eastern Europe. The Iron Curtain made it very difficult to travel into or out of Eastern Europe.
鐵幕（指原東歐共產主義國家與歐洲其他國家之間的分界線）

the IRS: abbreviation for Internal Revenue Service (= the part of the US Treasury Department that collects most taxes owed to the federal government, including income tax)
美國國家稅務局（Internal Revenue Service的縮寫）

the Ivy League: a group of eight respected colleges and universities in the northeast of the US
常春藤聯合會（指美國東北部八所歷史悠久的著名大學）

the jet set: rich, fashionable people who travel around the world enjoying themselves
to travel around the world enjoying yourself

the jewel in the crown: the best or most valuable part of something
王冠上的寶石，最珍貴的部分

the job/matter in hand: the job or matter that is important at the present moment

the Joint Chiefs of Staff: the leaders of the US armed forces, who give military advice to the president

the joke is on: If you say that the joke is on a particular person, you mean that that person has tried to make someone else look silly but has made himself or herself look silly instead.
開玩笑反而開到（某人）自己頭上

the Jolly Roger: the black flag with a picture of bones on it that was traditionally used on a ship belonging to pirates

the jury is still out: If the jury is (still) out on a subject, people do not yet know the answer or have not yet decided if it is good or bad.
（答案或觀點）尚不明確，懸而未決

the jury is out: If the jury is (still) out on a subject, people do not yet know the answer or have not yet decided if it is good or bad.
（答案或觀點）尚不明確，懸而未決

the key to: the best or only way to achieve something
實現…的關鍵；完成…的要訣

the KKK: 三K黨（the Ku Klux Klan的縮寫）

the knives are out: used to refer to a situation when people are being unpleasant about someone, or trying to harm someone

the knock at/on the door: an occasion when police or soldiers come to take you away from your home
員警（或士兵）到家裡把某人帶走

the Koran: the holy book of the Islamic religion

the Kremlin: a group of buildings in Moscow that is now the centre of government of Russia, or the Russian government itself. In the past, the Kremlin also meant the government of the Soviet Union.
克裡姆林宮；俄羅斯政府；（舊時）蘇聯政府

the Ku Klux Klan: a secret US organization of white Protestant Americans, especially in the south of the country, who oppose people of other races or religions
三K黨（主要活動於美國南部的秘密組織，成員為新教白人，反對其他種族和宗教）

the lads: used to refer to the group of men that a young man spends time with socially, especially those who he drinks alcohol with or plays sport with

the laity: all the people who are involved with a Church but who are not priests
（非教會神職人員的）普通信徒

the land of the midnight sun: the part of Europe inside the Arctic Circle where the sun is in the sky very late at night in the summer
午夜太陽國（指位於北極圈內的歐洲國家）

the last but one: the one before the final one

the last judgment: 最後審判日；世界末日（同 Judgment Day）

the last minute: the latest possible opportunity for doing something
the latest possible opportunity for doing something

the last post: a tune that is played on a bugle at military funerals or when it is time for soldiers to go to bed
軍人葬禮號；軍營熄燈號

the last rites: a religious ceremony performed by a priest for a person who is dying

最後的晚餐（耶穌在受難的前一天與祂的門徒吃的晚餐）

something that you certainly do not want, need, etc.
根本不想／不需要（等等）的東西

the last word in: the best or most modern example of something
（某物）最好的的例子；最現代的例子

the law is an ass: the legal system or a particular law is wrong or not good enough, and should be changed
這是項愚不可及的法律。

the law of averages: the idea that over a period of time a particular thing will happen because it is just as likely to happen as the other possible events

the law of the jungle: the idea that people who care only about themselves will be most likely to succeed in a society or organization

the League of Nations: an organization of several countries, formed to try to keep world peace, that existed from 1920 to 1946

the left wing: supporting the political left; relating to the belief that wealth and power should be shared between all parts of society

the length and breadth of somewhere: If you travel the length and breadth of a place, you go to every part of it.

the lesser of two evils: the less unpleasant of two choices, neither of which is good

the Levant: the countries and islands of the eastern Mediterranean
黎凡特（指地中海東部諸國及島嶼）

the Liberal Party: in the UK, a political party that joined with the Social Democratic Party to become the Liberal Democrats

the lie of the land: the shape or height of the land

the life and soul of the party: someone who is energetic and funny and at the centre of activity during social occasions
（社交活動的）靈魂人物，中心人物

the lion's den: a dangerous or threatening place or situation

the lion's share: the largest part or most of something

the lithosphere: the solid outer layer of the earth

the Loch Ness Monster: a large creature that is believed to live in Loch Ness in Scotland, although its existence has not yet been proved
尼斯湖水怪（一隻體型碩大的怪獸，被認為棲息在蘇格蘭尼斯湖中，但其存在至今未被證實）

the long and the short of it: said when you want to explain the general situation without giving details
總之，總的來講，總而言之

the long ball game: a way of playing football that involves sending a series of long high passes towards a tall or very fast forward, rather than passing the ball along the ground to the feet of another player

the long haul: a period of years, rather than days, weeks, or months
以年記（而不是以天、周、月記）的一段時間

the long jump: a sports event in which a person runs up to a mark and then jumps as far forward as they can

the Lord's Prayer: in the Christian religion, the prayer taught by Jesus Christ to his disciples (= the first men who believed in him)

the low man on the totem pole: someone who has the least important position in an organization
（組織中）地位低微的人；基層；底層

the lowdown: the most important facts and information about something

the lower orders: the poorest social groups in society

the lowest of the low: people who have no moral standards and no personal qualities

the lull before the storm: a time that seems quiet but will very soon be followed by something unpleasant happening

the lunatic fringe: people who have very strong opinions that are outside the usual range
少數頑固派；少數極端分子

the Magi: in the Bible, the three men, thought to be kings or astrologers, who followed a star to visit Jesus Christ when he was a baby and give him presents. They are also called the Three Kings or the Three Wise Men.
三王，三智者，東方三博士（《聖經》中跟隨星辰攜帶禮物朝見初生耶穌的三聖人）

the magic sponge: used humorously to talk about a wet sponge, used during a football game to treat an injured player, that seems to have magical qualities because the player is quickly able to move and play normally again
魔術海綿（戲謔的說法，指足球比賽期間用來治療受傷球員的濕海綿，因為接受治療的球員似乎都很快就恢復正常了）

the mainland: the main part of a country or continent, not including the islands around it

the Maldives: a country in the Indian Ocean formed of many small islands
馬爾地夫（印度洋上的島國）

the man in the moon: (in children's stories) the human face that you can imagine you see when you look at the moon
月中人，月宮人（在兒童故事中，指看著月亮幻想所看到的人）

the man/woman in the street: an ordinary, average person whose opinions are considered to represent most people

the man/woman on the Clapham omnibus: an imaginary person whose opinions or ideas are considered to be typical of those of ordinary British people

the Marine Corps: a part of the US military forces that consists of soldiers who operate on land and at sea

the Marshall Islands: a country formed of a group of islands in the Pacific Ocean
馬紹爾群島（太平洋群島國家）

the Mason-Dixon Line: the border between the states of Maryland and Pennsylvania in the US, traditionally considered to mark the division between the north and south of the US
梅森－迪克森線（美國馬裡蘭州和賓夕法尼亞州之間的分界線，也是傳統上認為的美國北方各州和南方各州的分界線）

the mass media: newspapers, television, radio, and the internet

the matter in hand: the subject or situation being considered
處理中的事，手頭上的事

the mesosphere: the layer of gases surrounding the earth at a height of between 50 and 100 kilometres
中氣層（離地球表面50至100公里的大氣層的一部分）

the Met Office: the British government department that studies weather conditions and says what is expected to happen with the weather

the Middle Ages: a period in European history, between about AD 1000 and AD 1500, when the power of kings, people of high rank, and the Christian Church was strong

the middle distance: the part of a picture or a view that is neither very close nor very far away
A middle-distance race is run over a medium distance, especially 800 or 1500 metres.

the Middle East: the area from the eastern Mediterranean to Iran, including Syria, Jordan, Israel, Lebanon, Saudi Arabia, Iran, and Iraq, and sometimes also Egypt
中東（指從地中海東部伸延至伊朗的這個區域，包括敘利亞、約旦、以色列、黎巴嫩、沙烏地阿拉伯、伊朗和伊拉克，有時也包括埃及）

the Midlands: the central part of England, including the cities of Birmingham, Coventry, Nottingham, and Derby

the midnight sun: the sun when seen in the middle of the night in summer in the arctic or antarctic (= the parts of the world furthest to the north and the south)
（南北極地區夏季可見的）夜半太陽，子夜太陽

the Midwest: an area in the US that includes Ohio, Indiana, Michigan, Illinois, Wisconsin, Iowa, Minnesota, Nebraska, Missouri, and Kansas

the military police: the police force within the armed forces, responsible for dealing with members of the armed forces who break the law

the military-industrial complex: the armed forces and the industries that supply them, considered as a strong influence on government decisions and actions
軍事工業複合體（軍隊與為其提供補給的工業的聯合體，對政府決策和行動具有重大影響）

the milk of human kindness: 人類的惻隱之心；人類的善良天性

the Milky Way: the galaxy (= star system) that includes the earth, seen at night as a pale strip across the sky

the minute: at the exact or first moment when

the minutiae: small and often not important details

the mistral: a strong, cold, dry wind that blows south through France to the Mediterranean
密史脫拉風（從法國南部吹向地中海的一種乾冷北風）

the mists of time: used to show that something happened a very long time ago and is difficult to remember clearly
歲月的迷霧；久遠的年代

the moment of truth: an occasion when something important happens that tests someone or something and that will have an effect on the future
關鍵時刻；考驗人的時刻

the more the merrier: used to say an occasion will be more enjoyable if a lot of people are there

the morning star: a planet, especially Venus, that can be seen shining brightly in the east just before or as the sun rises

the naked eye: If something can be seen with the naked eye, it can be seen without the help of an instrument.

the name of the game: the most important part of an activity, or the quality that you most need for that activity
（活動）最重要的部分，最需要的素質

the national curriculum: in some countries, the set of subjects that children must study
（一些國家的中小學）全國統一必修課程

the National Front: a small British political party that is opposed to immigration

the National Guard: in the US, the state military force that is available for service in state and federal emergencies

the National Health Service: the service in the UK that provides free or cheap medical treatment for everyone and is paid for through taxes

the National Trust: an organization in the UK that owns and takes care of many beautiful and old buildings and beautiful and important areas of countryside

自然科學（如生物、物理和化學）

the never-never: using a system of payment in which part of the cost of something is paid immediately and then small regular payments are made until the debt is reduced to nothing

the new kid on the block: someone who is new in a place or organization and has many things to learn about it
剛上路的新手，初來乍到者

the New Right: a group of people who believe that government should be separated from a country's economy and that traditional morals are very important
新右派（認為政府不應幹預經濟，強調傳統道德觀的重要性）

the New Testament: the second of the two main parts of the Christian Bible, containing the books written after the birth of Jesus Christ

the New World: 新大陸，新世界（指美洲大陸）

the new world order: a political situation in which the countries of the world are no longer divided because of their support for either the US or the Soviet Union and instead work together to solve international problems
世界新秩序（指世界各國透過協作解決問題，而不再根據其支持美國或蘇聯分門別派立場的國際秩序）

the next best thing: the thing that is best, if you cannot have or do the thing you really want
僅次於…的事物；退而求其次的事物

the next thing I knew: used to talk about part of a story that happens in a sudden and surprising way
（用於描述事情突然意外發生）接下來，之後

the NHS: 英國國民保健系統（National Health Service的縮寫）

the Nikkei index: a list that gives the price of shares in the most important Japanese companies

the nineteenth hole: the bar at a golf course where people go to have drinks and talk after they have finished playing
第十九洞（指高爾夫球賽後球員們去的設在球場上的酒吧）

the nitty-gritty: the basic facts of a situation

the Norman Conquest: the defeat of England by Norman soldiers in the 11th century
諾曼征服（諾曼人於11世紀對英格蘭的征服）

（英國的）南北差異（尤指較貧窮的北部與較富裕的南部之間的經濟差距）

the nuts and bolts: the practical facts about a particular thing, rather than theories or ideas about it

the Occident: the western part of the world, especially the countries of Europe and America
西半球，西方；（尤指）歐美國家

the odd one out: a person or thing that is different from or kept apart from others that form a group or set
與眾不同的人（或物）；異類；不合群的人

the old school tie: the way in which people who have been to the same expensive private school help each other to find good jobs

the Old Testament: the first of the two main parts of the Christian Bible, which records the history of the Jewish people before the birth of Jesus

the Old World: 舊世界（指亞洲、非洲和歐洲）
belonging to or typical of a period in the past

the old-boy network: the way in which men who have been to the same expensive school or university help each other to find good jobs
校友關係網，老同學關係網；老同學間的互相關照

the oldest profession: prostitution (= the job of having sex for money)

the oldest trick in the book: a way of tricking someone that is still effective although it has been used a lot before
一種老套但仍然有效的騙人把戲

the onus: the responsibility or duty to do something

常見之物；盛行之物；重要之物

全國地形測量局（測繪不列顛和北愛爾蘭詳圖的政府機構）

東方國家（指東亞和東南亞國家）

the other side of the coin: a different way of considering a situation, making it seem either better or worse than it did originally

the outback: the areas of Australia that are far away from towns and cities, especially the desert areas in central Australia
內地（指澳大利亞遠離城鎮的地區，尤指中部的沙漠地區）

the past continuous: the grammatical form used for an action that someone was doing or an event that was happening at a particular time. It is made with "was" or "were" and the -ing form of a verb.

the past perfect: the grammatical form used for an action that had already finished when another action happened. It is made with "had" and a past participle.

the past simple: the form of a verb used to describe an action that happened before the present time and is no longer happening. It is usually made by adding -ed

the past tense: used to describe verb forms in many languages used for actions that have now finished. It is used by some people to refer to the past simple in English.

the patience of Job: the ability to remain patient and to do what you think you should do despite having many problems

the Peace Corps: an organization in the US that sends people to work as volunteers (= people who work without being paid) in poor countries
和平工作團（派遣志願工作者到貧困國家的一個美國組織）

the pen is mightier than the sword: said to emphasize that thinking and writing have more influence on people and events than the use of force or violence

the penny drops: If the penny drops, you suddenly understand something.

the perfect hat trick: an occasion when a football player scores one goal with their left foot, one goal with their right foot, and one goal with their head
完美帽子戲法（指一場足球比賽中同一個球員分別以左腳、右腳和頭頂入球）

表演藝術（如演藝、舞蹈和演奏）

the Pied Piper of Hamelin: a character in a children's story who led all the children away from the town of Hamelin by playing beautiful music after the town officials refused to pay him for getting rid of all the rats
吹笛手；花衣吹笛手（一個兒童小說中的人物；他消除了哈梅林鎮的所有老鼠，但鎮上的官員拒絕給他承諾的報酬，他就吹奏著美麗的音樂，把所有孩子帶出哈梅林鎮）

the Pledge of Allegiance: a promise to be loyal to the US that is said especially by American children at school at the start of each day

the plot thickens: said when a situation suddenly becomes more complicated or mysterious

the pluperfect: the grammatical tense used to describe an action that had already finished when another action happened. It is made with "had" and a past participle.

the Pole Star: a star that can be seen by people in the northern part of the world and always shows where north lies

the politburo: the main government group in a Communist country, which makes all the important decisions

the polluter pays principle: the idea that the person or organization that causes pollution should pay to put right the damage that it causes
污染者付費原則；「誰污染誰給錢」的原則（這種思想是，造成污染的個人或組織應為污染所致的損害付錢以進行治理）

the populace: the ordinary people who live in a particular country or place

幕後的實權人物，幕後操縱者；垂簾聽政者

the powers that be: important people who have authority over others

the Pozna\u0144: a celebration by football supporters when their team scores a goal, that involves them all standing with their backs to the pitch, holding each other by the shoulder, and jumping up and down together
（足球比賽期間，球迷們在所支持的球隊進球之後，背對球場，相互摟著肩膀一齊上下跳躍的慶祝儀式）波茲南舞

the Premier League: the top football league (= group of competing teams) in England since 1992, consisting of 20 teams from England and Wales
（1992年成立，由英格蘭和威爾士的20支足球隊組成的）英格蘭足球超級聯賽

the present continuous: the verb form used for actions or events that are happening or developing now

the present perfect: the form of the verb used for actions or events that have been completed or have happened in a period of time up to now

the present simple: the tense that is used to refer to events, actions, and conditions that are happening all the time, or exist now

the priesthood: the position of being a priest

the primary sector: industries that involve collecting and selling natural things, for example crops, rock, and wood, often in order for them to be made into something else
（採集和銷售自然產品如穀物、石頭、木材的）第一產業

the prime meridian: the imaginary line from the North Pole to the South Pole that passes through Greenwich in England and marks 0° longitude, from which all other longitudes are measured
本初子午線（從北極到南極的一條假想線，穿過英格蘭的格林威治，定為經線0°，其他經線以此為測定標準）

the primrose path: If you lead someone down the primrose path, you encourage that person to live an easy life that is full of pleasure but bad for them.
享樂之路（如果你將某人引向享樂之路，你就是鼓勵他們過安逸的、充滿享樂的生活，但這種生活對他們來說並非好事）

the Prince of Darkness: the Devil (= the main evil spirit in the Christian religion)

the proletariat: the class of people who do unskilled jobs in industry and own little or no property

the proof of the pudding: said to mean that you can only judge the quality of something after you have tried, used, or experienced it
布丁好不好，吃了才知道（只有通過體驗才能判斷事物的好壞；空談不如實證）

the property ladder: a series of stages in owning houses in which you buy a small house or apartment first and then buy a bigger or more expensive house when you have enough money
房產階梯（先買小房子或小公寓、然後再買更大或更貴一些的房子的一系列階段）

the public sector: businesses and industries that are owned or controlled by the government

the purse strings: the spending of money by a family, company, or country

the Pyramids: stone structures in Egypt of a pyramid shape that were built in ancient times as places to bury important people, especially kings and queens
（古埃及為埋葬重要人物，特別是法老或王后修建的）金字塔

the Queen's English: the English language as it is spoken in the south of England, considered by some people as a standard of good English
（英格蘭南部的英語口音，被一些人認為是標準的英語口語）女王英語

the RAC: abbreviation for the Royal Automobile Club: a British organization that gives help and information to drivers who are members of it
英國皇家汽車俱樂部（Roayl Automobile Club的縮寫）

the RAF: abbreviation for the Royal Air Force: the air force of the UK
英國皇家空軍（Royal Air Force的縮寫）

the Raj: the period of British rule in India

the rat race: a way of life in modern society, in which people compete with each other for power and money
（現代社會人們爲權利和金錢進行的）你死我活的競爭，激烈競爭，永無休止的競爭

the RCMP: abbreviation for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police
加拿大皇家騎警隊（Roayl Canadian Mounted Police 的縮寫）

the real deal: someone or something that is very good and has all the qualities that people say they have
真正的能手／好事（非常好的某人或某物，具有人們所說其應有的所有素質）

the real McCoy: the original or best example of something

the real thing 1: the original, best, or most typical example of something
真貨；最好的東西；典型的東西

the real world 2: the set of situations most humans have to deal with in their lives, rather than what happens in stories, films, etc.
happening in the world or in someone's life rather than in a book, in the imagination, on the internet, etc.

（觀眾坐在舞臺周圍的）圓形劇場；圓形劇場戲劇表演

them and us: used when describing disagreements or differences, especially between different social groups
他們和我們；別人和自己人

theme music: music that is written for and played during a particular television programme or film

theme park: a large permanent area for public entertainment, with entertaining activities and big machines to ride on or play games on, restaurants, etc., sometimes all connected with a single subject

theme song: a piece of music from a television programme, film, etc. that is remembered as the music that represents that programme or film

then again: used when you have had a new thought that is different from or the opposite of what you have just said
（用於表達與先前說法不同或相反的想法）話說回來，另一方面，然而

theoretical possibility: something that could happen but is unlikely to, or be true according to the known facts

there and back: adding together the distance or time to and from a particular place

there are plenty more fish in the sea: mainly UK US usually there are plenty of fish in the sea used to tell someone whose relationship has ended that there are many other people that they could have a relationship with

there but for the grace of God: said when something bad that has happened to someone else could have happened to you
（表示沒有遭到別人的厄運而慶幸）要不是上帝的恩典（我也遭殃）；多虧上帝開恩（我才逃過一劫）

there is a God!: said in a bad situation when something good happens unexpectedly
（用於在不好的形勢下出現轉機時）天助我也！老天有眼！

there is no holding N: If there is no holding someone (back), they do something eagerly and cannot be stopped.

there you go again: a way of emphasizing that an action is often repeated

they should worry!: said about or to someone who clearly has no need to worry
沒甚麼好擔心的，沒有必要擔心

thin down: If you thin down, you become less fat.

things that go bump in the night: used to describe anything unknown that might be frightening, especially a noise
夜裡可怕的響動；難解之謎

think again: UK to form a new opinion about something or decide to change your decision on it, often after learning more about it

think ahead: to think carefully about what might happen in the future, or to make plans for things you want to do in the future
仔細為未來做打算，未雨綢繆

think back: to remember something that happened in the past

think better of: to decide that something is not a good idea
決定不做…，改變對…的主意

think big: to have plans to be very successful or powerful

think for yourself: to make your own decisions and form your own opinions, without depending on other people

think nothing of: to consider that an activity is easy and not unusual

think of: If you think of something or someone in a particular way, you have that opinion about it, him, or her.
think highly, well, a lot, etc. of sb C2 also think the world of sb
to have a good opinion of someone or something
to have a low opinion of someone or something
to remember or imagine someone or something

think about: to remember or imagine someone or something

think on your feet: to make a quick decision or give an answer quickly

think outside the box: to think imaginatively using new ideas instead of traditional or expected ideas
跳出傳統的思維框框，以新的眼光看問題，獨闢蹊徑

think poorly of: to have a low opinion of someone or something

think tank: a group of experts brought together, usually by a government, to develop ideas on a particular subject and to make suggestions for action

think the whole world revolves around yo: to think you are extremely important
自命不凡；自以爲了不起

think the world revolves around you: to think you are extremely important
自命不凡；自以爲了不起

think the sun shines out of sb's arse: to love and admire someone so much that you do not think they have any bad qualities
（因為愛和崇拜）認為（某人）放的屁都是香的，滿眼都是（某人）的優點

think the sun shines out sb's arse: to love and admire someone so much that you do not think they have any bad qualities
（因為愛和崇拜）認為（某人）放的屁都是香的，滿眼都是（某人）的優點

think the sun shines out of sb's backsid: to love and admire someone so much that you do not think they have any bad qualities
（因為愛和崇拜）認為（某人）放的屁都是香的，滿眼都是（某人）的優點

think the sun shines out sb's backside: to love and admire someone so much that you do not think they have any bad qualities
（因為愛和崇拜）認為（某人）放的屁都是香的，滿眼都是（某人）的優點

third base: the third place a baseball player has to touch in order to score, or the position near this place played by a member of the team in the field

third party: a third person or organization less directly involved in a matter than the main people or organizations that are involved

third rail: a metal bar, running parallel with train tracks, that supplies electricity to some types of train
（用以給電力火車輸入電流的）第三軌

third-degree burn: a very serious burn in which the flesh is destroyed

third-party insurance: insurance that will pay money to a person or group damaged in some way by the person or group who has this insurance
第三方保險（當投保人導致第三方個人或團體生命財產損失時為其支付賠償金的險種）

thirst after: to feel very strongly that you want and need a particular thing

thirst for: to feel very strongly that you want and need a particular thing

thirsty work: hard physical work that makes you thirsty

this is the life!: said to mean that you are very much enjoying the situation you are in

this minute: now or a very short time ago

this side of: before reaching a particular age, date, place, etc.
不到（某年齡）；在（某日期）之前；在（某地方）之外

this vale of tears: This vale of tears is the world we live in, seen as sad and difficult.

this, our, etc. neck of the woods: this, our, etc. part of a particular area

thoracic outlet syndrome: a group of disorders affecting the shoulders, neck, arms, and hands that can cause pain, loss of feeling, or the feeling of a lot of sharp points being put quickly and lightly into the body

thorn in your flesh: a person or thing that repeatedly annoys you or causes you pain

thorn in your side: a person or thing that repeatedly annoys you or causes you pain

those were the days: something you say that means life was better at the time in the past that you are talking about
那時候可真好，那才是好時光

those whom the gods love die young: sometimes said when someone has died young

thought out: If something is carefully/well/badly thought out, it is carefully/well/badly planned.
經過（仔細或倉促）考慮的

thrash metal: a very fast type of heavy metal music, that also has some features of punk rock
鞭撻金屬樂（一種快節奏的重金屬搖滾樂，具有朋克搖滾樂的某些特點）

to move carefully through a crowded space, changing direction in order to avoid people or things
（避開障礙）穿過，通過（擁擠地帶）

三獅（英格蘭足球隊球衣上的官方標誌）

（政黨領袖要求該黨議員按照黨的要求投票的）緊急指令

three-piece suit: a matching jacket, trousers, and waistcoat (= a top without sleeves that is worn over a shirt) especially for men

three-piece suite: 三件套傢俱（包括一個沙發和兩把配套椅子）

three-point turn: a method of turning a car round to face the other direction by moving forwards across the road, then backwards in the opposite direction across the road and then forwards again

three-quarter length: A three-quarter length coat is between the length of a jacket and a coat.
（大衣）四分之三長的，七分長的

閉塞性血栓血管炎，血栓閉塞性脈管炎

throttle down: to reduce speed, or to reduce the power and speed being produced by an engine

through ball: in football, a pass that is kicked forward between an opposing team's defenders
（足球比賽中）在對方防守隊員間穿過的傳球

through route: a road that avoids the centre of a town or city

through thick and thin: If you support or stay with someone through thick and thin, you always support or stay with them, even if there are problems or difficulties.
不顧艱難險阻，在任何情況下，赴湯蹈火

through traffic: traffic that does not want to stop in a town

throw a curve: to surprise someone with something that is difficult or unpleasant to deal with

throw up: to produce new problems or ideas
UK informal If you throw up your job, you choose to leave it or stop doing it.

throw your money/cash around: to spend money, especially in an obvious and careless way, on things that are not necessary

throw money/cash around: to spend money, especially in an obvious and careless way, on things that are not necessary

throw a monkey wrench in the works: to do something that prevents a plan or activity from succeeding

throw a wrench in the works: to do something that prevents a plan or activity from succeeding

throw caution to the wind: to do something without worrying about the risk or negative results

throw caution to the winds: to do something without worrying about the risk or negative results

throw down the gauntlet: to invite someone to fight or compete with you

thyroid-stimulating hormone: a hormone that makes the thyroid gland produce a substance that helps the metabolism of almost every tissue in the body

tick by: If time ticks away/by, it goes past.

tick over: US tick along UK If a business, job, or system is ticking over, it continues to work but makes little progress.
（生意、工作或系統幾乎沒有進展地）進度緩慢
If the engine of a vehicle is ticking over, the engine is operating slowly although the vehicle is not moving.

（過去使用的）自動收報機用紙帶，電報紙條（用以列印不斷變化的訊息，如股價）
a moving area on a screen that shows changing information such as share prices
（螢幕上用文字顯示新聞或股價的）滾動資訊區

tickle sb's fancy: If something tickles your fancy, you like it and want to have it.

SEA: an extremely large wave caused by movement of the earth under the sea, often caused by an earthquake (= a shaking of the earth)
LARGE NUMBER: a sudden large number of things

tide pool: a small area of sea water contained by the rocks or sand around it when the tide goes out

tide table: a list of the times at which the tide in a particular place is high each day

M often passive: [ M often passive ] to limit someone's freedom
tie down: to make someone give you a clear decision
to hold someone or something in place with ropes

tie in: When ideas or statements tie in, they agree or are closely connected, and if you tie them in, you make them agree or connect closely.

tie in with: to plan an event or activity so that it combines with or happens at the same time as another, or to be planned in this way

tied cottage: a house owned by your employer that you can live in for as long as you are employed in a particular job

tied house: a pub that is owned by a particular beer company and only sells that company's products

tied to your mother's/wife's apron strin: If you say that someone, especially a man, is tied to his mother's/wife's apron strings, it means that he is strongly influenced and controlled by that person.

tighten the net: (especially of the police) to become closer to catching someone, especially a criminal
（尤指警方）收攏（抓捕罪犯的）網

tighten your belt: to spend less money than you did before because you have less money

向風車挑戰；跟實際不存在的敵人戰鬥

打破平衡／使天平傾斜；起決定性作用

tilt the scales: If something tilts the balance, it is the thing that causes a particular situation to happen or a particular decision to be made when other situations or decisions are possible.
打破平衡／使天平傾斜；起決定性作用

time and a half: the usual pay for a job with half the usual pay added on to it
相當於平時一倍半的（加班）工資

time and tide wait for no man: said to emphasize that people cannot stop the passing of time, and therefore should not delay doing things

BOMB: a bomb containing a device that makes it explode at a particular time
DIFFICULT SITUATION: a situation that is likely to become difficult to deal with or control

time capsule: a container that is filled with objects considered to be typical of the present period in history and then buried, so that it can be dug up and studied much later
時間膠囊；時代文物密藏器（裝入具有時代特徵的物件後埋入地下，以供後世發掘研究）

time clock: a clock which employees use to record the particular point in the day at which they arrive at and leave work

time flies: used to mean that time passes surprisingly quickly

time frame: a period of days, weeks, months, etc. within which an activity is intended to happen

time is of the essence: said to encourage someone to hurry

time is on sb's side: If you say that time is on your side, or that you have time on your side, you mean that you do not have to do quickly whatever it is that you want or have to do.

time limit: the greatest length of time someone is allowed to spend doing something

time off in lieu: time that an employee who has worked extra hours may take off from work

time signature: a symbol, usually in the form of two numbers, one above the other, written at the beginning of a piece of music to show how many beats there are in each bar

time travel: the idea of travelling into the past or the future

time traveller: someone who can move between different times in the past or the future

time warp: the idea of a change in the measurement of time, in which people and events from one part of history are imagined as existing in another part

be/live in a time warp figurative
to be old-fashioned in your behaviour or opinions
（行為或意見等）老式的，過時的，守舊的

time zone: one of many equal parts into which the world is divided. In any place within each part, the particular point in the day is the same, and is an hour in front of or behind that in the parts on either side

time's a great healer: said to mean that a painful or difficult situation will seem less bad as time passes
時間是治癒創傷的良藥。

（尤指工商業領域的）時間與動作研究（旨在找到最有效率的工作方法）

timed ticket: a ticket that allows you to go into a place, such as a famous building that the public is able to visit, at a particular time

tin opener: a device for opening tins of food

tip over: to (cause to) fall over onto one side

tip of the iceberg: a small, noticeable part of a problem, the total size of which is really much greater

tip the balance: If something tips the balance or tips the scales, it is the thing that causes a particular situation to happen or a particular decision to be made, when other situations or decisions are possible.
打破平衡局面；起決定性作用

tip the scales: If something tips the balance or tips the scales, it is the thing that causes a particular situation to happen or a particular decision to be made, when other situations or decisions are possible.
打破平衡局面；起決定性作用

tip truck: a large truck for transporting heavy loads, with a back part that can be raised at one end so that its contents fall out

tip your hand: If you tip your hand, you say what you are going to do or what you believe when you have been keeping it secret.

tipper truck: 自卸車，翻斗車（同 dumper truck）

tipper lorry: 自卸車，翻斗車（同 dumper truck）

tipping point: the time at which a change or an effect cannot be stopped

tiptoe around: to avoid dealing with a difficult subject, problem, or person
迴避（難應付的話題、問題或人）

tire of: to become bored with someone or something, or to stop enjoying an activity

tire pressure: 輪胎氣壓，輪胎內壓（tyre pressure 的美式拼法）

tired out: very much in need of rest or sleep

tissue culture: the scientific process of growing tissue (= cells) outside an organism, in a substance containing the necessary nutrients
組織培養（在實驗室中於某一有機體外培養組織細胞的科學過程）
a particular quantity of tissue grown in this way

tit for tat: actions done intentionally to punish other people because they have done something unpleasant to you

title bar: the long, narrow coloured part along the top of your computer screen that shows the title of the document or program that is open
（電腦螢幕頂部的）標題列，標題條

title deed: a document that states and proves a person's legal right to own a piece of land or a building
所有權證書，產權證；房契

title page: a page at the front of a book on which you find the name of the book, the writer, and the publisher

title role: A title role in a play or film is the character referred to in its name, usually the main part

title track: the piece of music on an album that has the same name as the album itself
（曲名與唱片標題一樣的）標題歌曲，標題音樂

tjanting tool: a tool for putting wax onto cloth before it is dyed (= has had colour put on it), so that that area will not be coloured
（給布染色時使用的）爪哇式塗蠟器

to add insult to injury: said when you feel that someone has made a bad situation worse by doing something else to upset you
雪上加霜；往傷口上撒鹽

to and fro: in one direction and then in the opposite direction, a number of times

to be reckoned with: worth taking seriously because of being powerful, important, or good
須重視的；須認真處理的

to be wise after the event: used to mean that it is easy to understand what you could have done to prevent something bad from happening after it has happened
事後聰明很容易；放馬後炮很容易

to begin with: at the start of a process, event, or situation
used to give the first important reason for something

to cap it all: used when you mention something in addition to all the other (bad) things that have happened

to coin a phrase: something you say before using an expression that has been very popular or used too much
套用一句流行的話；常言道；俗話說

to crown it all: used to say that something is the worst thing to happen in a series of unpleasant events

to die for: excellent or to be strongly wished for

something that you say that means that it is natural for people to make mistakes and it is important to forgive people when they do
人皆犯錯（寬恕是德）；凡人多舛誤（唯神能見宥）； 人非聖賢，孰能無過

to give credit where credit's due: an expression that means that you should praise someone who deserves it, although you might dislike some things about them

credit where credit's due: an expression that means that you should praise someone who deserves it, although you might dislike some things about them

to have arrived: to have achieved success and become famous

to hell: If you wish or hope to hell that something is true or that it will happen, you are saying how strongly you want it to be true or to happen.

to hell with: mainly US informal also US the hell with sb/sth used to say that you do not care about someone or something
讓…見鬼去吧（表示不在意某人或某事）

to my eye: used when giving your opinion about the appearance of something or someone

to put it mildly: used for saying that something is much more extreme than your words suggest
保守地說；說得好聽（或委婉）一點

更不用說；而且還； 遑論

to say the least: used to show that what you are describing is in fact much more serious or important than you have suggested

to sb's face: If you say something unpleasant to someone's face, you say it to them directly, when you are together.

to the bad: UK having lost or spent a particular amount of money as a result of something

to the best of my recollection: from what my memory tells me

to the bone: all the way through, or very badly

to the core: 徹頭徹尾的，完完全全的，完全的

to the gills: used in expressions to mean completely full

to the good: 大多數人有利的，有益於多數人的，普遍有好處的

to the gunwales: If something is filled to the gunwales, it is extremely full.

to the last: until something is complete or has been achieved
until the end of someone's life

to the letter: If you obey instructions or rules to the letter, you do exactly what you have been told to do, giving great attention to every detail.

to the life: If a picture or description is someone to the life, it is exactly like that person.

to the nth degree: as much or as far as possible

to the point: expressing something very important or suitable for the subject being discussed
中肯的，切中要點的，切題的

to top it all: If you have been describing bad things that happened, and then say that to top it all something else happened, you mean that the final thing was even worse.

to wit: used to make clearer or more particular something that you have already said

to your heart's content: If you do something to your heart's content, you do something enjoyable for as long as you want to do it.

to your name: If you have nothing or very little to your name, you own very little or have no money.
在自己名下，屬於自己所有

to give the devil his due: said when you admit that someone you do not like or admire does have some good qualities

give the devil his due: said when you admit that someone you do not like or admire does have some good qualities

to-ing and fro-ing: repeated movement from one place to another
also to-ings and fro-ings many different and repeated discussions and activities

to all intents and purposes: in all the most important ways
在所有主要方面；實際上

for all intents and purposes: in all the most important ways
在所有主要方面；實際上

toast rack: a device for holding pieces of toast that supports them vertically

toasting fork: a fork with a long handle used for holding slices of bread near a fire to make toast

toby jug: a drinking container traditionally shaped like a fat old man wearing a hat with three corners and smoking a pipe
小酒杯（這種小酒杯的形狀傳統上像一個頭戴三角帽、口叼煙鬥的胖老頭）
