今日北美，明日世界（用於表達希望已在一個地方取得成功之後，將來在其他地方仍要繼續取得成功）

toe cap: a hard covering to protect the toes in a shoe or boot

toe poke: a kick of a football, especially a hard kick, that is made using the end of your toe
（足球運動中，尤指以腳趾觸球方式）大力踢球
to kick a football with the end of your toe
以腳趾觸球方式踢足球

toffee apple: an apple covered with a sticky layer of toffee and held on a stick
（外塗乳脂，插在籤上的）太妃蘋果

toilet bag: a bag in which you put things for keeping yourself clean and tidy, especially when you are travelling
（尤指旅行時用的）盥洗用品袋

toilet brush: a brush with a long handle that is used to clean the inside of a toilet

toilet paper: soft paper, usually in a long roll, used to clean yourself when you have used the toilet

toilet roll: a long, narrow length of toilet paper, rolled around a cardboard cylinder

toilet soap: sweet-smelling soap that is intended for washing the body

toilet water: a weak perfume (= liquid with a pleasant smell, used on the skin)

toiletry bag: a bag in which you put things for keeping yourself clean and tidy, especially when you are travelling
（尤指旅行時用的）盥洗用品袋

toll bridge: a bridge that you pay to use

toll plaza: a place on a road where there is a line of tollbooths
收費廣場（道路上有一排收費口的地方）

toll road: a road that you pay to use

tomato ketchup: a sweet, red tomato sauce, eaten cold and usually poured from a bottle

tommy gun: a light machine gun (= a gun that fires many bullets quickly) that is held in the hand

tone in: UK When colours tone in, they match and look pleasant together.

tone language: a language in which the same series of sounds can represent different meanings, depending on how high or low they are spoken

tone poem: a piece of music for orchestra that represents a particular story, image, or mood

tongue depressor: US UK spatula a small piece of wood used by a doctor to hold someone's tongue down in order to examine their mouth or throat

tongue in cheek: If you say something tongue in cheek, you intend it to be understood as a joke, although you might appear to be serious.
meant to be understood as a joke, although it might appear to be serious

tongues wagging: If what someone says or does starts tongues wagging, it causes other people to start talking and guessing things about their private lives.

too bad: If you say something is too bad, you can mean either that you feel sympathy about a problem, or that you do not. The difference is in what is being talked about and the way that you say it.

too big for your boots: behaving as if you are more important than you really are

too good to be true: so good that it is hard to believe, or seeming very good but not real

too good to miss: If you say that something is too good to miss, you mean that it is a very good opportunity and that people should see it, do it, etc.

too little, too late: not enough of something that should have been provided earlier

too many chiefs and not enough Indians: too many managers and not enough people to do the work
官多兵少；將多兵少；動嘴的多，動手的少

too many cooks spoil the broth: said when there are too many people involved in trying to do the same thing, so that the final result will not be good
廚師太多燒壞湯；人多反倒誤事

too much information: used when you want to tell someone that what they have said should be kept private or is embarrassing

too much like hard work: If you say that an activity is too much like hard work, you do not want to do because it needs a lot of effort.

too much of a good thing: the fact that something pleasant becomes unpleasant because you have or do too much of it
好的東西太多了也會厭倦

too right: 一點不錯，太對了；太有道理了

tool up: to get together the equipment you need for doing or making something
將做某事（或製作某物）所需工具收齊準備好
to arm yourself (= get weapons ready) in preparation for something
武裝起來（準備應付某事的發生）

tooled up: carrying a weapon, especially a gun

tooth fairy: an imaginary being who children believe takes away a baby tooth that has come out and leaves them money instead
（兒童們相信的能取走他們脫落的乳牙並留下錢的）牙仙子

top and tail: to cut off the hard parts at each end of a fruit or vegetable when you prepare it for cooking
除去（水果或蔬菜）的兩頭

top brass: the people with the highest positions of authority, especially in the armed forces

top dog: a person who has achieved a position of authority

top floor: the highest level of a building

top half: the top half of a league table (= a list showing the position of teams who play against each other)

top hat: a tall, black or grey hat worn by men on some formal occasions, especially in the past

top secret: (of information) extremely secret and not to be told to anyone outside a particular group of people

top ten: the ten most popular or successful things in a group of similar things, or the ten things that someone likes best
（一組相似事物中）最受喜愛的十個
the set of ten songs that have been bought by the largest numbers of people in the previous week

top-up card: a card you can buy that gives you more time on your mobile phone

top-up fees: tuition fees , used especially around the time that these were first introduced in the UK in 2004

torch song: a song about love or about people in love
有關愛情（或戀愛中的人）的歌曲

tortilla chip: a small, fried piece of tortilla, often eaten with a spicy sauce

tortoiseshell butterfly: a type of butterfly with yellow, orange, and brown marks on its wings
（翅膀上有黃色、橙色及褐色斑點的）蛺蝶

toss off: to do something quickly, especially in a careless way or with little effort
（尤指粗枝大葉或輕而易舉地）快速做
to give someone sexual pleasure by rubbing their sex organs, or to do this to yourself

toss up: to throw a coin up into the air and guess which side will land facing up, as a way of making a decision
If you describe a situation as a toss-up, you mean that either of two possibilities is equally likely.

Total Football: an attacking style of playing football in which all the players in a team except the goalkeeper can change positions during the game
全攻全守足球，全能足球

tote bag: a large open bag with two handles, often made of strong cloth

totem pole: a tall wooden pole with symbols cut or painted on it that is part of the tradition of the Native Americans of the west coast of Canada and the northern US
（加拿大、美國北部西海岸美洲原住民的）圖騰柱

touch base: to talk to someone for a short time to find out how they are or what they think about something
與（某人）取得聯繫；聊聊，談談

touch down: When an aircraft touches down, it lands.

touch football: an informal type of American football in which players touch an opponent who has the ball instead of tackling him or her
觸身式橄欖球（一種非正式美式橄欖球，只允許觸碰球員，但不得抱人搶截）

touch on: to mention a subject quickly when speaking or writing about another subject
（說話或寫作時）簡略提到，觸及

touch upon: to mention a subject quickly when speaking or writing about another subject
（說話或寫作時）簡略提到，觸及

touch wood: said in order to avoid bad luck, either when you mention good luck that you have had in the past or when you mention hopes you have for the future

strike a raw nerve: 觸及（某人）痛處，使（某人）難過

strike a nerve: 觸及（某人）痛處，使（某人）難過

tough love: the fact of deliberately not showing too much kindness to a person who has a problem so that the person will start to solve their own problem
（為迫使某人解決自身問題採取的）強制手段

tough luck: said to show that you have no sympathy for someone's problems or difficulties

tour de force: an achievement or performance that shows great skill and attracts admiration

tour of duty: a period of time that someone, especially a soldier or an official, spends working in a foreign country
（尤指軍人或官員在國外的）服役期，工作期，任職期

Tourette's syndrome: a rare illness of the brain in which a person makes noises and movements that he or she cannot control, often saying offensive words without meaning to

tourist class: the ordinary travelling conditions passengers on a plane or ship get when they buy the cheapest tickets

tourist office: an office that supplies information to people who are visiting an area for pleasure or interest
旅遊資訊諮詢處；旅客服務中心

tourist trap: a crowded place that provides entertainment and things to buy for tourists, often at high prices
旅遊陷阱；敲遊客竹槓的地方

tow bar: a bar attached to the back of a car that is used for pulling a caravan or trailer
（用以牽引拖車的）牽引杆，拖杆

tow rope: a rope or chain that a vehicle uses to pull another vehicle

tow truck: a truck with special equipment for pulling a vehicle that is not working to a place where it can be repaired
（將故障車拖往修理廠的）救險車，拖車

towel rail: a horizontal bar on the wall, or a frame with a horizontal bar, used to hang towels on

tower above: to be much bigger and more successful than another thing of the same type

tower over: to be much bigger and more successful than another thing of the same type

tower block: a tall building divided into apartments or offices
（作公寓或辦公樓用的）高層建築，摩天大樓

town and gown: the university and the local people of a city, considered together
同一座城市內的大學和當地居民

town clerk: in the UK, an official responsible for acting on the decisions made by a town council
（英國的）鎮書記（負責執行鎮政務委員會作出的決定）

town council: the local government of a town

BUILDING: a building in which local government officials and employees work and have meetings

town house: a house in a town or city, usually a comfortable, expensive one in a fashionable area
（通常指時尚地段舒適而昂貴的）城鎮住宅，透天別墅

town meeting: a meeting of the people who live or pay taxes in a town, for the purpose of governing the town

town planning: the planning of the way in which towns and cities are built in order to make them pleasant to live in

toxic asset: a financial asset (= something a person or company owns) whose price has fallen by a large amount and that cannot be easily sold
（價格大幅下跌，不易轉售的金融資產）有毒資產

toxic debt: a debt or debts that have little chance of being paid back or of being paid back with interest
（幾乎沒有可能償還或付息的債務）毒債

toy boy: a young man who has a sexual or romantic relationship with an older woman
（年紀較大女性的）小情夫，小男友

toy with: to consider something or doing something, but not in a very serious way, and without making a decision
to touch an object or move it around with your hand, without any purpose but while thinking about something else

trace element: one of several types of simple chemical substance that are necessary for healthy growth and development, and exist in animals and plants in very small amounts

tracing paper: thin, transparent paper that you use for copying a picture by putting it on top of the picture and drawing over its lines

track and field: the general name for a particular group of sports in which people compete, including running, jumping, and throwing

track event: a sports event in which athletes compete with each other by running a race on a specially prepared circular path

track meet: a sports competition between two or more teams, involving various different running races and jumping and throwing events

track record: all the achievements or failures that someone or something has had in the past

track shoe: a shoe with short pointed pieces of metal or plastic attached to the bottom, worn by people who compete in running races

tracker dog: a dog specially trained to help the police find people they are looking for, using its sense of smell

tracking station: a place where electrical waves are used to follow the direction of objects, such as spacecraft, in space

tracksuit bottoms: soft, loose trousers that you wear for doing sport or exercise, or as informal clothing

tracksuit manager: a football manager who usually dresses in a tracksuit (= a sports top and trousers),rather than a formal suit, at games
（在足球比賽期間通常穿運動服而不是正式西裝指揮比賽的）運動服教練

tract house: one of a large number of very similar-looking houses built on a single area of land
（同一地塊上外觀十分相似的）住宅區房屋

traction engine: a large, heavy vehicle, operated by steam power, used especially in the past for pulling heavy loads along roads
（以蒸汽為動力、舊時尤用於牽引重物的）牽引機車，牽引車

trad jazz: a style of traditional jazz music, usually with a two-beat rhythm, that originally began in New Orleans in the US in the 1910s
傳統爵士樂（通常為兩拍，1910年代起源於美國新奧爾良）

trade deficit: a situation in which the value of goods a country imports (= buys from other countries) is greater than the value of goods it exports (= sells to other countries), or the size of this difference

trade fair: a large event at which companies show and sell their products and try to increase their business

trade figures: A country's trade figures are a record of how much the country has paid for goods that it has bought from other countries, compared with how much it has been paid for goods that it has sold to other countries

trade name: 商標；品牌名稱（同 brand name）

trade on: to use something, especially a characteristic, for your own advantage and usually in an unfair way

trade price: the price at which goods are sold to shops by the people who produce them, rather than the price which the customer usually pays in the shop

trade route: a route, often covering a long distance, that people buying and selling goods often used in the past

trade school: a school where students learn skills that involve working with their hands

trade secret: a piece of information about a product that is known only to the particular company that makes it
informal a piece of information that you are not willing to tell anyone

trade surplus: a situation in which the value of goods a country exports (= sells to other countries) is greater than the value of goods it imports (= buys from other countries), or the size of this difference

trade union: an organization that represents the people who work in a particular industry, protects their rights, and discusses their pay and working conditions with employers

trade up: to buy something, usually a house or car, that is of higher or lower value than the one you already have
買更貴／更便宜的東西（通常指房子或汽車）

trade down: to buy something, usually a house or car, that is of higher or lower value than the one you already have
買更貴／更便宜的東西（通常指房子或汽車）

tradesman's entrance: the side or back door of a large house, used, especially in the past, by people delivering goods who were not allowed to use the door at the front of the house

trading estate: 工業區，工業園區（同 industrial estate）

trading post: a small place, especially in the past, far from other places in which people live, where goods can be bought and sold or exchanged
（尤指舊時遠離人口居住區的）貿易站

traffic calming: the act of building raised areas, small roundabouts, or other similar structures on roads, usually roads where there are houses, so that vehicles are forced to move more slowly along them
交通緩行措施，減緩機動車速措施（通常在沿線有住宅區的道路上設置凸面、小環島或其他類似設施，迫使車輛減速）

traffic circle: a place where three or more roads join and traffic must go around a circular area in the middle, rather than straight across

traffic cone: a cone-shaped object that is usually red and white or yellow, used to keep vehicles away from an area of road temporarily, usually because repairs are being done to it
（通常因維修而暫時封閉某片道路用的）交通錐，錐形交通路標

traffic island: also island a raised area in the middle of a road where people who are crossing the road can wait safely for traffic to go past

traffic jam: a large number of vehicles close together and unable to move or moving very slowly

traffic light: one of a set of red, yellow, and green lights that control the movement of vehicles, usually at a point where two or more roads join

traffic police: police officers whose job is to direct the movement of vehicles on a road or to stop drivers who are breaking the law and give them an official notice of their offence

traffic warden: someone whose job is to make certain that people do not leave their cars in illegal places

trail away: When a person's voice or a similar sound trails away/off, it becomes quieter and less confident and then stops completely.
（說話聲或類似聲響）逐漸減弱到停止，逐漸消失

trail off: When a person's voice or a similar sound trails away/off, it becomes quieter and less confident and then stops completely.
（說話聲或類似聲響）逐漸減弱到停止，逐漸消失

trailer camping: the activity of going on holiday in a trailer

trailer park: an area of ground where trailers can be parked, especially by people using them as their homes
（尤指供度假者停車的）旅行拖車停車場

train set: a toy train and the tracks, equipment, toy houses, etc. that go with it
玩具火車（包括相關裝備、房屋等的成套玩具）

train wreck: something that fails completely or goes extremely badly

training bra: a piece of underwear for girls whose breasts are still developing
（乳房正在發育的女孩所用的）少女胸罩

training wheels: small wheels attached to each side of the back wheel of a bicycle to prevent it from falling over when a child is learning to ride it
（兒童學騎腳踏車時安裝在後輪兩側的）穩定輪

trans fat: a type of fat that is produced by hydrogenation (= when vegetable oil is made into solid fat) and is used in margarine, fried foods, etc.
反式脂肪，反型脂肪（將植物油製成固體脂肪時透過氫化生成的脂肪，用於人造奶油、油炸食品等）

Transcendental Meditation: a brand name for a method of making the mind calm and becoming relaxed by silently repeating a special word or series of words many times
超脫禪定法（透過默念真言來使內心平和的一種方法）

transfer fee: the amount of money that a sports team pays in order to buy a new player from another team

transfer list: a football or rugby team's list of players that are available to be sold
（足球或英式橄欖球球隊的）轉會名單，讓度名單
to offer a player for sale

transfer RNA: a type of RNA (= chemical in all living cells) that combines with a specific amino acid and carries it to the protein being made

transfer window: a short period within the football season during which clubs can buy and sell players
（足球賽季中允許俱樂部買賣隊員的一段時間）轉會視窗

transit camp: a place where refugees stay in tents or other temporary structures when they have nowhere to live permanently

transition metal: any of a group of metal chemical elements including copper and gold that show more than one valency (= the number of hydrogen atoms that can combine with one of its atoms to form a compound)

transport caf\u00e9: a cheap restaurant next to a main road, used mainly by truck drivers
（主要供卡車司機進餐的）路邊小餐館

transport plane: an aircraft used especially for taking soldiers or military supplies from one place to another

transport ship: a ship used especially for taking soldiers or military supplies from one place to another

transverse flute: a flute that is held to the side, like an orchestral flute, and not to the front, like a recorder

transverse wave: a wave moving through a substance in which the particles are vibrating (= moving quickly backwards and forwards) at a 90 degree angle to the direction of the wave

Trappist monk: a member of a Roman Catholic organization with very extreme rules, such as no talking
特拉普派僧侶（屬天主教，有極其嚴格的戒律，如保持緘默）

trash bag: a plastic bag put inside a bin to hold the waste and keep the container clean

trash can: （常置於室外的）垃圾箱，垃圾桶

trash can liner: a plastic bag put inside a bin to hold the waste and keep the container clean

travel adapter: a plug that connects a piece of electrical equipment brought from one country to the electricity supply in another when they cannot be connected directly, used especially when travelling

travel agency: a company or shop that makes travel arrangements for people

travel agent: a person or company that arranges tickets, hotel rooms, etc. for people going on holiday or making a journey
旅行代辦人；旅行代理商；旅行社

travel expenses: money that your employer pays you because you are spending that amount on travel that is necessary for your work

travel plug: a plug that connects a piece of electrical equipment brought from one country to the electricity supply in another when they cannot be connected directly, used especially when travelling

travel sickness: a feeling of illness, especially of needing to vomit, that some people get in a moving vehicle
旅行眩暈（指暈車、暈船、暈機）

traveller's cheque: a piece of paper that you buy from a bank or a travel company and that you can use as money or exchange for the local money of the country you visit

tread carefully: to speak or behave carefully to avoid upsetting or causing offence to anyone

tread gently: to speak or behave carefully to avoid upsetting or causing offence to anyone

tread lightly: to speak or behave carefully to avoid upsetting or causing offence to anyone

treasure hunt: a game in which the players are given a series of clues (= pieces of information) to direct them to a hidden prize

treasure trove: a place that is full of something good
UK a large amount of money or a large number of valuable objects found hidden somewhere and seeming to belong to no one

Treasury bond: an official US document showing that someone has lent money to the US government that will be paid back after ten years and on which interest will be paid twice a year

treble clef: a sign on a stave (= the five lines on which music is written) which shows that the notes are above middle C (= the C near the middle of a piano keyboard)

treble recorder: a recorder (= a wind instrument) with a slightly lower sound than the descant recorder

tree fern: a large tropical fern (= plant with leaves like feathers) with a thick stem

tree house: a small building, structure, or shelter built among the branches of a tree

tree hugger: someone who is very interested in protecting the environment
對保護環境非常感興趣的人

tree ring: one of the rings that you can see in a tree trunk (= centre part) if you cut through it. Each tree ring shows one year's growth.

tree surgeon: a person whose job is to take care of trees and make sure that they are healthy and safe, for example by cutting off branches that are damaged
（工作職責是保證樹木健康安全的）樹木保護人

tremble to think: If you say that you tremble to think about a possible future event, you are worried or frightened about it

trench coat: a long, loose coat with a belt, usually made from waterproof material (= not allowing water through) and similar in style to a military coat
（通常以防水材料製成、樣式類似軍大衣的）有腰帶的寬鬆大衣

trespass on: to take unfair advantage of a good quality in someone's character
不公正地利用，濫用（他人性格中的優點）

trespass upon: to take unfair advantage of a good quality in someone's character
不公正地利用，濫用（他人性格中的優點）

trestle table: a table that consists of a board supported by a trestle

trial and error: a way of achieving an aim or solving a problem by trying a number of different methods and learning from the mistakes that you make

trial run: a practical test of something new or unknown to discover its effectiveness

trials and tribulations: troubles and events that cause suffering

tribute band: a group of musicians who play the music of a famous pop group and pretend to be that group

trick of the trade: a clever method used by people who are experienced in a particular type of work or activity
（某一行業或活動的）絕招，絕活，門道

trick question: a question that makes you believe you should answer it in a particular way, when the real question is hidden or there is no right answer

trickle feed: the process of supplying continuous small amounts of something
滴流饋給（連續小量的供給某物）

tricuspid valve: the valve (= structure that opens and closes) in the heart that stops blood from returning into the right atrium (= upper space) from the right ventricle (= lower space)

tried and found wanting: tried and discovered to be not effective

trifle with: to treat someone or something carelessly or without respect

trigeminal neuralgia: a disorder of the trigeminal nerve that causes sudden short periods of severe pain in the face along the nerve

trigger finger: the finger that someone uses to shoot a gun
specialized medical a disorder of the tendon of a finger that makes it difficult to straighten the finger once it is bent
扳機指（手指彎曲後難以伸直的病症）

trigger food: a food that causes someone to have an allergic reaction
觸發食品（能使某人出現過敏反應的一種食物）

Trinidad and Tobago: a country in the Caribbean formed of two islands
千里達及托巴哥（由兩個島嶼組成的加勒比地區的國家）

trip up: to fall because you hit your foot on something, or to make someone fall by putting your foot in front of the other person's foot
informal to make a mistake, or to cause someone to make a mistake

trip off the tongue: Something that trips off the tongue is easy to say or pronounce

trip switch: a safety switch that automatically stops electricity from flowing to a machine if a dangerously large current is created by the machine failing to operate as it should
跳閘開關，跳脫開關（一種安全開關，機器故障不能正常運行而產生較大的危險電流時，它自動停止為機器供電）

triple glazing: three layers of glass in a door or window that are separated by air spaces to prevent heat from escaping from a room or to reduce the amount of noise coming in from outside

triple jump: a sports event in which the competitor jumps from one foot and lands on it, then jumps from one foot and lands on the other, and finally jumps with both feet

trisomy syndrome: a condition in which someone has three rather than two chromosomes in some or all of the body cells

trochlear nerve: either of the nerves that control certain muscles of the eye

Trojan horse: literary a person or thing that joins and deceives a group or organization in order to attack it from the inside
特洛伊木馬；（潛藏在內部的）顛覆分子
also Trojan a computer program that has been deliberately designed to destroy information, or allow someone to steal it
（特意用來破壞資訊或讓人偷竊資訊的電腦程式）特洛伊木馬，木馬

troop carrier: a vehicle, ship, or aircraft that has been designed for transporting a lot of soldiers
運兵車；運兵船；（運送軍人的）運輸機

trophic level: any of the layers of an ecosystem with the same position in the food chain

trophy cabinet: a piece of furniture with shelves that is used for storing sports trophies
the number of trophies that a sports team has ever won, or the number of medals, prizes, etc. that a sportsperson has won during his or her career
體育球隊贏得的獎盃；運動員在職業生涯中贏得的獎牌（和獎勵等）

trophy wife: a young, attractive woman who is the partner of a rich and successful older man and acts as a symbol of his social position
（年紀大的成功男人用來顯示社會地位的）花瓶妻子，嬌妻，花瓶女友

trophy girlfriend: a young, attractive woman who is the partner of a rich and successful older man and acts as a symbol of his social position
（年紀大的成功男人用來顯示社會地位的）花瓶妻子，嬌妻，花瓶女友

tropical rainforest: thick forest that grows in hot parts of the world

trouble spot: a place where trouble, especially political violence, happens regularly
多事地區，不安定地區；（尤指）政治暴力多發區

trouser press: a device for making or keeping trousers smooth by pressing them between two boards

trouser suit: a matching jacket and pair of trousers that is worn by women on formal occasions

trout pout: very big lips that women get if they have too much collagen put in their lips in an operation to make them look bigger
鱒魚嘴（豐唇手術中，因為唇中放入過量的膠原蛋白而形成非常大的嘴唇）

truant officer: an official who searches for truants and returns them to school
（搜尋逃學學生並將其送回學校的）訓導員，檢查員

truck farm: a small farm where fruit and vegetables are grown for selling to the public

truck stop: an area next to an important road with a restaurant, fuel, and repair services, where the main customers are truck drivers wanting to eat and drink cheaply
貨車停歇站，（主要為貨車司機服務的）路邊廉價餐館

truckle bed: a low bed on wheels that is stored under an ordinary bed ready for use by visitors
（不用時可推入大床下的）裝有腳輪的矮床

trudge through: to do work or a particular task slowly and with effort or difficulty
艱難地做（工作），費力地完成（任務）

true love: literary a person that you love

true north: the direction towards the top of the earth along an imaginary line at an angle of 90° to the equator
真北（地球北極的方向，沿著一條想像的直線與赤道成90度）

true to life: showing things and people as they really are, or seeming to be real
栩栩如生的；逼真的；真實的

true-life story: a story that is based on real rather than imaginary events
以事實為依據的故事；紀實的故事

trump card: an advantage that makes you more likely to succeed than other people, especially something that other people do not know about
獨有的優勢，獨門法寶；王牌；絕招

trundle bed: a low bed on wheels that is stored under an ordinary bed ready for use by visitors
（不用時可推入大床下的）裝有腳輪的矮床

trunk road: an important road for travelling long distances at high speed

trust fund: an amount of money that is being controlled for a person or organization by another person or organization

truth is stranger than fiction: said when you want to emphasize that real events or things are sometimes stranger than imaginary ones

truth will out: said to show that you believe the truth will always be discovered

try it on: to deceive someone or behave badly, especially in order to discover how much of your bad behaviour will be allowed
向…行騙；對…粗魯無禮；耍弄

try out for: to compete for a position in a sports team or a part in a play
參加（運動隊的）選拔；參加（劇組的）試演

try your hand at: to try doing something for the first time

try your luck: to try to achieve something although you know you might not succeed

tsetse fly: one of various types of African fly that feed on blood and can give serious diseases to the person or animal they bite
舌蠅，采采蠅（非洲一種吸吮人和動物血液並傳播嚴重疾病的蒼蠅）

tu-whit tu-whoo: used in writing to represent the sound made by an owl

tube feeding: providing food through a tube into the stomach or other parts of the digestive system for patients who are cannot eat through the mouth
（通過導管直接將食物送到無法進食的患者的胃或其他消化系統裡）導管餵食

tug at/touch your forelock: to show respect to someone in a higher position than you in a way that seems old-fashioned

tug of love: used, especially in newspapers, to refer to a situation in which one of the separated parents of a child takes care of the child but the other parent claims that right, or a situation in which a child is being taken care of by people other than the child's parents but the parents claim that right
（尤指報章用語）監護權的爭奪，「奪子戰爭」

tug of war: a type of sport in which two teams show their strength by pulling against each other at the opposite ends of a rope, and each team tries to pull the other over a line on the ground

tuition fees: money that a student pays to a university for their teaching

tumble dryer: a machine that dries wet clothes by turning them in hot air

tune out: to ignore someone or not give your attention to something or to what is happening around you

tune up: If musicians who are preparing to play tune up their instruments, they make small changes to them so that they produce the correct notes.
to prepare for something, or to prepare something for something, especially by making small changes to improve it
（尤指通過作出細微改變）為…做好準備

tune in: to watch or listen to a particular television or radio programme or station
to have a good understanding of what is happening in a situation or what other people are thinking

tuning fork: a metal object with two long, thin parts, joined to a short handle, that, when hit gently, produces a particular note. It is used for tuning musical instruments.

tuning peg: a short wooden or metal stick with a flat, rounded end that is turned to make the strings on a musical instrument tighter or looser

SEEING: a medical condition that makes someone see only things that are directly in front of them
管狀視，視野狹隘（一種眼疾）
THINKING: disapproving the fact that someone considers only one part of a problem or situation, or holds a single opinion rather than having a more general understanding

turf war: a fight or an argument to decide who controls an area or an activity

Turkish bath: a health treatment in which you sit in a room full of steam and are then massaged (= rubbed) and washed, or a building in which this treatment is available
土耳其浴，蒸汽浴；蒸汽浴室

Turkish delight: a soft type of sweet, usually in the form of square pieces covered with powdered sugar

turn against: to start not to like or agree with someone or something, or to make someone do this
（使某人）不喜歡；（使某人）不贊成；（使某人）與…為敵

turn back: to return in the direction you have come from, or to make someone do this
（使某人）折回，（使某人）原路返回

turn into: to change and become someone or something different, or to make someone or something do this

turn over: to change to a different television station
to use or allow something to be used for a different purpose
to think about something for a period of time

turn to: If you turn to a particular subject, or you turn your thoughts or attention to it, you begin to speak, think, or write about it.
注意，關注；將（注意力等）轉移到…上

turn a blind eye: to ignore something that you know is wrong

turn a deaf ear: to ignore someone when they complain or ask for something
不理睬，充耳不聞，置若罔聞

turn a place inside out: to search every part of a place very carefully

turn away: to not allow someone to enter a place

turn back the clock: to remember or imagine times in the past

turn in: to return something to an organization or a person in authority
UK to produce results, usually good results

turn in your grave: If you say that a dead person would turn in their grave, you mean that they would be very angry or upset about something.
在九泉之下也不得安寧；氣得（或由於不安）在墳墓中輾轉反側；將死人氣活

turn into a pumpkin: used when saying what time you usually go home or go to bed at night

turn of phrase: the ability to express yourself well

turn off: to stop someone feeling interested or excited, especially sexually
使（某人）失去興趣（尤指性慾）

turn on: to start to show a particular quality

turn on the waterworks: to start crying, especially too much or in a way that does not seem sincere
（尤指過分、不必要或假惺惺地）哭起來

turn out: to produce or make something, often quickly or in large amounts
mainly UK If you turn out a container or the things in it, you empty it completely.

turn over a new leaf: to start behaving in a better way
翻開新的一頁；改過自新

turn sb's head: If something turns someone's head, it has an influence on how that person behaves, especially by making them too proud.

turn sb's stomach: to make someone feel sick, often because they are angry or upset about something
使倒胃，使感到噁心；使不舒服，使反感

turn signal: one of the lights at the front and back of a road vehicle that flash to show which way the vehicle is turning

turn somewhere/sth over: to steal something from a place or to search it, making it very untidy or causing damage

turn tail: to turn around and run away, usually because you are frightened

turn the corner: If a situation turns the corner, it starts to improve after a difficult period.

turn the other cheek: to not do anything to hurt someone who has hurt you
（受到傷害後）不予還擊；容忍；甘受污辱

turn the spotlight on: to attract attention to something, usually to give information about something bad
把注意力集中於（某事）；聚焦於（某事）

turn the tables on: to change a situation so that you now have an advantage over someone who previously had an advantage over you
扭轉局面，轉而佔（某人的）上風

turn to jelly: to suddenly feel weak because you are frightened, nervous, or ill
（由於害怕、緊張或生病等）突然感到虛弱

turn up: to make a piece of clothing or part of a piece of clothing shorter, by folding the material and sewing it into position
informal to discover something, especially information, after a lot of searching

turn your back on: to stop being involved in something

turn your hand to: If you say that someone could turn their hand to an activity or skill, you mean they could do it well, despite having no experience of it.

turn your nose up: to not accept something because you do not think it is good enough for you

turn up trumps: to complete an activity successfully or to produce a good result, especially when you were not expected to
意外地成功；結果出乎意料地令人滿意

come up trumps: to complete an activity successfully or to produce a good result, especially when you were not expected to
意外地成功；結果出乎意料地令人滿意

turning circle: the amount of space a vehicle needs in order to go round in a complete circle
（車輛等掉頭用的）回轉空間，轉向圓

turning point: the time at which a situation starts to change in an important way

turtle dove: a small, pale brown bird that makes a soft pleasant sound

tussle with: to try hard to understand or deal with a difficult idea or problem

TV dinner: a meal that can be bought already prepared from a shop and just needs to be heated before being eaten, especially while watching television
（只需加熱即可食用的）電視便餐

twelfth man: in a cricket team, a reserve (= extra player)
（板球運動中的）替補隊員，預備隊員
used to refer to the football supporters at a game when they are giving good support to their team and have the same value as an extra player
足球比賽中為球隊提供有力支持的球迷（他們的存在仿佛使球隊增加了一名球員）

Twelfth Night: 6 January, twelve days after Christmas, or the evening before
主顯節之夜；主顯節前夕（1月6日，聖誕節12天以後）

twelve-bar blues: the standard form of blues song, consisting of three parts that are each four bars long
十二小節藍調（標準的藍調歌曲，由三部分組成，每部分四小節長）

twelve-tone scale: a musical scale including all twelve half steps (= smallest differences in sound) in an octave (= series of eight notes)

twenty-four seven: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week; all the time
全天候（地）；每時每刻（地）；實時（地）

twenty-twenty vision: perfect sight, especially as measured by a standard test

twiddle your thumbs: to do nothing for a period of time, usually while you are waiting for something to happen

twilight years: the last years of someone's life

twilight zone: an area where two different ways of life or states of existence meet
（介於兩種生活方式或生存狀態之間的）過度區域；過度狀態，模糊狀態

twin bed: one of a pair of two beds that are each big enough for one person

twin town: a town or city that shares planned activities and visits with a similar town in another country

twist sb's arm: to persuade someone to do something they do not want to do
強迫（某人），向（某人）施加壓力

twist tie: a short piece of wire covered in plastic or paper that is used to fasten a plastic bag
（用於綁緊塑膠袋口的）包塑金屬絲，包紙金屬絲

twist the knife: to make someone who is annoyed, worried, or upset feel even worse
揭人傷疤；往傷口上撒鹽

turn the knife: to make someone who is annoyed, worried, or upset feel even worse
揭人傷疤；往傷口上撒鹽

two can play at that game: something that you say when you intend to harm someone in the same way as they harmed you
（表示要進行報復）你這一套我也會

two fingers: in Britain, a sign that is considered rude, made by holding your hand up with your palm facing towards you and your first and second fingers held in a V shape
（手心向裡，食指和中指比成V的表示侮辱的）V形手勢

two's company, three's a crowd: said when two people are relaxed and enjoying each other's company but another person would make them feel less comfortable

two-footed tackle: in football, an illegal tackle in which a player jumps or slides forwards with both legs stretched towards an opposing player

two-up two-down: a small house on two levels that has just two main rooms on the ground floor and two bedrooms on the top floor
兩上兩下的小房屋（指樓下有兩間主要的房間，樓上有兩間臥室）

two-way mirror: a mirror that can be used in the usual way from one side but is transparent from the other side and can therefore be used to watch people without them knowing
雙向鏡，單向透明鏡（從一面看是鏡子，從另一面看是透明的）

typhoid fever: an infectious disease spread by dirty water and food, causing a high body temperature, red spots on the upper body, severe pains in the bowels, and sometimes death

tyre pressure: a measurement of how much air is in a tyre

LETTER: the 21st letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第21個字母）
FILM: universal : in the UK, a film or a symbol for a film that is considered suitable for children of any age
universal : used in the UK to refer to a film that is considered suitable for children of any age
（英國）電影 U 級的，適合各年齡段的人觀看的（universal的縮寫）
UPPER-CLASS: UK old-fashioned (of behaviour or ways of speaking) acceptable to or expected to be used by people of high social class
（指舉止和說話腔調）是上流階級的

ugly duckling: someone or something that is ugly and not successful when young or new but will later become beautiful or successful
醜小鴨（年少或剛問世時難看平庸、日後變得漂亮或出眾的人或物）

ulnar wrist pain: pain in the wrist on the side opposite the thumb

umbilical cord: the long, tube-like structure that connects a baby that has not yet been born to its mother's placenta (= the organ that provides it with food and oxygen)

unaccounted for: If a person is unaccounted for, it is not known where they are or whether they are still alive.
If something such as an amount of money is unaccounted for, it is not present and there is no explanation for what has happened to it.

uncared for: not taken care of well enough

uncivilized hour: a very early or very late time in the day
（因為太早或太晚而）很不合適的時間

Uncle Sam: the US, or its government, sometimes represented by an image of a tall, thin man with a white beard and a tall hat
山姆大叔（指美國或美國政府，有時以一個留白鬚、頭戴高禮帽的瘦高個男子的形象出現，尤見於政治漫畫中）

Uncle Tom: a black person who is considered to be too eager to agree with white people or too willing to be treated in a way that is not equal to white people
湯姆叔叔（指對白人曲意逢迎或逆來順受的黑人）

under arms: provided with weapons and willing to fight
處於備戰狀態；嚴陣以待

under lock and key: If a person, especially a criminal, is under lock and key, they are being kept in a place from which they cannot escape, usually a prison.
（尤指罪犯）在牢房裡的，在押的

under sail: travelling in a boat or ship with sails

under sb's roof: in a home that belongs to someone

under starter's orders: UK ready for the signal to start a race

under the cosh: UK informal If a football team is under the cosh, it is defending continuously.

under the counter: Things bought under the counter are bought secretly and illegally.
（購買東西）秘密地，暗地裡，非法地

under the heel of: completely controlled by something or someone

under the same roof: 在同一屋簷下；在同一座房屋裡

under the table: If something is done under the table, it is a secret, hidden action.

under the wire: If someone does something under the wire, they do it at the last possible moment.

under your breath: quietly so that other people cannot hear exactly what you are saying

under your feet: If someone is under your feet, they are near you in a way that is difficult and prevents you from doing what you want to do.

under your own steam: If you do something under your own steam, you do it without help.

undreamed of: Undreamed of wealth, success, or progress is better or greater than anyone would think possible.
（財富、成功或進步）做夢都沒想到的，意想不到的

unearned income: money that you get from investments and property that you own, instead of earning by working
（因投資、擁有房産等獲得的）非勞動所得

unemployment benefit: money that the government pays to unemployed people who are looking for a job

uneven bars: two horizontal bars of different height that are used in an event in women's gymnastics, or the event itself

unexplained gastrointestinal bleeding: bleeding from the digestive system for which the cause is not known
不明原因的消化道出血

Union Jack: the red, white, and blue flag of the UK

unit trust: a service where financial experts invest the money of many people in many different companies
單位信託投資公司（代客戶進行不同組合的投資）

United Church of Canada: a large Protestant Church in Canada that includes several Churches

universal indicator: a chemical solution made from a mixture of substances that produce many different colour changes according to different pH levels, used to discover how acid or alkaline something is
（化學上用的）通用指示劑（用來測定物質的酸鹼性）

universal joint: a joint in a machine or engine that connects two parts and allows movement in all directions

unknown quantity: a person or a thing whose abilities, powers, or effects are not yet known
未知數（尚未被人瞭解的人或事物）

until you are blue in the face: If you say or shout something until you are blue in the face, you are wasting your efforts because you will get no results.

unto thine own self be true: used to say that you should only do what you think is right.
只做自己認爲對的事情。

up and down: sometimes successful and sometimes not successful

up and down somewhere: everywhere in a particular area, especially an area that stretches from north to south

up and running: If something, especially a system or a machine, is up and running it is operating.

up for grabs: available and ready to be won or taken
人人都可以爭取，供大家爭取，提供給任何人

up in the air: If a matter is up in the air, it is uncertain, often because other matters have to be decided first.

up sticks: to take all the things that you own and go and live in a different place

up the ante: If you up the ante, you increase your demands or the risks in a situation in order to achieve a better result.
增加賭注；提高要求；提高風險

up the spout: 浪費掉的；毀掉的，毀壞的

up to: used to say that something is less than or equal to but not more than a stated value, number, or level
good enough for a particular activity
strong enough for a particular activity
強壯得能進行（某種活動）
RESPONSIBILITY: to be the responsibility of someone
DOING: be up to sth B1 informal
to be doing something, often something bad or illegal, usually secretly
（通常指偷偷地）正在做（常指壞事或不法之事）

up to a point: partly, or to a limited degree

up to date: modern, recent, or containing the latest information
現代的；最近的；包含最新資訊的

up to snuff: US informal as good as it should be; of an acceptable standard
達到可能實現的最好程度；達到可接受的標準

up to speed: If you are up to speed with a subject or activity, you have all the latest information about it and are able to do it well.
了解最新情況；跟上進度

up with: shouted or written on notices to show support
支援…，要求…（用於表示支持的口號或標語中）

up yours!: used to show that you very much dislike someone or the things that someone has just said or done

up to the hilt: Something that is done (up) to the hilt is done completely and without any limits

to the hilt: Something that is done (up) to the hilt is done completely and without any limits

up your alley: to be the type of thing that you are interested in or that you enjoy doing

down your alley: to be the type of thing that you are interested in or that you enjoy doing

upon my word!: 喲，嗨，哎呀（表示驚訝或生氣）

my word!: 喲，嗨，哎呀（表示驚訝或生氣）

upper airway resistance syndrome: a sleep disorder in which the passage that carries air through the mouth to the lungs becomes narrow during sleep so that someone does not sleep well and is tired during the day

upper case: If letters are in upper case, they are written as capitals.

upper class: a social group consisting of the people who have the highest social rank and who are usually rich
上流社會；上等階級；富人階層

upper house: one of the two parts that some parliaments are divided into

ups and downs: If someone or something experiences ups and downs, a mixture of good and bad things happens to him, her, or it.

upset the apple cart: to cause trouble, especially by spoiling someone's plans
製造麻煩；（尤指）打亂計劃

upside down: having the part that is usually at the top turned to be at the bottom

upwardly mobile: moving or able to move to a higher social class, for example by becoming richer

urban jungle: city life, especially the unpleasant parts of it
城市叢林，都市生活（尤指城市生活中令人厭惡的部分）

urban myth: a story or statement that is not true but is often repeated, and believed by many to be true
都市神話（廣為傳播、被許多人相信，但並不真實的故事）

urban renewal: the improvement and sometimes replacement of buildings in a city, especially of whole neighbourhoods of housing
都市環境改造；都市重建計畫

urethral stricture: the situation when the urethra (= the channel that carries urine from the bladder) becomes abnormally narrow

uric acid: an acid that is produced during metabolism (= the processes by which a living thing uses food for energy and growth) and is removed from the body in the urine

USB stick: a small piece of equipment that you connect to a computer or other piece of electronic equipment to copy and store information
採用通用序列匯流排介面的小型記憶體，随身碟

use your head: used to tell someone in a slightly angry way to think more carefully about what they are doing
（略有些生氣地告訴某人）動動腦子

use your loaf: used to tell someone in a slightly angry way to think more carefully about what they are doing
（用於表示對某人思考問題欠認真而稍為惱火時）多動動腦子，好好想想

user group: a group of people who are interested in a particular area of computer science or use the same product and who use the internet to share information about it
（電腦技術領域或某種產品的）使用者群組；用戶組

utility knife: a sharp knife with a short blade that can be replaced or put inside the handle if not being used

utility player: a player in a sports team who has the ability to play in several different positions, and often plays in different positions for their club

utility room: a room, especially in a house, where large pieces of useful equipment such as a washing machine can be kept and where things can be stored
（放置洗衣機等生活用品的）雜物室，儲物間

LETTER: the 22nd letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第22個字母）
NUMBER: also v the sign used in the Roman system for the number 5

vacant possession: the fact that no one is living in or using a house or property at the moment when someone buys it
空房（或空地）的合法佔用

vacuum cleaner: also vacuum, informal vac, UK also trademark Hoover a machine that cleans floors and other surfaces by sucking up dust and dirt

vacuum flask: a container that keeps hot liquids hot or cold liquids cold

vacuum pump: a piece of equipment for removing air or gas from a container, creating a vacuum inside

vaginal agenesis: a condition in which a girl is born without a vagina (= the part of the body that connects the outer sex organs with the womb)

Valentine's Day: 14 February , a day when you give a valentine card to someone you have, or would like to have, a romantic relationship with

valet parking: the service offered by a restaurant, hotel, etc. of putting your car in a parking space
（餐廳、飯店等提供的）代客泊車服務

valet service: the service of cleaning clothes offered by a hotel to people staying there
（飯店為房客提供的）洗衣服務

value judgment: a statement of how good or bad you think an idea or action is

valve disease: a condition in which one of the heart valves (= flaps that control the flow of blood) does not open or close properly, causing extra strain on the heart

valve-preserving aortic root repair: an operation to replace a section of the aorta (= the largest blood vessel) at a point where it leaves the heart, but keeping the heart valve
瓣膜保留主動脈根部重建

vampire bat: a small Central and South American flying animal that sucks blood from other animals

vanishing point: the point in a drawing or painting where parallel lines seem to meet at a distance

vanishing spray: a coloured liquid that can be sprayed onto a football pitch to make a temporary mark ten yards away from where a free kick is to be taken, used to show the defenders where to stand
消散性噴劑（足球比賽中罰任意球前，裁判用來在草皮上離罰球點10碼遠處標明防守隊員站立位置的噴劑）

vanity plates: number plates on a vehicle that have particular numbers or letters on them that the vehicle's owner has specially chosen and paid to have

vanity press: a publishing company where writers pay to have their books produced

vanity unit: a small cupboard that stands on the floor in a bathroom and has a washbasin (= a fixed bowl-shaped container for water) in the top
（帶有盥洗盆的）浴室櫃；組合式盥洗盆

PLACE: a place, especially a high place, that provides a good, clear view of an area
OPINION: formal a particular personal way of thinking or set of opinions

vapour trail: water vapour that looks like a line of white smoke behind an aircraft as it flies
（飛機飛行時留下的）凝結尾跡，拉煙

varicose vein: a swollen and often painful vein, especially in the legs

variety is the spice of life: said to emphasize that doing many different things, or often changing what you do, makes life interesting
豐富多彩的經歷會令生活充滿樂趣。

variety store: a shop that sells many different things, usually at low prices

various and sundry: 各種各樣的，許多不同的

vas deferens: the tube through which a male's sperm pass on the way out of the body

vascular disease: a disease affecting the blood vessels (= tubes that carry blood around the body)

Vatican City: an independent state in Rome, where the Pope lives and works

vee belt: a strip of material that is used to connect two turning parts in a machine

veg out: to relax and spend time doing very little

veggie burger: a type of food similar to a hamburger but made without meat, by pressing together small pieces of vegetables, seeds, etc. into a flat, round shape

vena cava: one of the two very large veins through which blood returns to the heart, one from the upper body and head and one from all of the body below the chest

vending machine: a machine from which you can buy small things such as cigarettes, drinks, and sweets by putting coins into it

venereal disease: a disease that is spread through sexual activity with an infected person

venetian blind: a cover for a window, usually made of thin, horizontal strips of wood, plastic, or metal, that can be moved in order to change the amount of light that is allowed in

Venn diagram: a mathematical plan consisting of overlapping circles that show how things that belong to mathematical sets relate to each other
（用圓表示集與集之間關係的）維恩圖

ventricular assist device: a piece of equipment that helps the heart pump blood to the rest of the body or the other side of the heart

ventriloquist's dummy: a toy in the shape of a small person that ventriloquists operate, so that it seems to be alive

venture capital: money that is invested or is available for investment in a new company, especially one that involves risk

venture on: to try to do something difficult or dangerous

venture upon: to try to do something difficult or dangerous

Venus flytrap: a plant that feeds on insects and catches them by quickly closing its leaves when their surface is touched so that the insects cannot escape

verbal diarrhoea: to talk continuously or too much

verge on: to be almost a particular state, quality, or feeling, especially one that is very bad or very good

vernal equinox: the time in the spring when the sun crosses the equator, and when night and day are of equal length

vertical blind: a cover for a window made of vertical strips of stiff cloth or plastic that can be moved in order to change the amount of light that is allowed in

vertical farm: a place where plants or livestock (= animals for food) are grown or kept in tall buildings with many floors

vertical gardening: the activity of making plants grow up a wall or out of a wall, often because there is not much space available on the ground

vertical integration: a process in business where a company buys another company that supplies it with goods or that buys goods from it in order to control all the processes of production
（公司為全面控制整個生產過程而進行的）垂直一體化，縱向結合

vertical take-off: a way of leaving the ground in which an aircraft rises straight up

very good: a way of saying yes to someone who is in a higher position or rank than you
（用於和比自己級別高的人說話）好的，是

very well: a way of saying yes to someone or of agreeing to do what someone asks

vested interest: a strong personal interest in something because you could get an advantage from it
people or organizations who have a financial or personal interest in a business, company, or existing system
既得利益人群；既得利益集團

veteran car: （1919年尤其是1905年前製造的）老式汽車，古董車，老爺車

Veterans Day: a legal holiday on 11 November in the US and Canada, when people honour members of their countries' armed forces who have fought in wars
退伍軍人節（美國和加拿大紀念陣亡將士的日子，定於11月11日）

Vicar of Christ: a title sometimes given to the Pope (= the leader of the Catholic Church)

vice chancellor: in the UK, the person in charge of a college or university
（英國大學或學院主持工作的）校長
in the US, the person in charge of some parts of a college or university
（美國大學或學院主管部分工作的）副校長

vice president: US abbreviation VP, US informal veep the person who has the position immediately below the president in some countries, and who is responsible for the president's duties if he or she is unable to do them
US the person who is responsible for a large, important part of a company or organization

vice ring: a group of people involved in immoral illegal activities, especially illegal sex or drugs
（尤指與性或毒品有關的）犯罪團夥

vice squad: a special group of police officers whose job is to stop crimes that involve sex and drugs

vice versa: used to say that what you have just said is also true in the opposite order
反過來也一樣，反之亦然

vicious circle: a continuing unpleasant situation, created when one problem causes another problem that then makes the first problem worse

victim support: the act of providing emotional and practical help for people who suffer because of a crime, or an organization that provides this
受害者扶助；受害者扶助組織

video camera: a camera that records moving pictures and sound either as a digital file or, especially in the past, onto special tape

video card: a circuit board (= small piece of electronic equipment) inside a computer that allows it to receive and show moving images

video conferencing: a system that allows two or more people who are in different parts of the world to talk to each other and see each other on television screens

video game: a game in which the player controls moving pictures on a screen by pressing buttons

video monitor: a device with a screen on which moving pictures can be shown

video technology: technology that involves the recording and playing back of moving pictures and sound
the use of cameras and other equipment to record events in a game of football, rugby, etc., in order to help the referee make decisions such as whether a ball completely crosses the goal line
（足球或橄欖球等比賽中用來協助裁判做決定的）錄影技術

videocassette recorder: a machine used to record and play television programmes or films on videocassettes

villain of the piece: The villain of the piece is someone or something that is seen as being the cause of trouble on a particular occasion.

vintage car: （1919至1930年間製造的）老式汽車，古董車，老爺車

virgin territory: a completely new area of activity

Virginia creeper: a vine (= climbing plant) often grown on walls, the leaves of which become dark red in autumn
五葉地錦（一種藤類植物）

virtual memory: space that can be used on the hard drive of a computer to store information temporarily so that there is more memory available when it is needed by software such as a computer game

virtual reality: a set of images and sounds, produced by a computer, that seem to represent a place or a situation that a person can take part in

visceral muscle: any of the muscles that work automatically and are found in the organs of the body such as the stomach and lungs

visit with: to spend time talking with someone you know

visiting hours: the times when you are allowed to go and spend time with someone who is in a hospital, prison, etc.

來賓登記簿；來客留言簿

visual aid: something that you are shown, such as a picture, film, or map, in order to help you understand or remember information

visual variant of Alzheimer's disease: a condition in which the back of the brain becomes damaged, so that someone gradually becomes unable to see

vital signs: signs that show the condition of someone's health, such as body temperature, rate of breathing, and heartbeat
生命跡象（一些顯示健康狀況的人體特徵，如體溫、呼吸率和心跳等）

OFFICIAL FACTS: a group of official facts that show such things as the number of births, deaths, and marriages in a particular country, area, etc.
生命統計，人口動態統計（顯示某個國家或地區人口的出生、死亡、婚姻狀況等）
WOMAN'S MEASUREMENTS: mainly UK old-fashioned humorous the measurements of a woman's breasts, waist, and hips

vitamin A: a vitamin found in foods such as butter, egg yolk, milk, and fish oils, or produced in the body from the carotene in green vegetables with a lot of leaves or in orange vegetables. It is important for normal growth, healthy skin, and the ability to see well, especially at night.

vitamin B complex: a group of vitamins that dissolve in water and are found in food

vitamin B1: a vitamin found in foods such as whole grains, brown rice, nuts, and liver. It is important for the production of energy from sugar and starch in the body and helping the heart, muscles, and nervous system to work well.

vitamin B12: a vitamin found in foods such as liver, kidney, eggs, fish, and milk. It is important for a healthy nervous system, normal growth, and the production of red blood cells.

vitamin B2: a vitamin found in foods such as liver, milk, cheese, yeast, and whole grains. It is important for the production of energy in the cells and for the production of particular hormones.

vitamin B6: a vitamin found in foods such as liver, yeast, fish, and bananas. It is important in chemical processes in the body, and for keeping the skin, digestion, and nervous system healthy.

vitamin C: a vitamin found in foods such as citrus fruit, green vegetables with a lot of leaves, tomatoes, and potatoes. It is important for healthy bones, joints, teeth, and gums (= the part of the mouth from which the teeth grow), and for fighting infection.

vitamin D: any of a group of vitamins, found in foods such as liver, some fish, and egg yolk, that are important for healthy bones and teeth

vitamin E: a vitamin found in foods such as vegetable oils, whole grains, green vegetables with a lot of leaves, and fish. It is important for healthy blood and cells.

vitamin K: a vitamin found in foods such as green vegetables with a lot of leaves, liver, vegetable oils, and egg yolk, important for healthy blood

vitreous humour: the thick, clear liquid substance inside the eye between the lens at the front and the retina at the back
玻璃體（水晶體與視網膜之間的無色透明膠狀體）

vocal cords: a pair of folds at the upper end of the throat whose edges move quickly backwards and forwards and produce sound when air from the lungs moves over them

vocational school: a school where students learn skills that involve working with their hands

voice box: an organ that contains the muscles that move to create the voice

voice recognition: the ability of a computer or other machine to understand spoken instructions or to recognize who a human voice belongs to

voice within you: your conscience (= the part of you that tells you when you are doing something wrong)

voltaic cell: a device that produces electricity by a chemical reaction

vote of confidence: formal an occasion when the members of a parliament or other organization are asked to say that they support the people in authority and agree with their actions
a sign that you are pleased with the quality of something or what someone has done or produced

vote of no confidence: an occasion when most of the members of a parliament or other organization say that they do not support the people in authority and that they disagree with their actions

vote of thanks: an act of formally and publicly thanking a person or organization for something they have done

vote with your feet: to show your opinion by leaving an organization or by no longer supporting, using, or buying something

voting machine: a machine used to automatically record and count votes in an election
選票計數器；選舉計票器

voting slip: a piece of paper on which people mark who they want to vote for in an election and then put into a box in order to vote for that person

vouch for: to say that you know from experience that something is true or good, or that someone is honest and has a good character

vox pop: the opinions of people recorded talking informally in public places
a broadcast for radio or television in which people going past in a public place are asked their opinion on a particular subject
（廣播或電視節目收集的）街頭民意調查

vulgar fraction: a fraction in which there is a horizontal line with one number above it and one number below it

LETTER: the 23rd letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第23個字母）
ELECTRICITY: 瓦，瓦特（電功率單位，watt的縮寫）

wade in: to start to do or say something in a forceful way, often without thinking about it carefully

wade into: to become involved in a difficult situation, often without thinking about it carefully

wafer biscuit: a light, sweet biscuit slightly thicker than a wafer with a soft sweet filling

wage freeze: an occasion when a company or government sets the amount paid to workers and will not allow any increases

wage packet: the money that you earn, especially when it is given to you in notes and coins in an envelope

wait a minute: said in order to interrupt someone or to get their attention, or when you have suddenly thought of something important

wait a moment: said in order to interrupt someone or to get their attention, or when you have suddenly thought of something important
等等，等一下（用於突然想起某件重要的事時）

wait a second: said in order to interrupt someone or to get their attention, or when you have suddenly thought of something important
等等，等一下（用於突然想起某件重要的事時）

wait around: to stay in a place and do nothing while you wait for someone to arrive or something to happen

UK used to tell someone not to not start until the correct moment

wait for: to delay serving a meal until someone arrives

wait in: to stay at home because you are expecting someone or something to arrive, or someone to phone you

wait in the wings: If someone or something is waiting in the wings, they are not yet active or important, but are ready or likely to be so soon.

wait on: to wait until you know the result of an activity before doing or deciding something

said when you are excited about seeing another person's reaction to something special or unusual
等到…吧（表示對看到某人對某些特別或不尋常之事的反應感到興奮）

wait up: to not go to bed at night because you are expecting someone to arrive

wait your turn: to wait until it is really your turn to do or get something

waiting game: a situation in which you delay taking any action, so that you can watch how a situation develops and see what it is best for you to do

waiting list: a list of people who have asked for something that is not immediately available but will be in the future

waiting room: a room in a place where people can sit while waiting, as in an airport or a doctor's office

wake up: to (cause to) become conscious after sleeping
（某人）醒來；叫醒（某人），弄醒（某人）

（使）（某人）清醒過來，（使）（某人）反應過來

wake up and smell the coffee: used to tell someone that they are wrong about a particular situation and must realize what is really happening

wake up to: to start to understand that a situation or problem exists

wake up!: If something that happens is a wake-up call, it should make you realize that you need to take action to change a situation.
a phone call that you arrange to be made, for example in a hotel, to wake you up at a certain time

wake-up call: If something that happens is a wake-up call, it should make you realize that you need to take action to change a situation.
a phone call that you arrange to be made, for example in a hotel, to wake you up at a certain time

walk all over: to treat someone very badly or defeat them very easily
虐待（某人）；輕鬆戰勝（某人）

to escape an accident without being badly hurt

walk into: to get a job very easily

walk of life: When people talk about walk(s) of life, they are referring to different types of jobs and different levels of society.
各行各業；各個社會階層

walk off: to walk in order to try and get rid of pain or an unpleasant feeling such as anger
散步消除（不適）；散步緩解（頭痛）；散步消（食）

walk off with: to steal something or take something without asking permission

walk on air: to feel extremely excited or happy

walk on eggs: If you are walking on eggs/eggshells, you are being very careful not to offend someone or do anything wrong.
小心翼翼地做事；小心謹慎

walk on eggshells: If you are walking on eggs/eggshells, you are being very careful not to offend someone or do anything wrong.
小心翼翼地做事；小心謹慎

to suddenly leave your husband, wife, or partner and end your relationship with them
to stop working or leave your job because of a disagreement with your employer

walk the walk: to show that something is true by your actions rather than your words

耐心地給（某人）示範…；詳細地教授（某人）…

walk-on part: A walk-on part in a play is a very small part in which the actor is on the stage for a short time and speaks very few or no words.
（戲劇裡的）跑龍套角色，小角色

walk a tightrope: If you walk/tread a tightrope, you have to deal with a difficult situation, especially one involving making a decision between two opposing plans of action.

走鋼絲；（尤指因進退兩難而）處境危險

walking frame: （老年人等用的）齊默式助行架

walking papers: If you give someone their walking papers, you ask that person to leave a place or a job because they have done something wrong.

wall hanging: a large piece of material or sewing that is hung on a wall as a decoration
（掛在牆上裝飾用的）壁毯，壁掛

Wall Street: a street in New York that represents the financial centre of the US

wallow in: to allow yourself to enjoy something completely
to remain in an unhappy emotional state without trying to get out of it, as if you are enjoying it or trying to get sympathy from other people

walls have ears: something you say to warn someone that it is not safe to speak at that particular time because other people might be listening

walrus moustache: a moustache that is long and hangs down at both sides of the mouth

want ad: （報刊上的）分類廣告（同 classified ad）

war bride: a girl or woman who, during a war, marries a member of the armed forces from a different country
戰時新娘（戰時嫁給其他國家軍人的女人）

war clouds are gathering: If you say that war clouds are gathering over a particular country, you mean that a war seems increasingly likely there.

war crime: a crime committed during a war that breaks the accepted international rules of war

war cry: a phrase or word shouted by people as they start to fight, intended to give them the strength and wish to fight harder

war dance: a formal dance, performed by some tribal people, either before they fight or after they have won a fight

war game: a pretend military battle that is performed only for the purpose of training

war memorial: a large structure, usually made of stone, that is built in honour of those people who died in a particular war

war zone: a place where people are fighting in a war

warm up: to heat food that has already been cooked
to entertain people while they are waiting for a performance to start, for example by telling jokes
節目開始前活躍觀眾氣氛（如講笑話）
to become warmer or to make someone or something warmer

warm to: US also warm up to sth If you warm to an idea, you start to become interested in or enthusiastic about it.
對…變得感興趣；對…變得熱衷

warning bells start to ring: used to describe an occasion when you realize that something is wrong
響起警鐘，意識到情況不妙

warning bells start to sound: used to describe an occasion when you realize that something is wrong
響起警鐘，意識到情況不妙

alarm bells start to ring: used to describe an occasion when you realize that something is wrong
響起警鐘，意識到情況不妙

alarm bells start to sound: used to describe an occasion when you realize that something is wrong
響起警鐘，意識到情況不妙

warrant officer: a middle rank in the armed forces

warts and all: describing or including all the bad qualities in a person's character, with no attempt to hide them
不隱瞞缺點的；不遮醜的

wash out: If a colour or dirty mark washes out, or if you wash it out, it disappears when you wash it.
If an event or sports competition is washed out, it is prevented from happening or stopped early because of heavy rain.

wash up: UK to clean the plates, pans, and other things that you have used for cooking and eating

wash off: to remove something with flowing water

wash your dirty linen in public: People who wash their dirty linen in public discuss, or allow to be discussed in public, matters that should be kept private.
在公開場合談論私密之事；家醜外揚

wash your hands of: If you wash your hands of something that you were previously responsible for, you intentionally stop being involved in it or connected with it in any way.

wash your mouth out: humorous an expression used humorously when someone has used a rude or offensive word
（讓說髒話者）淨嘴，嘴巴乾淨點

washboard stomach: a stomach that is very flat with well-developed muscles

NOT BRIGHT: Washed out cloth has become less bright as a result of being washed a lot.
TIRED: （感覺或看上去）極為疲憊的，筋疲力盡的

washed up: If you are washed up, you are no longer successful and you have no chance of success in the future.
（工作）不會再有成功的希望的，沒有前途的

washing machine: a machine for washing clothes, sheets, and other things made of cloth

washing powder: a detergent in the form of a powder or liquid that is used for washing clothes and other things made of cloth

washing liquid: a detergent in the form of a powder or liquid that is used for washing clothes and other things made of cloth

washing-up liquid: a thick liquid detergent, added to hot water when washing pans, knives and forks, etc.

Washington's Birthday: a US holiday on the third Monday in February when people remember George Washington and other former presidents
華盛頓誕辰日（美國節目，每年二月份的第三個星期一）

waste away: to gradually get thinner and weaker, in a way that is unhealthy

waste disposal: an electrical machine, connected to a kitchen sink, that cuts up food waste so that it will flow easily through the pipes
（安裝於廚房水槽下方用於切碎食物垃圾的）廢物處理機

waste not, want not: said to advise someone not to waste anything, because they might need it in the future

waste of space: a person or thing that is not useful or helpful

waste water 1: water that is not clean because it has already been used in homes, businesses, factories, etc.

water that is not clean because it has already been used in homes, businesses, factories, etc.
（家裡、公司或工廠等排出的）廢水

waste your breath: If you waste your breath, you spend time and energy trying to give advice that is ignored.

wasted on: If you say that something is wasted on someone, you mean that its quality is too high for that person and they will not understand its true value.
浪費在（某人）身上；用在（某人）身上就是浪費

wastepaper basket: an open container that stands on the floor inside buildings and is used for putting rubbish in, especially paper

wasting disease: a disease that causes a person to gradually become very thin and weak

watch it: used to tell someone to be careful

watch out: used to warn someone of danger or an accident that seems likely to happen

watch out for: to be careful to notice someone or something interesting

watch over: to protect someone and make certain that they are safe

閒著看油漆變乾（表示某事很無聊）

watch the clock: to often notice the time and wish that it was later, especially when you are doing work that you do not like

watch the world go by: to look at people as they go past

注意看著（精彩的情形即將發生）

watch your back: to be careful of the people around you, making certain that they do nothing to harm you

water bill: a regular charge that is made to people for the use of their local water supply

water bird: any bird that lives near or on water

water biscuit: a thin, hard biscuit, often eaten with cheese
水麵餅乾（一種薄而硬的餅乾，常配乳酪食用）

Indian English a bottle of water

water buffalo: a large Asian animal like a cow with horns that curve backwards, often used for pulling farming tools

water butt: a large container for collecting rain that can then be used to water plants
