water ice: （用果汁、水和糖調製的）冰糕（sorbet的舊稱）

water jump: an area of water with a fence before it, designed for people or horses to jump over in a competition
（障礙賽馬或賽跑中需越過的）水溝障礙

water lily: a plant whose large, flat leaves and cup-shaped petals float on the surface of lakes and pools

water main: the main underground pipe in a system of pipes supplying water to an area
自來水總管，自來水幹管

water meadow: a field that floods with water from a river when there is a lot of rain

water park: a large area containing several different pools, usually with equipment and activities for swimmers, that visitors pay to use

water pistol: a toy gun with which you can send out a stream of water to hit people or things

water polo: a game played in water in which two teams of swimmers try to get the ball into the other team's goal

water power: power that is obtained from water flowing from one level to a lower level

water softener: a substance or device that removes chemicals such as calcium from water

water sports: sports that take place on or in water
水上運動，水上體育項目

water supply: the water that is provided and treated for a particular area

water table: the level below the surface of the ground at which you start to find water

water tank: a large container for collecting rain that can then be used to water plants
（收集雨水用於澆灌植物的）水罐，水箱

water taxi: a small boat on a river or other area of water, operated by a person who you pay to take you where you want to go

water tower: a device to provide water pressure by positioning a large container for water on top of a tower-like structure

water under the bridge: problems that someone has had in the past that they do not worry about because they happened a long time ago and cannot now be changed
已成往事，不可改變的既成事實

water vapour: water in the form of a gas resulting from heating water or ice

watering can: a container for water with a handle and a long tube used for pouring water onto garden plants
（用於澆灌園藝植物的）長嘴噴水壺，灑水壺

watering hole: a pub or bar where people go to drink alcohol

watery grave: death by drowning (= dying because you cannot breathe underwater)

wattle and daub: a mixture of sticks, earth, and clay, used in some parts of the world as a building material
（一些地方用作建築材料的）抹灰籬笆牆，泥笆牆

wave after/upon wave: large quantities or groups of something, one after another
一波又一波；一批又一批

wave and pay: 非接觸式支付的，感應支付的（利用無線技術透過信用卡、轉帳卡以及行動電話支付）

wave goodbye to: to accept that you will no longer have something you value or that you will not get something you hoped to receive
向…揮手告別；不再指望得到…

wave the flag: to show support for the country, group, or organization that you belong to
（對自己的國家、團體或組織）表示擁護，搖旗呐喊

show the flag: to show support for the country, group, or organization that you belong to
（對自己的國家、團體或組織）表示擁護，搖旗呐喊

fly the flag: to show support for the country, group, or organization that you belong to
（對自己的國家、團體或組織）表示擁護，搖旗呐喊

wax and wane: to grow stronger and then weaker again

waxed paper: a type of paper that has a thin layer of wax on it and is used for wrapping food

way of life: the manner in which a person lives

way round: a way of dealing with or avoiding a problem
（解決或避免問題的）出路，解決辦法，餘地

way station: a place where people can stop when travelling from one place to another

way to go!: informal used to tell someone they have done well, or used humorously when someone has done something stupid
（用以表示贊同、興奮等或揶揄他人時）很好，真棒

way the wind blows: If a person tries to discover which way the wind blows/is blowing, they try to discover information about a situation, especially other people's opinions, before they take action.
看看風向，了解情況，探查形勢

direction the wind blows: If a person tries to discover which way the wind blows/is blowing, they try to discover information about a situation, especially other people's opinions, before they take action.
看看風向，了解情況，探查形勢

ways and means: The ways and means of achieving something are the methods and other things needed to make it happen.

weak acid: an acid with a pH of 5 or 6 whose molecules do not break down into smaller molecules or atoms in water

weak at the knees: If you go weak at the knees, you lose your strength and feel you are going to fall over, usually because of seeing or talking about either someone you are very attracted to or because of something unpleasant or frightening.
（通常指因看到或談到非常喜歡的人或讓人害怕的事而）膝蓋發軟的，腿發軟的

weak base: a base whose molecules do not break down into smaller molecules or atoms in water

weak force: a reaction between particles that causes some radioactive substances to break down
（引起放射性衰變的）弱力，弱核力，弱相互作用

weak form: the way that word is pronounced when there is no stress on it

weak link: a weak part, especially the weakest part of something

weapons of mass destruction: weapons, like nuclear bombs, that cause a lot of damage and kill many people

wear away: to become thin and disappear after repeated use or rubbing, or to cause something to become thin and disappear in this way

wear out: to use something so much that it is damaged and cannot be used any more, or to become damaged in this way

wear and tear: the damage that happens to an object in ordinary use during a period

wear off: If a feeling or the effect of something wears off, it gradually disappears.

wear on: If a period of time wears on, it seems to pass very slowly.

wear sackcloth and ashes: to show by your behaviour that you are very sorry for something you did that was wrong

wear the trousers: (especially of a woman) to be the person in a relationship who is in control and who makes decisions for both people
（尤指女性）掌權當家，佔主導地位

wear thin: If your patience wears thin, you become less and less patient.
If something such as a joke wears thin, it becomes boring or annoying or stops being funny or effective, because it has been seen, heard, or used too much.
（因出現太多而）失去吸引力（或趣味），不再有效

wear your heart on your sleeve: to make your feelings and emotions obvious rather than hiding them

weasel out: to avoid doing something that you have agreed to do, especially by being dishonest
（尤指不誠實地）推諉，逃避（答應過的事）

weasel words: something that someone says either to avoid answering a question clearly or to make someone believe something that is not true

weather balloon: a type of balloon that contains measuring instruments and that is sent into the air in order to find out information about weather conditions
（尤指用於天氣預報的）氣象氣球

weather forecast: a statement of what the weather is likely to be for the next day or few days, usually broadcast on television or radio or printed in a newspaper

weather forecaster: someone who scientifically studies weather conditions and says what the weather is likely to be in the future
天氣預報員；氣象研究員

weather station: a building or place where information is collected about local weather conditions

weather the storm: If someone or something weathers the storm, they successfully deal with a very difficult problem.

web address: 網路地址（電郵地址或網址）

web browser: a computer program that makes it possible for you to read information on the internet

web hosting: the service of keeping and managing websites on a server (= large central computer)

web page: a page of information on the internet about a particular subject, that forms (a part of) a website

web server: a computer system or program that sends websites and information to internet users

wedding list: a list of all the things that two people who are soon to be married would like to receive as presents, often kept at a particular shop
（即將結婚的情侶列出的希望收到作為新婚禮物的）婚禮物品清單

wedding planner: a person or company whose job is to organize weddings for other people

wedding reception: a party to celebrate the marriage ceremony of two people

wedding ring: a ring, usually made of gold, worn to show that you are married

wee hours: the early hours of the morning, between twelve o'clock at night and the time when the sun rises

wee small hours: the early hours of the morning, between twelve o'clock at night and the time when the sun rises

Weed Whacker: a brand name for an electric tool that is held in the hand and is used for cutting grass and weeds in places that are difficult to reach

weeping willow: a type of willow tree that has long, thin branches that hang down

weigh in: to be officially weighed before competing in a sport, especially boxing or horse racing
（尤指拳擊或賽馬比賽之前）量體重
informal to become involved in an argument or discussion in a forceful way

weigh on: If a problem or responsibility weighs on you, it makes you worried or unhappy.
（問題、責任等）使（某人）焦慮不安，使（某人）擔憂

weigh your words: to carefully think about everything you are going to say before you say it

weighing machine: a piece of equipment that you can stand on to find out your weight, or place an object on to find its weight

weight loss: the fact of a person's or an animal's body weight becoming less

weight training: the activity of lifting heavy objects for exercise, especially to improve the strength of muscles and the appearance of the body

weight-loss surgery: an operation that makes the stomach smaller so that less food can be eaten and digested
（通過使胃變小來達到目的的）減重手術

welcome mat: a small piece of strong material with "welcome" written on it that is put on the floor by the door to greet people as they come in

welcome wagon: used in phrases such as 'roll out the welcome wagon' and 'be greeted by the welcome wagon' to refer to a happy and friendly way of greeting people who are new to a place
US trademark the name of an organization that gives information about businesses and services in a town to people who have recently moved there
（為新居民提供商業及服務資訊的）歡迎機構

welfare state: a system that allows the government of a country to provide social services such as healthcare, unemployment benefit, etc. to people who need them, paid for by taxes

well adjusted: A well adjusted person is reasonable and has good judgment and theirbehaviour is not difficult or strange.

well appointed: having a good supply of comfortable or necessary furniture and attractive decorations
設備完善的；裝修豪華的

well argued: described or asked for in an effective and intelligent way
表述清楚的；有說服力的

well attended: If an event is well attended, many people are present at it.

well away: completely involved in what you are doing

well balanced: containing a mixture of ideas, people, etc. with each one being represented equally or fairly
A well-balanced group of foods together provide a good range of the things you need to stay healthy.
A well balanced person is calm and reasonable and shows good judgment.

well behaved: behaving in a way that is accepted as correct

PERSON: old-fashioned coming from a family that has a high social position
出身名門的；有高貴血統的
mainly UK speaking or behaving in a way that is generally considered correct and polite
有教養的；有修養的；彬彬有禮的
ANIMAL: (of horses, dogs, etc.) bred from parents who are both considered to be good quality animals

well brought up: People, especially children, who are well brought up are polite and act in a quiet and pleasant way, because they have been taught this behaviour at home.
（尤指孩子）有教養的，受過良好教育的

well built: A well-built person is large and strong.
豐滿的（fat 的禮貌性說法）
US having a strong, attractive body

well connected: having friends or family members who are important or powerful people
與顯貴人物有交情的；與有影響人士有來往的；很有背景的

well developed: having grown or increased in a positive way
發展良好的；發育良好的；健全的

well documented: 有大量檔記載的；書面證據充分的

well done: used as a way of praising someone and saying that you are pleased about and approve of something they have done
(of meat) cooked so that it is firm and has a grey-brown colour all the way through

well dressed: 衣著講究的；穿著時髦的

well earned: deserved because of what you have done or experienced

well educated: 受過良好教育的；有教養的

well endowed: having a lot of something, especially money or possessions
天賦甚多的；擁有很多（尤指金錢或財產）的
humorous approving (of a man) having large sexual organs, or (of a woman) having large breasts
（男性）陰莖粗大的；（女性）胸部豐滿的

well established: having a recognized position, or being generally known about

well founded: 有事實根據的；理由充分的

well groomed: having a neat and pleasant appearance that is produced with care
外表整潔的；衣冠楚楚的

well grounded: being based on or having a good knowledge of facts
基礎紮實的；根據充分的

well in: to have a good relationship with someone in which they like you and from which you get an advantage

well informed: having a lot of knowledge or information about a particular subject or things in general
（對某一話題或總體情況）非常熟悉的；消息靈通的

well intentioned: wanting to have good effects, but sometimes having bad effects that were not expected
出於好心的，本意良好的

TIDY: 乾淨整潔的；受到悉心照料的
HIDDEN: A well-kept secret has not been told or shown to anyone.

well known: known or recognized by many people

well mannered: behaving in a pleasant and polite way

well meaning: wanting to have a good effect, but not always achieving one

well meant: said or done in order to be helpful, but not always achieving this

HAVING A LOT: UK [ after verb ] having a lot of or a number of

well paid: earning or paying a lot of money
薪水高的，工資高的，報酬高的

well preserved: (especially of something old) kept in good condition
（尤指年代久遠的東西）保存完好的
mainly UK often humorous (of an older person) not looking as old as they really are
（上了年紀的人）保養得好的；不顯老的

well qualified: having suitable experience or formal qualifications

well read: Someone who is well read has learned a lot of information on different subjects by reading.
飽讀詩書的；博覽群書的；知識淵博的

well rounded: involving or having experience in a wide range of ideas or activities

well spoken: having a pleasant and polite way of speaking that is considered socially acceptable
（人）善於辭令的；談吐文雅的；說話得體的

well thought of: considered by other people as good; admired, and approved of

well thought out: 精心計劃的；經縝密思考的

well thumbed: A well thumbed book, magazine, etc. is one whose slightly damaged appearance shows that it has been used many times.
（書等）翻舊了的，讀過很多次的

well timed: happening or caused to happen at a suitable or effective time
及時的；適時的；不早不晚的

PERSON: (of a person) having been to many different places, especially to many different countries
ROAD: (of a road, route, etc.) used by many people

well tried: used many times before and known to be effective
經反覆驗證行之有效的，屢試不爽的

well trodden: 用過多次的；常被參觀的
used to refer to a set of actions that many people have done or a subject that many people have dealt with previously
（一系列活動）多次做過的；（問題）多次探討過的

well turned: expressed in an interesting and intelligent way
A well-turned phrase is expressed in a clear and pleasing way.

well woman: used to refer to health services provided for women/men

well man: used to refer to health services provided for women/men

well worn: Well worn clothes have been worn often and are becoming old.
used very often or too often

well what do you know!: something you say when you are surprised by a piece of information. This phrase is often used humorously to mean the opposite
（表驚訝時用，常借此幽默地表達相反的意義）真想不到！你說怪不怪！

what do you know!: something you say when you are surprised by a piece of information. This phrase is often used humorously to mean the opposite
（表驚訝時用，常借此幽默地表達相反的意義）真想不到！你說怪不怪！

well, I never (did)!: said when you are very surprised at something

Welsh rarebit: a piece of toast with cheese on it that is heated until the cheese melts

went out with the ark: If an object or method went out with the ark, it has not been used for a long time.

West Indian: (a person) of or from the West Indies

West Nile virus: a virus that is spread by mosquitoes (= small flying insects), can cause a fever, and seriously affects the brain in a small number of people

Western Sahara: a territory in North Africa where the Sahrawi people live

Western Saharan: belonging to or relating to the territory of Western Sahara or its people
西撒哈拉的；西撒哈拉人的
a person from the territory of Western Sahara

wet blanket: a person who says or does something that stops other people enjoying themselves

wet dream: a sexually exciting dream in a man that causes an ejaculation (= release of semen)

wet macular degeneration: a disease in older people in which blood vessels leak fluid into the most important part of the retina (= the area at the back of the eye that receives light), making it weaker and leading to problems when looking directly at objects and to loss of sight

wet nurse: in the past, a woman employed to give her breast milk to another woman's baby
to treat someone too carefully as if that person is unable to do anything himself or herself
悉心照料（無微不至地照顧某人，就好像受照顧者甚麼都做不了）

wet room: a bathroom in which the shower is not separated off from the rest of the room, and water from the shower is allowed to fall directly onto the floor and then flow away through a hole in the floor

wh- question: a question in English that is a request for information. Wh- questions usually start with a word beginning with wh-, but "how" is also included. The wh- words are: what, when, where, who, whom, which, whose, why, and how.

whack job: someone who is very strange or has mental problems

what a business!: used to mean that something was annoying and caused a lot of trouble for you

what an idea!: something you say to show that you think a suggestion is stupid

what are friends for?: said to a friend who has thanked you for doing something special for them

what are you going to do?: used to say that there is nothing you can do to make a situation better
（用於無計可施時）你又能有甚麼辦法？

what are you like?: used when someone has said or done something silly
（用於表示某人的言行很愚蠢）…怎麽這個樣子？

what do you bet?: used to say that it is very likely that something is true or will happen

what do you have to say for yourself?: used to ask someone to explain why they have done something bad
你還有甚麽好說的？ 你如何解釋？

what do you mean?: used to show that you are annoyed or that you disagree
（表示惱火或不同意）你這是甚麼意思？

a way of asking what the purpose of (doing) something is

what if?: used to ask about something that could happen in the future, especially something bad
如果（尤指糟糕的情況出現）會怎麼樣?

what is he, are they, etc. like?: said to ask someone to describe someone or something to you
他／她／它／他們（等等）是甚麼樣的?

what more do you want - jam on it?: used to say that someone should be grateful for what they have or have been offered, and not demand something better
知足常樂（用來表示某人應對其所擁有的或別人所提供的表示感激，而不應當得寸進尺）

what of it?: used to rudely say that you do not think something is important
那又怎麼樣呢？那又有甚麼關係？

what price...?: said when you think it is possible that the admiration, success, etc. that has been achieved was not worth all the suffering it has caused
名聲／勝利／成功等又有甚麼用？

what the blazes...?: used to give force to something you feel angry about
（用於增強憤怒的語氣）到底…？ 究竟…？

what the heck: used to say that you will do something although you know you should not do it
管它的（表示要做明知不應該做的事）

what the hell: said when you suddenly realize that your plan is not important to you and that you will do something else

what the hey: used to say that something does not matter: We're not going to make any money out of it, but what the hey.

what with: used to talk about the reasons for a particular situation, especially a bad or difficult situation
（尤指糟糕或困難的局面）因為，由於

what with one thing and another: You say what with one thing and another when you want to explain that the reason you have failed to do something is because you have been very busy.
因為事情一件接著一件，因為忙得不可開交

what you lose on the swings you gain on: said to mean that the positive and negative results of a situation or action balance each other
有得也有失；有利也有弊；失之東隅，收之桑榆

what you see is what you get: said to show that there is nothing hidden

what's cooking?: used to ask about what is happening or what someone is planning
發生甚麽事了？怎麽回事？要做什麼？

what's done is done: said when you cannot change something that has already happened

what's eating sb?: used to ask why someone seems angry or upset

what's it worth (to you)?: said when you want to know what someone will give you if you give them the piece of information they have asked for

what's more: used to add something surprising or interesting to what you have just said
而且；更有意思（或驚人）的是

what's not to like?: used to say that you think something is very good, and that nobody could disagree with your opinion
（表示認為非常好）有什麼不好的呢？

what's on: used to mean "what is happening". This phrase is often used as the title of the part of a newspaper that tells you about events and entertainment happening in the next week or month.
正在發生的事（常用在報紙的標題中，用來預告下週或下個月將發生的大事或娛樂事件）

what's sauce for the goose is sauce for: said to emphasize that if one person is allowed to do something or to behave in a particular way, then another person must be allowed to do that thing or behave in that way, too
適用於此者也應適用於彼；應該一視同仁

what's that all about (then)?: used when you do not understand why something or someone is so popular or fashionable
（用於表示不理解為甚麼某人或某物如此流行）那算是甚麼?

what's that about (then)?: used when you do not understand why something or someone is so popular or fashionable
（用於表示不理解為甚麼某人或某物如此流行）那算是甚麼?

what's the betting?: used to say that it is very likely that something is true or will happen
很可能（是真的或會發生）

what's the big idea?: used to ask someone why they have done something annoying

what's the damage?: used to ask how much you have to pay for something

what's the drill for sth?: used to ask what the usual, correct way of doing or getting something is
通常都怎麽辦？正確的步驟是甚麽？

what's the magic word?: said to a child who has not said "please" when asking for something
該怎麼說呢？（讓孩子要東西時說「請」字的用語）

what's the score?: used to ask someone about what is going to happen, especially when arrangements have been confused
（尤指安排被打亂時）情況怎麽樣？

what's the use of...?: used to tell someone to stop worrying because worrying will not help
（用於勸告某人不要爲某事擔心）…有甚麽用?

what's the world coming to?: something you say that means that life is not as pleasant or safe as it was in the past
世界變成什麼樣了？（抱怨生活不像過去那樣舒適或安全了）

what's up?: used to ask someone what the problem is

what's your game?: something you ask when you want to know what someone is doing or secretly planning to do
你在玩甚麽把戲？你在搞甚麽鬼？

what, how, why, etc. in the world: used to emphasize your surprise when asking a question
（用在疑問句中強調很吃驚）究竟，到底

what the devil: used to give emphasis to a question

where the devil: used to give emphasis to a question

how the devil: used to give emphasis to a question

why the devil: used to give emphasis to a question

wheat complexion: If a person has a wheat complexion, the skin on their face is light brown in colour.

wheel and deal: to try to make a profit or get an advantage using clever or complicated methods and often deceiving people or breaking the usual rules
（為獲利而）投機取巧，耍弄手腕

wheel clamp: a metal device attached to the wheel of an illegally parked car that will only be removed when the owner pays an amount of money
（懲罰違規停車的）車輪固定夾

wheelie bin: a container for rubbish that has wheels so that it can be moved easily

wheels within wheels: hidden or unknown things that influence a particular situation, making it more complicated than it at first seems

when all is said and done: said when you are about to tell someone the most important fact they should remember in a situation

when hell freezes over: If you say that something will happen when hell freezes over, you mean that it will never happen.

when in Rome: when you are visiting another place, you should follow the customs of the people in that place

when the chips are down: when you are in a very difficult or dangerous situation, especially one that makes you understand the true value of people or things
在困難時刻，在危急關頭

when the going gets rough: when a situation becomes difficult or unpleasant

when the going gets tough: when a situation becomes difficult or unpleasant

when the going gets tough, the tough get: said to emphasize that when conditions become difficult, strong people take action
形勢越困難，勇者志越堅；艱難之路，唯勇者行

where there's a will there's a way: used to mean that if you are determined enough, you can find a way to achieve what you want, even if it is very difficult

where there's muck there's brass: said to mean that a lot of money can be made from business activities that are dirty or unpleasant

which is which: used in expressions that relate to being able to see the difference between two very similar things or people
哪個是哪個（用於區分兩個相似的人或物時）

while the cat's away, the mice will play: said when the person who is in charge of a place is not there, and the people there behave badly
貓不在，老鼠翻天；閻王不在，小鬼跳樑

while the going is good: 趁還有機會時；趁情況還有利時；趁形勢還未發生變化時

whipping boy: someone or something that is blamed or punished for problems that are caused by someone or something else

whipping cream: cream that gets thicker when it is whipped

whispering campaign: the intentional damaging of an important person's reputation by saying unpleasant things about them that may not be true
（破環他人名聲的）造謠活動，散播流言蜚語的活動

whist drive: a social occasion at which people play whist

whistle-stop tour: a series of short visits to different places, made usually by a politician

white blood cell: a cell in the blood that has no red colour and is involved in the fight against infection

white dwarf: a small star that is not very bright, but is very dense (= contains a lot of matter)

white goods: large electrical goods for the house, such as cookers and washing machines

white heat: the very high temperature at which metal gives out a white light

US used, especially in the past to refer to a white person who is expected to be more successful than a black or Hispanic person, for example a boxer or basketball player
（尤其在過去，被寄予厚望在拳擊或籃球等比賽中勝過黑人或西班牙裔人的）白人

white wine: a wine with a pale yellow colour that is made from green or yellow grapes, or from black grapes without their skins

whitewater rafting: the activity of being moved quickly in a raft (= small boat filled with air) along rivers where the current is very strong

who needs...?: used to mean that the thing referred to is not necessary or useful, or causes trouble

a book containing information about the world's richest or most famous people

win out: to succeed after a lot of difficulty

win the day: to persuade people to support your ideas or opinions

win through: to finally succeed after trying hard to achieve something

gain your spurs: to achieve something that proves that you are skilled in a particular type of activity and to therefore win the respect of other people

If a business or organization winds down, or if someone winds it down, the amount of work it does is gradually reduced until it closes completely.
（使）（企業或機構）逐漸關閉，（使）慢慢倒閉

window box: a box filled with earth, for growing decorative plants in, positioned on an outside windowsill

window ledge: windowsill  (= a shelf below a window)

wire brush: a brush with pieces of wire fixed into it, used especially for cleaning metal

wire wool: （用以打磨物體表面的）鋼絨，鋼棉（同 steel wool）

said after the name of a particular quality to say that it is very strong, using its first letter

without a backward glance: If you leave without a backward glance, you are completely happy to leave and have no sad feelings about it.

do wonders: to have a very good effect

wrapping paper: decorated paper that is used to cover presents

wrecking ball: a large, heavy metal ball that is swung against a building in order to knock it down because it is no longer needed

wrestle with: to try very hard to deal with a problem or to make a difficult decision

wriggle off the hook: If someone wriggles off the hook, they avoid a responsibility.

wriggle out of: to avoid doing something that you do not want to do

wring your hands: If you wring your hands, you show that you are worried or unhappy.

writ large: If one thing is another thing writ large, it is similar to it but larger or more obvious.

write in: to add someone's name to the official list for an election in order to show that you want to vote for them
（在選票上）寫上（非原定候選人）姓名

write off/away for: to write a letter to an organization asking them to send you something

writer's block: the condition of being unable to create a piece of written work because something in your mind prevents you from doing it
作者心理阻滯，寫不出東西

writer's cramp: a painful stiffness in the hand that people suffer from if they have been writing continuously for a long time

written all over sb's face: If an emotion is written all over someone's face, it is clear what they are feeling.

written in the stars: If you believe that something is written in the stars, you believe that it will be made to happen by a force that controls the future.

wrought iron: iron that can be bent into attractive shapes and used to make gates, furniture, etc.
（製作大門、傢俱等的）鍛鐵；熟鐵

LETTER: the 24th letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第24個字母）
NUMBER: the sign used in the Roman system for the number 10
VOTE: used when voting to mark the name of the person that you are choosing
（選舉中用於標記自己選擇的候選人姓名）
X, x: used especially in the past to refer to a film or show that is not suitable for people under 18 years old because it contains violence or sex

X-acto knife: a brand name for a sharp knife with a short blade that can be replaced

X-linked agammaglobulinaemia: a rare genetic condition in which low levels of immunoglobulins (= proteins that destroy harmful bacteria) affect the body's ability to fight infection
X連鎖型無伽瑪球蛋白血症

Y, y: the 25th letter of the English alphabet

yada yada yada: blah blah blah (= a phrase used to represent boring speech)
等等（用於表示無聊的講話）

Yale lock: a brand name for a type of lock, especially for doors, that is cylinder-shaped and is operated by a flat key

yarn bombing: the activity, often done secretly, of covering parts of buildings, etc. with decorative items that have been knitted, as a form of art

yeah, right!: used when you do not believe what someone has said

year end: the end of the financial year, or the end of December
財政年度的最後；年終，歲末，年底

year in, year out: every year, especially in a way that seems boring

year's end: the end of the financial year, or the end of December
財政年度的最後；年終，歲末，年底

yeast infection: an infection of the mucous membranes caused by a fungus called Candida albicans

yellow fever: an infectious tropical disease that causes the skin to become yellow and can result in death

yellow jacket: a black and yellow wasp (= a flying insect that stings)

yes and no: used when you cannot give a particular answer to a question

yield to: to agree to do something that you do not want to do or should not do

悠悠俱樂部（不停升級又降級的足球俱樂部）

Yom Kippur: a Jewish holy day in September or October when nothing is eaten all day and people say prayers in the synagogue asking God to forgive them for things they have done wrong
贖罪日（猶太教節日，在每年的九月或十月，人們於此日禁食並懺悔祈禱）

Yorkshire pudding: a type of food from England that is a baked mixture of flour, milk, and eggs, traditionally eaten with roast beef
約克郡布丁（一種英國食物，習慣上和烤牛肉同食）

you bet: used to emphasize a statement or to mean "certainly"
US used when someone thanks you

you can bet your life: used to say that you are completely certain that something is true or will happen

you can say that again!: used to show that you completely agree with what someone has said
你說得很對！一點也沒錯！

you could cut the atmosphere with a knif: used to describe a situation in which everyone is feeling very angry or nervous and you feel that something unpleasant could soon happen

you could have heard a pin drop: something that you say in order to describe a situation where there was complete silence, especially because people were very interested or very surprised by what was happening

you could have knocked me down/over with: said when you are extremely surprised
（用來表示自己極度吃驚）你嚇死我了！

you got it: used to say that you will quickly do what someone has asked you to do
（用於表示很快就完成對方要求你做的事情）

you have got to be kidding: informal also you must be kidding used to show that you are very surprised by what someone has said and do not accept it
（表示對某人的話非常驚訝而且不相信是真的）別開玩笑了

you have to be kidding: informal also you must be kidding used to show that you are very surprised by what someone has said and do not accept it
（表示對某人的話非常驚訝而且不相信是真的）別開玩笑了

you have no idea: said for emphasis when you are describing how good or bad an experience is
（表示強調）你不知道，你難以想像

you know: a phrase with little meaning, used while you are trying to think of what to say next
used when trying to help someone remember something or when trying to explain something

you know something?: said before giving an opinion or a piece of information
（用於告知意見或資訊之前）要我告訴你嗎？你聽說了嗎？

you live and learn: said when you hear or discover something that is surprising

（表示…耐人尋味）你覺得出奇吧

you might as well be hung for a sheep as: said to mean that because the punishment for a bad action and an even worse one will be the same, you have no reason not to do the worse one
既然懲罰都一樣，我還不如索性做得更差些。

you must be joking: said in answer to something that someone has said, meaning that you do not believe they need said it seriously, or you think it is a stupid thing to say
（表示不相信或覺得荒謬）你一定是在開玩笑吧

you name it: used to say there are many things to choose from
凡是你說得出的；應有盡有

you never know: said to mean there is a possibility that something good might happen, even if it is slight

you said it!: used to say that you agree with what has just been said

you see: used when you hope someone else will understand what you are saying or asking

you should be so lucky!: used to say that someone is very unlikely to get what they want
（用於告訴某人其幾乎不可能如願）但願你走運！

you should get out more: used to tell someone that they are spending too much time doing things that are boring or not important

you should have seen: seeing or hearing something or someone would have interested or entertained you very much

you should have heard: seeing or hearing something or someone would have interested or entertained you very much
你真該看看／聽聽（某事或某人）

you the man!: used to praise a person who has done something well
（用於稱讚）做得不錯，老兄！真有你的！

you win!: something you say to someone who has persuaded you to do something that you did not intend to do, especially when that person has used force and you are angry

your every move: 一舉一動；做的每一件事

every move: 一舉一動；做的每一件事

your every word: all the things that you say

every word: all the things that you say

yours truly: used to mean the person who is speaking or writing, often when they are talking about something they have done unwillingly
（常用於談論勉強所做的事時）本人，鄙人

youth club: a place where older children can go to meet other children, play sports, and do other social activities

youth culture: young people's opinions and the way they live
青年文化（青年人的看法以及他們的生活方式）

US a large piece of wood, usually burned on Christmas Eve
耶誕節原木（指聖誕前夜放入爐中燃燒的大原木）

Indian English in the Indian parliament, the time during which members of parliament can ask questions without arranging to ask them first

Zimmer frame: a brand name for a metal frame with four legs that you place in front of you and lean on to help you move forward if you have difficulty in walking, for example when old

Zip drive: a brand name for a part of a computer used for copying large documents onto special disks

zoom in on: to notice and give special attention to something

（使照相機或計算機）畫面放大／縮小

醫院急診部（Accident and Emergency的縮寫）

a cross to bear: an unpleasant or painful situation or person that you have to accept and deal with, although you find it very difficult
沉重的十字架；煩惱；心理負擔

a trot through: an occasion when you examine or explain the whole of a subject, method, or piece of work quickly without stopping or getting slower

a bad workman blames his tools: said when someone has blamed a mistake or failure on the things that they use to work

a banner season: a particularly good or successful period of time

a banner month: a particularly good or successful period of time

a banner week: a particularly good or successful period of time

a big ask: informal something you ask someone to do that will be difficult for them

a big/great girl's blouse: a weak and cowardly (= not brave) man

a bird in the hand: said when you recognize that you should not risk losing something you already have by trying to get something you think might be better

a bunch of fives: If you give someone a bunch of fives, you hit them hard with your hand closed.

a bundle of laughs: a funny, entertaining person or situation

a clean slate: the situation in which people decide to forget your past behaviour, usually because it was not good

a close call: 僥倖的脫險，幾乎發生的壞事

a feather in your cap: an achievement to be proud of

身材高大健美的男子／身材高挑動人的女子

（通常指秘密地）搜集資訊、資料（以求調查揭示真相）

a game in hand: If a sports team has a game in hand over other teams in a competition, it still has another game to play in which it can gain points.

a gleam in your eye: an expression in your eyes that shows that you are amused or that you have a secret

a good/bad turn: UK an action that helps/harms someone

a heavy hitter: someone who is powerful and has achieved a lot

令人驚訝的好人（或好事）

a hive of activity: a place where a lot of people are working very hard

繁忙的場所，忙碌的地方

a hole in one: in golf, an occasion when someone's ball goes into the hole the first time they hit it

a hundred/thousand/million and one: 非常多的，許許多多的，極多的

a kick up the arse: If you give someone a kick up the arse, you do or say something to try to stop them being lazy.

\u00e0 la carte: If you eat à la carte, you choose each dish from a separate list instead of eating a fixed combination of dishes at a fixed price.

in the most modern style or fashion

a leap in the dark: something you do without being certain what will happen as a result

A level: a public exam taken in England and Wales by children aged 17 or 18. Students take AS level exams then A2s, usually a year later, which together make a full A level qualification.
（英格蘭和威爾士的中學生在十七八歲時參加的）高級程度考試，高級考試

a lick and a promise: a quick and careless act of cleaning or washing

a little bird told me: said if you know who gave you the information being discussed but do not want to say who it was

something that is not true, or something of very bad quality
一派胡言／一堆垃圾（等等）

a load/weight off your mind: an occasion when a problem that has been worrying you stops or is dealt with
卸下了思想上的重負，放下了心頭大石

a long face: If you have a long face, you look sad.
表情悲傷的；哭喪著臉的

a man of action: a man who prefers to do things rather than think about and discuss them

a man's gotta do what a man's gotta do: said to mean that you will do whatever you have to do, even if it is difficult or dangerous
該做的你就要做；上天入地也要做

a means to an end: something that you do because it will help you to achieve something else

一下子，很容易（就能注意到…）

a mouth to feed: someone, especially a new baby, who you must provide food for
需要養活的人（尤指新生兒）

a mug's game: an activity that will not make you happy or successful

a narrow squeak: a success that was almost a failure

a needle in a haystack: something that is impossible or extremely difficult to find, especially because the area you have to search is too large
不可能（或極難）找到的東西；大海裡的針

a new broom sweeps clean: said when someone new takes control of an organization and makes many changes

a new lease of life: an occasion when you become more energetic and active than before
an increase in the period for which something can be used or continued
使用壽命（或持續時間）延長

a night on the town: an evening when you go to various places and enjoy entertainment such as dancing, eating in a restaurant, or drinking in a bar
在外玩樂的夜晚，狂歡之夜

a nod is as good as a wink: used to say that only a slight sign is needed for you to understand clearly what is meant by something or what is happening in a situation

a notch on the/sb's bedpost: informal someone that a person has sex with, not because they want a serious relationship, but because they want to have sex with as many people as possible

a numbers game: a situation in which the most important factor is how many of a particular thing there are, especially when you disapprove of this

a pack rat: someone who collects things that they do not need
（收藏的東西都是自己不需要的）垃圾收藏家

a page in/of history: an important part of the history of a place, time, or group of people

a pain: someone or something that is very annoying

a pain in the arse: someone or something that is very annoying

a pain in the backside: someone or something that is very annoying

a paper chase: the activity of dealing with many different documents in order to achieve something
文檔追索搜集，大量文案工作

a parting of the ways: the point at which two people or organizations separate

a pearl of great price: something that is very rare and is considered very important

a penny saved is a penny earned: something you say that means it is wise to save money
能省則省；省一文賺一文

a piece/slice of the action: involvement in something successful that someone else has started
參與或插手（他人成功之事）；分一杯羹

a piece/slice/share of the pie: part of the profit or benefit from something, or part of the amount of something that is available
可以得到的一份（盈利或福利）

a pig in a poke: something that you buy or accept without first seeing it or finding out if it is good
盲目購買（或接受）的東西

a place for everything and everything in: This means that the best way to stay well organized is to keep things in their correct positions.
物歸其所就會乾淨整潔。

a political football: a problem that politicians from different parties argue about and try to use in order to get an advantage for themselves
政治足球（各黨派政治家爭論並試圖利用以獲取好處的問題）

a pretty/fine kettle of fish: a very difficult and annoying situation

a priori: relating to an argument that suggests the probable effects of a known cause, or using general principles to suggest likely effects
由因及果的；由一般到具體的；演繹的

a problem shared is a problem halved: used to say that if you tell someone about a problem, it is easier to deal with

a question mark over: an expression used when doubt exists about a particular thing

a rap on/over the knuckles: the act of speaking to someone severely or angrily because of something they have done or failed to do
嚴厲的批評；厲聲的指責；憤怒的譴責

a reach of the imagination: the act of trying very hard to imagine something

a reign of terror: a period of time when a ruler controls people in a violent and cruel way

a ripe old age: the condition of being very old; used especially to talk about someone who has a long healthy life

a rolling stone: said to mean that a person who is always travelling and changing jobs has the advantage of having no responsibilities, but also has disadvantages such as having no permanent place to live
滾石不生苔，來去真自在（表示經常在外遊蕩或老換工作的人可以不用擔負責任，但是也居無定所）

a rubber check: a cheque (= piece of paper from someone's bank used as payment) that is not worth anything because the person does not have enough money in the bank

a rung on/of the ladder: one of the stages or levels in something such as a process or organization, through which it is possible to rise or make progress

a safe pair of hands: someone who you can trust to do an important job well, without making mistakes

a shot in the arm: something that has a sudden and positive effect on something, providing encouragement and new activity

a shot in the dark: an attempt to guess something when you have no information or knowledge about the subject and therefore cannot possibly know what the answer is

a shoulder to cry on: someone who is willing to listen to your problems and give you sympathy, emotional support, and encouragement
可以傾訴的對象，可以向其尋求安慰的人

a sight for sore eyes: a way of saying that you are very pleased to see someone or that you think someone is very attractive
樂於看到的人；極有吸引力的人

a sledgehammer to crack a nut: If you use a sledgehammer to crack a nut, you use much more force than is needed.

a slice of life: A film, piece of literature, or a play might be described as a slice of life if it describes or shows the ordinary details of real life.
現實生活的寫照，反映現實生活的電影（或文學作品、戲劇）

a snowball effect: a situation in which something increases in size or importance at a faster and faster rate

a spring in your step: If you walk with or have a spring in your step, you walk energetically in a way that shows you are feeling happy and confident.
步伐輕快；（走路）輕鬆自信

a step backwards: going back to a worse or less developed state

a stitch in time: said to mean that it is better to act or deal with problems immediately, because if you wait and deal with them later, things will get worse and the problems will take longer to deal with

a sure thing: something that is certain to happen

a thing or two: 一些事情；些許知識，一星半點

a torrid time: a period when you experience a lot of problems

a tough/hard nut: someone who is very unpleasant and difficult to deal with
討厭的傢夥；難對付的人

a tower of strength: a person who gives you help and support when you are in a difficult situation

a turn of the screw: an action that makes a bad situation worse, especially one that forces someone to do something

a walk in the park: something that is very easy to do, and usually pleasant
簡單易做的事；做起來輕鬆愉快的事

a watch out: the activity of watching carefully and looking for someone or something

a wet weekend: UK a very boring and disappointing experience or person
無聊（或令人沮喪）的經歷；討厭（或無聊）的人

a whale of a: used to refer to a very great amount of something or a very good thing

a whole new ballgame: a completely different situation, often one that is difficult or that you know little about
完全不同的情況，完全是另一回事（尤指難事或自己不甚瞭解的事情）

a wolf in sheep's clothing: a person with a pleasant and friendly appearance that hides the fact that they are evil

a world of difference: If there is a world of difference between two people or things, they are very different.

a penny for your thoughts: said when you want to know what another person is thinking, usually because they have been quiet for a while

penny for your thoughts: said when you want to know what another person is thinking, usually because they have been quiet for a while

LETTER: the first letter of the English alphabet
（英文字母表的第一個字母）
MARK: a mark in an exam or for a piece of work that shows that your work is considered excellent

A.N. Other: used at the end of a list of people to refer to someone whose name is not yet known
（用於名單之末尾，表示人選尚待擇定）無名者，還有一位不知名者

a gathering of the clans: an occasion when a large group of family or friends meet, especially in order to enjoy themselves

the gathering of the clans: an occasion when a large group of family or friends meet, especially in order to enjoy themselves

abide by: formal to accept or obey an agreement, decision, or rule
遵守，遵循（協議、決定或規章）

abound in: If something abounds in/with other things, it has a lot of them.

abound with: If something abounds in/with other things, it has a lot of them.

above board: If a plan or business agreement is above board, it is honest and not trying to deceive anyone.

above the fold: the top/bottom half of a newspaper, that can/cannot be seen when it is folded in half and is considered a good/bad place to have an article or advertisement
（報紙的）上／下半折（被認為是用來刊登文章或廣告的較好／較差位置）
the part of a web page that can/cannot be seen before you scroll down the page
（網頁）不需要／需要移動卷軸可看到的部分

below the fold: the top/bottom half of a newspaper, that can/cannot be seen when it is folded in half and is considered a good/bad place to have an article or advertisement
（報紙的）上／下半折（被認為是用來刊登文章或廣告的較好／較差位置）
the part of a web page that can/cannot be seen before you scroll down the page
（網頁）不需要／需要移動卷軸可看到的部分

absence makes the heart grow fonder: This means that when people we love are not with us, we love them even more.

absentee ballot: a system of voting in which people send their votes by post when they cannot be present at an election
（無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式進行的）缺席投票制，郵寄式投票制

（無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式所投的）缺席選票，郵寄式選票

（將房產等租給他人，但很少或不來看管的）在外房主，在外地主，在外業主

absentee vote: a system of voting in which people send their votes by post when they cannot be present at an election
（無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式進行的）缺席投票制，郵寄式投票制
a piece of paper on which people mark their votes and then send them by post when they cannot be present at an election
（無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式所投的）缺席選票，郵寄式選票

absolute majority: a situation in which one person or political party wins more than half of the total votes in an election
（某候選人或政黨贏得超過半數選票的）絕對多數

absolute value: the distance from zero of a number on a number line
絕對值 （即數軸上一個實數距離原點的距離）

absolute zero: 絕對零度 （可能存在的最低溫度，即-273.15°C）

abstract noun: a noun that refers to a thing that does not exist as a material object

Academy Award: one of a set of American prizes given each year to the best film, the best male or female actor in any film, and to other people involved in the production of films
美國電影藝術科學院年獎，奧斯卡金像獎

accede to: to agree to do what people have asked you to do
accede to the throne/accede to power
to become king or queen, or to take a position of power

access course: in the UK, a set of classes that people take so they can get a qualification that can be used to get into university or college

access provider: a company that allows you to use the internet and use email, and gives you space on the internet to put your documents
網路接取提供商，網路服務供應商

access road: a road leading from or to a particular place
UK a road leading to a main road

accessory pathway: an extra electrical connection between one part of the heart and another that affects the heart's electrical system

accidental death: a verdict (= an opinion stated at the end of a trial) that is given when a death was the result of an accident and not of murder or suicide

accidentally on purpose: If you do something accidentally on purpose, you do it intentionally but pretend it happened by chance.

accidents will happen: said after an accident in order to make it seem less bad
（事故發生後說的安慰話）出事是難免的。

accord with: to be the same as something, or to agree with something

METHOD: in a way that agrees with
Something that happens according to plan happens in the way it was intended to.

account to sb for: to explain the reason for something or the cause of something

account for: to form the total of something
to explain the reason for something or the cause of something
（對某人）就…作出解釋；（對某人）就…作出說明

accustom yourself to: to make yourself familiar with new conditions

acetic acid: a clear acid with a strong smell, found in vinegar

achievement test: a test of a student’s knowledge of a subject, which can be compared with the performance of other students taking the same test
學業成績測試（以了解學生對某學科知識的掌握程度，可做對比研究資料）

阿喀琉斯的腳踵，致命弱點，致命傷

Achilles tendon: the part of the body that connects the heel bone to the muscles in the lower part of the leg

acid jazz: a style of popular dance music that is a mix of funk, soul, and jazz
迷幻爵士樂（結合了鄉土爵士樂、靈歌和爵士樂的流行舞曲）

acinic cell carcinoma: a cancer that is most common in the parotid gland (= a gland in front of the ear that produces saliva)

act out: to perform the actions and say the words of a situation or story

用行動來表現（想法、感情等）

act up: If a person, especially a child, acts up, they behave badly.

（機器）運轉不正常；（身體部位）出毛病

used to tell people to get ready immediately to do the particular jobs that they have been given to do
（用來命令做好準備）各就各位！

actions speak louder than words: said to emphasize that what you do is more important and shows your intentions and feelings more clearly than what you say

active immunity: the situation in which the body produces its own antibodies (= substances in the blood that fight disease)

activity holiday: a holiday in which you can do a lot of sports and other activities

ad hoc: made or happening only for a particular purpose or need, not planned before it happens
特別的，專門的；臨時安排的

ad lib: said without any preparation or practice
to speak in public without having planned what to say

ad nauseam: If someone discusses something ad nauseam, they talk about it so much that it becomes very boring.
喋喋不休地，令人厭煩地

Adam's apple: the part of your throat that sticks out, especially in men, and moves up and down when you speak or swallow

add up: to calculate the total of two or more numbers

add fuel to the fire: UK also add fuel to the flames to make an argument or bad situation worse

add on: to include or build something extra

add salt to: If you add salt to a subject or conversation, you make it more interesting.
使（某一主題或對話）更有趣

add up to: to have a particular result or effect

added time: （足球比賽的）延長賽（同 extra time）

added value: an improvement or addition to something that makes it worth more
（使某物增值的）改進；附加功能；附加物；附加價值

addition reaction: a chemical reaction in which two or more substances combine to form a new substance
加成反應（兩種或多種物質組合生成一種新物質的化學反應）

addition sign: the symbol + , used between two numbers to show that they should be added together

additive inverse: 加法反元素（一個數字的相反數）

address book: a computer document that keeps a list of names and email addresses
（電腦上用於存放連絡人姓名和電子郵件地址的文件）通訊錄
a book in which you write people's addresses

adenoma hyperplastic nodules: tumours that are formed by an unusual increase in thyroid tissue. They are benign (= not likely to cause death).
腺癌，增生性結節（通常為良性）

adhere to: to continue to obey a rule or have a belief

adjacent angle: one of the two angles on either side of a straight line that divides a larger angle into two
鄰角（由角分線將一個大角分成的相鄰兩個小角中的一個）

adjourn to somewhere: to finish doing something and go somewhere, usually for a drink and some food

adjustment disorder: a condition in which someone feels sad and hopeless as a result of a stressful event
適應障礙（一種情緒障礙，由於壓力事件而產生憂鬱、絕望等情緒）

administrative assistant: someone whose job is to do tasks such as arranging meetings, typing letters, etc. for someone
行政助理（為某人安排會議、錄入信件等）

admit of: to allow something or make it possible
容許；給予…機會；為…留有餘地

adrenal cortex: the outer part of the adrenal gland

adrenal gland: one of a pair of glands that produce adrenalin, found just above the kidneys
腎上腺（腎臟上方製造腎上腺素的一對腺體）

adult education: classes for people who have finished their school education, usually taken in order to learn things they failed to learn in school

advance directive: （關於病危時採取何種治療手段的）事前遺囑，生前遺囑

Advent calendar: a decorative piece of card, often hung on the wall, that has a small opening with a door for each of the days of the month before Christmas. Children open one of these doors each day, finding a picture under it.
基督降臨曆（掛在牆上的裝飾卡，上有小門，孩子在12月1日至聖誕節前每天打開一扇小門就可看到裡面的圖畫）

adventure playground: a public open space where children can play and climb on structures, usually made of wood, ropes, and old tyres
（供兒童玩耍的）奇遇遊樂園，冒險樂園

aerial root: a root that grows down to the ground from above the ground
氣根（樹幹上長出的根，可一直垂入到土壤）

aerobic respiration: a chemical process in which energy is produced in the body from food by using oxygen
有氧呼吸（人體內透過氧氣參與分解食物來產生能量的化學過程）

affiliation order: a legal order in which a man who is not married to the mother of his child must pay money to the mother to support his child
非婚生子女生父身份確認令；親父鑒定令（法庭令非婚生子女的生父支付撫養費的裁決）

affinity card: a credit card that earns a small amount of money for a charity each time something is bought with it
（持卡人每次消費時都會向慈善事業捐獻一小筆金額的）慈善信用卡，愛心信用卡，認同卡

affirmative action: If a government or an organization takes affirmative action, it gives preference to women, black people, or other groups that are often treated unfairly, when it is choosing people for a job.
（政府或機構招聘僱員時優先僱用常受到歧視的女性、黑人或其他群體的成員的）積極補償行動，平權措施

Afghan hound: a tall, thin dog with long, smooth hair, and a pointed nose

African American: a person who lives in the US and is a member of a race of people with dark skin that originally came from Africa

African Methodist Episcopal Church: a Christian religious group that is one of the Protestant Churches

African violet: a small plant with purple, pink, or white flowers that is grown in a container in a house

after all: used to add information that shows that what you have just said is true

after hours: after the usual hours of work
If you drink in a bar after hours, you drink alcohol at a time when it is not allowed by law.
在違禁時間，在正常營業時間之外

after your own heart: having the same opinions or interests as you
與（某人）觀點（或興趣）相同

afternoon tea: a small meal eaten in the late afternoon, usually including cake and a cup of tea
（通常包括蛋糕和茶的）午後茶點

Aga saga: a story about the lives of people who have a good standard of living and live in the English countryside
雅家小說（反映英國鄉村中家境較好者的生活）

against all the odds/against all odds: If you do or achieve something against (all) the odds/against all odds, you do or achieve it although there were a lot of problems and you were not likely to succeed.
儘管困難重重；在極為不利的情況下

against the odds/against all odds: If you do or achieve something against (all) the odds/against all odds, you do or achieve it although there were a lot of problems and you were not likely to succeed.
儘管困難重重；在極為不利的情況下

against the clock: If you do something against the clock, you do it as fast as possible and try to finish it before a certain time.
When people do something against the clock, the time they take to do it is recorded, in order to find which person or attempt is the fastest.

against time/the clock: If you do something against time/the clock, you do it as fast as possible and try to finish it before a certain time.
（為了如期完成而）爭分奪秒，加快工作，搶時間

against your better judgment: If something is against your better judgment, you think it would be wiser not to do it.

age group: people of a similar age, considered as a group

age limit: the age at which a person is allowed or not allowed to do something

Age of Exploration: the period from around 1400 to 1600, in which Europeans travelled the rest of the world in search of goods, raw materials, land, and trade partners
探索時代（約1400至1600年代，歐洲旅行家在全球探求貨品、原材料、土地和交易夥伴的時期）

age-associated memory impairment: mild loss of the ability to remember facts that is considered a normal part of the ageing process

age-related macular degeneration: a disease in older people that weakens the most important part of the retina (= the area at the back of the eye that receives light). This leads to problems when looking directly at objects and sometimes eventually to loss of sight.

agent provocateur: a person who intentionally encourages people to do something illegal so that they can be caught
（誘使反政府人士違法以便將之逮捕的）密探，坐探

aggravated assault: a serious, violent attack on someone
重傷害；嚴重毆打，暴力傷人

aggravated burglary: a crime that involves using a weapon or committing another crime while illegally entering a person's house to steal something
惡性侵入住宅罪，惡性暴竊

aggregate score: in football, the combined number of goals scored by two teams over two or more games

agnogenic myeloid metaplasia: a condition in which scar tissue grows in the bone marrow so that not enough blood cells are produced for the body

agonize over: If you agonize over/about something, you spend time worrying and trying to make a decision about it.
為…傷腦筋；對…猶疑不定；因…痛苦彷徨

agonize about: If you agonize over/about something, you spend time worrying and trying to make a decision about it.
為…傷腦筋；對…猶疑不定；因…痛苦彷徨

agony aunt: a person, usually a woman, who gives advice to people with personal problems, especially in a regular magazine or newspaper article
（尤指在報刊上為讀者解答個人問題的）夫人信箱

agony column: the part of a magazine or newspaper where letters from readers about their personal problems are printed, together with advice about how to deal with them
（報刊上為讀者解答個人問題的）「為您解憂」專欄

agree to differ: If two people agree to differ, they accept that they have different opinions about something and stop trying to persuade each other that they are right.
同意各自保留不同意見

agree with: to think that something is morally acceptable

aid worker: someone who is working in a country where there is a war, no food, etc., in order to help people
援助隊員（當一國發生戰亂、饑荒時前往救援的人員）

aim at: If information is aimed at a particular group of people, it is made known in a way that influences them or makes them interested in something.
使…針對（某人）；將（某人）定為…的對象

air ambulance: a plane or helicopter with all the equipment needed to fly sick or injured people to hospital

air bladder: a small bag of air or gas inside a fish's body, that helps it to float or breathe
魚鰾（幫助魚控制浮沉和呼吸）

air brake: a brake operated by air pressure, used on large vehicles such as buses and trains
（公共汽車、火車等的）氣閘，空氣制動器，空氣煞車

air con: 空調，空調系統(air conditioning的縮寫)

air conditioner: a machine that keeps the air in a building cool

air conditioning: the system used for keeping the air in a building or vehicle cool

air drop: the act of bringing supplies or equipment by dropping them from aircraft

air force: the part of a country's military forces that uses aircraft and fights in the air

Air Force One: the plane that the US president uses for official flights
空軍一號（美國總統的專用座機）

air freshener: a substance or device that makes a room or vehicle smell pleasant
空氣清新劑；空氣清新機；空氣淨化器

air hostess: a woman who serves passengers on an aircraft
客機女乘務員，空中小姐

air kiss: an action similar to kissing someone without touching them with your lips, especially in a way that is not sincere
to perform an action similar to kissing someone without touching them with your lips, especially in a way that is not sincere

air letter: a letter that is sent by aircraft, usually consisting of a single very thin sheet of paper that is folded and then stuck at the edges to form its own envelope

air mass: a large area of air that has nearly the same temperature and humidity at any height
氣團（水平方向溫度、濕度差異很小的大空氣團）

air mattress: a large rectangular rubber or plastic bag that you fill with gas so that you can lie on it in water or use it as a bed

Air Miles: points worth part of a plane journey that are given free when you buy products or services from particular companies
（消費積分每滿一分就可免費乘坐飛機一英里的）飛行裡數，飛行里程積分

air pistol: a small gun that uses air pressure to fire a pellet (= small object)

air pocket: an area in the sky where the air is flowing differently from the way it is in the surrounding parts. Air pockets can sometimes cause aircraft to go up or down suddenly.
（大氣中可引起飛機急速上升或下降的）氣阱，氣穴

air power: the force of a country's military aircraft and the ability of these aircraft to be used for defending the country and attacking other countries

air punch: an act of hitting upwards with your fist (= closed hand) to show that you are happy because you have been successful

air quotes: imaginary quotation marks that you make in the air with your fingers, to show that you are using a word or phrase in an unusual way or repeating exactly what someone has said
說話者用手指在空氣中劃出的引號（用以表示自己正以不尋常的方式使用某詞或某片語，或表示自己在重複他人的話）

air rage: sudden angry and violent behaviour by a passenger on an aircraft during a flight
（客機乘客的）空中暴力，空中鬧事

air raid: an attack by enemy aircraft, usually dropping bombs

air rifle: a gun with a long barrel (= part shaped like a tube) that is fired from the shoulder and uses air pressure to fire a pellet (= small metal ball)

air sac: a space filled with air that continues from a bird's lungs into one of its bones or another body area, used in breathing
氣囊（鳥類體內從肺部延伸至骨骼或其他身體部分的氣囊，用於呼吸）
a wide part like a bag in the tubes an insect uses for breathing
an alveolus (= a very small air bag in the lungs)

air terminal: a building in an airport or in a place near an airport where aircraft passengers go before their flight leaves or from which they leave after their flight has arrived
（機場）候機大樓，機場大樓，航廈

air traffic control: the activity of managing aircraft from the ground as they take off, fly, and land, or the people who do this

air-sea rescue: (an act of) using aircraft, including helicopters, and boats to try to save people in danger at sea
（使用飛機和船隻援救海上遇險人員的）海空搜索救援

aircraft carrier: a large ship that carries military aircraft and has a long, flat surface where they take off and land

airing cupboard: a heated cupboard where clothes, sheets, etc. that have been washed and are almost dry are put so that they can become completely dry

airs and graces: false ways of behaving that are intended to make other people feel that you are important and belong to a high social class
裝腔作勢，擺架子；矯揉造作

akinetic-rigid HD: a genetic disease that causes uncontrollable physical movements and eventual dementia. It is a form of Huntington's disease that starts before the age of 20 and progresses rapidly
運動不能強直性亨廷頓氏症

al dente: Pasta or other food that is al dente has been cooked so that it is still firm when bitten.
（蔬菜或麵食）烹調得不太軟的，有嚼勁的，耐嚼的

Aladdin's cave: a store of very many interesting or unusual objects
收藏珍奇物品之處；寶庫

alarm call: a phone call to wake you up at a particular time, for example in a hotel

alarm clock: a clock that you can set to wake you up at a particular time with a loud noise

align yourself with: If you align yourself with an organization or person, you agree with and support their aims.

alimentary canal: the parts of the body that food goes through as it is eaten and digested

alive to: If you are alive to something, you are thinking about it or familiar with it.

alive with: full of things that are living and moving

alkali metal: any of a group of soft, white metals that are chemical elements and react easily with other substances

all along the line: ever since the beginning of a relationship or process

all comers: any people who want to take part in a particular competition or activity

all expenses paid: If something is all expenses paid, it means that you do not have to pay for anything yourself.
一切費用已付的；別人支付的；免費的

all eyes are on: If all eyes are on someone or something, everyone is watching that person or thing and waiting to see what will happen.

all good things must come to an end: said when you accept that even enjoyable experiences cannot last for ever

all good things come to an end: said when you accept that even enjoyable experiences cannot last for ever
天下無不散的筵席；千好萬好總有終

all hell breaks loose: If all hell breaks loose, a situation suddenly becomes violent and noisy, especially with people arguing or fighting.
頓時亂成一團（尤指人們突然爭吵、打鬥起來）

all in a day's work: If something difficult, unpleasant, or strange is all in a day's work for someone, it is a usual part of their job.
日常工作的一部分；習以為常，不足為奇

all in good time: used to tell someone to be patient because the thing they are eager for will happen when the time is right

all is well: everything is in a good or acceptable state

all of a flutter: UK in a state of nervous excitement

all of: used to emphasize the amount or number of something, usually when something is small in a disappointing or unusual way

all or nothing: relates to doing something either completely or not at all

all over the place: put or left in a lot of different places in an untidy way

GOOD/SATISFACTORY: (in a way that is) satisfactory or reasonably good

used to show that you think someone is lucky or has an easy life when the same is not true for you

ABLE TO MANAGE: used to refuse the offer of food or drink
表示拒絕別人給予的食物或飲料
AGREED: used to show that something is agreed, understood, or acceptable

it's all right A2 also that's all right
an answer to someone who has just thanked you for something or just said sorry for something they have done

APPROVAL: slang said with the main emphasis on "right", expressing approval of what has been said or done

all roads lead to Rome: said to mean that all the methods of doing something will achieve the same result in the end

all that glitters is not gold: said about something that seems to be good on the surface, but might not be when you look at it more closely

all the same: despite what has just been said

all the way: as much as possible or completely

all the while: for all of a period of time

all things to all people: UK also all things to all men If you try to be all things to all people, you try to do things that will please everyone.

all very well: If something is all very well, it is fairly useful or good in some situations but not excellent and not useful or good in every situation.
You say that something is all very well/fine/good if it seems good by itself but you think that there are problems connected with it

all's fair in love and war: in love and war you do not have to obey the usual rules about reasonable behaviour

in one piece: 完好無損地，安然無恙地

all-in wrestling: a type of wrestling (= sport in which people fight) in which there are very few rules

allow for: to consider something when you are planning something

ally yourself to: 與（某人）結盟；與（某人）聯合

US the official song of a school, college, or university

burst a blood vessel: to become very angry about something

along the way: during the time that something is happening or that you are doing something

altar girl: a girl who helps a priest in Christian church services

alternative medicine: a range of treatments for medical conditions that people use instead of or with western medicine

altitude sickness: breathing problems and dizziness as a result of having less oxygen to breathe in high areas, for example when climbing mountains

alto recorder: a recorder (= a wind instrument) with a slightly lower sound than the descant recorder

alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma: a rare cancer that is found in the connective tissues of the muscles of the legs, arms, and abdomens of older children

American English: the English language as it is spoken and written in the US

American football: a game for two teams of eleven players in which an oval ball is moved along the field by running with it or throwing it

American plan: an arrangement in which all your meals are provided at the hotel or rooms that you are paying to stay in

amino acid: any of the chemical substances found in plants and animals that combine to make protein (= a substance necessary for the body to grow)

ammonium hydroxide: a chemical consisting of water and ammonia, used as a bleach and a strong cleaning solution

amniotic fluid: the liquid that surrounds the embryo of a mammal, bird, or reptile

amoebic dysentery: an illness of the bowels caused by an amoeba

amount to: to be the same as something, or to have the same effect as something

amour propre: a belief and confidence in your own ability and value

amusement arcade: a place in which you can pay to play games on machines

amyl nitrite: a drug that can be used for increasing pleasure during sex and was originally used for treating angina

an ace up your sleeve: secret knowledge or a secret skill that will give you an advantage

an acquired taste: something that you dislike at first, but that you start to like after you have tried it a few times
後天養成的嗜好；假以時日並多次嘗試而喜歡上的東西

an apple a day keeps the doctor away: This means that eating an apple each day can help to keep you healthy.
一天一蘋果，不用上診所／一日一蘋果，醫生遠離我。

an early bath: used to refer to a situation in which a football player is ordered to leave the pitch during a game because they have done something wrong
（因為犯規，足球隊員被要求）提前下場

an easy touch: informal someone who you can easily persuade or deceive into giving you something, usually money
（通常指容易上當受騙送人錢財的）冤大頭

an elephant in the room: If you say there is an elephant in the room, you mean that there is an obvious problem or difficult situation that people do not want to talk about.

an embarrassment of riches: so many good things or people that it is impossible to decide which of them you want

英國人的家就是他的城堡（指英國人認爲在自己的家裡有權做自己想做的事情）

an eye for an eye: said to show that you believe if someone does something wrong, that person should be punished by having the same thing done to them

an iron hand/fist in a velvet glove: used to describe someone who seems to be gentle but is in fact forceful and determined

an old/a wise head on young shoulders: a child or young person who thinks and talks like an older person who has more experience of life

anabolic steroid: a hormone (= a chemical made by living cells) that causes muscle and bone growth. Anabolic steroids are sometimes used illegally by athletes competing in sports competitions

anaerobic respiration: a chemical process in which energy is produced from food without using oxygen, for example by yeast

anally retentive: Someone who is anally retentive is too worried about being organized and tidy.
整潔成癖的；過分注重細節的

anatomically correct: showing the body of a person or animal accurately, including the sexual organs

ancien r\u00e9gime: an old system, especially a political or social one, that has been replaced by a more modern system

and all that jazz: used when speaking to mean "and other similar things"

and another thing: used to introduce one more in a series of arguments or complaints

and have done with it: to deal with and finish the whole matter

and no mistake: added to the end of something you say to emphasize it

and the same to you with knobs on: used to return an insult forcefully to someone who has insulted you

all the rest: used at the end of a phrase or list to refer to other things or people that belong to the same set or group and that you have not had time to mention
諸如此類，以及其他，等等

and no messing: said to emphasize that you want something to be done
我說的是真話；不是開玩笑

no messing: said to emphasize that you want something to be done
我說的是真話；不是開玩笑

aneroid barometer: a piece of equipment that uses a small box whose shape can change in order to measure air pressure and show when the weather is likely to change
膜盒式氣壓計，空盒氣壓錶

angel food cake: a light cake, popular in the US, made without egg yolks or fat
（在美國很受歡迎，不含蛋黃和油脂的）天使蛋糕

angel hair: a type of pasta in the shape of very thin threads
義大利麵的一種（像天使的髮絲一樣細）

angle bracket: the symbol < or >, found on a computer keyboard and used, for example, around tags (= codes for marking particular types of information)

angle for: If someone is angling for something, they are trying to get something without asking for it directly.

angle of incidence: the angle that a beam of light touching a surface makes with a line vertical to that surface

angry young man: a young man who is not satisfied with people in authority and expresses strong opinions about them
（對當局宣洩強烈不滿的）憤怒青年

animal husbandry: the farming of animals to produce foods such as meat, eggs, and milk

animal kingdom: animals as one of the groups that all natural things can be divided into

animal rights: the rights of animals to be treated well, for example by not being used for testing drugs or by not being hunted

annoy, frighten, scare, etc. the hell ou: to make someone extremely annoyed, frightened, etc.

（尤指女性由於害怕變胖而引起的）厭食（症）；食慾缺乏

another second bite at/of the cherry: UK another opportunity to do something

a second bite at/of the cherry: UK another opportunity to do something

another final nail in the coffin: an event that causes the failure of something that had already started to fail

atrial septal defect: a problem, present from birth, in which blood from the left atrium (= one of the top spaces) of the heart passes directly into the right atrium resulting in too much fluid in the right side of the heart and possible heart failure
